Helena?
Helena D-68
Colphne?
(Darkness. Darkness all around.)
(A hazy mist and darkness obscure my view. I hear water dripping... Judging from the echoes, I am in a very spacious environment.)
(This place... must be...)
You wish to leave?
I would like to know why.

The shattered order is calling for restoration. This broken world can finally be unified. |Everything before us shall be reformed into a new world, a new order—and we shall be a shining beacon in this brave new world.
...Just you, not us. You don't need me, Earl. |To you, I'm just a pawn that can easily be replaced. I won't take orders from you anymore.
I simply wish to know your final decision.

The hedgehog, who serves absolute truth, reduces the world to one organizing principle, raises his spines all over, and staunchly resists all other views. |The cunning and mercurial fox rides the waves of tumultuous times, narrowing his eyes and discerning the discordant voices that can reshape the world.
—You once asked me this question. Now I'm making my choice.
You don't wish to be a hedgehog?
Nor do I wish to be a fox.
So your choice is to run away.
No, my choice is to stop being your pawn. |Hedgehog or fox, I'd still end up being used as a stepping stone by you and other bastards like you.
Does it matter what choice I make? The world hasn't become any better or worse; nothing has changed at all despite all the choices I made!

I will not make excuses for what happened in the past, but you must get over things that are already set in stone in order to make your choice. |Problems do not get solved by running away. You are no more than a coward if you only wallow in self-pity.
I'm running away? I'm a coward? Ha! Fine, I'll admit it. |Don't come looking for me anymore. I will never come back. As I've already told you, my final decision is self-exile.
Farewell, Earl.
You must make the right choice; your destiny must return to its ordained path. |Enjoy this momentary separation—we WILL meet again.
Commander...
—Ow, ow, ow...
(In the ops room, Groza is busy working at the main terminal—her gaze is fixed ahead.)
You're awake, Commander? |There's some sobering tea on the table next to the coffee machine.
...Sober... what?
Sobering tea. |Mayling wrote down the recipe after she got drunk, so I tried making some. Give it a go.
Mayling...?
(After rising to my feet, I make my way to the table in the lounge, picking up a cup filled with a cooled, amber-colored fluid.)
...What's in this?
A few ingredients with strange names.
And you boiled them up for me to drink?
"I will be your sword and shield, and in return, you will tell me how my cooking tastes." |Remember these words, Commander?
...If I'd known better, I wouldn't have made a promise like that. It's cutting into my life expectancy.
(Coughs) Ugh... This... is really spicy! |Are you sure this can actually be drunk?!
It does smell a bit dubious, but the effect seems quite promising, don't you think?
Dubious...? The smell alone wakes me up completely like a smack in the face.
Let's save the rest for the next party.

There probably won't be a party for a very long time. |Just yesterday, Mayling's "collection" got cleaned out and used to throw the welcome party for Krolik. Why don't you give some proper thought to how to make up for that, Commander?

...The URNC seems to be accelerating their Development Plan lately. |The Varjagers are running around everywhere and ELIDs are showing up more and more frequently. Our missions are getting increasingly difficult to complete.
(I look over at the console on the desk. The screen is still showing the mission interface.)
(We are already 25 days into the mission of transporting the item designated TASK-3115, but our progress is only at 63%.)
(If I multiply the cost of carrying out the mission by the time factor, the total sum would be...)
So?

Money is getting harder to come by, and the Elmo's balance sheets have been in the red every single month... |So Mayling's rice wine will have to wait until we finish this job... Uh, she won't mind, will she?
With our expenditure on the rise, we need to complete assignments more frequently to keep the Elmo running. |The situation should improve as we take in more members.
Krolik, you mean? |Well, that finally solves our problem of communicating with Nemesis...
What about the others?
All the idle Dolls are helping Mayling with maintenance on the vector engines in the engine room... Our drones detected an approaching Collapse storm three hours ago.
Three hours ago... Wait, so we're in the middle of the storm right now?
Everyone was resting at the time, so the mobile base vehicle proceeded along its preset course.
Is this region prone to Collapse storms?
The environmental data from B.R.I.E.F. didn't include any warnings on the subject.
Oh, how reliable... Bring up a topographical map of the surrounding terrain.
(As Groza taps away on her console, a topographical map is displayed on the projector screen in the ops room.)

We are currently approaching the storm. |There is a valley upwind of it, but the surrounding terrain is quite rough. If we take shelter there, we run a higher risk of being ambushed by lurking threats.
It's more dangerous to move through the storm while our vector engines are being serviced. Let's take refuge in the valley.
The number of breakdowns experienced by the vehicle have spiked recently. We may need to do very extensive maintenance.
...Well, it's been running for ten years... |We'll have money once we're done with this mission. Let's give the Elmo a complete overhaul then.
This mission pays too well, Commander.

I know... Not to mention, we'll have to go to troublesome places like the Green Zone. |But we're bounty hunters now. We take money and render a service. We deliver our cargo to its destination without any hiccups and earn an honest living.
...Nothing you've done over the last ten years can be considered an honest living.
Hm... What if we compare it to the things I did before that?
...Then it IS an honest living.

The height of the valley is different from what's stated in our topographical data. We can't launch drones during the storm, so we cannot be certain of the terrain data pertaining to the surrounding region or the real-time conditions. Our chances of being ambushed will go up if we carry on like this.
So we're practically blind, huh... How are the engine repairs going?
Still in progress.
Override the safety speed limit and move through at full speed. |...I'll buy a few more bottles of wine for Mayling the next time we go shopping.
I estimate we will clear the valley by 08:54.
(We fall silent.)
(Time ticks by, and as the vehicle moves forward, the end of the valley gradually comes into view.)
Thank goodness—
Wake 'em.
Hello? Hello?
Tsk.
You up?
...That insignia... Varjagers?
Humph.
Your way of tying people up is pretty crude.
Tsk, quit your bitching. |There's a Collapse storm outside, you ever been in one?
... |Not yet, unfortunately.
Well, this is your lucky day. Want to give it a try?
(I stretch my body as inconspicuously as I can to make sure that the GPS device below my chest is still intact.)
The hell are you doing?!
My legs are numb, I'm just stretching them.
Don't try anything funny, now spit it out!
Spit what out?
The only thing I've had since yesterday was wine... and a cup of tea. |The smell might be kind of intense if I spit it out, you know?
Drop the act! Now open this damn thing!
—Right now, you're standing on the "damn thing" in question. |Don't you Varjagers have a lot of experience with "opening boxes"?
...Ugh!
Humph, you'd better wise up. |Now open this damn thing, or this day next year is going to be the anniversary of your death!
...You need a code to open the box.
You need a code to open the box?!
—Yes, a code. |Now, if you tell me why you're here to seize this box, I'll give you the code.
Why—? |You think we Varjagers need a reason to take your stuff? If you had any sense, you'd have handed over your valuables long ago!
...If this is about money, why don't we try to make this a win-win situation? |I'll pay what you want and the box leaves with me, how about that?
Win-win, you say? How much money could you possibly have in that beat-up vehicle of yours?
...You wound me.
Enough! Now give me the code.
...The code is too complicated, it'll take some—ugh!
How about we put a few holes in your head? Will that help you think?
Our employer only allows us to open this box in case of utmost emergency. |The code... The code is on my vehicle's computer.
Don't give me any of that crap! I've already blown your vehicle and those trash Dolls of yours to pieces!
Blown to pieces, you say? |But they look perfectly alive and well to me?
What?!
Boss!
(The jeep is now a safe distance away. I treat the bullet wound on my shoulder with the medkit in the car.)
What took you so long?
...Upon the plains, the storm conceals an invisible object...
...Um, huh? What... Nemesis? |Where are Groza and Krolik? Why are you all using spare bodies?

I was in the ops room, and Krolik and Nemesis were in the engine room when we were all caught in the explosion. Only Mayling survived by taking cover inside an empty fuel tank. |The frame depot was completely destroyed, so Mayling promptly uploaded our neural clouds into the remaining spare bodies before we set out immediately.
Right now, Mayling is working as quickly as she can to get the drone elevator back online, so air support will have to wait. |We need orders, Commander.
... |Get the box back.
(Groza, seated on the passenger's seat and focused outside, hesitates for a moment.)
We can't guarantee your safety without Doll protection.
Do I LOOK like I need protection? |We're going to starve if we don't get that box back!
Understood.
(On an open stretch of a valley in the Yellow Zone.)
(Under extremely poor visibility, the jeep steadily advances through the Collapse storm when it suddenly runs over a large lump of rock on the ground and lurches dangerously to one side.)
(Groza, who is on overwatch on the roof with a leg wedged through the window, is almost thrown off.)
(At the same time, a large chunk of rock is dislodged by the storm from the cliff that the jeep is driving past. It hurtles through the air straight towards the jeep.)
(Jostled by the lump of rock that it just ran over, the jeep suddenly decelerates, and the Varjagers in hot pursuit rapidly catch up to us.)
(The Varjager on the roof of the frontmost vehicle starts laying down fire at us and the box.)
Commander! I can't secure the box!
(Bullets and the large falling rock close in on the jeep and the box simultaneously. Groza, now immobilized, is utterly helpless.)
Groza!
(Having been continuously jostled and attacked, the crack on the box continues to widen until the outer shell bursts open all of a sudden.)
(The explosion blows the incoming projectiles and rock away and leaves an indent on one corner of the roof of the jeep. Groza is also knocked down by the shock wave.)
Nemesis, stop the vehicle!
(Nemesis brakes abruptly and brings the vehicle to a halt.)
(The broken box reveals another slightly smaller box. Its contents cannot be made out.)
(The smaller box appears more or less identical to the larger one. It shudders in the air, then lands several meters away from Groza.)
...What's this?
Commander...!
(Amid the Collapse storm, Groza scrambles to her feet with great difficulty.)
(Now that the jeep is stationary, the Varjager convoy has us promptly surrounded. The jeep carrying their leader lingers in the back.)
You m*****f***ers think you can escape?
Dying for nothing is very unwise. |Ammo is expensive, and the thought of wasting it on you makes my heart ache, you see?
—Get the box back.
And crush that bastard!!
All of you, get them! Take that box back!
(The Varjagers shuffle around for a bit but maintain the loose encirclement.)
They outnumber us a bit too much for my liking... |Groza, how are we doing?
Our tire is in shreds. We can only move at low speed.
You cowards! There are only a handful of them—Get the hell in there!
How much longer till our drone support arrives?

Mayling couldn't give us an estimate on when the drone elevator would be fixed before we set out, and the interference from the storm is too strong right now for transmissions to get through. |...I'd say we still need to hang in there a while longer, Commander.
If we don't do something soon, you can kiss this Commander goodbye.
Bring out the big guy! Hurry up and get rid of them!
That's...?
It's a modified mech equipped with a large-caliber cannon! We need to get off the vehicle ASAP, Commander!
(Through the Collapse storm, a mech that seems to have been converted from a construction vehicle rises to its full height.)
(It emerges from behind the convoy and moves towards us slowly, pushing aside the Varjager vehicles.)
That'll show you—your ammo may be expensive, but my artillery fire definitely hurts more!
(The Varjagers' startling armament only makes our situation more dire. The modified mech gets ever closer. Our battered jeep is completely at its mercy.)
Looks like I'm... finally out of luck?
Commander!
Commander! Do you copy, Commander?!
(Two drones tear through the Collapse storm and come diving towards my location.)

(The signal reception of the short-range communication device installed on the drones isn't the best, so the voice speaking through the comms is a bit patchy, but all three of us let out a sigh of relief when we hear it.)
Mayling? You're just in time, how's the mobile base vehicle?
Commander... We're screwed, Commander! (Sobs) The MBV is totally wrecked this time!
—All our stores and parts have also been destroyed! Those bastards even stole the Collapse pieces I've been saving up (sobs)!
Er, Mayling, it'll be fine. There'll be more Collapse pieces to come... In any case, just get us out of here first. |How much longer can these drones fly?
O-oh, oh, oh, that's right, you're still around, Commander! I'll still be getting a paycheck!
(Mayling maneuvers one of the drones to lay down suppressive fire on the mech and commands the other one to land on a relatively safe cliff further away.)
The drones have 56 minutes' worth of fuel left—hurry and get on, Commander!
Groza, Nemesis, fall back! |And bring the box along!
(The drone lands on the drone elevator of the Elmo, which has undergone initial repairs.)
(We clamber out of the rubble. The wound on my shoulder is bleeding again due to the impact.)
Ow, ow, ow...
Commander, are you alright?
It's just a scratch. I'll get a full check-up afterwards. How's Mayling?
(Mayling emerges from the entrance and rushes towards us anxiously.)
Uh, Mayling? I'm currently hot with Collapse radiation, so maybe we can dispense with the welcome-back hug?

What are you talking about, Commander? Our communications equipment along with the drivetrain are all destroyed. We've managed to get the control systems back online with emergency repairs, but all our part stocks—and Doll frames—were blown up!
Our budget for new equipment is zero now... You do have some Collapse pieces of your own in reserve, right? Please tell me you do?
...I'll pay for it.
That... that's wonderful, Commander!
But with our comms equipment wrecked, I guess we can't make an order with B.R.I.E.F. right away, can we?
Ah...
How are the vector engines?
Oh... Uh, they're barely running, but we're missing parts for the control systems and I can't complete repairs on it. Our current safe movement speed is around 25 km/h.
How bad is the damage to the comms equipment?

The entire transmitter got blown up. |We can use the backup systems onboard for short-range operations, but the vehicle signal booster and vehicular communications equipment are completely destroyed, so connecting to the internet and long-range comms... doesn't seem too likely.
Can we try fixing it?
The spare parts store got blown up along with it...
—While our current situation looks a little dire, our mission objective is still in our possession. |Once the mission is complete, everyone will get a big bonus.
R... really?!
Of course. |Now, let's think of a way to get our comms and propulsion back. That'll make things a lot easier going forward.
(Groza puts down the box she has been carrying. The quivering box grows still the moment Groza breaks contact with it.)
I believe—there's a girl in there?
Nemesis, what do you think?
...Flames... scatter... flowing through the veins, a cruel master returned...
We don't have any other Doll frames we can use right now, so we can't bring Krolik back online for the moment.
It looks just like an ordinary box, albeit a pricey one. |Why isn't it moving anymore...? Groza, approach it.
(As Groza draws closer, the box starts vibrating again.)
Nemesis, you try.
(Groza falls back while Nemesis walks up to the box. It continues to vibrate.)
I doubt it's a problem with Groza. Mayling?
(As Nemesis puts some distance between herself and the box, it stops quivering.)
Well, in terms of what we have in common, I guess the Commander and I... are both human?
Let's confirm our plan for the rest of the mission. We'll meet up in the ops room. |Mayling, find a place where we can store the box and continue with the repairs.
O-okay.
We've begun a full vehicle self-diagnostic. Estimated time of completion is at 08:12.
(I stand before the full height windows in the ops room. Right now, all is quiet outside.)
...A series of Collapse storms, mistakes in the weather logs, errors in our map, our mission information being leaked... This is all too much of a coincidence.
—Commander, do you suspect that this attack was planned in advance?
It has to be. Who's the nearest environmental information broker?
Our purchase logs indicate that the trading partner is a B.R.I.E.F. subsidiary. The information itself is tagged as common data with no special providers.
And who issued the contract?
When the assignment was handed down, the client was listed as anonymous. It was transacted through B.R.I.E.F. HQ, who only provided basic information on the client and their parent organization.
The payout for this mission was very high. Many bounty hunter teams fought over it, but it ended up falling into our hands in the end.
(Groza stops what she's doing and turns slightly to look at me.)

...We are currently disconnected from the internet, so we cannot obtain further information. But given what we know so far, this mission isn't much different from other such missions in the past, aside from the abnormally high payment.

Let's get our comms back up and connect to the internet so we can replenish our supplies and fix our MBV first. |...We also need to purchase a new body so we can reactivate Krolik. Perhaps Nemesis' strange instincts can help with that.
...Shadows wander in the fog at night... A sharp corner...
Er... Okay?
There's a horde of ELIDs approaching, threat level II to III.
Wipe them out.
Diagnostic complete. The vehicle has sustained 49% damage. |Nemesis is helping Mayling perform emergency repairs, but it will be difficult since we are experiencing a severe parts shortage.

At the moment, the only available Tactical Dolls are myself and Nemesis. We might have a hard time if more ELIDs of a higher threat level show up or if the Varjagers manage to catch up with us, Commander.
In any case, let's get the MBV moving first.
Destination coordinates?
While I want to carry on towards ZJKK32E-U8PB4Q, given our present situation—
Yeah...
We've been in similar situations before.
Back when you had just become a bounty hunter in the contamination zones... |This feeling of not knowing what to do when trying to complete an assignment was a frequent occurrence.
Back then... Haha.
You have changed a lot since then.
So have you— |Though I'd say you're a lot more like how you "used to be" right now.
When I first entered the contamination zones, I was still doing things the old way... Only after being taken advantage of multiple times did I realize... I'm no longer the "Commander" from before.
...You will always be the Commander, Commander.
Even when I couldn't even use the most basic B.R.I.E.F. reception system?
(I think back on the years when things were the most difficult.)
(In the beginning, I was on my own. Back then, being a bounty hunter wasn't a respectable profession. I was just taking private cases aimlessly, living like there was no tomorrow.)
(Then I took in Groza, and we rescued Mayling together.)

(Soon afterwards, B.R.I.E.F. was founded, and bounty hunters could finally start operating through an official channel and follow proper procedures. Thanks to that, we slowly got the Elmo up and running.)
(Groza has seen me at my worst, and yet she has stayed by my side as a stalwart companion.)

Well, it was only a month of being a wanted criminal for ordering contraband because you couldn't tell the difference between the private networks of underground brokers and the URNC public internet, thus accidentally sending your order to a URNC government department.
...The signal in the contamination zones is terrible. It's hard to avoid mistakes when you keep jumping from one network to another.

Still, now that we have B.R.I.E.F. to coordinate things, the communication codes for underground broker networks and the URNC internet are now clearly demarcated, so sending your messages to the wrong recipient probably won't be too—
Commander, it's the URNC internet.
It's from a "beacon", a signal tower that the Great Wall Railway Garrison has set up in contamination zones!
The drones must have passed over a train of the Great Wall Railway on the way back, so the beacon cluster ought to be nearby.
Move out! Our destination is the beacon cluster!
We'll "borrow" their equipment to restore our comms and internet access. That'll be a good start.
The beacon towers here are a little old, and only these two are still usable.
Hm... This model is way too obsolete. It's not really compatible with the comms modules in our MBV.
The serial number of the nearby purification zone is still W_2069.
2069? They're pretty efficient at what they do. |Can we use the comms now?
Um, the compatibility isn't ideal, but I guess it'll work, kind of. We should be capable of mid-range comms.
Mid-range... Mayling, send this message to all the signals you can detect: "The siren sings upon the sands on a sunny day."
R-right.
(The message is sent out, and we soon receive a response.)
We have a reply. "The Collapse pieces are ready; Harpagon is waiting." There's also a string of—what appears to be a communication code?
Heh... Use it.
(The call is promptly picked up.)
Yo, I wondered who would be calling at this hour.
...Poludnitsa...
Ha, if it isn't the Commander~
Who else would use that code other than me?
Oho~ I gather you're ready to be baptized by Harpagon?
...No, you're simply the only available broker who happens to be active in the area.
Hey, this is seriously disappointing~ |As punishment, I might have to ask for more moolah, you understand?
...I'm hoping you can be... how shall I put this, magnanimous? |I'm in need of a lot of MBV parts and Doll frames.
Is this a business expansion or what...?
Yep, I was jumped.
Ha, how the tables have turned, Commander~ Didn't think you'd get into trouble for causing trouble everywhere you go, eh?
I'm just trying to fulfill a contract as usual.
The contract IS a little strange, though. We've had a string of strange coincidences, but the cargo is still with me. |Once I hand it over and get paid, I'll be looking for you to refurbish the Elmo.
Refurbish the Elmo... Hang on a minute. Don't tell me you're the one who got that high-paying job...?
...My contract certainly is a high-paying one.
Hm...
There's been some intriguing rumors about this particular contract.
What rumors?
That's a secret~ |But if you come and collect the order yourself and also take care of some small trouble for me while you're at it, I can give you a 2% discount plus some extra free intel. Deal?
...My Dolls and drones are pretty much done for right now. In fact, I only have one vehicle left.
Bad timing, Commander~ During this special period, we don't do deliveries, and no free intel is available~
Are you in trouble?
Oh, it's not a BIG problem. It's just that we received a shipment earlier, and a pack of wild mutts have caught the scent and come to feed.
...Sounds like a pretty big problem to me.
I just don't know who's the Judas in my team that went and kissed our enemy.
...Since when did we have a common enemy?
Well, we do now—What's happening on your end? I'm getting static over here.
The comms equipment in the MBV is broken. The stuff I'm using now is borrowed.
It doesn't sound like normal static to me. |In any case, I'm at TY3IU-8SSZ90. Thanks for shopping with us, Commander.
...Mayling, make a list of the supplies we need and send it to that comms code.
Alright. Er, Commander, is that Poludnitsa...?
Yep, she's that old friend of mine who has something of a screw loose... But she's worth every cent of her fee when it comes to the variety and quality of her supplies.
Then... does she have...
Oh, add one more item to our shopping list—10 bottles of home-brewed rice wine.
This... this is wonderful! Thank you so much, Commander!

Also, recalibrate the comms equipment. Set it to a fixed comms channel and make sure its encrypted. |Groza, Nemesis, I'll be counting on you to collect the goods—and remember to bring along the backup of Krolik's neural cloud.
Understood.
Hm, this is a good position~
How's the comms channel with Groza and Nemesis?
Connection is stable. Judging by the time, Leader should be there by now, right?

Oho~

A worthless human like you wants to deal with me? |Hand over the sample. That way, I will not completely annihilate those worthless defects that you call second-gen Dolls.

Ah, Commander... Leader and the others backed up their neural clouds before leaving, so it won't be a total loss!
Oho~
I hope you have a clearer picture of the situation that you and your companions are facing. |Right now, your MBV has little in the way of supplies, and nothing in the way of Doll frames.

Thanks to your help, Groza and the others won't be overpowered by this one Doll.

—Pardon me, but you seem to have overlooked my presence here.
—Your time is up.
(The Doll seems to be adjusting her communications module.)

This will be the last thing you can hear from your defects. |I hope that at the very end, you will be grateful to me for allowing you to bid those defects farewell.

(This is most probably a workshop for machinery assembly. The incandescent lamps overhead are almost burned out, their flickering light barely illuminating the space.)

—While I already knew you were worthless defects, you still took longer than I expected to get here.

My left shoulder is now damaged and immobile due to the explosion at the center. It's probably related to the hydraulic rod. |Tsk, that Re-something Pattern is a massive pain in the ass to work with. What do you mean you were creating opportunities to attack for me? If I wasn't here you'd be scrap!
—Nemesis, what's your status?
...The cruel sounds of clarions, dashing upon the steady rock... Crumbling pebbles...

Colphne?
Hmm—?

...Not contacting you in time and allowing them to exploit this timeframe was my mistake. My apologies, Commander.
Ah... uhh... Can you confirm the identity of those who are helping you?

...From assigning me this assignment to now, this series of events goes far beyond just "illegal armed forces". |Kalin, just what exactly are you doing?

...What about Dandelion, then? She's capable of lifting the city lockdown on ODE-01. Does she have some other role as well? It couldn't be that she managed to breach the city management system of the URNC, right?

Central Army Emergency First Response Unit, 3rd Medical Team of the 11th Medical and Chemical Regiment, Medical Doll TS-K-2076, Colphne?
Mhmm—That's me~
Woah, you figured it out so quickly—As expected of the Commander's trusted "old friend"~

Helena's immunity to Collapse radiation possibly exhibits itself within a specific range of radiation concentration. ...Helena was briefly taken away by them before. If Helena is a "fully-immune individual", acquiring her biological information and extracting sufficient experimental samples within a short period of time might have been enough for them...
But if Helena isn't a "fully-immune individual", then perhaps what is more valuable to them is the "Helena" that was once an experimental subject.

...The Girard Group is our primary target of investigation, but we find no subsidaries registered in the field of biotechnology within the organizational structure of the Girard Group.

In the URNC's vital documents archive, there's a document labelled ZMQ_038, which details an event relevant to the Purification Project.

During the process of laying down purification zones, the Great Wall Railway Force detachment responsible for the area discovered a large amount of carcasses while clearing out a sewage treatment tank.

After an investigation, it was revealed that this location was once under the control of a biopharmaceutical company. In their pursuit of expediting drug development and ensuring drug efficacy, the company unlawfully used clones—these clones shared similar physical conditions.

Colphne.

...First it was the Collapse storms, then it was the Varjagers with that Boojum something, and then there's Dolls that can transform along with involvement of the Girard Group, and possibly some biotechnology conglomerate. Who knows what else will get dragged into this...

(Sigh) Why is this assignment so complex... Seriously, Kalin, why the hell did you hand this off to me? Thank goodness I nabbed some supplies out of this, or even the Elmo's gonna come crashing down with it all.

Commander~ Smoothed things over with Big Sis Kalin, have you?
(Colphne's gaze flickers toward the projection screen.)

Hmm... An abandoned mine. Sounds a bit dangerous. |Why would the Varjagers hang around here?

(Groza glimpses something out of place through the gap.)
(The two Dolls slow down and creep towards the gap.)
Ah, found em~
Look closely.
(They spy a semi-open space surrounded by abandoned machinery.)
(The space is at a low altitude. It must be over ten meters deeper than their position.)
Would you look at that?
Boss, look at how much we've plundered! If we turn it all in, we'll surely get a good spot at the next hunt!

What are you talking about? We didn't plunder anything. Those idiots couldn't hold onto what they had, and said some crap about how they'd come back for revenge. Hahahahaha, what about your revenge now?
You know about Team 1?

Yeah, I don't know what they were thinking in the first place, going all that way to help those Team 57 maggots. And how did it turn out? Hahahaha, 30% of them disappeared in a blink of an eye, 30%! Who's the boss of 57 again?
Berserl?

Yeah, yeah, Berserl. That weakling, hiding behind his connections of the URNC, and that ugly bas—who was it... Ravn? With the way he walks, he's been a pain in the ass for ages. And with that, the entirety of Team 57 is gone! Hahahahaha!
Are we turning in all of this, Boss?
Of course not. Team 1's known for having the best equipment and being good at fighting, but what are they gonna do when something real tough comes along?

I'm telling you, it's a million times better to rely on ourselves than Glasir! If we just stay here, we'll have everything we'll ever need! Go, find what you can, and leave the good equipment for ourselves. We'll be happy to sit in the middle of the hunt; the ones in the front are the first to die anyway!

Of course, of course. Once we get our hands on some serious gear, let's go have a run of those few places nearby. Those fat pigs still refuse to pay tribute. It's about time we showed them how things work around here!
Are, are we going to kill them?
What, are we going to let them go and wait for them to come back for revenge? Ahahaha!

Come on, let's get this over with and wait for the next batch of idiots to come along. Why haven't we gotten news from the guys at the entrance? Someone go check on them! We'll put down each little lamb that comes crawling along. Go!
(Colphne's features grow cold as she peers at the swaggering Varjagers in the canyon.)
Colphne?
Leader, they're saying... they'll kill the people close by?
...That lines up with how they operate.
So we... are we going to get rid of them?
The positions they occupy will interfere with the MBV's progress. |Contact the MBV; we need Krolik's and Nemesis' support. With the equipment these personnel have, we can't take them on ourselves.

Judging from their conversations, they'll be staying here for some time. |Colphne, what's going on?

Make the call, Leader!
Take it, take it, take it all! Load them all into the vehicles, let's go!
There's no time, Boss, no time!
What're the entrance guys doing? What do we pay them for?
Who cares, we're leaving!
Hmph, weren't you going to show us who's boss? |Are we going after them, Leader?
We are. Nemesis, aim for the tires.
...Empyrean fire, radiating searing brilliance...
You pieces of scrap, how dare you intrude on my business! I'll give you something to chew on! Fire!
Incoming!
Fire! Get outta here, I'll do it myself!

(Their leader scrambles onto the jeep at the forefront and starts fumbling with the rocket launcher mounted on the back of the jeep.)

Retreat!
I—I need to—
The fire's burning beyond what your body can handle, Colphne. Retreat!
No—Leader! If they get away, the people nearby—they're going to die!
Colphne! We've eliminated most of their forces. They don't have enough equipment remaining to threaten the residents near here!
Nonononononono—Just a bit faster—if I could stop them just a bit faster!
Krolik, grab her. We're leaving!
Mayling, tally the parts we currently have remaining in our storeroom. I need to place a shaped charge on the roof of the upper section of the ops room. How long will that take?
Which direction?
Upwards, towards the sky. Blow it up the moment someone comes down!
Um... it's not a very large modification, and it shouldn't take too long, but we might need a more stable environment...
I, I can still fight, we'll take out these Varjagers in a second, just, just a bit more time—a bit more time, Leader!
Alright, alright, how the hell do you have this much strength in those little hydraulic bits of yours? If you want to kill Varjagers, I'll let you have a few more of them next time!
...Drifting mercury, gazing towards an unassailable fortress...
Didn't you just let them go because you got distracted?! I saw it crystal clear, those few shots of yours hit absolutely nothing!
...Mountain ranges blocking fire, meandering and growing along a set path...
Who exactly was blocking your line of sight?!
(Krolik lets go in agitation, while Colphne struggles free of her grip and catches up with Groza, who is now in front of me.)
Leader!
Quiet!
(Startled by Groza, Helena winces behind me.)
Groza, scary!
Wh-what happened, Leader... Colphne is?
The Varjagers in the canyon ahead have been cleared out. We can proceed, Commander.
No—no! Some of them got away, Commander!
Hang on, slow down. Groza, what's the situation?

...The majority of the Varjagers previously positioned in the middle of the canyon have been eliminated, with some of them escaping in jeeps. During the pursuit, the remaining Varjagers used rocket missiles, causing an explosion. The explosion ignited a fire, and due to the debris in the vicinity, the fire grew significantly. But I could have caught up with them! If we used the Remolding Pat—
Colphne!
(Groza snaps a little too loudly, and Helena tugs at my sleeve.)
"We can all die right here. Is that what you want, then?"
I—

Even if you caught up with them, you'd have nothing to do other than eliminating what remains of their forces. They already pose no threat to the MBV. In these circumstances, the resources we would need to commit for pursuing them, as well as the associated risks, are far greater than just retreating, Colphne.
Is it something with the Varjagers?
Go have a change of clothes. Clean up the Collapse radiation.

As a member of the team, you need to listen to your Leader's orders. Don't worry, we're not leaving the contamination zone anytime soon. If the reason you joined the team in the first place was to eliminate the Varjagers, you'll get plenty more opportunities.
It's not the Varjagers. I didn't...
(Colphne desperately tries to defend herself.)
(But she abruptly falls silent when she meets my eyes.)
I understand.
(She leaves the ops room in silence.)
Colphne, angry?
Bad, Commander!

Bully Mayling, bully Colphne, Commander, bad!

Well, they're off. Are we going into the canyon, Commander?
...Let's go.
Not again... Who is it this time, Groza?
Unknown.
Well, I suppose I'm getting used to this... Put it through.
(I straighten my clothes and walk up to the projection screen.)
(A casually-dressed woman with short hair appears on the screen.)
Hello, B.R.I.E.F. registered—
Bounty hunter? You bounty hunters always start with this line, and I have to hear it two to three times a day.

{}, right? Hello, I'm Saga. |The supplies the Counselor asked me to provide you are prepared, are you outside Bihor Canyon?
Yes.
I knew it.
The Counselor's warnings were not without reason. This commander, by the name {}, rarely ever intends to make a grand entrance, but always successfully manages to do so.
...What's the meaning of this?
We have a delicate partnership with those Varjagers in the canyon. |We allocate a portion of our profits to fulfilling their supply demands and they help us filter out undesirable customers.

If you had contacted me at the entrance of the canyon, you could've gone straight in... Now, the Varjagers leaving is not a big deal, but the optical filter camouflage we used for our secret entrance got caught up in the explosion and is completely busted.
Lenna!
(I recall Lenna's words through grinding teeth and bow a little in apology.)
The personnel who I communicated with did not alert me of this. |My most sincere apologies, Miss Saga.
No, no, Saga will do. Can I call you Commander just like the Counselor, {}?

After entering the canyon, it will take around a ten-minute drive to get here. |Drive your vehicle in and I'll be waiting for you at the entrance. See you in a bit.
Wait.
Yeah?
I have a blue-haired Doll here...
Uh, I meant to say... If possible, please do not mention your cooperation with the Varjagers in front of her.
Oh—ooh, okay. |I await your arrival, Commander.
Power up the engines, we're moving.
Understood.
Cooperation with the Varjagers... Did I hear that right?
Hmph, what good is there in cooperating with scum like them?
This is a contamination zone. |You all, as well. After we get in and meet with Saga, don't mention anything about the Varjagers.

Oh—huh, your base of operations is a big boy, huh? How are the maintenance costs on it?
Bearable.
If I were you, I would've quit the bounty hunter life a long time ago with such a big guy like that. |Sell it for a hefty sum, find a city in a Green Zone, and live out the rest of my life.

Hah, there's some truth in that. Come over here, I'll take you to our warehouse. |The Counselor has a lot of supplies for you. As for transport, your Dolls—ah.

There's four Dolls. Should be enough.

Man, this vehicle of yours sure is big. Any bigger and the elevator might not be usable. The maintenance on it can't be easy, can it?

Take a left turn here. It's just up ahead.
Alright.
Speaking of which, I heard that you used to be a big shot in some high-up places?

As if. Her conversations with me are very brief. Aside from discussing the supplies needed and how to identify whom those supplies belong to, there was only talk of money.
The person who told me is another broker. Poludnitsa. You should be familiar with her.
You know Poludnitsa? She's not active around here, is she?

Thanks to the Surrogates establishing these Underground Quarters, us small-time brokers found a way to make a living. I happened to run into her, and overheard her talking about you.

The channels of merchandise we brokers use are a well-kept secret.

Poludnitsa came here mainly to look for some intel related to the Varjagers—oh, and she said something about providing the said intel for free to some big shot Commander who used to be in charge of some big places. |To get free intel from Poludnitsa... Gee, how big of a favor does she owe you?
...No, she's given us a lot of help.
(I can't help but glance at Colphne.)
(Saga also takes a brief look at her.)
(Colphne is following quietly behind me and does not notice our attention on her.)
Building good relationships with bounty hunters is indeed important. |We've arrived, Commander.
(We come to a stop before a warehouse camouflaged as a rock face.)
(Saga presses a button, triggering some sort of mechanism and opening the door.)
The supplies the Counselor requested for you are inside.
Groza, Krolik, Nemesis, Colphne, I'll have to trouble all of you to move these supplies back.
I might need you to leave behind two Dolls.
While we have backups for the entrance's optical camouflage, it'll take time to deploy and activate them.
The costs will be covered by the Counselor, but as a form of interest... let's arrange for a fair exchange. I'll need you to ensure the safety of the underground channel.
...My apologies, that was my mistake. How long will it take?
About as long as it'll take you to transport these supplies.
Alright. Krolik, Nemesis, you get started with moving the supplies. Groza, Colphne, you—
(A sharp noise interrupts me.)
(The noise sounds like the feedback you get when testing a sound system. The ear-splitting noise is soon replaced by a clear voice.)
Come listen to Vepley's song, everyone☆
You again, you again! Stop it, it's too god damn loud! Get down from there!
Lalala☆~
Shut up! Saga—!
Ah! Coming!
This is?

I've got a Doll here, and her name's Vepley. You heard her. I take my attention off from her for a second, and she runs off to a big rock in the middle of the underground channel to sing. |Oh right, could you help me bring her back?
...Does that fall under the defense of the underground channel?

Here's the deal. Even though the Counselor paid for it, you did buy an impressive amount of supplies this time. If you're willing to send your Dolls to fetch Vepley, I'll give her over to you as a complimentary gift as a bonus for the bulk purchasing. How does that sound?
...Isn't there a need to ask that Doll named "Vepley" for her opinion on this?
We can ask her when you bring her back. |She'll say yes.
Don't move—Stop it! How many times do I have to tell you?
Performance failed! Vepley's going to try again!
...Crumbling gravel, breaking the valley's solemn veil...
Hah?! You do it then! You try holding her down yourself! What the hell is up with this sassy lost child? She's smaller than Colphne but even stronger!

(At the sound of her own name, she merely looks up briefly at Krolik but does not answer.)
Commander.
Thank you for your hard work.
Let go of Vepley—ah, Saga, Saga!

Saga—!
Ah, be more gentle... Ow, ow...
Today's concert was a failure, but~
Vepley tried a cutesy type of performance☆How was it, Saga?

Shut the Doll down, delete the neural backup. |Create a new neural profile for "Vepley", and that'll be the "Vepley" you want to see.

Ah... haha, I'm trying to make a living in the contamination zone, and I still need to rely on my Dolls. They might cause some trouble but it's no big deal. Shutting her down... There's no need to go that far.
It's no big deal, but you want to send away the Doll you rely on?
Ah, uh, Colphne—
Colphne, that's not something the Commander would ever do.
Hah, I'm talking about Vepley.
(Hearing her own name again, Vepley turns to Colphne with curiosity.)
Hi, I'm Vepley~ |Your hair has a beautiful color, like the sea! Vepley remembers your name. It's Colphne!
I'm telling your owner to shut you down and delete your neural backups!
But Vepley has been managing her backups properly and has been shutting down to rest? |Is Colphne unhappy?
(Vepley is confused by Colphne's lack of response.)
(She looks back and forth between Saga and Colphne, and after some thought, she puts forward an earnest suggestion.)
Should Vepley sing you a song? |If something's making you unhappy, just come to Vepley~
(As Colphne's features darken, I hurriedly put myself in between them.)
Ah, well, Saga, we'll be off with the supplies. I'll leave Vepley with you. |It seems like Vepley doesn't really plan on leaving, does she?

...About that, I didn't intend to put it this way... but the intention isn't really to make Vepley listen. |According to what Poludnitsa said, the impression given was that you have a bunch of T-Dolls under your command, yet you let them do whatever they want for the most part.

I feel that... Vepley might have a bit more freedom with you? Like singing on your vehicle every day or something? Your MBV is massive, so you can surely find a place for her to sing, right? |As you can see... nobody here is really a fan of Vepley's singing.

Yay! Vepley wants to sing☆

With the number of Dolls you have, surely adding one more won't be a problem, right? If you don't want her to stay with you, you can leave her somewhere safe once the repairs are done, yeah?
Okay, okay, stop going on about that Vepley something. Commander, I'm off to carry the supplies!
...Then I'll trouble you with that.

...Scattered light, undistinguishable figures in the mirror...
I'M childish?! Well, I think you're just a coward!
...Otherworldly images, coalescing once more...

(The bickering Dolls make for the stash of supplies, pick up a massive box each, and make their way back to the Elmo.)
...I'll go help with the supplies.

This blue-haired Doll of yours, Colphne, is she usually like this?
...She's not like this normally... She's usually the opposite.
Okay, then what about Vepley?
Hi!
(Vepley raises her arm in response to hearing her own name. She and Saga both look expectantly at me.)
The assignment I'm taking care of is a bit troublesome... and I am short of manpower. However, whether she's coming or leaving me rests on what Vepley thinks.
Vepley, would you like to come to my convoy? Body maintenance is covered, and while we might not be able to let you sing freely every day, there won't be too many restrictions either.
Okay~ |Vepley, now starting a new journey☆

Commander, think about it. Even if her bodily state is not amazing, but for one Collapse piece, you can get your hands on a T-Doll equipped with a fire-control core. Vepley can immediately become a force you can utilize directly. Seems a good deal to me.
And with the prerequisites of possibly needing deep repairs and bodily replacements?
—In compensation, I would be more than happy to introduce you to a few other assignments, guaranteed to be at a far better rate than whatever you could take from B.R.I.E.F..

...Alright, one Collapse piece. I'll hand it over later.
Please come again.
Vepley, you've got a place to sing now. Are you happy?
Ecstatic!
Groza, contact Mayling, prepare the ownership registration and the resource allocation for Vepley . |The underground channel's defense—
(Not far away, Colphne lifts another supply crate.)

I'll leave that to you and Vepley. While you defend the area, make sure to support Krolik and the rest of them.
Understood. |Vepley, come with me.
Performance, with Leader☆
We're not performing. Are the condition of your body and ammo stocks fine?
Systems green, Vepley standing by!
(Vepley follows Groza towards the elevator.)

It'll take a while for the supplies to finish being transported. Would you like to take a break Commander? |Dinner time is approaching. Would you care to join us? I can't promise that it'll suit your taste, but you won't go hungry.

Don't worry.
(Ten minutes later...)
(Saga leads us to her stall.)
Please take a seat. I'll go get dinner.
Thanks.
(I sit down on a chair next to the stall and take in my surroundings.)
(The underground channel is illuminated primarily by the various lights of different stalls.)
(Speckles of light embellish the dark and cavernous space and divide it into multiple sections that vary in size.)
Here, this is "mici". It's a local specialty here.
(Saga puts down a platter of what looks like roast meat skewers in front of me.)
Is this meat? This can't be potato, can it?
It's not potato. Have a taste.
Alright.
(I pick up a "mici" skewer and take a bite.)
(The texture is marvelous. The air-dried outer layer is both bouncy and crispy. When I bite into the meat it cracks open, and the stuffing oozes out like mozzarella cheese.)
How is it?
Not bad. |To have meat for dinner, I guess business must've been good lately?
It's all thanks to the Contamination Zone Development Plan.
I thought that project would decrease your profits?

Not really. The progress of laying down the purification zones shrunk down the area of activity of the original residents here, and though the ELIDs have become more active... the price of supplies has spiked. We've earned a tidy sum.
(Before long, I have already finished an entire mici skewer.)
Do you have a recipe for this "mici"? If possible, I'd like to let my team Leader try making some of this.
I expected you to have a hard time adjusting to this.
Is this not a normal meat?
It can be categorized as "meat", but the material is not conventional.

In recent years, we have discovered a type of insect that lives underground. These insects exhibit a certain resistance to Collapse radiation, and the residents believe that consuming these insects can enhance our own resistance.
Mici is made from them and is well-liked here. However, most people outside of here struggle to adjust to the texture.
...Insect?
Yeah. If you'd like, I could price it at—
No, thanks.
Alright.

Thank you for your hospitality. It's about time, I'll go get the Collapse piece. |Vepley's ownership registration and authorization transfer will be arranged after the Collapse piece is in your hands, yes?
Thank you for your understanding. |Take care, the road ahead to the left is more densely lit.

Equipment, supplies, I wanna see it here!
...The Varjagers?
(Having finished hauling our supplies, Team Groza hurries back to me.)
(A stray bullet whizzes towards me. I jump aside to dodge it.)
Commander!
I'm fine. How are the supplies?
Transportation is complete. The enemy's composition is largely similar to those we encountered previously in the canyon, and can be identified as the same group.
I didn't expect someone as small as you to be able to carry this bulky protective gear. Hmm, you can also carry supplies and run quickly. You're way more useful than Nemesis.
Huh? No, no, no, Vepley can't carry this! I also can't move things around!
Hah?
...Sky's boundary, to a barrier... scattered colors...
Nemesis, you were the one who needed my help with that, weren't you?! If you don't feel any need to use your eyes, how about I rip them off you and sell them to the brokers here?!
Uhh, aha, we don't currently take in Doll parts... Well, Commander, are you done with the supplies?
Yeah. Groza, go take care of the Varjagers in the underground channel.
Understood.

You, why are you damned robots here?! You, you better remember me! We're leaving!

"The resources we would need to commit for pursuing them, as well as the dangers associated, are far greater than just retreating." They're already not a threat, I know.

This attack from the Varjagers was because of us attacking them before—

That's reassuring.

Even though their harvest this time was a bit more aggressive and the high level of destruction was indeed because of you, it's fortunate that you've mostly wiped them all out. We can handle the remaining few. All we have to do now is to get a new batch of co—
(Saga glances at Colphne.)
...Um, I mean a new batch of equipment, to take care of more Varjagers that might come around.

As a token of gratitude for your assistance, how about joining me to rest at our residence for the night? We can address Vepley's authorizations and discuss the assignments I mentioned in detail.
...Yeah, that will do, we have some matters to take care of as well. |Come on, let's go have some rest.

The elevator at the entrance is no longer operational, and the alternative entrance is some distance away. |May I have the honor of being a passenger on your vehicle and guiding the way for you, Commander?
Sure.
(Saga and I make for the Elmo while Groza and the others follow suit.)
(Colphne scans the surroundings one last time as she brings up the rear.)
(The lights go out one after the other in the underground channel, gradually plunging the space in darkness.)
Colphne?
Yeah.
(She quickens her pace and catches up with us.)
(Her face is devoid of emotions.)
(After leaving the underground channel that night, we drive along a barely navigable highway towards Saga's place.)
(With Saga showing us the way, the Elmo manages to leave the Collapse storm behind before it gets worse.)
Woaaah—This big boy of yours is pretty quick considering its size. That Collapse storm hit so fast I thought we wouldn't be able to dodge it.
The MBV will keep us safe from the storm as long as we don't spend too long in it.
But seriously, are you really not going to sell it?
What would I do after that, go to a Green Zone?

Even if you couldn't go to a Green Zone with the leftover money, you could find a place to stay and renovate it a little so you can have a place to put your boots up after wandering for a long time. Our place welcomes people like you—
Suckers like me?
I never said that.
Are we close to your settlement?
Yup. Turn right past that pile of rocks up ahead. We're almost there.
Turn right, Groza.
Understood.
(As the Elmo makes the turn, a semi-underground district comprised of abandoned buildings gradually comes into view.)
Er, is, ah... Is Vepley okay?
We've transferred her Doll authorizations, and Mayling is running diagnostics on her body. Once they're done, I'll go familiarize her with the MBV.
Mayling, would she be that reliable mechanic of yours?
Mhm.
She isn't just a mechanic, is she? From the look of things, doesn't she handle a lot of other jobs too?
Yup, she's also my very capable adjutant... |If possible, I'd like to stay with you guys for a while.
You're more than welcome. May I ask why?

We have a fairly long journey ahead of us. Before that, I'd like my mechanic-cum-adjutant to get a good rest. |Since this is a residential area, are there any entertainment facilities or activities that you'd recommend?
We aren't a particularly big community or anything.

As for entertainment... Hm, there's a decently high slope to the northwest. The kids go sand-skiing there from time to time. |Alternatively, that mechanic-cum-adjutant of yours called "Mayling" might prefer to help pick fruit in our underground greenhouse... I mean, it's probably entertainment compared to fixing doors, windows, or sweeping the streets, right?
...That doesn't sound very entertaining to me. |That said, you have fruits here? How much are they?
If you're buying, you get a friend's discount. That's a lot cheaper than other underground brokers. I'll go confirm the price afterwards.
Alright. There's no need to pick them, but I'd like to know the price, if it's not too much trouble.

Oh, it's no trouble at all. We need to sell them after planting them, and being able to cut out transportation losses does everyone good. |Selling fruits in a contamination zone can be quite an expensive business. Thanks for your patronage in advance, Commander.

I'm just a Doll, JUST A DOLL! Other than doing everything I can and taking every chance I can to avenge her, what else can I do? What else can I do? What can I do? What should I do? Can you tell me, Commander?
(Looking at Colphne, I can almost see my past self.)
(I hesitate for a moment, then I pat her again and kneel down with her.)
...I don't know either.
(Cries)
Dolls cry and laugh. All of you are different "people" to me. If you believe she's still alive, then go look for her. If not, then seek revenge. To make a choice instead of running away...
As a "person", you're braver than I am.
Colphne, as for what to do, there's nothing I can say.
I'm sorry, but I can't provide you with an answer.
...I should be the one saying sorry.
(Colphne grips the metal box carefully with one hand and returns my hug with her free arm.)
(...Her hand is shaking. I can clearly sense it on my back through my coat.)

Sorry for causing so much trouble. Thank you for modifying my frame and providing maintenance for me. I didn't want to leave without saying anything... but when I chose to leave, I thought that I shouldn't keep a neural backup on the MBV... and then, I came back.
Sorry, thanks, goodbye, I'm back—I should be the one saying these things, Commander!
Of course, you're braver than I am, Colphne.
(Colphne hugs me again. Then she dries her eyes, puts the box aside, and pulls herself up to her feet.)
(She bows solemnly to me.)
Thank you for allowing me to return. I'm back—If there's anything you need, please tell me, Commander.
Hmm, let's see... just act like usual. |If you have anything you need, just tell me and I'll let you know if anything comes up.
(Still bending at the waist, Colphne offers me her hands and helps me off the floor.)
(After that, she picks up the metal box reverently with both hands.)
I'll remember that. Thank you for the gift, I really appreciate it.
I'll go take a look at Helena!
Thank you for your hard work.
Don't mention it.
(She runs two paces, then stops. She turns around and gives me her usual bright smile.)
What you've said today, I'll burn it into my neural cloud, Com~man~der~
(I wave at her and watch her leave the central hub with the metal box in her arms.)
Alright. It's about time. Next...
Commander.
Hmm? Your maintenance is done?
Yes. I'm tidying up the mission report, and it's estimated to be uploaded via the usual channel in 24 minutes.
...I've been thinking about a bunch of questions on the way here, but now I don't really know where to begin. Maybe it'll be better if I go straight to reading the report?
Did something happen with Colphne?
Not really. It's just that.. I'm thinking, maybe I can take the initiative a bit more...
That's the way you've always been. For example, even when it comes down to what to eat.
You know that's not what I'm talking about. Alright, let me get started, then.
Okay.
...What exactly did you run into? The damage you suffered was far beyond my expectations. I originally thought this was just an infiltration mission that needed to be approached with caution.

It's Helena. She lost control of her defense equipment and Krolik had to knock her out. She's very closely related to Paradeus and the purification ritual. I think she is the "lost Cavitas", Commander.
Give me the details.
Before it started, Helena mentioned "ritual" and "experiment", and the moment she lost control lined up with the beginning of the purification ritual.

During the ritual, the Nyto mentioned "pure Cavitas". Collating Paradeus' attitude towards Collapse radiation from the descriptions of Nyto and Niter, I think "Cavitas" refers to a "fully-immune individual"—Helena, in other words.
You saw a Nyto?
The Unitates referred to the individual performing the ritual as "Lady Nyto". I will attach the image to the mission report shortly.

Right. Even if "Cavitas" is referring to a "fully-immune individual", Helena might not be the "lost Cavitas"—she's not a true "fully-immune individual". Helena is very different even when compared to the individuals I've previously seen... but her bodily functions began to deteriorate in environments without Collapse radiation.

Perhaps there are trigger conditions or circumstances we are not yet aware of, Commander. |Both Nyto and Niter asked their Unitates to search for the "lost Cavitas", and Helena is right in our hands. I don't think this is a coincidence.

No, since there might be many copies of Helena, Paradeus might have created individuals of other types. If at the same time, an individual of another type also disappeared, then the "lost Cavitas" might not be referring to Helena.
Although there's no evidence linking this assignment's commissioner or client to Paradeus... Helena's box did, however, use technology from Paradeus.

Could that company "registered in the field of biotechnology" be Paradeus? Or, apart from the Varjagers and the Girard Group, is there a direct link between that implicated biotechnology company and Paradeus?
I think it would be the latter... If Paradeus was active in the White Zones, Kalin would tell me.

During this operation, Helena was exposed in front of a Nyto. If we are correct, the impact of that incident cannot be measured—We should immediately request for reinforcements from Kalina, Commander.
I'm not certain of the situation with Kalina. If she hasn't contacted me of her own volition... I can't make contact with her right now. |After you left, did the Nyto pursue you?
No, she did not attack us.
Wait, I thought your damage was caused by an increase to Nytos' combat ability?
It was Sextans.
Sextans?! |Why's she with Paradeus?!
I'm not sure.
Before we arrived, she was already there. However, compared to before, she exhibited significantly reduced combat abilities.

The order you gave me was to retreat immediately when the reading reaches the danger zone. The value stayed within a safe range at all times, but I determined that no more information could be acquired, so I ordered a retreat instead of stimulating the Remolding Pattern.
After fighting, did Sextans not pursue you either?
The situation was chaotic and we did not find any sign of her after our retreat.
...I see.

The information about the Nytos and your encounter with Sextans should be put in the mission report and submitted ASAP. |Additionally, ask Mayling to try tracing back the channel Kalin used previously. The chances of tracking it aren't high, but we'll have to try.
Alright.
What about Nemesis? Anything noteworthy?
She was as usual.
Cross-reference the environmental data. Where are we right now?

Our current coordinates are 7WE2WX3-EO021R4, approximately 290 km from the location of the purification ritual. Environmental data indicates that a Collapse storm is up ahead. Currently, we are attempting to circumvent this area. We are projected to enter a 430 m deep valley in 6 minutes.
Another Collapse storm and another valley? |Pull back about 500 km, find cover, and get ready.
Incoming! The explosives we set above the MBV have been detonated!
...Again?

No time to backtrace... and no time for repair either. I've only been able to go through basic maintenance on everyone... Sextans is out there, and the storm here is bad... W-we'll be alright, right, Commander?
—Groza?
Enemy number confirmed to be just one.
Is it Sextans?
...Yes.
(A burst of static comes through the comms, making it difficult to make out what Groza is saying.)
It's just her? No other Paradeus combat units?
No. Enemy confirmed to have left combat area.
So they've withdrawn?
She's remaining outside of our firing range and is not leaving.
T-there's a new communications request—caller unknown!
...Put it through. Groza, stay alert.
(Mayling displays the new comms window on the projection screen.)
(I walk up to the projection screen.)
Good... day...
(I find myself looking at Sextans, who is wearing a hood.)

(I cannot be certain if the Collapse storm is affecting the signal reception or if Sextans' vocalization module is damaged, but her words are very choppy, and the simple greetings took her seconds to get out.)
It's a terrible day. This should be the first time I've seen you in the flesh—Sextans, chasing us here, tailing us—what do you want?
Sex... tans... my... na... me...?
You... kn... ow... who... I... am... pl... ease... tell... me...
Still trying these childish tricks on us?
(Sextans makes no reply or any sort of movement. She looks like a static image pasted on the projection screen.)
Groza, sitrep.
No abnormalities. No movement from enemy unit.
I have no time for this. Groza, get rid of her.
Tell... me...
(Sextans takes off her hood...)
(...Revealing her exposed circuitry, protruding eyeballs, and mangled metallic hardware.)
Neu... ral... autho... ri... zation... un... lock... li... mit... tell... me...
Give me the order, Commander!
A new comms request! Encrypted channel... caller is... "Light the dawn, shining edge in hand"?
...Put it through.
Commander!
Even in the place furthest from the sun, daylight does not fade so easily.
A new comms request! Encrypted channel... caller is... "Light the dawn, shining edge in hand"?
...Put it through.
Commander!
(I am consumed by nightmares of the past. Lenna's transmission brings the latest tidings.)
(Murmurs of terror, buried away by She who toys with destinies with a wave of her hand. The sandbox tells another tale.)
(The Elmo proceeds at full speed across the wilderness, route data feeding in intermittently.)

(It's the afternoon, the time when the sun is strongest. For but a moment, the daylight from outside strikes my eyes. In a moment of stupor, a most familiar name comes to mind—one that has not left my lips in quite some time.)
416... Klukai.
(Klukai and Mechty shelter from a Collapse storm in the remains of a building.)
(Gravel endlessly pelts the ruins as it gets propelled by the raging storm. The frail windows emit an unsettling screech, ready to burst into a million tiny blades any second.)
(Mechty leans against a broken wall far away from the window, looking at the seething Collapse storm outside with fatigued eyes.)
Jeez... what kind of accursed place is this? Collapse storms just rock up outta nowhere without any notice.
Sure would be nice to be Andoris or Belka right now, lounging about in the temporary base instead of having to do some preliminary survey...
If you were expecting weather forecasts this close to a Red Zone, then I'm afraid you'd be sorely disappointed.
Yeah, yeah, whatever you say...
(A great gale rushes over the building, bringing with it a variety of swept up debris and grabbing Mechty's attention.)
Woah! What was that just flew by? Looked like a wooden crate if my eyes weren't deceiving me.
Thank goodness our heavy bike could fit in here... or all the equipment I painstakingly brought would've gone flying away.
I regret allowing you to bring all that trash along.
You just don't get it, Klukai.
Compared to the equipment we found in the few settlements we investigated, what I've brought is worthy of being family heirlooms...
(She proudly glances at the backpack strapped to the heavy bike.)
So much so that even those kids back there would be envious.
...You were tasked with investigating Paradeus, and you went to mess around with children instead?
Hey, don't give me that scary look, I didn't shirk my duties or anything... I just didn't get any answers.
Not a single person there has seen any Dolls resembling a Nyto, much less heard anything about the whole Paradeus deal.
Are they really still active like Leva said?
Do you think we'd be on this mission if someone could simply answer that question?
Hey, I'm just asking.
Come to think of it, weren't all the Paradeus remnants cleaned up? To think they'd show up again... Don't they ever get tired?
If they like that gig so much... why not just get 'em to come work at 404? Shooting at people's the same no matter who you work for...
(The storm shows no signs of letting up. Mechty scratches her head in frustration and lies down.)
(Klukai follows Mechty's gaze, looking outside briefly before returning her attention to Mechty.)
Get up. What happened to staying alert while on the job?
(Klukai approaches Mechty and tugs at her jacket, the latter refuses to get up and only changes her position lazily.)
Ah... come on, can't one lie down a bit when there's the opportunity? There's still plenty to be busy over later on, isn't there?
Anything related to Paradeus is never easy. And we'll get unlucky, like, super unlucky.
I dunno what Leva was thinking when she accepted these arduous, ungrateful assignments... It'd be more profitable for us all to lie around at base and do nothing.
(Klukai lets go of Mechty and looks at her helplessly.)
What she was thinking doesn't matter. A job is a job.
Not like I'm slacking off or anything... I don't see this storm stopping anytime soon, and we can't exactly do anything other than hide from it in here.

I think you're way too anxious about all of this, anyway... We haven't even run into a single bounty hunter or a Varjager this whole time, much less Paradeus. If it weren't for the ELIDs, this place would already be "safe and secure", no?
That's exactly what's suspicious. We should use this time to plan our future operations.
I have a feeling we'll be running into some difficult circumstances this operation.
(Klukai solemnly looks toward the all-consuming storm outside.)
The frequent Collapse storms, the radiation levels noticeably above average... The environment here is significantly worse than what Leva's intel would suggest. And so...
Chill out, Klukai... Zzzzzz... zzz...
(Klukai and Mechty defeat the incoming enemies and split up to survey their surroundings.)
No clear indication of affiliation on this one either... The only serial number here seems to have been inscribed back when Sangvis Ferri was active.
Anything on your side, Mechty?
(Mechty's listless voice comes through the comms.)
More of the same, though they're a little different from the Sangvis machines we've encountered before.
Yeah, some of the modules have traces of modifications.
Nothing out of the ordinary, though. Almost any PMC you can find has a ton of these things lying around. Would be strange to make no modifications at all.
Yeah...
Don't think I don't know you're slacking off just because you're using comms.
Fine, fine...
(Mechty perks up a little on the other side of the line.)
Any discoveries other than the machinery?
Hm... how should I put it? Looks like someone used this place as an outpost not long ago.
Some of these valves have signs of recently being used. There are also some scattered cables and cords on the ground... They must've left in a hurry.
Who could it have been?
Some passing bounty hunters or Varjagers hiding from the storm, perhaps.
So those machines that attacked us just then would be theirs?
...Difficult to imagine anyone leaving their combat bots behind in an area with such ELID presence. That would be tantamount to suicide.
I'll contact the base. Get back here.
(Yawns) Break time, finally.
(Mechty looks as if a she's been released from a great burden as she ends the call.)
(Klukai and Mechty continue to shelter from the storm within the ruined building. Klukai attempts to contact their temporary base while Mechty rests in the corner.)
(The persistent "No Signal" notification dashes Klukai's hopes of contacting the outside world.)
(Can't contact the base, and the other person... a hint of frustration arises as Klukai thinks of them. In truth, she's glad she sent a message before she set off.)
(A habit she's kept to these past few years before leaving for a dangerous assignment.)
Signal's absolutely terrible with this storm going on.
Still can't contact Andoris and the others? I did say we should've just left together, but you insisted on this preliminary survey...
Leave together, get ambushed together, and then get stuck here together?
But I miss the sofa at the base... those two must be lounging on those babies right now, don't you think?
They don't have it nearly as easy as you imagine.

The new external equipment and programs Dier prepared for Andoris are still in the testing stage, and her presence at the base is necessary for trial runs. Yours isn't, seeing how slacking off is your highest priority.
(Mechty rolls over, ignoring the disapproval in Klukai's eyes.)
(Yet, finding things are still not quite comfortable, she lazily scoots over to the heavy bike.)
What's wrong with slacking off... It's not quite a sofa, but I brought this... Hmm, where was it...
(She produces a travel sleeping kit from her backpack.)
Hardly improved in combat abilities, but has made leaps and bounds in the field of sleeping...
Yeah, impressive, right? I hand-picked it together with Andoris and Belka. State-of-the-art in both comfort and value for money. A must-have for any battlefield environment.
Easy to store when uninflated, and when you need it, you simply go like this—
(Mechty smugly presses a button, and soon enough the neck pillow and its cushioning are filled with air.)
"Exceptional, convenient, every traveler's best friend.”
That's how the ad put it. Wanna try?
Hm.
(Giving Mechty a frigid response, Klukai aims her weapon and fires in the pillow's direction without hesitation.)
Uwah!!!
(The bullet zips past the pillow in Mechty's hands, and from behind her comes a shrill cry of an ELID eating lead.)
Forget about the pillow if you don't want to sleep with the ELIDs. Pick up your weapon.
(Klukai and Mechty annihilate the ELIDs without further incident, save for the inflatable pillow's commendable "sacrifice".)
(Mechty crouches down and fiddles with the damaged pillow on the ground, sorrow written all over her face.)
Wah... there's no repairing this level of damage...
Klukai, that shot was on purpose, wasn't it?!
Hmph.
(Paying no attention to Mechty's pitiful cries, Klukai casts her gaze outside to find the veil of gravel and sand clearing up.)
The Collapse storm's shrinking.
(She pulls up her comms screen as she speaks, and sure enough, the signal has been restored.)
(Klukai dials in a series of commands already committed to muscle memory, and an image of the call's recipient soon appears.)
Big Sis! Long time no see!
...It's only been half a day at most. 5 hours, to be exact.
(Spotting Andoris behind Belka, Klukai immediately begins her enquiries.)
Andoris, are you finished with the data collection?
Yes. Using Leva's intel as a foundation, I've acquired a series of in-depth reports from the underground brokers active in the area, as well as B.R.I.E.F.'s databases.
Unfortunately, nothing about Paradeus was found. Other than that...
What is it?

In terms of the environmental data, there are some pretty significant discrepancies with the data Leva provided. |The environmental conditions have been gradually deteriorating especially in the past 6 to 12 months, and the Collapse radiation is far more intense than in other areas close to Red Zones.
As B.R.I.E.F indicates, many bounty hunters have gone missing after entering this area, and as a result their intel here is always out of date.
Regrettably, the engineering department for the URNC Purification Project is likely much the same in terms of information.
Yeah, our field survey results line up with that.
It should also be noted that Mechty and I were assaulted by a force of unknown affiliation—
Unknown affiliation?! Were you hurt, Big Sis?
What do you think?
Oh, I'm not doubting your abilities, Big Sis... I'm just worried about Mechty dragging you down, that unreliable sod. Yeah, just like that!
Yeah, yeah, I'm unreliable...
(Dejection overtakes Mechty's countenance, remains of her pillow clutched between her arms.)
Hehe, Belka's just worried about Leader Klukai.
Don't waste your time on such meaningless concerns. We cannot conclude this attack to be a targeted action against 404, but chances are that this assignment will be far more difficult than described.
Andoris, send me what you've gathered.
Yes, Leader.
Also—
(As the data transfers, Klukai pulls up an area of the surroundings and selects a settlement.)
See these coordinates? Get ready and meet us there later.
The reception here is poor. Tell Dier to find a way to maintain the comms.
Very well. Dier is still adjusting the equipment outside, so I'll tell him when he's free. Make sure to be careful, you two.
Hmph, the good-for-nothing's still fixated on that damaged inflatable pillow.
(Klukai gazes at the still crestfallen Mechty with a mixture of exasperation and concern in her eyes.)
She did make very sure to prepare it for the trip, after all.
...Whatever.
Do not support Mechty's wanton expenditures in the future. Especially you, Andoris.
Of course. I'll keep it in mind next time.
(Andoris nods with a gentle smile on her face.)
I somehow doubt you're really scrutinizing that...
Let's leave it at that. Don't tarry and depart while the weather remains calm.
Yay! I already can't wait to see Big Sis!
C'mon, c'mon, c'mon—Big Sis is waiting for us!
(Belka anxiously taps her feet, attempting to hurry up Andoris' file transfer.)
Don't be in such a rush, I need to go over it again... Records of population change... static maps within the past 10 years... ELIDs in nearby areas and Boojum sighting reports... Not to mention...
Andoris, even if you have all of that local storage space, you don't need to transfer all the data in there.
I already installed a signal booster for you and Belka. Your connection shouldn't be cut off if everything works as intended,. If you need something, just transfer it over the network.
Hehe, I just can't help but be worried since Leader Klukai mentioned the signal instability.
It's the Yellow Zone after all. Some instability can't be helped, especially with the frequent Collapse storms. There's no need to be so uneasy.
Mm... I wish I could agree, but Leader Klukai's encounter with the unknown enemies makes me worry.
That is indeed an issue... Right, Andoris. Are you bringing "that" this time?
...That?
Ah, you mean the newly adjusted external equipment?
Yes, and the firepower algorithm to go with it. The adjustments are mostly complete; it's time to enter the combat testing phase.

Both accuracy and firepower should be significantly improved with it equipped, but since it's still a prototype, its power efficiency and runtime both leave something to be desired. Remember to borrow the external battery for Mechty's frame.
On top of that... the equipment's still quite unwieldy, though it can still fit in the jeep's trunk—just barely.
You'll have to bring the trailer for the heavy bike too, right? Place the other supplies there. I'm sure you can find some room.
Will do. I'll have to leave that to Dier.
Give me a moment, I'll go load it.
(Dier returns to the control panel and begins a series of operations.)
Right, speaking of Mechty... bring a new travel kit for her.
Belka, can you help me get something from the depot?
Why for her...
Leader was talking about future expenses. But this here is money we've already spent.
Wow, Andoris must've taken on some bad habits from that dork!
Hehe.
I'll go fetch the goods. Hurry up, you lot!
Alright, alright.
You too, Dier!
Yes, of course.
Andoris, the person I sent to run checks on your vehicle is finished. When this transfer is done, we'll be ready to go.
(Andoris drives towards the meeting point with Belka.)
(Their vehicle leaps across the Yellow Zone with Andoris at the wheel. She's humming a tune with a relaxed expression.)
(Humming)
A-Andoris, I want to see Big Sis too, but not this much... you could, you know, slow down a bit.
Hm? Is this really fast?
(As she speaks, the jeep flies off a small incline. Belka holds onto a handrail for dear life.)
Ah, woahhh—!
You're always a slowpoke, but how come you drive like a wild animal?
Hehe, we are in a Yellow Zone, after all. The roads here are much simpler than in the White Zones or satellite cities. Even I can drive without much issue.
See, like this.
(She smiles and slams on the accelerator as the jeep piles through a small ELID in its way.)
What a relaxing drive this is~
I-Is that so...
Aahhh—!!
(The vehicle suddenly swerves, and the squeal brake pads and tires sound out in unison.)
(A series of bullet holes suddenly appear in the vehicle's original path, sending up great clouds of dust and sand.)
