(Belka and Andoris take advantage of the vehicle's spinning momentum, quickly opening the doors and tumbling behind some natural cover nearby.)
Careful, incoming!
According to the combat record you've sent over, the modifications made to these enemies are quite similar to the machines that attacked us before.
In a place as desolate as this, we can more or less confirm they are of the same affiliation.
Leader Klukai...
Hm, things can't be explained by mere coincidence anymore. These are organized attacks.
But why are they going after us? Is Paradeus deploying these machines?
We can't be sure as of yet.
Perhaps these machines are not only attacking 404. Didn't Andoris' data indicate that many bounty hunters have gone missing in this area in the past month?
So you're saying... Those weren't incidents caused by the environment?
That's just a guess.
But you guys should be careful... We... go...
(Zzz—zzt—zzt)
(A wave of static washes over the communications channel. Klukai's projection violently shakes a few times, then disappears entirely—comms are down again.)
This...
(Andoris attempts to restore the connection, but her efforts are for naught.)
What happened? The reception was perfectly fine just now.
Looks like something's happened on the Leader's side. Maybe the Collapse storm's picking up again.
She'll be in danger, won't she? What should we do?
As of now, it would be more prudent to proceed as originally planned.
Please contact Dier. Let's see if he can do anything about this signal problem remotely.
Got it, I'll talk to him immediately.
Andoris?
If you can hear me, please respond. I repeat, if you can hear me—
Don't waste your effort, the signal's obviously gone again...

This network provided by the underground brokers is so trash! If you rent for a few days the rate is several times worse than the monthly rate, which in turn is several times worse than the yearly rate. And this is the quality we get?
Get paid, do nothing... Seems like they're very "efficient" businessmen.
Man, that sounds nice—
(Mechty stretches with a deep sigh, her face full of envy.)
Hmph, when this assignment's over, I think we need to go and have a "talk" about the rates.
Uwah... you look really scary right now!
Well, here comes an opportunity to let off some steam. Those machines are here again... in greater numbers than before.
...How annoying.
Don't just sit there and commentate, get down here and fight!
Do we need to get rid of all of them? The numbers really aren't in our favor.
Pick off the fast units and those with long-range capabilities, then look for an opportunity to retreat.
Do not overextend before we rendezvous with Belka.
Ugh... that sounds even more troublesome.
Their pursuit has already forced us to significantly deviate from our original route.
(Klukai checks her terminal, and once again finds that only short-range communications are available. Long-range comms are still down.)
The storm is still going, there's no reception, and we're unable to pinpoint our location in real time...
Are you saying we're lost?
(Sigh) I knew that anything involving Paradeus would be a recipe for disaster.
But in any case, the signal quality this time has been atrocious, isn't it?
It's never been this bad even during Collapse storms on our previous Yellow Zone missions.
(Klukai vigilantly monitors the surrounding environment, ignoring Mechty. Seeing this, Mechty decides to fall silent.)
(Creak, creak, thud, thud.)
(The sound of mechanical units advancing.)
(Klukai makes a hand signal, gesturing for Mechty to dive into Level II.)
Those sounds... They sound like antique cars that haven't been oiled in centuries.
They are approaching our location from the north.
Are they the same batch as those who had attacked us earlier? But there's only a few of them, and they seem really weak.
Don't let your guard down.
Uwah... But they look so trashy.
(A creaking ground reconnaissance unit appears a short distance away.)
Such an old model... And it looks so run-down. It's a miracle that it can still move.
Most likely bait. Look above it.
Is that... a flying drone?
Yeah. And it seems to have a fire control core installed on it.
That's impressive... But also really weird. Why are two machines with disproportionate performance operating together?
Why not ask yourself the same question?
Ugh... Those are some really condescending eyes.
If you don't want to be looked down on, then prove your worth.
(Klukai looks toward the broken wall to the right of Mechty, suggesting that she should use it as cover to sneak up on the reconnaissance unit.)
We need to ascertain who they are just in case. If they are our enemies, it'd be good to know their numbers.
...(Sigh)
(Mechty perks up with a sigh, reluctantly moving right towards the cover.)
(The scouting units are approaching as she moves.)
There doesn't seem to be any units other than just these two.
Hey... Could they be broken? Why have they not noticed us after getting so close?
Remain alert and stay where you are. Wait for them to get closer.
Don't reveal yourself without a good reason.
Okay...
(Mechty props up against the cover, using sound and environment to track the enemy movement.)
(Creak— Creak—)
(The joints on the ground mech creak rhythmically.)
Uwah... It's like the elderly doing morning exercise...
(The ground mech stops abruptly, as if its power has been cut.)
Hm... The sound stopped? Could it have broken down?
Hey! Stop!
(But Klukai is too late. Just when Mechty tries to shift herself for a better view, she conveniently exposes herself to the ground mech's sensor.)
(Beep— Beep— Beep—)
(The warning light on the ground mech flashes red, and it emits an ear-piercing alarm.)
(At the same time, the UAV launches an attack. The abandoned container Mechty was using as cover just a second ago is riddled with bullets.)
What the hell—?!
(Mechty dodges the attack and darts toward other sources of cover.)
(Meanwhile, Klukai takes the opportunity to break the drone's wings with a three-round burst, while the ground mech simply keeps blaring its sirens.)
(At this moment, a group of armed humans and mechs appears on the northwest side of the building, raining down fire on them.)
Didn't you say there were no more enemies?!
My radar isn't working!
I'm not a dedicated scout Doll, so my detection range isn't supposed to be this long.
Besides, who knew they would stay silent and wait for their bait—
(After downing another drone, Klukai zips back into cover. After confirming Mechty's combat status, she issues an order.)
Mechty, cease fire!
Huh? Am I hearing that right?
Quickly!
(Just as Mechty rolls over to some nearby cover and puts her gun away in disbelief, a booming male voice comes through a loudspeaker from behind cover on the opposing side—)

This is the 3762nd Platoon of the 7th Environmental Survey Corps of the Neo-Soviet Union District Environmental Purification Project under the URNC Contamination Zone Management and Recovery Administration! I am First Sergeant Dmitry, and I suggest you cease fire immediately!

I repeat, this is the 3762nd Platoon of the 7th Environmental Survey Corps of the Neo-Soviet Union District Environmental Purification Project under the URNC Contamination Zone Management and Recovery Administration! I am First Sergeant Dmitry, and I suggest you cease fire immediately!
(After confirming that Mechty has put her gun away, Klukai turns on her voice amplification device as well.)
Acknowledged.
We have issued an order to cease attacking.
(Upon hearing Klukai's response, the opposing party immediately ceases gunfire, but both sides remain ready to resume hostilities.)
State your reasons for attacking, and we will judge whether or not you are considered to have deliberately attacked a regular army force.
We had no intention of launching an attack on your forces.
Your bullets tell a different story.
We can explain our actions.
As a gesture of good faith, we will meet in the center of the battlefield in 10 minutes. We will not carry any weapons.
Alright. Make sure you keep your word.
(The voice falls silent. Mechty has retreated from the front, gazing at the other side of the battlefield with visible concern. The armed forces are recuperating after the combat.)
How come it's the URNC's people?
This is real bad... That big guy sounded really angry.
I'll negotiate with them in a bit. Stay alert and cover me.
If push comes to shove, I might need to activate Plan B.
...Plan B? Wait. You're not going to press the switch here, right? There'll be no end to our troubles if we antagonize the Rossartrists.
We can't confirm whether they are friend or foe at the moment, so it's necessary to eliminate all risks by strengthening our guard. Still, I'll try my best to avoid conflict.
Okay... I hope it's all just a misunderstanding. Dealing with them is a lot of trouble.
(Seeing Klukai coming alone and unarmed, the platoon leader lets out a displeased grunt from behind his protective suit.)
Hmph. What's the point of just sending a Doll over?
Tell your cowardly owner to come out and talk.
(Voice recognition tells Klukai that this is Dmitry whom she had talked with earlier.)
H.I.D.E 404 is an autonomous armed Doll squad, currently assisting the Non-Military Forces Administration in investigating illegal PMCs in the Yellow Zone.
(Klukai intentionally modifies the part about Paradeus in accordance with Kalina's instructions.)
404? What's that? Never heard of it.
The Non-Military Forces Administration hired you guys too?
(Although he's still suspicious, hearing the Non-Military Forces Administration being mentioned makes him relax a bit.)
We are supernumerary Dolls, so it's normal that you haven't heard of us.
And we have some business to discuss.
Business? Of course.

(Dmitry takes a look at the radiation detector and ensures that the reading is within safety limits. He then pulls the protective hood off his head, revealing the face of a middle-aged man with an angular jawline. Years on the battlefield and years of desert wind have left their marks on his face.)
What kind of a protective suit is this? This junk is choking me.
(He curses quietly with a grimace, then looks at Klukai with unbridled disgust in his eyes.)
You claim to be working under the NOMFA, so how come you don't know the rules of engagement?
Shoot first, ask questions later, is that what they taught you?
We were previously attacked by mechs of unknown origin, and then your scouting unit appeared, without the usual identifying insignia of the URNC Survey Corps. We simply opened fire in self-defense.
You better start using your tin brain before you speak. We encountered no unknown mechs on our way here.
It's up to you whether you believe me or not. The fact you haven't encountered them doesn't mean they don't exist.
Besides, it was your drone that started shooting first. We were just responding to such an attack.
The drone runs in auto mode. Do you?
Right, how could I forget? You're just like that drone. Just another clanker that runs on algorithms that can only do as you're told.
(Seeing that the opposing side is trying to provoke her instead of making progress information exchange, Klukai raises an eyebrow and remains quiet.)
(However, Dmitry doesn't seem to mind at all. He continues to ask questions in a condescending manner.)
Regarding what you said, we'll report that to our superiors later and request an investigation.
For safety reasons though, we will need to know the contents of your mission and the formation size.
The specifics are subject to a non-disclosure agreements signed with the Non-Military Forces Administration, so please show me proof of your clearance level.
As for our numbers, only two Dolls have been engaged in combat by your forces just now.
T-Two?!
(Dmitry's soldiers are shocked by the contrast between the firepower they witnessed and 404's real numbers. After receiving a stare from Dmitry, they promptly shut up.)
That's impossible. That level of firepower must have come from a group numbering at least ten people.
404 is a squad made only from tactical Dolls. Our combat capabilities and battlefield awareness are different from what you got used to during your duties at the Great Wall Railway.
...How do you know that we're from the Great Wall Railway?
A messy combat mech composition, haphazard modifications, old equipment—
Those were looted from Varjagers, underground brokers or bounty hunters, weren't they?

The few pieces of elite equipment you have bear the insignia of the Great Wall Railway, and perhaps there was no time to switch to the insignia of the Environmental Survey Corps. I'm guessing you are all temps in your roles.
(Noticing his stiff expression, Klukai inserts an additional remark.)
—Right, how could I forget? The ones guarding the Great Wall Railway are basically "regular armed forces" that consist of a bunch of old mechs most of the time.
Watch your mouth. What does a blasted machine like you know?
(Dmitry raises his gun, but Klukai simply stares at him coldly without moving a muscle.)
I've explained everything. Isn't it time for this to end?
Hold up!
(Just as Klukai turns away to leave, Dmitry shouts for her to stop. The soldiers raise their guns and aim at her.)
What?
Even if you really are from the Non-Military Forces Administration, how do you plan to compensate us for the losses we've suffered?
404 has lost assets too, both sides are responsible for what happened today.
Trying to renege on your debt?
No.
Then where's the money? We worked long and hard to gather all that equipment!
Does your broken tin brain realize that we are responsible for surveying for the construction of the Intercontinental Railway? Not even the NOMFA will back you up on this.
Renege means we are indebted to you. I don't think we owe any such debt to your forces.
(Facing Klukai's unwavering attitude, Dmitry takes out his communicator.)
If we can't settle it between us, then you will wait for orders from above.
But before I contact them, remember that even if we are temps, we are considered part of the regular army. Do you think a Doll like you will be taken as seriously as us?
And I have over 30 people ready to testify, do you think you two can manage to win them over?
...You're able to contact the outside world right now?
(Hearing Klukai's question, Dmitry simply assumes that the opposing side is considering his threat, and so he increases the pressure in his voice.)
Of course. Once the message gets out, the situation gets a whole lot more serious.
Stop dawdling. I have to bring them over to the next settlement. Ain't got no time to waste on the likes of you.
We have no money for you, but we can assist you in combat for some time.
This environment must be pretty hard on your forces after all.
And you've seen us in action just now.
(Dmitry does not expect this reply. He sizes up Klukai.)
What are you up to?
Nothing. It's just that before we set off, we were told not to unnecessarily antagonize the local forces.
...Hmph.
(Dmitry pockets his communicator after a moment of consideration.)
Deal. But here's my warning: you better listen to my orders and not think of trying anything funny.
The regional comms frequency is 110.32. Adjust your communicators accordingly.
There's a lot of interference in this hellhole, so make sure you stay within a maximum of two kilometers from our forces.
I hope I don't have to hear too much crap from you.
Don't worry about it. I couldn't care less about you.
Two crappy dolls want in on our internal regional communications? They'll need a password for that.
(After confirming that she has successfully connected to the comms frequency, Klukai ignores the insult and turns to leave.
Tsk. Goddamn machine.
Lorraine, once we're back, go tell the guys responsible to scale down scouting patrols by 30%. Have those two tin cans handle any danger we come across whenever possible.
Are we really bringing those two Dolls along, Dima? What if they try something on us?
I will contact the warrant officer to confirm their identities. You guys should be careful too and keep your distance from them.
No matter how you put it, having two Dolls be our vanguard is beneficial for our mission.
But... What if they do something to us? Their level of combat proficiency...
Could you grow a spine for once? You think 30-odd men plus mechs ain't enough to deal with the two of them?! Didn't you see how the earlier battle went?
Also, make sure to address me as sir. You're really good at forgetting that if I don't keep telling you.
Hey, I'm used to calling you differently, that's all.
That's not an excuse. We've served in the Railway Force for so many years, you need to be addressing me appropriately. Otherwise, the newer guys will think I'm biased again.
(Seeing Dmitry's serious expression, the soldier named Lorraine corrects his casual demeanor and salutes him.)
Understood, sir!
That's more like it. You can go back now. Tell everyone to continue on towards our target location. We've been delayed enough already, so we should go as far as we can before the sun sets.
First we have to find Paradeus, and now we have to help the URNC's Survey Corps... Will more work just keep coming like this?
Klukai, 404 isn't lacking funds, is it? Why can't you just settle it by giving them some money...
You'll only be adding to the number of insufferable people in the world if you give in to their unreasonable demands.
But being free labor for them has no benefits for us either...
At least we won't be lost anymore.
Uh, you mean that signal problem from before?
But they aren't going to the same settlement as the one we agreed on...
...Are you an infant who has just learned to walk? We take one step at a time.
(Klukai sighs with concern.)

The Collapse storm has ended, but our signal is showing no signs of getting restored. Yet, the Survey Corps are able to contact the outside world, so it's highly likely that the underground brokers' base station is broken, causing our signal interruption.
So if we follow these people and reach a settlement, we can at least borrow the settlement network to contact Andoris and Belka.
Get it now?
Okay...
But you know, children are not the only ones who walk one step at a time. That applies to the king in chess too, yeah? It's impressive.
(The communicator receives a comms request from the Survey Corps following them.)
This is Squad 404's leader, tactical Doll Klukai. What's up?
First Sergeant Dmitry wants you to change direction, effective immediately. Maintain the same speed and head in the two o' clock direction.
That's a severe deviation from the course for our target location, and—
(Klukai has more to say, but she is interrupted by the angry Dmitry.)
What do you rust buckets even know?
Change course when I tell you to change course. Don't forget what I said. Listen to my orders.
Yes, of course.
(Klukai cuts the comms and swerves to the correct direction. The incoming barrage of wind hits the yawning Mechty right in the mouth.)
(Coughs)
W-what the hell!
Changing course.
(Mechty adjusts her posture so that the wind doesn't blow into her face.)
(The heavy bike flies over the empty wilds like a released arrow, carving a clear path in the landscape.)
Zzzzzz... Zzzz...
Woah!!
(The heavy bike suddenly brakes. The slumbering Mechty loses her balance, but Klukai catches her before she falls off.)
(Klukai connects to the Survey Corps' comms.)
A small group of ELIDs to the northwest, around five to ten of them. Estimated time before contact with the main force is five minutes.
Then wipe them out.
Contacting us for such trivial matters, are you a broken trumpet?
...It was you who told us to listen to your orders. We are simply waiting for your command in accordance with our agreement.
(Upon hearing this, Dmitry utters something under his breath, but it is too quiet for Klukai to hear.)
(After a short moment, he responds with an impatient tone.)
I don't want to see any ELIDs remaining. That's it.
(The comms are abruptly cut. With a stiff expression, Klukai parks the heavy bike against a nearby boulder.)
Get down. Time to work.
(The ELIDs have been eliminated, and the main force arrives right after.)
(Under Dmitry's orders, the troops stop to collect samples from the ELID corpses as part of their routine.)
You people arrived early but chose not to help in the fight. Is this the bravery of the URNC soldiers?
If you need help against such a small group of ELIDs, you'd better go back to a Green Zone to work as window cleaners.
(Noticing something off about Klukai, Mechty tugs on her clothes.)
Hey... He's not really wrong. There weren't too many ELIDs...
Of course. Our sergeant chooses the safest routes all the time.
Be it random ELIDs or Varjagers, we'll never lose with him around!
(Upon hearing this, Klukai gives Dmitriy a questioning look.)
You've been in other theaters of combat?
What?
You couldn't have gained this level of experience just by guarding the Great Wall Railway.
I heard that some folks like you were once part of the retired formations of the Neo-Soviet Union.
What are you getting at with questions like these?
Don't poke your nose where it doesn't belong.
You. Come over here.
(Dmitry glares at the soldier who had interjected just now.)
(Feeling the sergeant's displeasure, the soldier makes the wise decision to shut up, packs the samples he has collected, and follows Dmitry towards the trucks.
Hah... He's finally off. Glad you two didn't go at each other's throats again.
But Mr. Sergeant really seems to hate us. Even if it was because of a misunderstanding at first, I don't get why he's still angry towards us.
Be careful.
Huh?
We haven't met any of those mechs that attacked us earlier ever since we met these people. Don't you think it's weird?
Uh, maybe they gave up? We're with a large group for now, after all.
...He might be right. With this amount of caution in your brain, you really should go back to wiping windows in Green Zones.
Get on the bike. We have to move on.
(At night, a well-equipped off-road vehicle quickly pulls away from the purification zone. The emotionless Doll in the vehicle accepts a comms request from within a White Zone.
How's progress? The work being done here is of great importance to "them". Don't let them down like Sextans did, Blusphere.
I know. But looking at the reports from over there, the situation seems to have changed.
Oh?
Two squads made of tactical Dolls have appeared on the outskirts of our mission area. They are closing in.
If it's just a bunch of T-Dolls, why not deal with them just like always?
We have indeed sent out our mechs, but we underestimated their combat abilities.
Also...
Also?
One of the squads has met with a ground formation from the URNC Survey Corps. For some reason, they are working together now.
In order to avoid alerting the URNC government and causing any unnecessary trouble, I have issued retreat orders for the pursuing mechs.
Please tell me my next move.
Send out the mechs to wipe out the nearby signal base station. Once the area becomes a signal dead zone, finish them all in one fell swoop.
Got it.
(Blusphere nods quietly. These orders are familiar to her.)
(It has always been the case that once these orders are transmitted, one dead zone appears after another, becoming graveyards in the contamination zone.)
By the way.
(As if to intentionally emphasize the moment, the Doll on the other side of the comms makes a pause.)

According to internal intelligence, a URNC department responsible for purification works had seconded troops from the nearby Great Wall Railway Force near the target area. The formation you mentioned should be them.
So, do be sure to hurry it up, okay? Finish your work before what happens here attracts attention.
Acknowledged.
Currently, Paradeus has almost finished evacuating this area. What's left is to track down and recover "it".
I'm currently moving towards the target area. The mission will be completed on time.
You make me feel at ease, Blusphere. It makes me want to cheer for you.
Anyway... Since you're working so hard, I will arrange some reinforcements for you.
They will contact you once they have reached the area.
Got it.
Eh? Not even gonna thank me?
Even though they number few, they are a "gift" for Blusphere that I have painstakingly prepared, you know?
(Blusphere shifts her gaze from the road to the comms interface for a moment. Her empty eyes betray no emotion nor fluctuation, as if she's a military drone that only understands orders.)
Thanks, Cocoon.
Eh—
Compared to Darture, you're so boring. You only respond to orders.
Fine, fine.
Go quickly. Don't make the higher-ups wait, okay?
Acknowledged.
(Cocoon cuts the comms. Blusphere hits the gas, and the dark vehicle blends into the night.)
(Under the setting sun, the Elmo moves forward, still a long distance from its target.)
(Over the years, whenever darkness falls, the past comes rushing back to me uncontrollably.)
(This is why I detest the night. The Mephisto agreement and the unending work of a bounty hunter isolate me best from this world's maelstrom, both in time and space.)
(Despite the hard work and isolation, they are like a calming tranquilizer. They make friends with alcohol, pulling me into slumber.)

(Yet, the white nightmare does not fade. It has caught up with me, making it difficult to confront the choices I made in the past. A million self-reassurances and rationalizations fall flat in the face of this.)
(The "contract" with the devil has since changed.)
(I will not run, but am I truly ready?)
(The comms terminal interface shows a recent message from Klukai, as well as messages from before. One after another, the message repeats the same thing—)
("Where are you?")

(Where am I...? I've never answered this question, in my head or to them. To say the truth, I often struggle to fathom where I am in this world. What I know for sure is, I don't want to drag 404 and their friends down the maelstrom with me.)
(But it is time for me to give them an answer. Not in the form of a message, I want to convey my sincerity.)
(All these years, as I've tried to pull further and further away to the point of aphelion, she has sought to be closer to me.)

(The Environmental Survey Corps have chosen an abandoned settlement to make camp. The soldiers gather for a round of poker around a campfire, the crowd emitting song, anger and laughter every now and then.)
Give it up, Lorraine. It's your loss. Show us the can you've been hiding.
W-What can? If you want that, go find logistics.
Miss me with that load of bull. I saw your lover slip you something before we left. You're definitely hiding something.
Tsk. You watch me really closely for how little I have...
Blame the uppers if you want. They accept missions in swathes in hopes of getting some merit.

They make us set off without supplying us with enough resources and equipment. If it wasn't for the sergeant taking the opportunity to scavenge something every now and then, there's no guessing how badly we'd be faring by now.
Yeah. It's tiring enough to guard the railway, and now we have to do some kinda environmental survey for the them...
Why don't they pay and equip us to the standard of an actual survey corps for starters?
Leave it be, man. You think you can do something other than what the uppers tell you to do?
The only thing you can do here is curse people's mothers.
Hey, I think what you are doing here is inviting me to teach you a lesson!
(Lorraine slaps him hard on the back of the head, and the two of them start to roughhouse with each other. The onlookers start making a din and cheer them on.
(Compared to the boisterous soldiers, Squad 404 is rather quiet.)
(Mechty is in sleep mode after being busy for an entire day, while Klukai looks on the buffooning and joking soldiers coldly.)
(Dmitry notices her gaze, returning it with his own wit unfriendliness on his face.)
What are you looking at?
I'll remove your eyes if you keep looking.
Rabble.
Huh? Say that again?!
(Dmitry straightens up, putting his bottle down.)
Corruption, gambling, extortion, hiding around. How are you all different from common gangsters?
You talk about how urgent the mission is, then camp here and enjoy yourselves boisterously. It's good enough that I don't call you a bunch of wage thieves.
Tch. What do you tin-cans know?
Humans aren't unsleeping mission machines like you two. We need rest when it is needed, so that we can use our bodies and brains at the right moments.
(While speaking, Dmitry gestures towards his temple, giving her a provocative look.)
But for you cable-for-brain Dolls, it's true that rest is unneeded.
You guys simply wait for your masters' commands and do them like good little puppies.
I will emphasize again that 404 is an elite squad consisting of self-managing Dolls. We call the shots on our own.
Hah, what a joke. Elite squad, eh?
Look at that little one beside you. She sleeps earlier than any of us here.
ZZzzz...
(Just as Klukai wanted to make a retort, Mechty rolls over, laying near Klukai's feet. She seems to be thoroughly enjoying her sleep.)
Hahahahaha. That's an ELITE?!
(The soldiers of the Survey Corps roar in laughter.)
Get up!
(Klukai bends down and shakes Mechty awake.)
(Mechty shakes her head around in confusion.)
What do you want now?!
Patrol!
(Klukai pulls Mechty up, leaving the camp with long strides.)
(Behind them rings out the taunts from soldiers, with Dmitry's voice being the most prominent—)
Now that's more like it! Go be good guard dogs, elite Dolls!
(The night passes by without trouble. After a couple hours of movement, the formation finally reaches the target settlement.)
Our support work ends here. I request that you honor our deal and release 404 from all blame.
Hmph. Help me send my regards to your Non-Military Forces Administration masters. Tell them to educate their underlings better before letting them out.
(Dmitry waves his hands impatiently before leaving with the soldiers.)
Hah... I reckon that Leva and Kalina must have been harassed a bunch at this point, no?
Good thing we are supernumerary Dolls, otherwise we might be on the way to a court martial already...
Leva is still part of 404. Handling things like this is part of her job.
True enough. What do we do now?
Find the residents here and borrow their network.
Oh. Feel free.
I'm going to find a place to sleep. I've been forced to wake up early even after having to stay up late yesterday night...
(Seeing Mechty rub her eyes and attempting to slip away, Klukai grabs her with haste.)
Uwah! Not the collar!
You don't need two people to borrow the network, just go by yourself—
We would like to borrow you our network... But we've lost signal for a couple of days now.
The connection is intermittent even on normal days, plus there's been many Collapse storms recently. Perhaps the base station has completely broken down after all.
Does the settlement not need to contact the outside world?
The people from the URNC Survey Corps help to do that. Because they needed to carry out survey missions nearby, some of them started to camp here since half a month ago.
So in recent weeks, we have been using their communication equipment to contact the outside world when it was needed.
Do you know where their camp is?
It's near the southwest border of our settlement.
That area is an old abandoned residential complex, so it is perfect for parking their vehicles and housing the wounded and the sick.
Sick? You mean ELID infected?
Yeah...
(The scrawny middle-aged woman tugs at the cloak she wears. Her withered hands fold anxiously.)
ELID infection rates have gone up considerably in the past year.
The symptoms have become more severe and are progressing much faster... I thought it was just my imagination...
(Klukai and Mechty exchange looks.)
Until I saw the URNC Survey Corps... Quite a number of them were infected too.

It should be that the medical professionals they have with them would be more skilled than those of us who can't even be considered doctors, but it seems that they too are at their wit's end about these infections... They had no choice but to house some of their seriously ill people there.
So what you're saying is, they had a bunch of people leave them previously?
Yes. About 20 of them.

We have not seen them ever since that day. I heard from some bounty hunters that there's been an increase in the number of ELIDs roaming nearby... Even if they lived, they must have succumbed and become just like them now.
If people from the regular army can't take it, I don't know how much longer we can last...
(She bites her lip, unable to continue the topic.)
Ah, I need to take care of my kid...
Thank you.
(The woman nods and closes the old, worn door.)
Uwah, the underground brokers' base station is really done for now because of their shoddy construction, huh?
What should we do now, Klukai?
The rendezvous point is around one or two hours from here, so the place is not that far-off according to the static map.
But it's so dangerous. What if we get attacked by those unknown mechs again? We have no signal and will have to rely on the static map. We could easily get lost, you know...
(Mechty grabs and rubs her hair as if experiencing a breakdown, her tangled hair threads as messy as her mentally exhausted neural cloud.)
Why don't we wait for a bounty hunter or underground broker convoy, and go back home with their help?
...If you can think just as fast as you gave up, 404 would be in a much better place right now.
Then wouldn't it be so over if I give up thinking at the speed of light...?
Our only issue now is having no signal. So once we have signal and get the relevant access permissions, everything will be solved.
We are going in a loop now... No one has signal here, other than—
Wait a minute. You can't be thinking of asking the Survey Corps for help, right?
(Klukai nods calmly.)
It's impossible if you just think about it for a second...
There could be something even worse than Dmitry in their camp, perhaps a way more tricky end-stage BOSS...
Humans have a saying somewhere along the lines of this — "Money makes the devil turn millstones for you".
404 has not been lacking in money recently.
Weren't you saying something along the lines of not enabling insufferable people by giving in to their unreasonable demands...
F-Fine! We'll go then...
(Klukai and Mechty arrive near the complex situated on the southwest side of the settlement. They see a transport escorted by military jeeps arrive and stop at the nearby field.)
(Personnel in protective suits remove supply boxes from the vehicle.)
(Hearing the commotion, medics from the Survey Corps come out of the complex to meet with them.)
Isn't that a transport from the URNC? Looks like they are staying right over there.
Let's go over there and ask. Perhaps we won't even need to get to the uppers before we are granted access permissions.
(As she speaks, Mechty moves towards the transport, but is dragged into a hiding spot by Klukai.)
What now? Are you regretting it now...?
That's not a URNC vehicle.
Hm... It's not the common identifying insignia of the URNC.
Also, sending this many escorts to guard a supply transport is a bit too much, even for a dangerous environment like a Yellow Zone...
Every dose of medicine could save someone's life. What would Dolls like you know?
(Dmitry's resonant voice rings out from a dozen meters behind the duo.)
Uwah, when did you...
Next time you want to spy on somebody, make sure you're well hidden from the get go.
However...
(Standing up from behind cover, Dmitry's gun is aimed at Klukai.)
Why are the two of you sneaking around? What are you planning?
Give me a reason, and I'll ask my gun if it likes it.
(Klukai and Mechty is instantly surrounded by armed soldiers who have popped up from behind walls. They are all aiming at the duo.)
(Klukai gives Mechty a look. They raise their hands to show that they have no intention to fight.)
We are here to find you.
Hm?
(Dmitry stares at the two Dolls, but eventually lowers his weapon. However, he does not order his subordinates to stand down.)
What do you want with me?
We—
I don't want you to tell me. Let her say it.
(The yawning Mechty is given a rude shock upon hearing those words. With her mouth still open, she quizzingly points at herself with a look of disbelief on her face.)
That's right. You.
(Seeing that Klukai has given her a nod, Mechty scratches her head in resignation.)
Uh, it's like this...
(Mechty explains their situation to Dmitry, then tells him about their request to gain access to communications.)
Hmph. I knew you wanted something else when the two of you offered to escort us.
You Dolls do have some brains after all.
Klukai, is he complimenting us? What a weird guy...
We wish only to access the network, communicate with our teammates and regroup with them.
And why should I give a crap to help? Screw off back to where you came from.
We will pay for your help.
...Hmph. Your words carry such strength and confidence.
Don't go thinking that we'll give you a discount because you are working for the Non-Military Forces Administration.
(Facing Klukai's unyielding attitude, Dmitriy lifts an eyebrow and switches to a cantankerous tone.)
It's true that the signal here is pretty weak. So, even if you want to use the military's line, we need to use special signal boosters.
So, fees for the use of our equipment and line, maintenance fees, compensation for borrowing our equipment and hence causing us trouble, a deposit for lending equipment and—
Name your price.
(Dmitry makes a hand gesture.)
Uwah... that's real shady of you, uncle. Why don't you change careers and be an underground broker?
Pay if you can, piss off if you can't.
Deal.
WHAT?!
(It's not just Mechty. A flash of surprise runs across Dmitry's face as well.)
Give me your account details. It's definitely a private one, right?
Hmph.
Let me make this clear. This is a dedicated line for the URNC Regular Survey Corps, so you better watch what you say while using it.
If we find that you are contacting suspicious people, I will revoke your access. Don't blame ol' me then.
As irregular as we are, we don't have to rely on a borrowed vehicle to transport supplies like you people.
Peh. What would Dolls like you know?

This is called reasonable allocation and usage of civilian resources. With so much trouble happening all over the world now, we'd be skeletons eating sand if we all waited for the URNC's official vehicles.
And these are the decisions of our top brass. What right do you have to criticize us?
...You guys. Send them what they need.
Copy that!
(A subordinate beside Dmitry nods, then starts working on the trade. Klukai's communicator rings.)
Received.
(Shortly after, Dimitriy's communicator rings as well.)
(After taking a glance at the balance in his account, Dmitry closes the interface irritably.)
Alright. It's in.
Take what you want and scram. Stop being an eyesore over here.
(Pocketing her communicator, the two Dolls turn towards the exit of the camp.)
(After leaving the Survey Corps' camp, Klukai immediately establishes communications with Andoris and Belka. Belka's voice and projection appears immediately.)
Uuuuu, Big Sis, I was so worried about you!
I thought we would see each other soon, but we suddenly lost contact with you. That was so torturous!
We kept being unable to contact you two. Belka was so anxious, she was about to run off on her own to start a wide-area search.
That's because I can't live without Big Sis.
Knock it off. It's time for serious discussion.
Have you two successfully reached the designated settlement?
We have, but not smoothly.
(Andoris wears an expression of worry, yet she touches her face relaxedly.)
Our signal died off on our way here... Even though Dier specifically equipped us with signal-amplifying receivers before our departure.

Our luck was decent, however, and we weren't attacked by unknown mechs or ELIDs after the loss of signal. We used the sun's position, wind direction, and landscape to navigate using the static map, so we didn't get lost on our way.
After reaching the settlement, we borrowed the network from the residents. We've been trying to contact you ever since.
Hm. Now that's something from you two.
Hehe, I was praised by Big Sis! So happy!
It's all thanks to the various types of training Leader Klukai arranges for us in peacetime.
Now compared to you two, I have a useless Doll over here who can only complain in the backseat...
Zzzzz... Zzzzzz...
(Mechty has taken the opportunity to switch to sleeping mode at an unbelievable speed while they were talking.)
(Watching the unambitious Mechty, Klukai lets out a sigh.)
...All she wants is to sleep all day.
Haha, it's good to let her rest for a bit. Mechty must have been tired after going on such a long journey.
The more you speak for her, the worse she gets.
(After placing a makeshift pillow of clothes under Mechty's head, Klukai ultimately allows her to continue her slumber.)
Andoris, Belka, head immediately to the location I had just sent you.
The Survey Corps here seem to be experiencing strange difficulties here. It might be due to the change in environment conditions and the movements of Paradeus around this region.
I will remain here with Mechty to start an investigation.
Got it.
Before I forget, here's something I want you to help investigate.
(Klukai sends over footage and images she had taken over to Andoris.)
Hm? What's this?
They say this is a supply transport from the URNC, but the insignia is different from what we've seen before. In addition, it was followed by a number of armed personnel.
Are you suspicious that they are involved in the strange happenings of this region?
Suspicious might be too strong a word, but it's good to be prepared.
I see.
Maintain a good connection on comms. Tell us if you run into any trouble.
Understood!
(After ending the communication, Klukai finally has some time to herself. She opens her message interface. As expected, there is no message from that particular person.)
(Klukai understands that she would definitely hear about it if they had met an end. So...)
(If they don't respond, they are safe.)
(With this line of thought, Klukai pockets her communicator.)
(With Andoris' information, Klukai can confirm that the underground brokers' network used by 404 was completely down. So, she decides to contact Dier for an arrangement.)
(After communicating the situation with Dier, he unexpectedly bears a face of resignation.)
The underground brokers' network is completely down... Hm. I know. I heard about the signal issue from Andoris as well.
And what do you plan to do now that you have heard about it?
404 uses network services provided by underground brokers when operating in contamination zones. My responsibility is Doll maintenance, not base station repair.
I have no power over the fact that their base stations are rarely repaired and maintained, okay?
What?
...Don't stare at me with such a scary expression.

It's really not that I'm too lazy to help. Your mission area is already pretty close to a Red Zone for starters, and with a hostile environment combined with little money from very little people in this area, it's natural that the underground brokers can't and don't maintain this place very much.
Then prod them for repairs.
Did that a long time ago.
But don't you understand those people? Tell them this month and they reply in the next, then it will take another month to complete the repair.
I'll contact them again and see if I can solve the issue by giving them more money or some technical support.
But I just want to make things clear: I cannot guarantee how long this will take to repair. No one knows how this will go.
It's best if you continue borrowing the Survey Corps' signal if you need it.
(The thought of having to continue cooperating with those soldiers irritates Klukai.)
(At this moment, a comms request from Andoris appears in her visual interface.)
In any case, make sure to restore the signal as soon as possible no matter what methods you use.
Unless the underground brokers want me to visit them on their doorstep.
...Wow. Scary.
I have other things to take care of. This is it for now.
(Klukai switches over to Andoris' comms request. The sounds of gunfire and the roars of ELIDs can be heard through the comms.)
Leader, we've been attacked by a large number of ELIDs! Please assist!
Save me! Big Sis! Andoris' jeep couldn't crush them all!
Acknowledged.
Keep moving in the same direction and sync your locations with me every now and then.
Remember, focus on evasion and don't overexert yourselves before reinforcements arrive!
Understood!
Understood!
(After confirming their coordinates, Klukai secures the sleeping Mechty on the heavy bike's backseat before hitting the gas.)
(Driving on the open wilds, the bumpy ride finally manages to wake up Mechty.)
UWAAAAAH—Who am I? Where am I? Why did you do the seatbelts this way?!
Shut up and raise your gun. Clear out the ELIDs blocking our path.
Then undo the seatbelt for me! I can't move!
Andoris, it's Big Sis!
That's great! We're here, Leader Klukai!
(Hearing the shouts from the comms channel, Mechty scratches her head.)
It's not a big deal... but could someone acknowledge my existence for once?
To all Squad 404 members, commence the elimination operation.
Objective: eliminate all attacking ELIDs.
Acknowledged.
I'll be sure to get it done!
Hm.
Big Sis!!!
Uwah—!
(Right after the last bullet ends the final ELID, Belka jumps off the boulder and rapidly sprints to where Klukai is.)
Stop.
Uuuu... But this was my plan... No, my preparation. I have long prepared for a hug of tears and laughter after the long-awaited reunion between sisters...
Is that why you did not operate according to how you were trained, and instead rushed into a mass of ELIDs?
No, I was just spooked by the ELIDs~
Good thing we have sis Klukai~ Sis Klukai is so cool!
...Go on patrol with Mechty to see if there are any ELIDs we missed out.
Ehhhh—?
Go now if you don't want me to send you back to the outpost.
...Uuuuu.
(Evading Belka's reluctant puppy gaze, Klukai turns toward Andoris who has just walked over.)
Why are you so careless? You've disturbed too many ELIDs.
Before we set off, I reminded the two of you to minimize any contact with ELIDs. We are here to investigate Paradeus, not perform environmental work.
There weren't so many at first, but...
(Andoris shows her data records that she has on hand.)
Even though we tried our best to adjust our route, these ELIDs seem to actually be heading in the direction we want to go. So, it became impossible to evade them.
What? Send me the data.
Got it.
(After skimming the data, Klukai feels that there's something off, but she doesn't manage to think of any implications.)
Forget about that for now. Do you have any results from the investigation I asked you to perform?
Yes. According to gathered intel, the insignia you had photographed belongs to the "Mangi Security Service", a private company and a PMC registered within the White Zones.
A PMC?
Correct. Their website states that their business scope includes but isn't limited to material transport, escort services, et cetera, et cetera.
They number around two thousand, and their activities span from Green Zones to Yellow Zones.
The data starting with Z in their names are a record of some recent commissions they've taken on, but this is not comprehensive due to permission issues.
...Cecht FABN?
Is that their main client? Transactions between them take up more than 85% of their commissions.
Indeed, I noticed that too, which is why I collected some info about that group.
Continue.
Got it.
(Witnessing the affirmation of her initial speculation, Andoris organizes her thoughts and continues.)
"Cecht FABN" is a German-French pharmaceutical conglomerate. Part of their business involves working with some URNC departments and agencies.
The conglomerate's transport missions are usually entrusted to the Mangi Security Service.
There are a ton of PMCs out there in the world, and there are many way bigger than Magni Security.
What's Cecht FABN's reason for choosing them?
I believe that the reason... would be this.
(As she spoke, Andoris sends another set of data to Klukai.)
...This conglomerate is the main shareholder for the Mangi Security Service?

Although I have not found the exact contract papers, but according to some past records from Cecht FABN, there was once a security department with the same name as the Mangi Security Service, headed by the same legal representative of the current company.
A security department splitting off to become it's own company... No wonder they work so closely.
Mm. This organizational split happened likely due to tax considerations.
A pretty common move in the Green and White Zones.
Right. You said they were working with a URNC research department?
Correct. Mainly on the supply and development of some medicine.
Could they really just be transporting medicine...
Andoris, contact Leva and see if you can find the relevant transfer orders.
Hehe, I've already done that.
According to what information Leva has for now, the Environmental Survey Corps commissioned by the Central URNC government really did send in a request for high efficacy medicine a few days back.

But this kind of work does not fall under the jurisdiction of the Non-Military Forces Administration, so it is hard to know the exact reasons why they have not asked regular forces to transport it in favor of PMCs.
Yeah...
That's all the intel we have for now.
Since I can only make relatively superficial judgements to assist in pre-screening the information, I will later send all that we have to Level II for your further verification, Leader Klukai.
What's going on?
The volume, accuracy and precision of your short-term intel gathering has improved significantly compared to before.
Your process has become more rigorous... and you have also slowly developing your own ability to make judgements...
(Klukai turns her head after noticing Andoris' smile.)
...You pass.
Hehe, I'll make sure to catch up faster.
When I catch up to everyone, will Leader Klukai become happier?
...Don't get too carried away.
Okay~
(A thought hits Klukai just as they end the topic of conversation.)
Belka!
Here! What can I do for you, Big Sis?
(Hearing Klukai's voice, the patrolling Belka rushes back.)
Wake up the one sleeping on the rocks. It's time to move.
Alright, off I go!
(Klukai looks towards Andoris as Belka runs off.)
You and Belka will be in the same jeep just like before. I'll be with Mechty.
Other than that, make sure to connect to this military line that we borrowed from the Survey Corps. The civilian signal here is too unstable.
Acknowledged.
By the way, Leader Klukai.
What?
The winds and Collapse radiation levels are changing... I'm afraid a Collapse storm is about to start up again.
Yes, of course.
Make sure to get back to the settlement as soon as possible. Don't waste time on the road.
(As Squad 404 reaches less than a kilometer away from the settlement, Andoris' voice comes up from Level II.)
Leader Klukai, we just received a SOS signal and comms request from an unknown party.
It seems that we are under the same network according to the IP address. Should we answer?
Yes. Transfer the comms request over to me.
(Upon accepting the comms request, a familiar booming male voice rings out from within a sea of noise.)

This is the 3762nd Platoon of the 7th Environmental Survey Corps of the Neo-Soviet Union District Environmental Purification Project under the URNC Contamination Zone Management and Recovery Administration! I am First Sergeant Dmitry, please respond if you hear me! Please respond if you hear me!
...What's going on?
(He is momentarily shocked upon hearing Klukai's voice.)
Why you again...
Bah, I can't care too much about that now!
Are you few still around?! We need backup now!
Our partnership is over.
Damn the partnership or whatever! There's no time to talk crap with you now!
There's a Boojum and ELIDs attacking the settlement, we can't hold it off much longer even with the PMC's help!
If you really are Dolls who can think rather than just order-following machines, you'll know what to do!
How many of them? What's the B.R.I.E.F. registration number and name of the Boojum?
At least 30 Level III ELIDs!
Unable to determine the registration number and name of the Boojum, but it's danger level is at least level IV and above!
Yes, of course.
(As she cleanly cuts the comms, Klukai issues an order through Level II to all of Squad 404—)
Attention all members of 404 Team One, prepare for combat and maintain Level II communication at all times!
Keep driving towards your current direction with additional haste, Mechty and I will contact the enemy in one minute!
Andoris and Belka will provide cover fire from the back.
Acknowledged!
I'll listen to Big Sis!
...Ah? What's happening? Are we fighting? Who are we fighting?
A Boojum.
What? A Boojum?!
Aren't those super dangerous?!
I might activate Plan B at any moment if the need comes, make sure you get ready for it.
Ah?! You're stringing me along again?!
Leader! I can see the battlefield!
(One does not need Andoris to see that the intense gunfire and screams that signal a fierce upcoming battle.)
(The armed forces and mechs surround a single large Boojum. Their rifle rounds do not seem to do any real damage against its hardened skin.)
(The storm throws up yellow sand, making the small buildings of the settlement in the distance seem even more delipidated and brittle.)
(The Boojum waves it's thick and sturdy limbs around, toppling over a heavy jeep with ease.)
(The men in the jeep who have no time to escape are buried for eternal sleep in this dangerous wilderness before they can even scream.)
Hey... That Boojum looks a little too ferocious!
We can't beat it! Klukai, we should run!
(Klukai takes a deep breath, getting ready to press the button. However, she is a little hesitant.)
Wait a minute, Leader Klukai!
...What's going on?
According to battlefield intel... M-Mechty...
(Andoris's voice once again stutters, the amount and complexity of battlefield information almost overwhelming her to the point of crashing.)
(But line after line of battle intel continues to successfully be transmitted to Klukai though Level II.)
(After quickly processing the information from Andoris, Klukai roughly understood what she means.)
This Boojum has reached the point where regular weapons won't be able to hurt it at all...
Even if we press the button to turn on her switch, Mechty won't be able to damage it even with her increased rate of fire and movement speed.
(Andoris returns to normal once the data transmission is over.)
Uwah, then even more reasons not to go...
Does that mean we'll never be able to deal with this big guy?
So... Why don't we try our the new combat program that Dier developed?
I prodded him to install it for me before we left. The external equipment is in the boot.
Are you sure it will work?
According to the test records, we can surely try.
But to use it, I will have to borrow Mechty's power and use about 120 seconds for loading and calibration...
Also, the process won't be able to stop once it starts. We have only one chance.
Mechty, retreat and find Andoris.
Belka, you and Mechty should help Andoris find a good place to shoot from and ensure her safety in the meantime. Use your free time to help the frontline in eliminating ELIDs.
I'll be sure to get it done!
How about you?
I'll fight it on the frontlines.
T-That's too dangerous!
They will need enough firepower to pin down the Boojum.
If the frontline breaks this early, it's all over.
Then I'll go with Big Sis!
Listen to my orders! Remember your own mission!
But...
You can trust her, Belka. Your big sister Klukai is super powerful, don't you remember?
Watch over my bike carefully. I'll come after all of you if it gets broken.
(Klukai heads towards the battlefield and finds Dmitry who is currently commanding the battle.)
Order your soldiers and the PMC to prioritize containing the Boojum. Cordon it off in a circular area with a 50 meter wide radius.
As for the ELIDs, ignore them unless they threaten to break the blockade. I will find time to take them out. Also, send me your regional comms password.
You want this and you want that. What's your circuit-brain thinking? That thing's skin is too thick, we can't kill it even if we circle it, you get it?
Shut up if you know you can't beat it.
404 has the firepower to deal some severe damage. All you have to do is cooperate.
(Dmitry stares at Klukai. After confirming that she isn't messing with him at all, he turns and presses the button on his comms device.)

All fireteams, listen up! Lock down the Boojum in a 50 meter radius, 110 meters from my 3 o'clock! Stop targeting the ELID trash! I repeat, contain the Boojum in a radius of 50 meters! The target location is 110 meters from my 3 o'clock! Get moving!
(The formation starts moving orderly once the order is received.)
(Dmitry puts down his comms device, and squints at Klukai.)
Here's the access key. You better succeed.
Squad 404 never goes back on their word.

All units, prioritize sending the wounded to the garrison camp for treatment! The rest of you, clean up the battlefield. Count up the casualties, and see if any of those machines can be restored to working order!
Most importantly... Find me the team leader of the PMC!
(Dmitry viciously kicks a broken machine near his feet after silencing his comms.)
Damn PMC. God damn Mangi Security Service. As reliable and secure as a babushka's leaking ass!
(On the other end, Squad 404's three other members rush over under orders from Klukai.)
What a pity— We almost got it.
If the humans didn't drop the ball, I bet that Boojum would be lying dead now.
Leader Klukai...
It's not your fault.
Mm. But I still feel sorry about this.
Hopefully that Boojum will never attack settlements again.
(Andoris looks worriedly in the direction the Boojum escaped.)
That thing Andoris brought along is way too powerful. Could Dier be having some kind of hidden propensity for violence?
Mechty, Belka, you two should head back to the settlement first and await orders.
Andoris, go have a look at why there was an unaccounted explosion just now.
(Looking at a bunch of Survey Corps soldiers gathering around a chunk of the Boojum's torso, Klukai puts her gun away.)
I'll go have a look.
No way... Is this what I think it is... ?
Probably... I've informed Sergeant Dmitry. He will be here shortly.
(Going past the shocked soldiers, Klukai sees spots of silvery-white light shining from underneath the bloody mess.)
(Viewing it at a different angle, Klukai realizes that the shine comes from a piece of metal.)
(The piece of metal protrudes from a broken stump, it's surface already covered with some crystals due to the effects of Collapse radiation.)
...Dogtags?
(Klukai attempts to come closer for confirmation, but Dmitry who has rushed over upon hearing the news, picks it up immediately upon seeing it.)
All of you, get out of the way!
(Dmitry swipes off the residue on his protective suit, then looks at the words carved on the piece of metal for two seconds before keeping it.)
What are you all doing here surrounding it? Think you have nothing to do? Haul your asses and get your jobs done.
(The soldiers disperse, but Klukai remains.)
Got nothing better to do?
Are those dogtags from the URNC? I didn't see what's on it clearly. Did it belong to the Great Wall Railway Force?
Did this Boojum... Consume your people before?
No comment. This is within our mission jurisdiction.
However...
(Dmitry stops, and after a bit of struggle, turns towards her and gives a formal military salute.)
On behalf of The 7th Environmental Survey Corps and the settlement's residents, I thank H.I.D.E. 404 for assisting us.
...No need.
(After staring at the spot where the dogtags once was, Klukai accepts his thanks calmly.)
(She turns and walks towards Andoris, who is waiting a short distance away after finishing intel gathering.
(Not far away, the Survey Corps have concluded their post-combat tally. The personnel responsible runs to Dmitry.)
Reporting, sir! Our losses are calculated at 32%.

The questioning of Mangi Security Service has concluded. They indicate that the offending vehicle was attacked by ELIDs before the recent battle, causing the fuel tank to have a small crack in it. There was no opportunity to fix it, causing it to lose control and explode during the previous battle.
Yes, of course.
Help me call the warrant officer.
Acknowledged!
(After a minute of waiting, the comms request is accepted.)

This is the 3762nd Platoon of the 7th Environmental Survey Corps of the Neo-Soviet Union District Environmental Purification Project under the URNC Contamination Zone Management and Recovery Administration. I am First Sergeant Dmitry, here to make a routine report.
Mm. How's progress?
After three days of travel, we have reached the target settlement and met with the forward troops' medical team.

During our march, we completed a preliminary survey of this region's environment. The specific details will be sent in the form of an email. The samples will be brought back at the end of our mission.
Good work. Continue with the mission.
Sir, in my judgement, a temporary halt should be put on the survey mission and reinforcements need to be sent! I believe that the survey should only continue when we have received reinforcements!
Explain your reasoning.

We encountered a Boojum with at least threat level IV at the settlement, and we've been unable to identify the name and registration number of it. One of the stumps broken off it contained a dogtag from personnel registered as MIA.
Since their dogtags are here, they are presumably—
(Dmitry falls silent, but grits his teeth and pushes on to complete the sentence.)
Presumably dead.
(The comms channel falls into a moment of silence.)
I will report it to the upper brass and call for reinforcements.
However, you have to continue on with the mission.
—We can't deal with the level IV Boojum with how weak our current forces are! Already more than ten of our brothers-in-arms are never going home again!
There's no completing the mission with this little people! You can't be telling me to lead them to their deaths!
(Noticing he has lost control of his emotions, Dmitry steadies himself.)
My apologies, sir.
What I meant was, we need stronger support and reinforcement to ensure mission completion. Otherwise, the only result awaiting is unwarranted losses.
I understand your feelings, First Sergeant Dmitry.

But we cannot put a halt to the construction of the Intercontinental Railway in this region. Once the rerouting is confirmed, new plans have to be completed urgently. Every piece of environmental information you gather, every batch of land that you survey, and every base station that you establish will have significant and far-reaching impacts.
Continue with your mission. This will help facilitate progress once the reinforcements reach you. I will dispatch personnel for your reinforcement ASAP.
Yes, sir!
Mm. I eagerly await your next report.
(After ending the communication, Dmitry notices that the soldiers around him are carrying strange expressions.)
Let it out if you are feeling afraid. It is a very normal emotion to feel.
Those who aren't afraid are inhuman. You'd be a machine.

Sir, that.... is a Boojum. One attacked back when we were guarding the Great Wall Railway. If we didn't receive support from the outpost garrison, it would have rushed in and toppled the entire Great Wall Railway train!
I know.
(He lets out a heavy sigh.)
Pass word to the cooks. Break out the goods and cook up something decent tonight.
The families of our fallen brothers will be taken care off in the best possible way. I will apply for them and ensure it.
O... Okay.
That's all. Go do what you have to.
Maybe you could head back with us, sir?
Later. I'll check again to see if we missed anything.
(The storm continues, but dusk is approaching.)
(As the setting sun paints a deep red over this broken, desolated land, Dmitry squeezes the found dogtags.)
(Despite being isolated by the thick protective suit, he can almost feel the hardness and lifeless cold that belongs only to metal.)
(For a long time, he simply looks towards the wilderness in front of him without speaking a single word. The wilds respond only with the sound of boundless wind.)
(Dmitry hesitates for a moment. And without regard for anything at all, he yanks off his protective mask and spits hard on the ground.)
It's so fucking suffocating.
(Squad 404 is temporarily camping out in the abandoned dwellings of the settlement. Klukai contacts Leva to report on their progress.)
Abnormal ELID symptoms, attacks from an unknown faction, unregistered Boojums...
What an exciting mission.
Stop it with your lame jokes.
Oh my, I was simply trying to lighten up your expression.
As for neural cloud management and creating a nice atmosphere, you have much to learn from Andoris and the others, dear Leader Klukai.
This is no management. They are just slacking off.
(Klukai looks towards the other three members of the team with no pleasure on her face—)
(Mechty, having received her new travel kit, is fast asleep. Andoris is maintaining her beloved gun, while Belka is holding her communicator, watching it intently.)
There hasn't been any progress on the mission, yet they're all so happy...
Didn't you guys manage to find quite a number of questionable things?
It's still too slow.
What we have found cannot be connected directly to Paradeus... It wouldn't be an exaggeration to say that our mission progress is at zero.
Don't be so pessimistic. I did manage to find out a few things for you.
Hm?
Remember how Andoris contacted me to ask about the reinforcements? I went ahead and found a few things on my own~
We have results now. Everything points to the Intercontinental Railway.
Indeed. I've also managed to glean some related information from the soldiers.
The original plan was to finish construction on this line three years ago, but construction work only began around one year back.

Since the environment changes constantly in the Yellow Zone and survey technology was not as advanced as it is today, they missed out on information required to complete the planned construction on time.
A slip-up?
Correct. Serious soil erosion caused the ground to collapse with a "boom" during the construction of a particular section, causing the tirelessly laid tracks to go kaput as well.
Since the URNC places great importance upon the construction of Intercontinental Railways, the person in charge hid this incident from "Heli".
Hmph. That is a fruitless endeavour.
Exactly. It was exposed about a month ago.
Rumor has it that the related departments had half their managers replaced, you know?
And then?
The newly minted manager was put under pressure to work overtime, creating a bunch of different plans overnight and then dispatching different teams to survey different sections of the planned areas.

Because the Environmental Survey Corps were already busy with their pre-existing survey missions and could not deal with this large amount of newfound work, soldiers serving in purification zones near the planned route were seconded to work as part of the Environmental Survey Corps.
The soldiers you encountered must be the ones coming from the purification zone.
Mm. So where is the connection with Paradeus in all this?
Oh my, why are Klukai's thought processes still so rigid~
Say it straight and stop being so eccentric and ambiguous about it.
You know it already, Klukai. There's something going on with the abnormal radiation levels, the Survey Corps losing contact with some soldiers, and having an absurdly high number of infected.
Of course I know. But none of this points directly to the actions of Paradeus.
The unknown Boojum might be behind the Survey Corps losing contact with some of their soldiers.
What if I told you that intel seems to show Paradeus conducting strange radiation-related experiments in the Red and Yellow Zones?
Would you still think everything is a coincidence now?
What I think is not important... Aren't you still at the guessing stage after all this speculation?
Isn't that normal? The person responsible for investigating all these clues is Klukai after all...
Please hurry up.

You... haven't forgotten, have you? The reason we've been delayed for so long is because the information you provided in the commission was inconsistent with the situation on the ground and the unreliable signals from Squad 404, right?
Oh my, you didn't lose your temper this time.
I can't be bothered to waste my time with you.
(Klukai brings the topic back on track after thinking for a bit.)

Due to the accidents that occurred during our mission, 404 has used up more energy and ammunition than expected. The environmental conditions and threats of unknown forces make it difficult to predict the risk level of future threats.
Do we really have to continue this mission?
I'm afraid so. Paradeus is elusive in the first place, so we have to chase down and verify every lead ASAP.
This does not mean we should proceed haphazardly.
Yes, yes, that's why I've also considered reinforcements. I even specially dispatched two additional teams for support.
They are Klukai's old acquaintances, by the way.
Acquaintances?
(Klukai lagged for a second, then her face darkened.)
You can't be talking about the Survey Corps.
Bingo~
Leva!
Alright. It's best if I explained this.
(On the other end of the comms, Kalina pats Leva and turns the camera towards her.)
It's been a long time, Klukai.
Mm.
I'm sorry that our inaccurate intel has caused trouble for you and your team.
...There was no major losses, no need to be so formal.
(Faced with Kalina's sincere apology, Klukai instead began to feel uncomfortable.)
However, I still don't feel that cooperating with the Survey Corps is a wise decision.
But at least they can be trusted.
According to what intel I have on hand, this much is undoubtedly true.
Are you sure?
After we met up with them, we were never attacked again by the mechs of unknown origin.
Mm. This is where I found my first guesses as to where those mechs came from.
It was reported that there are other armed powers assisting Paradeus. So, the disappearance of some URNC Survey Corps may not be as simple as how it looks at present.
So Paradeus has found a new collaborator...
Very likely.
So please, investigate this link. It would be best to find some concrete evidence.

(Several hours later, dawn comes to Zucchero—)
