[Dear Commander, this is officially my 5th letter to you! Ever since we parted, there have been so many stories and things that I'd like to share with you, but I never had the opportunity to do so... It was by coincidence that I found out that Miss Littara has been writing letters to you regularly, so I borrowed some pen and paper from her.]
[After shaking off pursuit by the humans and breaking through the encirclement by the ELIDs, we have successfully managed to relocate ourselves to the vicinity of our designated stopover point.]
[This journey has been so very perilous... Just the thought that you have also been living in constant danger without me by your side all these years is making me anxious!]
[I wonder when that "agreement" will be rescinded... In any case, I have decided to document all my personal experiences in great detail until then.]
[According to Miss Littara, by writing you these letters, we will not feel like total strangers to you when we finally meet again. I do hope she's right.] —Suomi
(The howling wind whips the collapsed wall, smashing sand and dust against it.)
(In the ruins, an ELID is guzzling a chunk of meat—most probably the flesh of another ELID. It suddenly freezes, like it has noticed something.)
Ah—!
Shhh—
(The ELID turns its head abruptly toward the source of the sound, but it finds nothing out of the ordinary.)
(Despite its confusion, it seems to have decided that the sound is just the wind from the Collapse storm and returns to savoring its meal.)
I-I think we managed to stay hidden...
Thanks to the storm, the visibility is quite low at the moment.
Get ready to move. |Stick to the plan. I'll draw its attention.
Okay. Be careful!
(Ullrid carefully takes a few steps forward, picks up a piece of rock from the ground, and throws it at the oblivious ELID...)
Awooooooo!
Good... Just like that! Now move this way!
All units, attack!
Copy that!
[ELIDs are such dangerous creatures, but under Big Sis Ullrid and Miss Littara's leadership, we managed to pull through.]
[But our biggest headache is still the shortage of supplies. I often see Miss Rosalind, who is in charge of repairs, and Big Sis taking stock of our supplies... and they both look very grim.]
[I sometimes hear troubled sighs from even Miss Littara, who is usually very calm and collected... and I would find her room littered with scrunched-up papers of abandoned plans.]
[That's probably why, even though we knew the thermal power plant was teeming with ELIDs, we still decided to scour the place in the hopes of finding some supplies for our subsequent travels.]
[You could probably think of a better solution if you were here, Commander, but since we're on our own, we'll just have to take the risk. I hope we will all come out of this in one piece.] —Suomi
(Ullrid kicks the motionless ELID on the ground. The heavy sack of flesh slowly rolls onto its side.)
(After confirming that the threat has been eliminated, Ullrid pulls out the arrow sticking out of the corpse.)
GSP-337, take someone with you to secure the area, then set up a signal booster. Now that the Collapse storm has temporarily let up, we should be able to contact Littara and Suomi.
R-right! |U-um... Ullrid...
Yes? Is there a problem?
N-n-no p-problem at all... It's just... uh... I've changed my name to Lotta! |Because... you also changed your name...
Oh! That's a nice name. I'll be counting on you, then, Lotta.
O-Okay!
(After watching Lotta run off with a smile, Ullrid looks down and starts rummaging through the ruins for anything worth scavenging.)
(However, the copious amount of ELID mucus all over the place is hindering her effort. With a scowl, she prods a piece of sheet metal covered in slime with her foot.)
Right, let me see if there's anything usable... Ugh, it's so sticky and gross... What's written on this? Mar... something... Thermal Power Plant? Marley?
Ullrid, you... done... yet?
Littara? I've finished cleaning up over here. How is it going on your end?
A-all good! |...The signal booster is also s-set up...
Hold on, let me turn down the volume... This signal booster seems pretty nifty. Who made this again? Uh, Bathilde?
Yeah, b-but it's only for short-range use. The radiation is t-too strong here, and that g-greatly affects the signal strength... Let's regroup for now!
Okay, but we're still searching for supplies. You'll have to come on over. I'm sending you the coordinates. I'll also get in touch with Suomi later. |Stay safe, I'll see you in a bit.
Okay!
U-Ullrid...!
Oh, welcome to my treasure vault—the garbage dump!
S-stop j-joking around...
(Littara holds up her notepad before she has even reached Ullrid. On it is a question scribbled in large handwriting—)
[How's the situation? Got any supplies?] —Littara
Be patient! I told you this is a treasure vault, didn't I?

I have actually found a lot of stuff, but most of it is in pretty bad shape. Since we're also short on repair equipment, we'll need Rosalind to assess what can be salvaged... In any case, let's take some of it back with us.
[Cool. I didn't find anything great, but I did pick out some stuff that looked kind of useful. We should bring a Doll mechanic with us next time to help sort through the mess.] —Littara
You're right. I'll ask Rosalind when we get back.

There won't be any ELIDs in this area for the time being. It shouldn't be too dangerous even if we bring along a non-combat Doll. Come to think of it, it's all thanks to Littara that we found such a convenient opening.
N-not at all—
[It was just speculation based on the trend of Collapse radiation levels... But enough of that! Where's Suomi?] —Littara
Oh, she seems to have come across a lot of good stuff. She's probably busy packing up—
Big Sis!
And Miss Littara! Is everybody okay?
We're all perfectly fine. Littara's guess was on point. There are barely any ELIDs in this area.
That's good. Well done, Miss Littara! Look, we ended up finding lots of stuff in the ruins of the warehouse.
See? We've filled up this whole pushcart!
This circuit board... should be compatible with a lot of frame models, right?
Yeah, and I've definitely seen many of these parts before!
You found all these in the warehouse?
Yes, Big Sis.
...Why are there so many Doll parts in the ruins of a thermal power plant?
...Oh... Maybe there used to be a lot of Dolls here?
[There's a possibility that this thermal power plant was run and maintained by Dolls before it was abandoned. Also, these parts are pretty generic and can be used on other machines as well.] —Littara

Hm, in any case, we got lucky with these. |We've wiped out all the ELIDs in the area for the time being, so we should be able to handle it even if new ELIDs stumble into this place. This could serve as a decent base.
You want to move our camp here?
Well... Maybe not right away. We should take a vote when making such decisions.

I'm just thinking we could at least get our hands on some supplies here. Also, some shelter from the sandstorms and blizzards is still better than the sandy camp we have right now, right? Besides, this place could be a foothold for exploring other areas of the ruins.

[You're right. The Dolls could use some rest and maintenance... But there could also be problems with this place, Ullrid. We mustn't rush into any decisions before making sure it's completely safe.] —Littara
(Sigh) You have a point.

(After kicking the ELID corpse on the ground again to vent her frustration, Ullrid looks up at the cooling tower in the distance—which is emitting a large plume of water vapor that's a greenish-yellow color.)
This does look really creepy. Why is that cooling tower spewing smoke that looks so gross?
Hm? What did you say, Big Sis?
Huh? N-nothing. I just said... we'll find a way to make this work. |Let's prioritize tidying up the place. We can consider our next step after we finish sorting out our supplies.
You're right. Then we'll leave it up to you and Littara to come up with a plan.
Sure, leave it to us, but you'll all have to help. |Now let's haul these supplies back and cheer Rosalind up! Time to get moving!
Okay!
(The Dolls disperse to carry out their own tasks. Ullrid lets out a secret sigh of relief while no one is looking. Littara pats her lightly on the back.)
Phew...
Good thing I didn't make them too nervous, or they might grow averse to the idea of exploring this place... Anyway, let's also get to work!
(At their temporary base, Ullrid directs the Dolls in packing up all the supplies they have gathered.)
Ullrid, where should I put the lubricant?
If it hasn't congealed, put it in the stash of consumables. |Lotta, take the parts in the pushcarts directly to the mechanics. Just let them trawl through the pile and take what they can use.
(Just then, Rosalind arrives with Bathilde.)
Welcome back. It looks like quite a haul this time?
Yes, Rosalind. Perfect timing. We've found quite a lot of things. Take stock of everything first, and we'll discuss how to distribute them later.
Sure. Bathilde, please move these to the preparation area and see if there's anything you can use.
Hm.
(The sight of her friend finally puts Lotta at ease.)
Oh, Bathilde! We've found a lot of—
Are you planning to let me push this insanely heavy pushcart all by myself while you jabber away off to the side?
Um... Oh, I'll help!
Be careful with the cart.
(Ullrid watches warily as the two push the rickety pushcart, whose mismatched wheels are creaking and groaning. She finds herself praying fervently for the cart and the Dolls to keep it together.)
(When they are some distance away, Ullrid turns her attention to the companion standing next to her.)
How are things?

Not good. Many Dolls have entered hibernation mode because of the energy shortage. Those who are still hanging in there are in very bad shape and need urgent repairs. These supplies that you just found will ease things a little...
But they're still not enough?
Mm.
If we can't secure a large amount of supplies soon, we won't even be able to keep our vehicle running properly, let alone maintain the Dolls' operation. The hibernating Dolls will have to be...
No. Dumping them at a place like this is practically giving them a death sentence.
...I don't want to resort to that either.
I-I'll think of something... Rosalind, please inventory our supplies...
After you're done, send the report straight to me; don't show it to the others...
Right, I understand. Don't stress yourself out too much for now. Let me finish the inventory report first. Then we'll figure out what to do. |Look, someone's looking for you.
...H-here. D-dropped the p-p-parts...
Thanks. |What is it, Littara? Is something the matter?
Yeah. C-can you c-come over?
Go on, I'll take over sorting out the supplies.
Thanks, "Mama" Rosalind.
(After giving the slightly exasperated Rosalind a wink, Ullrid follows Littara to an unoccupied corner to get out of everyone's way.)
What's wrong? You look so serious.
[Ullrid, are you planning to call a vote now?] —Littara
That's certainly the plan, but... I don't know, this doesn't feel like the best time for it.

[Yes. Actually, I've noticed something when reviewing the results of our previous votes. I'll get straight to the point. You're right in believing that this isn't the best time to call for a vote.] —Littara
Reviewing our previous votes... Like the one that took place while you were hibernating?
[That was part of what I looked at. When I checked the result, I found that 42% of the voters had abstained when a vote was held to decide on where to set up camp.] —Littara

[Then in the most recent vote on whether we should search for supplies around the thermal power plant, the percentage of abstention rose to 47%, and those in support of the proposition only outnumbered those who were against it by 7%, which made the vote barely valid.] —Littara

I noticed that too. Maybe they felt that they didn't know enough to make an informed decision. Besides... the incident with the bounty hunters has probably left a bad taste in everyone's mouth and made them apprehensive about voting on important matters.

[You're right, which is why this time I want to provide everyone with more information that will aid in their decision-making—they should be aware of the situation within the thermal power plant as well as what other alternatives there are.] —Littara
You're right...
But right now, most of our combat forces are in no shape to fight. We may have secured some supplies, but we're still incredibly short on everything...
I think if we are to conduct any further investigation, we will have to sort it out with just the two of us. And we must take care not to damage our own frames in the process.

[While I was searching for supplies, I came across some signs pointing to a "surveillance room". If we can find and activate the surveillance system, we will be able to obtain a lot more information without having to spend a lot of precious resources.] —Littara
Right, but it's still too difficult with just the two of us... Oh yeah, Suomi should be able to help as well.
Big Sis, you need me?
Suomi?! W-when did you—why didn't you make a sound?
I just got here. I saw you and Miss Littara looking very troubled, so I thought I'd ask if there's anything I can do to help.
Well, you've got the devil's timing.
What?
[Suomi, we want to gather more information for a vote we'll be calling very soon. We need to know more about the thermal power plant and its surrounding area.] —Littara
[But we can't afford to allocate too much manpower on this matter, so Ullrid wants to keep the party small. Can you help?] —Littara
Of course! My frame is in good condition. I'm ready to go whenever you want!

That's good to know. The interior of the ruins is more dangerous and unpredictable, so Littara and I will handle that. It'd be great if you could gather more geographical data on the surrounding area and find some locations that could work as our new base of operation.

Suomi, Littara will run some calculations and give you a rough idea of where you can explore with minimal chances of having to fight. Since power supply is limited, you mustn't be gone for too long. Make sure you return within 36 hours.
Sure, leave that to me. |Please be careful yourselves. There's no telling what you'll find inside the ruins of the power station, not to mention there may still be ELIDs around...
Don't worry, we'll keep our eyes wide open—and I'll veto any of Littara's crazy, risky plans.
[I just put forward ideas; you're the one who always goes for the risky ones, no?] —Littara
Haha, don't get so hung up on such things. |Littara, please plot out the area for Suomi to explore. I'll be back once I confirm the resource allocation and repair plan with Rosalind.
[Okay, see you later.] —Littara
Ammo, backup power supply, comms terminal...
R-Rosalind...
Yep, all sorted on that end. |This is all we can take with us. Let's go. The sooner we get it done, the sooner we can come back.
One moment, please!
Excuse me, Ullrid... A-are you... heading into the ruins?
Oh... You heard?
I... was with Bathilde earlier... |I was wondering... Can I come too?
(Ullrid raises an eyebrow and glances at Littara next to her, who gives her a nod. Ullrid knows what she means by that—"It's your call.")

The plan is to explore the place again to gather more information and bring back more supplies while we're at it. |You saw what it's like in there, Lotta. It's very dangerous even if it's just covert exploration.
My... My frame has been calibrated, so I'm in good shape and won't slow you down! And I promise... I'll obey your orders...
Is there any particular reason why you want to take part in this exploration?
Oh, don't be alarmed. I'm just curious. This is quite an urgent matter... and I don't have any reason to stop you from coming. |Can you set off this instant, Lotta?
Y-yes!

[After experiencing some hiccups, we all finally set off on our respective missions. To be honest, I was a little concerned about Miss Lotta's condition, but Big Sis decided to respect her wishes, and Miss Littara also said that we could use all the help we could get in a fight.]

[Miss Lotta herself was also very eager to help. It's hardly surprising. Whatever threats may be lurking inside the thermal power plant, to all of us, it is like an island in the ocean, an oasis in the desert.]
[I completely understand how everybody feels, because I also feel the same.]
[Will this place become our new base for the time being? Commander, have you found a home for yourself in the last few years?] —Suomi
(Outside the derelict building, a few ELIDs are rummaging roughly through the garbage dump for flesh that they can consume.)
(While they have their noses to the ground, a "Thoad" slips past them against the half-deteriorated wall—on six Doll legs. The ELIDs are none the wiser.)
...They haven't noticed us, have they?
Is this r-really necessary? Do we h-have to hide behind an ELID corpse...? D-don't you have optical camo—
My camouflage only helps me blend in with the environment; it doesn't hide my smell, so ELIDs would still spot me. |You see? Isn't this working perfectly? Stick together! Get ready to move!
O-okay!
(The poor, deceased Thoad is lifted up again. Using its corpse as cover, Ullrid, Littara, and Lotta inch toward the facility cautiously.)
Awooo... Rargh? Awoo...
Stop!
Eeek!
(The three Dolls squat immediately and curl up behind the Thoad corpse. The ELID creature lets out a low threatening growl, but with no response from the Thoad, it goes back to whatever it is doing.)
Awooo... Rargh? Awoo...
Aaaaaah... That was w-way too close! What kind of T-Thoad w-would move?!
It worked, didn't it? Considering the ELIDs' level of intelligence, we'll be fine. |The smell of the corpse can definitely cover our scent.
Alright, we're almost there. Let's pick up the pace. Ready... Go!
(Once they are inside the building, the Thoad's corpse has outlived its usefulness and gets tossed aside.)
Phew~ We made it! See? I told you we'll be fine.
I'm all... sticky...
S-smelly... Good thing it's n-not corrosive...
It couldn't be helped. There are so many ELIDs out there. If we had been spotted, the commotion could've attracted even more of them. |Enough of that. Let's see if luck is still on our side...
(Ullrid flips the power switch on with a "click".)
(The interior lights up. Display screens also come to life, and white texts start appearing on them.)
Huh, there's still power. |Let me see... "Please enter the surveillance passcode"?
Tsk, we'll have to brute force it. Lotta, are you any good with electronic warfare?
I only have the most basic... EW module...
...You'll have to go for it. Littara, prepare to connect to Level II.
Hahah! Well done, us!
[We're lucky the defense system here isn't up to date. Still, those defense automatons looked pretty odd.] —Littara
I've never seen them before either. Probably custom made—oh! We've got visuals.
(The three Dolls all take a step forward to look at the screens.)
(Having obtained access to the surveillance system, the screens now show live CCTV feeds of every room. The Dolls all stumble back at the sight.)
...That's... a lot of ELIDs...
I was kinda expecting this, but it still grosses me out to see so many in one place... Is this some sort of ELID expo?
[Look, Ullrid. These screens are dead. Judging from the numbers, I think they're monitoring the same area.] —Littara
Are the cameras broken? I wouldn't be surprised. This place is falling apart.
Look! That...!
What?
O-oh! Those... those are...!
Aren't those... Doll repair pods?! There are eight of them?! So many?
There are also hydraulic cylinders and... what looks like a bionic skin healant! To the side... Hm, I can't see clearly... There are more in the other CCTV feeds!
Th-this is beyond our wildest imagination! This is wonderful!
C-c-calm down!
[I'm taking down these camera numbers. Then I'll try to figure out where these supplies are stored!] —Littara
Littara, that's not the only room. There are supply crates in this one, this one... and this corner here, I think!
(Littara follows where Ullrid is pointing and checks the feeds one by one. She is so incredulous of what she is seeing, she has to take off her glasses to clean them and also rub her eyes.)

[We've got plenty of places to explore. I'll log all the locations of the supplies and equipment we've seen, as well as the distribution of ELIDs in the area. That'll give us something to work with.] —Littara
Ullrid, if we can get our hands on these supplies... does that mean... we can wake the hibernating Dolls?
That still depends on what state these supplies are in, but it should take quite a lot of the pressure off. |Haha! Littara, we may have just found the key to our survival!
[We need a lot more information before we can put together a plan. Ullrid, don't forget about the ELIDs in the ruins.] —Littara
I know, I haven't forgotten! But if we can get the parts we need soon, it'll make life much easier for all of us.
Maybe we can even sell some of them and use the profit for upgrading our servers or something. I don't want our neural clouds to have no backups.
(Just then, Ullrid's comms terminal chirps.)
Ull... copy...?
The signal isn't great, but I can just about hear. Is there news from Suomi's end?
Yes. If... find anything... back to... report...
Suomi seems ready to return. It's not safe to keep exploring either. We should also go back.
Mm.
Um... How are we supposed to get out...?
(The trio stares at each other. Nobody says a word.)
(In the end, with expressionless faces, they walk back to the entrance and pick up the Thoad's corpse again.)
[Commander, you must have seen a Thoad before, right?]
[I heard Big Sis describe how they returned from the ruins, and it was kinda gross... so I'll spare you the details.]
[But we got really lucky, Commander! This place is really like an oasis! We've all cheered up, especially Big Sis Ullrid. She didn't say anything, but I can tell that she is very relieved.]
[As part of the exploration team, I've also made some pretty impressive discoveries. I'm sure the good news will lift everyone's spirits!] —Suomi
...So the three of you went inside the thermal power plant again without going through maintenance? I see you've grown tired of living!
B-B-B-Bathilde! N-no, we i-infiltrated the power plant!
How's that any different?! What the hell is that all over you...? You stink! It's not ELID mucus, is it?!

And you two! If you take damage, you just slap some bandages on, dust yourself off, and call it a day! Then, as if that's not bad enough, you actually brought along this idiot who can barely hold a gun?!
Barely hold a gun?! Lotta, didn't you say your frame was in good condition?
It-it's not that bad! It's just some... minor issues with the hydraulic cylinders... It doesn't affect my ability to fight... |Bathilde, don't blame them... I insisted on going...
Shut up. When was the last time you backed up your neural cloud? If your frame had fallen apart in that pile of ELIDs, you'd be there for good! Now come with me!
(Before the stunned Ullrid and Littara can react, Bathilde has already dragged Lotta away.)
...Wow, she really didn't hold back, did she? Still, it was definitely our fault for not verifying Lotta's condition before setting off...

[Yeah... We were on a tight schedule and didn't check properly. We really need to do our due diligence whenever the situation allows. I hope Lotta will clear things up with Bathilde...|Now should we analyze the surveillance record together?] —Littara
Okay. |Here, let's sit down.
These cameras are numbered consecutively, and the frames do connect with each other, so they're probably placed in the same area.
[From what I've observed about the numbering pattern, this place should be pretty far from the surveillance room.] —Littara
...Littara, what do you think about what Bathilde just said?

[Do you mean the part where she blew up at you for making a Doll who could barely hold a gun fight... or the bit where she told you off for only slapping bandages on yourself when you get injured?] —Littara
I... (sigh) What I mean is... if my decisions have actually been putting everyone in danger.
[Ullrid, you need to realize that there's no way we can completely avoid battles. Besides, we haven't been acting on "your decisions". We made all the decisions as a collective.] —Littara
I know, that's why we need to find a way to acquire more supplies. This way, we can all get properly repaired.
[Instead of agonizing over whether we're making the right decisions, I think it's more important to consider everyone's aversion and avoidant attitude towards combat.] —Littara

Aversion and avoidance... If everyone knows that we can't undergo proper repairs after taking damage, then most Dolls would choose to avoid combat. This is caused by the base layer programming of our neural cloud.

[Exactly. That's why the most pressing priority right now is to figure out how to boost everyone's confidence in battle. Otherwise, even if we call for a vote, the result could be invalid due to the lack of a clear majority.] —Littara
[After all, combat is unavoidable whether we decide to explore the ruins of the thermal power plant or find an alternative location to set up camp.] —Littara
Aaaaargh! Is there really no solution that will make everyone happy?
Oh, Big Sis!
(As they hear a set of brisk footsteps, Suomi comes running up to Ullrid.)
Big Sis! Miss Rosalind said you found a lot of supplies and repair equipment that we need in the ruins, is that true?!
Yes, it's true.
—! Th-then let's hurry and—
Slow down! Apart from the supplies, there are also a horde of ELIDs that are way livelier than us.
[Suomi, why don't you tell us about what you've found first?] —Littara

Oh... I didn't actually find anything on my end. I combed through the 50 square kilometers that Miss Littara had plotted out for me, but all I found was several small towns in ruins, and there was pretty much nothing in there.
I did find a jeep 37 km to the southwest. There was a bounty hunter inside, but they were already...
Anyway, I filled up on some gasoline there. There's a human settlement further in that direction, so I didn't go any closer.
[Then we can rule out that area as a suitable location to make camp. Any future exploration will have to be in the direction of the Red Zone.] —Littara

The Red Zone? No way! None of the Dolls here have ever set foot in the Red Zone before. In the chaos, we could end up underestimating the threats we'd face in there... Besides, we don't even have the protective suits we'd need for entering the Red Zone.
Heading toward the Red Zone with a shortage of supplies and questionable combat capability is a bad idea no matter how you look at it!
[We're circling back to the same issue—we need to give everyone the confidence to win battles.] —Littara
To describe our current situation in Bathilde's words, we are "a bunch of Doll mummies wrapped in bandages". Even I don't have that kind of confidence.
Oh!
(Suomi's sudden exclamation interrupts Ullrid's complaint.)
...Huh?
Actually... Hm, technically speaking, I, uh... I did bring back a... um... It's not that much of a deal...
[Suomi, if you have something to say, just spit it out.] —Littara
Yeah, stop humming and hawing.
R-right! I-I've brought a former colleague back with me!
Colleague?!
You know, a fellow T-Doll from my days at Griffin.
I found her near the jeep. She's in hibernation, and her frame has taken a massive beating... I-I know we're in no state to be helping others!
But... I couldn't just leave her there, so I brought her with me.

(Suomi looks down in apprehension. She peeks up at Ullrid to her left, who appears deep in thought with her lips pursed, then at Littara, who is rubbing her chin in silence. She dares not make a peep.)

Suomi, is this colleague of yours... any good in a fight? |If she can bolster our strength, we could perhaps divert some resources to repairing her first. But if not, then I'm sorry, we'll have to leave her in storage for now.
Oh, um... I do understand, Big Sis. But I...

To be honest, I've barely had any dealings with her, but anyone who worked for Griffin can handle themselves perfectly in a fight... Oh right, you probably also know her, Miss Littara. It's Miss KSVK!
K-KSV... Oh, I-I know her!
[I've read her team's combat reports. They had a very high mission success rate, and KSVK's performance was exceptional as a sniper.] —Littara
That-that's right! I also remember that particular team was very dependable and often got sent on challenging missions.
Then do you think she'd agree to help us?
Well...
[I can't make any promises. After all, my knowledge about her is limited to what I've learned from the combat reports.] —Littara
B-but... Hm...
But what?

Actually, I asked Miss Rosalind to take a look at her. According to Miss Rosalind, KSVK's neural module is severely damaged. If it's not repaired soon, the neural cloud m-might lose stability and suffer a complete cascade... But I don't want to put you into a difficult position either...
(Suomi's head droops as she trails off.)
(Silence once again hangs heavily in the air. After a long while, Ullrid hammers the back of the chair next to her with a fist.)
Alright, it's decided. |Let's get her fixed up.
Really?!

Yep. If we stand by and let her suffer a neural breakdown just because she's no use to us, I can't very well go around claiming I want to "help all Dolls", can I? |And who knows? We may end up getting a powerful ally out of this! Haha!
[That's just like you, Ullrid.] —Littara

Stop making fun of me. |Still, we mustn't use any of the supplies meant for the others' repairs. My frame is still doing okay, so she can use some of my spare parts, though I don't know if they're compatible with her model.
Big Sis... is-is that really okay?
It's no big deal. I just have to make sure I don't get injured.
Then I'm also giving her my spare parts! My frame is also in good shape!
[Suomi, you can take my parts as well.] —Littara
Maybe you should hold on to them. Isn't your neural cloud also a bit unstable?

[I've run some calculations. My frame should be able to hold out for some time, and it doesn't make sense to keep the parts when we don't have the means or the equipment needed to actually carry out the repairs. If KSVK is willing to join us, we may be able to get our hands on more supplies sooner.] —Littara
Big Sis, Miss Littara...
Alright, stop giving us those sappy puppy eyes. Go and find Rosalind.
Will do!
[Commander, the good news I have for you is... we have found Miss KSVK.]
[Although her situation is very precarious... it feels like a miracle to run into a lost companion in the Yellow Zone.]
[I hope I will run into you like this as well someday, Commander... A chance encounter wouldn't be a breach in the agreement, so it wouldn't cause you any trouble, right?]
[Commander, I will now explain Miss KSVK's condition in greater detail.]

[Things are a bit confusing, so I may not be able to explain it very clearly. Please try your best to make sense of my letter when you receive it. If we ever meet again, I'll also explain it in person!] —Suomi
Huh... Things just got complicated.
[You mean with KSVK?] —Littara
Yeah. According to Suomi's most recent report, she has lost all her previous neural data.
[The damage in her neural cloud shouldn't affect her combat capability.] —Littara

That's not what I'm worried about... Since she has no memories, that means both you and Suomi are total strangers to her, no? If there's no emotional attachment, she isn't very likely to join us, is she?

[But we barely knew each other anyway. I don't think the damage in her neural cloud has much influence over her decision of whether she'd want to join us or not. I suppose it's really up to her now.] —Littara
Yeah, it's not like we can take her apart again—
What was that noise?
L-let's go, U-Ull—
(The two Dolls run to the crude maintenance area and are greeted by the sight of a unique Doll with animal ears sitting on the floor.)
(A panicking Suomi is standing off to the side with a mechanical arm in her hands.)
What is going on here? |Suomi, did you... tear her arm off?
No, Big Sis!
Suomi, put that down first!
Uh, o-okay!
(Flustered, Suomi drops the mechanical arm on the floor. Then she picks it up again and dusts it off stiffly.)
(After wiping her dusty hands on her clothes, Suomi pulls the Doll off the floor apologetically with Ullrid's help.)
I'm so sorry, Miss KSVK! Um... M-Miss Rosalind?
Let me.
You must be KSVK. Sorry about that. We're rather short on supplies, but we've patched you up the best we could.
...Just blowing away the smell of decay is enough to make me grateful.
...Huh? What does that mean...? You got any idea, Littara?
I-I-I... I don't—
Is her language module also damaged?
That's possible, but due to the time constraint and insufficient equipment, this is the best I can do...
I-I don't mean to—Um...
[Perhaps Miss KSVK is expressing her gratitude?] —Littara
That's right! It is... uh... just as you say.
[You are very welcome. Nice to meet you, my name is Littara. We used to work together at a PMC called Griffin and Kryuger, though you may not remember.] —Littara
My name is Ullrid. I'm the... uh, leader of this group, I suppose. |Now tell me, what just happened?

I just briefly explained the situation to Miss KSVK, and she immediately wanted to rush off to help us exterminate the ELIDs. I thought it was too dangerous, so I tried to stop her... I didn't mean to pull her arm off!

Her original left arm was a complete write-off. I managed to put together this slapdash new arm with what I have on hand, but the joint breaks very easily if too much force is applied, so do be careful with it.
Hm, a small token of gratitude to the Great Healer.
Small token? Great Healer? ...Looks like we've got ourselves another Doll with a "peculiar" way of expressing herself.
...Sorry.
It's nothing to apologize for. You're not the only one here who talks weirdly. |Still, I'm very glad that you're willing to help us.

[Ullrid, don't jump the gun here. Miss KSVK has just woken up, and Suomi hasn't got the chance to fill her in about everything. We should let her make her decision carefully knowing all the facts.] —Littara
That's right! Let me see... Where do I start...?
(From the disappearance of the bounty hunter and convoy leader Allen to the Dolls forming their own Doll collective to survive, Ullrid gives KSVK a summary of everything they have been through.)
(She also explains the voting system that the Dolls have just adopted with Littara's help for making major decisions.)
S-so Ullrid is... the Supreme Leader!
"Supreme Leader" is hardly necessary. Just call me Ullrid. Everyone takes part in the decision-making here. Nominally, I'm the leader, but, uh... I'm technically more like an organizer.
I see...
But much as we'd like to keep up the collective self-determination, the truth is... since we are faced with severe shortages on supplies, many of our friends are forced into hibernation...
Th-then I'm using—exiled sinners do not deserve grace! This wrong must be righted!
(KSVK is about to rip her temporary arm off.)
Oh no! That's not what I meant! Hold your horses! |We've found the ruins of a thermal power plant nearby that contains a lot of usable supplies!
Really?
Yep! If we can get our hands on those supplies, we'll be saved.
The problem is... the place is crawling with ELIDs... KSVK, could, could you help us fight them? J-just so you know, this isn't why we decided to repair you...
I understand. All obstacles that hinder the light will be shattered by the sword of hope!
Not so fast.
(Rosalind calmly stops KSVK from charging out again. She raps the back of the chair with the spanner in her hand. Her smile is gentle but also stern.)
You're not going anywhere before I tighten up your shoulder joint, you hear?
...Sorry...
[Thank you very much, Miss KSVK. We'll first need to put together an action plan. As Ullrid just explained, whether we do this or not ultimately comes down to a vote.] —Littara
Vote? What is a... vote?
Hm? Miss KSVK is suddenly speaking plainly.
[Looks like she has finally calmed down. We will kickstart the procedure soon. You'll get a better idea when you see it happen. But tell us more about yourself first.] —Littara
That's right, we barely know anything about you. Suomi said you've lost all of your neural logs from before you entered the contamination zone. Do you still remember why you came to this area?
I... I heard there's a key here that unlocks everything!
Hm, I'm struggling to understand what she's saying again.
S-struggling to understand?! It's me... I'm the problem. I—
Calm down! Please calm down, KSVK. Relax. Take a deep breath—
[Breathe in... Breathe out... It's okay, Miss KSVK. We are not telling you off. We just want you to slow down and explain everything as clearly as you can, okay?] —Littara
Uh, yes... After I woke up, I lost my memories.
Then I came across a Doll who seemed to know me. She gave me a set of coordinates and told me I might find some answers there.
I left the convoy... but soon after I got here, I ran out of power.
[Ullrid, some Griffin Dolls have stayed with us temporarily before. Could Miss KSVK have met one of them?] —Littara

Technically speaking, any Doll who leaves us should have the corresponding neural logs purged to prevent information about us from being leaked... But there are those who left without a word, and we couldn't do anything about them.
Find some answers... Maybe the Doll was referring to someone here who knows Miss KSVK? That would be me and Miss Littara?
That may be so... I have come in the hope of retrieving... the sand lost in time.
Y-you mean your lost neural logs? |But neither Miss Littara nor I knew Miss KSVK very well back then... Hm...
Oh! I think I've heard Miss DP-12 address you as "Dushevnaya"!
DP-12...? Dushevnaya...
[According to the combat reports I've read, Miss DP-12 and Miss KSVK teamed up very often in combat. I believe you were quite close.] —Littara
Dushevnaya... Can you call me Dushevnaya?
Of course. It's your name to begin with.
Okay!
Right, time is short. Dushevnaya, now that you know you probably won't find the answers you're searching for here... |Are you still willing to help us?
I-I am immensely grateful just for retrieving this name! Besides... that isn't my only goal. I shall keep my eyes firmly on where the North Star guides me!
...Huh?
[I'm guessing Miss Dushevnaya means she's happy to help us while she searches for her answers?] —Littara
Indeed! As expected of the Great Sage!
...G-G-G-G-Great Sage?!
Oh, because you are the smartest, wisest member of the party of heroes, like a great sage...
[You flatter me, but really, thanks so much for offering to help.] —Littara
This is wonderful, Miss Dushevnaya.
Yeah, honestly, our situation really doesn't allow much more delay... Littara, let's call a new vote straight away! I'm sure Dushevnaya's arrival will give everyone a boost in confidence!

[Commander, poor Miss KSVK looked very much like a migratory bird who had been separated from her flock after being reactivated. Miss Littara and I told her many stories about our time at Griffin, but those didn't seem to mean anything to Miss KSVK. Only at the mention of your name did her eyes suddenly light up with recognition and hope.]

[She asked us a lot of questions about you. Sometimes she looked sad, and sometimes she smiled as she listened. She said it felt both strange and familiar. Even though she remembered nothing but your name, she was certain that everything we told her had indeed happened.]

[Perhaps YOU are the key that would unlock her memories? But at least she has found her own name, as well as us. Our Doll community may just be a tiny, unsteady boat, but I firmly believe that as long as we have each other, we will make it through the storm.]

[However, despite the unexpected and joyful reunion, we are still faced with a lot of aggravating problems... From what Miss Littara has told me, Big Sis is worrying herself sick over them. I really want to help her, but I don't know what to do...] —Suomi
(Two hours after a vote was called...)
(Ullrid paces anxiously in circles like a caged beast. When she passes the chair that she was just sitting on for the third time, she finally trips over it.)
Ack! Who put this chair here?!
[Wouldn't that be yourself? Calm down. If you can't, use one of your stress-relieving tools.] —Littara
Y-you're right... Stress-relieving tools... Stress-relieving tools... I remember I have a scalp massager... Here it is!
Ah...
[...I'm still skeptical about the effectiveness of this thing, but I'm glad it helped you calm down. Things aren't actually that bad, Ullrid.] —Littara
67% of the voters abstained from voting this time! How can I not freak out about this?!
[You said to Miss Dushevnaya "It's okay. We may have failed this time, but there'll be a next time, so don't worry."] —Littara
I-I was trying to encourage her... Not only did her arrival not increase the voting rate, it actually caused more voters to abstain... she was close to tears!
(Ullrid tosses away the scalp massager, then pulls out a battered rubber pig from her pouch and starts squeezing it like mad. She bounces her leg restlessly as the rubber pig squeals and snorts.)
I don't get it, Littara.

The amount of information given beforehand increased by 73%. There was no problem with information transparency—we made sure everyone read through the report before voting. We had a consensus that our priority would be to obtain more supplies, and we even have a new volunteer...
So why did this happen?
[Our report may have illustrated the cost-effectiveness of the plan, but we still lacked decisive proof that fighting would lead to success.] —Littara

[To many Dolls, Miss Dushevnaya's arrival might just mean more competition for resources. This would mean their own chances of receiving maintenance were further reduced, which in turn made them even less willing to fight.] —Littara
But if we succeed, we won't be limited to such a small amount of resources! There will be no competition!
[You said it yourself—IF. Right now, when everyone is still feeling so hopeless, of course they'd zero in on the worst-case scenario.] —Littara
So the bottom line is... I didn't inspire enough confidence?
Y-you're not the p-problem, Ullrid.
No? Then I must've not made everything clear... Littara, have you finished the plan for extracting the supplies from the thermal power plant?
[Just done. I'll send it to you through Level II.] —Littara
Types and quantities of supplies to be brought back... Projected casualties... Right, got it.
Everyone, our previous vote was unfortunately invalid.
You all saw the result. However, our current situation really does not allow us to delay any further, so I would like to make some additions to the information pack provided earlier.

You should have just received a plan proposed by Littara. This plan details the quantities of supplies we will be able to acquire if we excavate the ruins of the thermal power plant, as well as the estimated cost of this venture.
Seriously? This many...?! You've got to be kidding!
...These resources are expected to... cover the repairs of more than ten Dolls...
But the excavators will also have a casualty rate of 25%...
A quarter... If someone gets completely destroyed under these circumstances...
Guys, listen. I expect the actual situation will turn out better than what the data suggest in the plan—not that I'm questioning Littara's calculations, obviously.
Humph, you have always been blindly optimistic.
Uh, I can't really deny that... However, my optimism is perfectly justified because of our very promising new recruit—Dushevnaya.
Hm, the one you already introduced two hours ago...

Indeed, but my introduction about Dushevnaya was a bit too brief, and I failed to make you understand how her arrival could change things for us—I believe we can be less conservative about our combat strength.
...What—huh? ...Me?! H-hold on, S-Supreme Leader! A rotten branch cannot possibly bear the weight of the world!
Branch? Uh, calm down. I don't think an elite T-Doll who worked for a famous PMC is a branch at all.
Ugh...
A famous PMC... You don't mean Griffin?
Bingo! I was so anxious, I only mentioned Suomi brought a new T-Doll back with her, but I forgot to explain her background.
Suomi, Littara, and the Griffin Dolls who stayed with us before—you have all seen what they can do.
Dushevnaya was also from Griffin, and according to the combat records that Littara had read, her mission success rate is probably the highest here!
That impressive? Why didn't you say so before?!
Hahaha, I was so flustered I completely forgot. Also, Dushevnaya's imprinted weapon is a sniper rifle, which fills the gap in our long-range attacks and gives us more tactical options in combat!
Y-you flatter me!
It's true, having another capable pair of hands will definitely improve our chances!
Hm, that is very reassuring!
Is that shrimp really so strong?
Bathilde, you shouldn't call her a shrimp...
Suomi, you picked up this stray called Dushevnaya, yeah? Is she really so powerful?
Yep! She is indeed.
So you're Dushevnaya? I wish I were as strong as you! We're counting on you then!
I... I... Too much expectation on a boulder would only cause it to s-s-s-sink—
Uh, calm down, guys!

Dushevnaya's neural cloud isn't the most stable, so please don't put too much pressure on her. If we all work together, I believe that not only will our chances of success increase, our casualty rate will also fall by 8%!
...That's quite a big drop!
25% minus 8% is still 17%! That's still pretty high, no?
I know, someone will have to make sacrifices—but not with their lives! We just have to have each other's back and make sure no one's frame takes fatal damage in battle!
Let's put in this last-ditch effort to bring those supplies back, then we can all get some proper maintenance, and more Dolls can come out of hibernation!
Right! You're right, but we can't just rely on our new friend here! We must also pull our own weight!
That's right, so many of us are in hibernation... We need to work hard for their sake too!
Even withered wormwood b-burns!
...Make sure you all get a proper check-up in the maintenance area before you set off.

I'm glad we're feeling more confident! |But we'll still have to vote on whether to put the plan into action. Please read through the operation plan and give it a good think first, then we'll take a vote in 15 minutes.
Phew... The Dolls' decision will be more in line with what we expect this time, don't you think, Littara?
Littara? What's the matter with you? Is your neural cloud acting up again?
(Littara snaps out of a daze and shakes her head. With a frown, she scribbles something down on her notepad, but then she promptly scratches it out.)
What's wrong? What's on your mind? Just tell me!
[I'm just thinking... both the current voting system and the way the Dolls make decisions seem a bit problematic. We seem to have overlooked some... issues...] —Littara
...Overlooked...

The result of the vote is out... 13% of the voters have still abstained, but 65% voted in favor of "excavating the supplies from the thermal power plant". That's good news. |Littara, the result is indeed in line with our expectations.
[But is that really a good thing?] —Littara
...I know what you mean. Actually, I've also been wondering about the same thing...
But right now, we should focus on solving our most pressing problem. Once the excavation is completed, we can review this issue. How about that?
[Sure. Now let's make sure the operation goes smoothly. I'll give the matter some thought.] —Littara
Jeez... What would I do without you, Littara?
[Don't be such a suck-up!] —Littara
But I really do mean it!
(In the dark space, a rustling noise can be heard in the corner.)
(But it ceases after a dull gunshot. The metal door opens with a few sparks. A hunched figure slips inside stealthily and takes in the surroundings.)
No ELID activity detected, Ullrid!
Alright, get ready to go in. |Stay alert. There could be ELIDs lurking in the shadows. I'm turning on the light.
Wow...
Look over there! There are so many crates on the shelves!
There are batteries over here. Can't really tell what state they're in, but there are more than 20 of them!
...There's so much stuff...
Gather the supplies according to the levels of priority stated in the acquisition list we sent you earlier! Don't lose your cool!
Eeep?!
What's going on?
I-I'm okay! I just... s-stepped on something... Waaah!
Are you alright?
I'm fine! I'm fine, sorry!
What's that? Glass... No, this feels like Collapse crystal?
These... look like seeds!
Seeds? What kind of seeds?
I don't know... If Wolfiin were here, she'd definitely know.
Wolfiin... If I remember correctly, she's a civilian Doll, isn't she? She has an affinity to plants, but I think she's been in hibernation for quite a while now...
Yeah, she's my friend. She used to work in agriculture before she went into hibernation.
I see... I'm sorry.

N-n-no, don't apologize, Ullrid! It's not your fault! She has no combat capability, after all... Allen agreed to take her in only because she could take care of the Collapse Epiphyllums in the first place...
Besides, she entered hibernation voluntarily. I just think she'd be very happy if she got to see these seeds.
Then let's bring some back.
Huh? C-can we?
Of course! Let's bring a little with us today, and we'll come back for more at a later date. We'll give Wolfiin the seeds when she is reactivated. I'm sure it'll make her day.
B-but we agreed we wouldn't take any supplies that are not on the list...
It's just a handful of seeds. It's fine. Pack them away now. There are so many batteries here I can't move them all on my own... Heh, there's even one with high capacity! We're saved!
High-capacity battery?
Yeah, what of it?
Nothing... I'll go... fetch the seeds first!
(Lotta scans the bottles and jars on the shelves and picks out the smallest container to stash into her backpack.)
What are you doing? All okay? |Lotta, don't go packing trash.
I-I'm not...
Oh, move aside. Let me see what we've got over here.
Thanks for coming along, Bathilde.
No biggie. I promised Rosalind I'd help the excavation team determine the worth and condition of these supplies. Just doing my job.
Then I'll leave you to it. Let me know if you run into any problems.
Gotcha! Bathilde, look over here...
(Ullrid leaves Lotta and Bathilde to their work and heads over to join Littara in front of another pile of supplies.)
Littara, do you remember Wolfiin?

[Sure, the Doll in charge of taking care of the Epiphyllums, right? After Allen was gone, the search for Epiphyllums didn't really matter anymore, so she volunteered to go into hibernation very early on. What got you thinking about her all of a sudden?] —Littara
Nothing. Lotta brought her up. She said Wolfiin would be very happy to see all this equipment in here.

(Ullrid conjures up the image of the agricultural Doll named Wolfiin trying to cultivate crops in the contamination zone in her neural cloud. She also recalls the moment when she decided to go into hibernation and bid her friends goodnight.)
I hope we can start making these supplies work for us soon. Then we can reactivate her.
[If there are enough resources...] —Littara
(Littara pauses and ultimately decides against writing out the sentence that would drag Ullrid back to reality.)
[Speaking of agriculture, all the supplies in this warehouse seem to have something to do with that.] —Littara

[There are a variety of artificial fertilizers on this side, all sorted into categories, along with some equipment for illumination and temperature control. In that corner, there's a small planting automaton that I believe is used for sowing seeds and plowing soil, though it has definitely seen better days.] —Littara
I also found some well-preserved seeds on the other side... Why are there so many agricultural supplies in a contamination zone?
[I'm thinking about that too. Maybe this facility also functioned as...]
(Before Littara can finish writing, the warehouse door slams shut from the outside with a deafening clang. Littara's pen slips, leaving a long black line on the notepad.)
What's going on?
...Bathilde! Littara!
Look out!
Awooooooo!
Ruff!
There's more?!
—It's too late!
(Just as the ELID's teeth are about to close around Lotta, the planting automaton that has been lost in the chaos suddenly reappears.)
(It whirrs as it rams right into the growling ELID, then crashes into the wall with a loud "clang" and tips over onto the floor. Its battery falls out of the slot.)
Ah—!
It-it's not going to move again... is it...?
Sheesh, can you stop being so careless...? |Ugh... the automaton is no good now.
...Sorry... Bathilde hates seeing machines getting wrecked...
Bathilde, are you okay?
Me? The visual module in my left eye is dead. It just messes with my depth perception a bit, but no big deal.
Is that high-capacity battery... still salvageable...?
Don't think so. The model is incompatible with the planting automaton to begin with. This is what you get for being so rough with electronics.
That's okay, we've still got many other batteries, so don't worry.
Ha... |This one here must have been thinking about reactivating Wolfiin with this battery.
How... Ugh, you got me...
...Oh yeah, being an agricultural Doll, Wolfiin does need a bigger battery than usual Dolls...
This one happened to be a high-capacity battery... I thought it could...
Even if it worked, who said it would be given to Wolfiin? Don't be so naïve.
...You're right.
(Lotta is still clutching the battery that has been burned to a crisp tightly. Exasperated, Bathilde yanks the battery out of her hands and tosses it aside.)
(Tears start welling up in Lotta's eyes, and she bites her lip stiffly. Seeing her like this, Ullrid feels like she should say something to comfort her.)
...Uh... Look, Lotta. Didn't it look like... hm... like this automaton was trying to protect you in Wolfiin's place?
Huh? What the hell are you talking about?
Uh... N-no, that's not what I meant—
...Hm, I don't really understand either... I'm sorry...
Suomi, what did the Supreme Leader mean by that?
I don't know either. Big Sis might be trying to comfort Miss Lotta...?
...Comfort?!
I-I was so flustered, this is all I could think of!
[Calm down, Lotta. What Ullrid meant to say is that as long as we have enough supplies, we will get to reactivate Wolfiin. She hasn't really left you.] —Littara
Yeah, I know. Thank you, Littara.
...Um, I know you did it to save me... I-if it hadn't been for this automaton, you would have to leave with my frame in pieces... so don't feel too bad about it.
Sure, don't worry.
I'm not actually worried... Ahem! Where did this planting automaton come from anyway? It sure had great timing.
[I think it ran into the door of the opposite building and turned to avoid more obstacles. Come take a look at this.] —Littara
It's true. The locking mechanism on this door got destroyed. It must be from the impact just now.
[According to the numbering pattern of the CCTV cameras, this is the place with the inactive surveillance feed.] —Littara
[I suggest we enter the building and survey it while we still have ample manpower. This will also give us more information to work with for subsequent operations.] —Littara
Yeah, I agree.
But what about the stuff in the warehouse? Are we just leaving them there?
Those are all treasures, of course we're not leaving them there. Let's rest up for a bit and organize the supplies we've gathered while we're at it. We'll enter the building in three hours.
Got it, Big Sis!
Understood!
(In the ruins of the thermal power plant. Suomi and Bathilde are standing outside the door of the building, keeping an eye out for danger while also guarding their supplies.)
B-Big Sis and the others have been in there for a while now!
If you have something to say, just say it. There aren't any ELIDs around anyway, so it's not like we've got much to do here.

Sorry about what? Spare me your sympathy. Sympathy alone won't wake her.
Miss Bathilde, you will definitely see Miss Wolfiin again, because you and Miss Lotta are still thinking of her.
...What's with the sudden cheesiness...
I just don't want you to be sad... S-sorry, I'm being presumptuous!
I didn't say you were, did I? But enough of that. What's taking them so long? What the hell is going on in there...?

I don't know... But with Big Sis, Miss Littara, and Miss Dushevnaya around, they should be okay! If something goes wrong, they'll contact us. We just have to secure their escape route and prevent them from getting locked in again.
Tsk, you're awfully talkative when it comes to Ullrid.
I-I just... You did say there's not much to do here because there are no ELIDs around... |...Hm? Not much to do... Hang on?!
What's going on?
We've been out here for so long, but we haven't seen a single ELID... We did clear out the area around the warehouse, but... what are the odds?
Isn't this a good thing? Fighting a few more ELIDs won't do you any goo—Hey, what are you doing?!
(A thought occurs to Suomi, and she abruptly leans in close to Bathilde.)
I'd like to test a hypothesis! Miss Bathilde, you're carrying a Collapse radiation detector, aren't you?
I am... What of it? Where are you going? What about our sentry duty?!
I'll be right back!
(Inside the power plant, Ullrid quietly opens a door and slips inside a room. She sweeps her flashlight across the space, and after making sure it's safe, she calls for her teammates to come inside.)
This room... looks a bit different. It's like... a lab? Is that a terminal in the corner?
Be careful. If you come across anything you're unsure about, get me or Littara. Lotta, check that terminal.
Supreme Leader, Great Sage! Please look at that on the wall.
Hm? Another one?
(Ullrid walks over to the wall and takes down the picture frame. She wipes away the dust with her fingers. It is a photograph of two unfamiliar Dolls.)
(Having explored multiple rooms, the Dolls are no longer fazed by the discovery.)
It's... the same photo again.
[Who are these two Dolls? Why is their photo... in every room here?] —Littara
This Doll here... the one on the left... She gives off a really weird vibe. How do I put it? She looks like a Doll frame without a neural cloud...
This place is full of unsolved mysteries. Our neural clouds will overheat and crash if we think about them all too hard.
[You're right. There are so many questions. We don't even know what a thermal power plant is doing so deep within a contamination zone.] —Littara
(Littara's writing hand pauses with unease.)
...Is it... to generate power for nearby settlements? The environmental conditions here are terrible though. The cables leading to the settlements would have rotten away like old bones.

[But according to the geographical data that Suomi has collected, there are no reasonably sized settlements within the power plant's coverage area. The one we're in is already the largest set of ruins.] —Littara
[Besides, considering the construction costs, even if settlements further away require power, they wouldn't have chosen to lay cables here of all places.] —Littara
...Ugh... I'm sorry. P-please forget what I said...
You don't have to apologize! It was an interesting guess. Um... Could it be an outpost for some kind of survey?
[Survey? You mean, like for the Purification Project?] —Littara
Yeah, you know those... beacons, purification vehicles, Great Wall Railway... They're everywhere these days, aren't they? Maybe there are similar plans for this place.
[There's no evidence to support this at all... but it's a reasonable guess.] —Littara

Wow, that was pretty harsh, even though you're basically agreeing with me. If my guess is correct, then these two Dolls in the photo could be the ones in charge of running and maintaining this facility. After all, employing Dolls is much cheaper than employing human staff this deep inside the contamination zone.

[Hm... Then something—maybe an accident—could have caused the Collapse radiation around the power plant to spike to abnormal levels, which attracted a large number of ELIDs, so they had to abandon all activities within the area...]—Littara
[If we follow this line of reasoning... then those strange cooling towers could be the reason!] —Littara
See? It's plausible.
[It is certainly plausible... but like I just said, this is all just conjecture with no supporting evidence. It just feels too... convenient of an explanation...] —Littara
Ullrid, Littara! Please take a look at this. The terminal is still operational.
Oh, coming!
(Ullrid hangs the picture frame back on the wall and dusts her hands off before joining Littara and Lotta at the terminal.)
See...? I turned it on, but there's nothing on it... Maybe I'm not doing this right...?
[It's definitely unnatural for it to be completely blank. The files are probably hidden. But our main objective is to gather supplies. Information isn't exactly essential...] —Littara
Let's try to get through on Level II and see if we can find anything.
Huh?

I can see that you're really curious about this. Since we already have experience hacking the surveillance system on Level II, we should be able to handle it with more Dolls with us this time. |Lotta, please help us set up the connection.
Will do!
[Ullrid, thank you for supporting me in trying to verify something that's irrelevant to our primary objective.] —Littara
Why are you suddenly being so serious? Besides, solving this mystery will also be helpful for planning our next steps.
Hm... If you really want to thank me, then promise you'll also support me in doing whatever I wanna do next time, even if it seems silly and irrelevant!
Okay!
Huh... There really are hidden files.
...These are all... leaves buried deep beneath the soil...
W-wait a minute... These... Th-th-these... Hm!

[These files all seem to be on the subject of cultivating crops! Look here. These documents are proposals for soil improvement, these are cultivation logs... And these are information about seeds, like the ones in the warehouse!] —Littara
They're researching how to plant crops? In a contamination zone?
What—Is-is it possible?!
[I don't know, but there are no clear experimental results... Here, look!] —Littara
Coordinates... of an experimental field? They actually set up an experimental field here?
Ullrid! We've found something in the room. Can you come and check this out?
Oh, sure! |I think that's everything in here, Littara. Let's cut the connection.
Ullrid, look! I noticed this hidden entryway right after we disconnected from Level II. It probably opened because we deactivated the defense system of this building.
It's so... cramped in here. It's like a storage room... Urk!
Look out!
I-I-I-I'm fine! I just tripped over the Devil's tail!
The Devil's? |...Tail?
[Lotta is still unfamiliar with Miss Dushevnaya's speech pattern... I don't think she's referring to the literal Devil.] —Littara
I see...
How are things?
Hm, there's a pile of random stuff, and in the corner are two huge... drones, I think!
Drones?
[They could be drones for hauling supplies or samples over short distances.] —Littara
They appear to be free of damage, just very dusty. They may still be functional, Supreme Leader!
Let me see... The switch is usually... Found it. |Uh, it's not turning on?
Machines tend to break if they're idle for too long... That's what Bathilde says...
Well, then we'll just have to take them back with us. |Even if we can't get them repaired, the parts could still be useful.
Big Sis!
Suomi, is there a problem out there?
No, Big Sis, but I may have found the cause of the high radiation levels here!
What's going on?
I was standing guard with Miss Bathilde outside, but there wasn't a single ELID here—they wouldn't even come close!
There are so many ELIDs around the warehouse, so this place should be crawling with them as well, so I thought I'd check the radiation levels here.
Makes sense. And?
There's no noticeable difference in the radiation levels, so I'm thinking—since the ELIDs are not here, they must have been drawn to another location!
C-could it really—a-a-actually...!
The cooling towers! When I approached one of the cooling towers that's spewing some strange gas, the reading on the detector suddenly skyrocketed, and the place was filled with ELIDs!
That lines up with our hypothesis!

[Partially, at least. The cooling towers may be increasing the Collapse radiation levels, but this doesn't explain why the ELIDs around the building are all drawn over to the towers while those around the warehouse aren't affected...] —Littara
Hm... Maybe the ELIDs around here were drawn to the warehouse because of our activities before we wiped them all out?

[I do hope that's the case... But at least we now know that in order to solve the problem about the Collapse radiation and ELIDs, we must start with the cooling towers. Ullrid, how should we proceed?] —Littara
We've gathered a lot of supplies already... It could get dangerous if we go any further, and we can't bring the supplies with us.
Let's get a group to take the supplies and information we have gathered so far back to camp. Having a smaller party should also make it easier to keep a low profile while we investigate.
The Dolls have taken quite a beating in the last battle, especially Bathilde. Send them back first. It'll also take a few Dolls to transport these two beautiful pieces of junk.
(Ullrid nudges the drones lying on the floor with the tip of her shoe.)

[Yeah, Bathilde isn't good in a fight either, so it's better to have some T-Dolls escort her. I think both the cooling towers and the experimental field are worth investigating. Your choice.] —Littara
Littara, show me a bird's-eye view of the area that we've mapped.
[Just sent it to you via Level II. I've marked both locations on the map.] —Littara

The experimental field is a bit closer... In that case, let's check out the field first. We haven't explored that area yet. There were a large number of ELIDs in the vicinity; I'm worried that they had already destroyed the field... We should prioritize that.
Suomi, get Bathilde to direct everyone in transporting the supplies back to camp. You, me, Dushevnaya, Littara, and Lotta are heading to these coordinates.
Got it, Big Sis!
(Beneath the dull sky of the contamination zone...)
(With Littara navigating, the lightly equipped Dolls travel quietly and cautiously toward the experimental field, stepping over the occasional ELID carcass strewn across the ground.)
Worried about Miss Bathilde, Miss Lotta?
Yeah... I hope they make it safely back to the camp...
She has T-Dolls as escorts. They will surely avoid the underwater reefs!
...Reefs? Is-is there an underground river here?!

Miss Dushevnaya probably meant they'd avoid places with lots of ELIDs. The ELIDs have all been drawn to the cooling towers now, and we've wiped out many of them on our way, so they shouldn't have much problem.
Right... Thanks, Suomi, Miss Dushevnaya.
Just Dushevnaya is fine, fellow adventurer. You can call me that too, Great Sage and Suomi.
[Sure, Dushevnaya.] —Littara
I-I'll stick with Miss Dushevnaya. I got used to it...
Now, now~ You can chat, but don't lower your guard! Still, there really aren't many ELIDs around here. Hm, looks like Suomi's right.
Heheh.
[Ullrid, something strikes me as really odd.] —Littara
Yeah...? Go on...?
(Ullrid slows down to let Suomi, Dushevnaya, and Lotta walk on ahead while she falls in line with Littara.)
[There's surveillance everywhere in the facility, which means this place is closely monitored.] —Littara

[Ullrid, you still remember the bots we encountered on Level II? We've been here for so long, but we haven't run into any of them or any kind of defense at all out here in the physical world. Nothing but ELIDs.] —Littara
ELIDs... right. You're right. The ELID flesh we see here is in an advanced state of decomposition, so I don't think ELIDs have been coming here recently, at least to this place.
Huh?
This means that this place is pretty safe, right? Don't worry too much, Littara! It–It will be fine! Yeah, nothing to worry about!

Woah! Wh–what are you doing?!

(Ullrid cautiously glances over the three who have walked over to her front. She wearily hangs her head.)
...Looks like you've found out.

The place seems abandoned... But the power is still on. I'm worried that it's not just some simple thermal power plant. Have I been leading everyone into an even more dangerous place than before...? What if...
[Are you worried that the operations personnel might still be around? That they might take measures against us, like use the bots we saw on Level II to attack us if they see us?] —Littara
Yes. Things will be really bad if that happens... Humans... No, humans with evil intentions are worse than ELIDs.

...Is that really what we are going to do...? But everyone is waiting for—

[Worrying too much will affect your performance. Remember that it's just hypothetical at the moment... Even if the worst does happen, I will be with you to come up with a solution.] —Littara
Heh... You're right. It's pointless to overthink it now. I have the reliable Littara to help me out if we really run into trouble.
[And Ullrid always says that I overthink to the point of crashing, maybe someone else fits that description too?] —Littara
I really am too anxious about it... (Sigh) I should've brought along my heart-shaped bubble wrap with me...
Big Sis! I found something!
(Suomi waves to the two from above. Littara checks the overhead map of the thermal power plant.)

Let's head over. Thank you, Littara.
D–don't mention it.
These coordinates... are for that short building, right? It's not even half as tall as the warehouse we were in just now. Is the experimental field really in there?
Get ready. There might be other kinds of defensive measures awaiting us.

(The Dolls swiftly but quietly prop themselves up against the walls on both sides of the building's front door. Ullrid gently pushes the door open. It falls over with a thud, sending up a cloud of dust.)

Okay!
It's safe, come in.
...Wh–why is there a hole on the floor...
This is obviously a tunnel to the abyss!
The abyss...
[Likely the entrance to the experimental field. The Collapse radiation levels are really high here, so it makes sense for the experimental field to be underground.] —Littara
We'll know what's up once we go in. Everyone, check your ammo, stay in alert formation, and get ready to enter.
(The Dolls maintain formation in the pitch darkness, slowly descending the stairs.)
Mind your step. I think we are almost at the bottom.
...Seems to be... a familiar smell... soil?
We're at the bottom... be careful getting down.
Um. What's up with the red lights on the wall?
What? Where are the red lights?
It came from the walls on our two sides. Did the Supreme Leader not see it just now?
I did not see any light—Dushevnaya!
Don't go over there, Miss Dushevnaya! Those are bots!
Wha—?
(Blue arcs of electricity spark all over the surroundings. A mass of red lights light up on the walls.)
(The silhouettes of bots crisscross in the dim lighting. The sounds of scraping metal resonate through the previously silent environment.)
It's op–optical... camouflage!
Run! Get out! Head to the exit—! |Suomi! Secure the exit! I'll hold them back!
Got it, Big Sis!

(Ullrid urges the Dolls to leave while she stands guard on the narrow staircase, striking down bots beneath her that attempt to ascend. The bot she strikes fall and crash into each other, but any gap formed is quickly swarmed by even more bots, their overwhelming electric arcs making Ullrid's scalp feel numb.)
Hmph. This is the same design we saw in Level II... |Keep running! To outside!
(The group executes a fighting retreat, breaking through the army of bots surrounding them.)
(But as they escape the building, gray-green snowflakes descend upon them.)
Big Sis, it's snowing! The radiation levels are spiking!
