We don't know how long we will stay here, but we can finally rest and recuperate for a while. Plus, this seems to be the best place we can find and use as a settlement for now.
Commander, I know that I have said before that Dolls tend to make decisions based on rationality and practical judgement, but after my experiences in the Doll collective, I'm not so sure anymore.

Maybe it's Big Sis's influence? Because as I look at my companions gathering around, I keep having this thought. That even though I acknowledge how tiny the probability is, I still can't help but hope that the day I reunite with you will come quite soon.
With that line of thinking in mind, I've got to work harder on my letters in preparation for our reunion!
I hope the winds of the contaminated zone will carry to you my hopes of seeing you again! — Suomi
(Bathed in the light of a small lamp, Suomi writes the ■7th letter that she wished to give to the Commander.)
(In the cold wastes of the Yellow Zone, the faint light of Suomi's lamp had only a miniscule possibility of being seen.)
(Yet not long after, every time Suomi recalls this night, she would always be amazed that while hopes and wishes cannot stand up to rational calculations, miracles do exist in this world.)
(The incoming signal stammers in the wake of the Collapse storm. Upon the screen is a lone line of text, "Audio Channel".)
Thank you, really!
Get a head count, and see if anyone needs emergency care. My Elmo has medics.
Take stock of supplies as well, though I am afraid I can't help with that.
Well, I think it's great that you've responded to our distress signal at all!
If it weren't for you—never mind whether or not this new settlement of ours would still be standing, E.L.I.D. would have gotten everyone here...
It's just... the matter of pay...
No need. A few ELIDs are no big deal for us.
...No, no, no, in reality... I have another request for you.
Huh?

("Settlement" may seem a rather informal name, but in the Yellow Zones, they are small human communities formed for the purpose of sharing wealth, land, buildings, equipment, as well as the mitigation of risks.
(Odds are that these conglomerations are far and few between in this broken world. Within yellow zones ravaged by Collapse storms, ELIDs, and Varjagers, however, exceptions could be found.)
(No matter the circumstances, humanity, as always—stubbornly seeks survival.)
In any case, I'll be leaving the stage play to you this time, Miss Jiangyu!
Eh—even if you say that, I'm still just a spectator here...
Hmph, where are Zhaohui and Faye? Lying about on the Elmo all day, slacking off...
"The Elmo and the Collapse Storm"... yeah, that should do for the title!
...Title?
Right, ahaha... I haven't even gotten started on the script...

In truth, I just wanted you to ask the Elmo's Monsoon Squad to put on something for the kids here and talk about some contaminated zone common knowledge and maybe a little about what we should do to adjust to the environment here.
So we have to put together the script anyway?
It doesn't have to be that serious, improvisation's fine, too. Just say what needs to be said, it's not like anyone here is a professional anyway.
It's just a shame that the Elmo's really too big to park around here, and would get in the way. Otherwise, we'd be able to put together a set.
Once this place is a bit more built up, maybe we could build a big stage. If that time comes, we'll invite you lot over again.
Hm? Again?
(Seeing Jiangyu's still disinterested mien, the chief smiles and points in a direction behind her.)
(Jiangyu's eyes follow, and she finds a few tiny heads poking out from behind a mass of rundown wooden boards.)

We... are all new to the contaminated zones. The adults are getting by for the most part. As foreign as the circumstances are, we at least have some life experience. The countless kids with us, though...
The kids' parents, they... well, they're in our hands now, and we ought to do what we can to raise them. Problem is the kids know next to nothing about how to acclimate and survive here.
You just saved us, after all. You know how kids are; they're fascinated with their "heroes". If you were to tell them a thing or two, I've no doubt it'll make a mark on them!
Look, over there, the kids are looking at you! Won't you let the children see your valorous figure in battle against the ELIDs again?
(The children look on with wide eyes, focused yet curious.)
...Alright, alright! But whether or not there'll be a next time is another matter!
Sure! Thank you, thank you!
(The chief sighs, leaving the scene.)
(Jiangyu stands still in contemplation, a frown upon her face.)
And here I was, thinking that I'd get to just step out and have a nice little stroll with this assignment. Now there's a script to write and a performance to put on... man, what a bother!
Something on this scale shouldn't be too difficult for you, right?
I'll help you with the script.
Hehe, I was hoping you'd say that.)
(Jiangyu turns around, sticking out her tongue at me.)
(The twin tailed girl is the same as she was before, full of spirit.)
(Daiyan walks towards us from a small distance away.)
Jiangyu, the chief's come to see you, yes?

Sis! You can't be for real! When we get back, you'd better give Zhaohui a good talking to! How could she just say yes so easily as the Monsoon Squad's head? And she hauled the two of us over here! Instead of going herself!
I thought this would just be a walk-on type of gig, maybe with a bit of choreography or drumming, but as a lead... my entire day's gonna be spent here!
The Commander signed off on this request, you know.
Wha? Commander?

Yes, that's why I came here with you—the Elmo's never gotten a request like this before. How to put it... I don't think it's a waste of time at all, and plays to your strengths. So, I told Zhaohui to accept it.
I think I've got a good idea of the play's contents.
What've you got?
As the chief says, despite it being a stage play, all we need to do is enact a few scenarios and tell the children how such situations should be approached.
We'll just string together a few common dangers in the contaminated zone based off our experiences.
One problem is that these kids are still little, and I would think that their only experiences are localized around this settlement.
You mean to say that some things that are mundane to us might not occur around here at all, right?
I thought of that as well. We need to survey the surroundings here before we pick the scenarios we enact.
Yeah. On top of that, we also need to—
Hold on! You mean that we can go have a bit of a wander around here?
Hooray! I'm off, then!
Jiangyu!
(She flashes us a super-wide smile, picking a direction and running off.)
...Sigh.
Well, I suppose we will have to follow her.
Alright.
Speaking of, how long are we staying here? Is everything on Mayling's side ok?
They should be... fine. Everyone else is still there.
We'll return when we're done with the play here. Let's leave the Elmo with Mayling for now.
Come, let's have a look around here.
Environmental intel recording complete. Cross-checked by Mayling.
I think that's all we need. Let's get back to the settlement.
Eh? Already? Commander, could we stay just a bit longer—
(Before Jiangyu is done, my terminal rings.)
Everyone, something's happened!
...That's the long and short of it.
It is my fault... There's just too many things to do, and we don't have enough people here to watch over...
W-what do we do...
Let me get things straight.

While we were away surveying the surroundings, the settlement was raided by Varjagers, who took some of your supplies. |You managed to evacuate to previously erected shelters with some wounded. After the Varjagers left, you found that three children were missing?
Y-Yeah... they can't have been taken away by the Varjagers, right?
How are the wounded?
Minor injuries, mostly...
What can you tell me about the enemy?
We all hid in different places, and couldn't get a good look at their exact numbers, maybe... ten of them? Two cars.
Beyond just teaching the kids how to adjust to life here, you might... have to get hands-on with improving the defenses at your settlement, then purchase some weapons.
I know a few brokers in the area. Unlikely I can get you a discount, but quality is assured. Would you like some recommendations?
Th-thank you...
We had purchased some supplies from them as well, but the Collapse storms nearby are far too frequent and delivery has been delayed... Just here at this node... Sigh...
I'll send Poludnitsa's contact details to you, she has more methods available. Anything you need in an emergency, you can get fast from her.
(I sigh as the chief struggles to get ahold of herself.)
Daiyan, contact Mayling, send a reinforcement squad. Make sure Colphne remembers her medkit.
Remain here and help them with whatever they need. Jiangyu, go with me.
Are you going to rescue those children, Commander?
Yes. Ten hostiles isn't too many for me and Jiangyu to handle.
I checked the environmental forecast a moment ago. A Collapse storm is incoming, and the chances are that ELIDs will follow. With Daiyan here, I can rest assured.
What if those Varjagers didn't move out in their entirety, and there are more than ten of them?
Would that not be dangerous?
Don't worry, Sis, I'll be there! Leave it to me to keep the Commander safe and sound!
Jiangyu...

If the numbers are against us, we'll scout out the children's circumstances and prioritize their safety—|Judging by what the chief told us and the tire marks on the ground, these Varjagers retreated in the southeast direction after their raid.
We can track them down via those tracks and send positional updates to the Elmo periodically. |By my projections, they have an outpost in that direction. It won't be hard to find them.
The others can track our positional signal and prepare to reinforce us if we give the signal.
Hehe, so long as we can find them, I can take ten of those Varjager pushovers with an arm behind my back! Saving those kids'll be no problem!
Jiangyu, do not be so impulsive.
Yeah yeah, I'll listen to the Commander~
So don't you worry, okay, Sis?
(Jiangyu blinks a few times in Daiyan's direction.)
I understand. A prudent arrangement, Commander.
Before reinforcements from the Elmo arrive, I shall handle things here. Jiangyu, the Commander is in your hands.
Leave it to me! I'll show 'em what I can do~
Alright, let's go.
(I follow the Varjagers' tracks with Jiangyu, infiltrating the interior of an abandoned dock.)
(Despite our efforts, we couldn't help but alarm some enemies.)
(Thankfully Jiangyu moved swiftly, and we managed to get past the undisciplined and poorly armed Varjagers.)
Phew... we're approaching the center of this outpost. Won't be so easy to hide our tracks moving forward.
(We hide behind a few stacked shipping containers as we scope out a sealed building not far away. Formerly a warehouse of this now deserted dock, its doors are now patrolled by gun-toting Varjagers.)
(Jiangyu lets out a long sigh with a grimace on her face.)
Commander, are those children really here?
We didn't hear the Varjagers talk about children or anything like that on the way here... could we have made a mistake?
Three children do not disappear into thin air. If they went missing after the Varjager attack, their whereabouts are without a doubt related to that incident.
That makes sense, but... where exactly are they?
Allow me to speculate, Jiangyu. If, for example, some Varjagers stole away some of the Elmo's supply, what would you do?
Huh? Beat the snot out of them and get what's ours back, of course!
What if the numbers heavily favor the enemy, and you can't beat all of them yourself?
Eh? Then... follow them at first? Then look for a chance to take all of them out!
We can't just let them have our supplies, no matter what!
I thought as much.
I would say chances are that those children are hidden somewhere inside, wherever the supplies are stored.
Huh?

Could it be possible... that the kids followed the Varjagers after their raid, looking to get their settlement's supplies back?

Let me sneak in!
Hm?
I'll go sniff out where they're hiding while you support me from outside.
When reinforcements get here, I should have already found them. Then, we'll act together and get the kids out!
Will you manage alone?
Don't underestimate me!
I'm an ex-Griffin Elite! Do you really not know what I'm capable of, Commander?
(Given the current circumstances, this is indeed a good solution.)
(Let's leave it to her.)
Alright, be careful.
Don't worry~
(She gives me an "ok" hand sign, leaving with weapon in hand. A few seconds later, she successfully approaches one of the building's corners.)
(While no one is around, she smashes a glass pane, deftly vaulting the window—)
Mm... I wanted to put on a show for the Commander, but this place is so big. Where do I even start looking?
—there?
Not bad at all. Place didn't look big at all, but those are some impressive spoils.
They say they just got here, but maybe they came from inside that place, you know.
Inside what... oh, you mean the Great Wall Railway?
Yeah, that's what it's called.
Whew, close call...
These people just walk about with no pattern, nowhere's safe... ah, to speak of it... Where would I be if I had to hide here?
To both avoid their patrols and retrieve the supplies... |A few kids can hardly carry any supplies, right? And getting from here back to the settlement would require some method of transportation...
(Jiangyu pokes her head out, cautiously observing the situation inside the warehouse.)
(Suddenly, she catches sight of a few parked transports on the other side of the building.)
Yeah, that looks good!
(After calculating the shortest route, she finds a timing and quickly slinks over.)
(She adjusts her auditory modules, turning them up to the max—)
Hmph... these guys are on another level of stupid, leaving the keys on the vehicle in open view.
In another two hours, it'll be dark outside. After these bandits are asleep, we'll leave in these cars with self-driving.
Can we really get out? If... if they catch up to us, it'll go really bad, right?
That's why we're waiting till they're asleep! We'll barge out the doors, and there's no way they'll react in time...
Shh—quiet down, someone's going to hear us!
(Three different voices! All three missing children are here!)
(Jiangyu breathes a sigh of relief, immediately sending a message via her communications terminal.)
Jeez, another two hours... I... I'm feeling hungry...
Are you an idiot? Deal with it!
(Jiangyu circles around behind the transport, silently entering one of the cabins filled with supplies.)
Don't be like that... a little when you're hungry is fine, right?
Everything here was originally ours anyway, right... ah! (Mumbles)
Shh—it's me!
(Jiangyu covers the mouth of the child who came close to yelling, and motions at the other two to be quiet.)
(Her terminal rings with a return message—the Elmo will arrive in 25 minutes. Prepare to evac.)
(She gives the shocked children a reassuring smile. She extends her hand, flicking the children's foreheads one by one—)
Did that hurt?
Owie...
Bullets hurt much more. Don't go off on your own and make the adults worry, you little dolts.
Imagine I was a Varjager who just found you three. What would you do?
We...
...We could run.
Run where? Their people are all over the place—
We all know how to drive, and this car has self-driving.
I could shoot out your tires or throw a grenade in your way.
You... your aim isn't always that good... and we have a backup plan...
Hm? Do tell me of this backup plan.
(The children lower their heads, finding no words to say.)
(Jiangyu releases a lengthy sigh.)
When your plans are inflexible and you mis-evaluate your own abilities, you'll create problems for others.
When the chief realized you were missing, she almost cried, you know. |When you get back, you better apologize to her proper, got it?
(The children give each other looks, then nod at Jiangyu.)
So long as you understand~
Now, all of you... listen to me.
No time for a full play, so I'll just give all of you a practical lesson today—how to retreat safely when surrounded by enemies. Watch closely!
(With the Elmo's fire support and assistance from Jiangyu, we manage to rescue the children.)
(Upon our return to the settlement with the children, the chief thanks us profusely, adding a considerable sum to the request's payment.)
Thank you, truly. If it weren't for you, chances are that these kids wouldn't have made their way back.
You are too kind. If you want the children to adjust to life in the contaminated zone, I fear a stage play won't do much good.|To develop their sense of danger, you still need to—
Come on! Just a bit more!
(I walk outside with the chief, finding Jiangyu in an open field out front.)
(More than a dozen children of varied height stand before her—practicing the horse stance.)
...What are you doing?
Hehe, I'm teaching them martial arts.
Martial arts?
Of course! A firm stance is the foundation of martial arts!
(As she speaks, Jiangyu pulls off a magnificent flying kick.)
To deliver a good kick, one must have strong legs—see? If you keep practicing, you'll eventually be able to do this too!
(I put hand to forehead as the children admire Jiangyu's display of prowess...)
If you teach them this stuff, they...
That's not everything I taught them, Commander.

I got them to agree that before they attained good form on a kick like that, they wouldn't go and make everyone worry by going off on their own.|If you can't protect yourself in your endeavors, you're only making more trouble for someone else.
After all—I of all people would know!
(She flashes me a shrewd smile.)
I knew what you wanted to say, Commander, so I went ahead and did it for you!
Sis, Groza, and the others should be ready. We should get ready to leave~
...Alright.
(I walk to Jiangyu's side, beholding her countenance.)
(She's barely changed compared to back then. All things considered though, through all of these years' trails, she's already grown up.)
(With her at the Elmo, I can take it easy a bit, right?)
(Mug of hot milk in one hand and half-cold coffee in the other, I walk into the ops room to see Mayling in a call with Groza.)
(Two months have passed since Suomi was registered to the Elmo.)

(Veritable mountains of work, occasional ELID encounters, and coffers as barren as the Yellow Zone's surface... With the total lack of manpower, I had to send even the recently recruited Krolik on expedition...)

(Taking Suomi with us is indeed dangerous on a contractual level, but with the example of Groza, can our encounter with Suomi break that rule as well? I'm not sure, nor am I so naïve, but I can't simply leave Suomi.)
(Let's just see how it goes... even if we must "execute", we should at least have a chance for adjustment.)
(I walk into the command room as I ponder.)
Mayling, I've got two drinks, which one do you—
Ok, ok! Message received. Please return to the MBV, Groza!
Received. ETA 12 minutes.
(Groza's figure disappears as the call ends.)
Morning, Commander... (Yawn)
Good work. Those dark circles... all-nighter yesterday?
(I mull over it for a moment, passing the cup filled with milk to Mayling. She blows lightly on the steam, sipping from the mug.)
(Better to have milk after an all-nighter.)
Oh, thanks... I slept a little, but the thought of the MBV's axis module malfunctioning and making us drift off course and running into something woke me up at maybe 4... Ah, (Yawn)...
(Mayling covers her mouth as she lets out a massive yawn, taking a few gulps of milk immediately after.)
(Her tired movements cause the milk to swish, the foam forming a white circle around her mouth.)
This won't do... What about the payment from that TASK-1377?
Let me have a look...|Still not deposited. What's taking them so long, should've been here two days ago...
Tsk, if B.R.I.E.F. did things a little faster, the contaminated zones would already be empty of ELIDs.|Pull up our financial summary this month.
Will do!
Expenditure and income are both in detail here. Biggest expenditure was repairs.
It wasn't cheap fixing Suomi's frame.

(I think back to that stormy night and the ray of light that pierced the dense darkness. Despite uncertain circumstances, I still ordered the Elmo to approach that dwindling light. Suomi was there, hoisting her lamp high against the wind.
(After she was restarted, Suomi handed me a letter, detailing her experiences while drifting with a Doll commune, including temporarily settling in the ruins of a thermoelectric power plant.)
(As she described, after settling in somewhat, her "Sister"—Ullrid, sent her out on expedition to acquire supplies, after which a series of twists and turns befell her...)
What that convoy did really was ridiculous. Suomi went to rescue their friends out of the kindness of her heart and they just left her behind!
(Mayling bangs the mug on the control panel, startling me with the sound. When I look back at her, she slams the control panel with her fist, spilling the still-warm milk onto the surface.)
(Perhaps remembering how much the panel costs, she immediately wipes it down with a paper towel.)
When we found Suomi, many of her frame's functions were impaired. Thank goodness her neural module was ok...

(Mayling is always been filled with indignance in regards to Suomi's experiences and always puffs up when it comes up in conversation. If one were to be angry at every misfortunate incident in the contaminated zones, their very being would soon burn away with rage.)
Thankfully we had some cash to spare back then. If any more "surprise" expenditures were to appear, I'd have to make like an ostrich and bury my head in the sand to escape reality.
Ah, I've already correlated the environmental information with our route...
The intel indicates that only scattered ELID clusters of Class I to II, at most Class III, are active. There shouldn't be a risk of damage to the frames of our Dolls... yeah!
Good work. This level of analysis makes things much easier for us.
Hehe, I didn't have much to do after I got up in the morning, so I had a look.
Everything is proceeding as planned. Just need TASK-1377's payment to arrive—
(The control panel emits the notification sound of incoming mail. Mayling leaps over and opens the message as I subconsciously lean in.)
A new email! Commander, it's the pay—Spectrum Bubble-Cart?
"The remote combat unit of your dreams, here to bring you a whole new battlefield experience" ...Aww... it's an ad...
When did B.R.I.E.F. turn into a shopping platform? This thing... looks like the opposite of reliable.
Seriously, Commander! The ads we get nowadays are all stuff like solar-powered turbine screwdrivers or auto-reloading robotic arms. All things that would obviously be practically useless!
Oh—is that so? I seem to remember you calling a number on one such ad, Mayling?
Th-that's... that's because it was the newest tetris console! The ad said it had built-in state-of-the-art AI and thousands of preset special stages! It looked really fun! Don't you agree, Commander?
I do not agree with its price tag—0.2 ounce of sardis gold. Enough for a box of batteries.
It's not like I ended up buying it... When I called and asked about it, they told me they were sold out! Who knows why they didn't prepare some extra stock after they put up ads.
(She collapses, her entire upper body pressed against the control panel. Her cheeks squish against the metal surface as she forcefully pushes her fingers into the panel, as if venting frustrations.)

Miss Mayling, Commander. We're back.
Welcome back! Ah, where's Nemesis?

The ELIDs blocking our route have been removed. No other ELID or organism responses have been detected within a 5km radius.|No frame damage, 30 rounds of ammunition expanded. Detailed report will be submitted later.
Alright. I'll have to ask you to take stock of our remaining ammunition with Mayling later.
Yes.|Additionally, Suomi's frame might need some adjustments.

Okay, I can get started right away! Give me a second to transfer some data to the armory terminal...

Sob... I-I also like... I love everyone like this... I-I want to...
Come on, let it all out, everything you wish to say.
I... I want to dwell in the crevice of time, and create more fateful entanglements with the people I meet!
Huh? What is she talking about?
Hahaha. I think Dushevnaya is trying to say she wants to stay!
Well, if you don't object, that's the interpretation I'll go with, Dushevnaya.
No-no objection! I want to stay and spend more, uh, more time with everyone, and create new neural records!
Alright, let's hug it out, everyone! In honor of Dushevnaya officially becoming our companion!
—Woah!
S-supreme Leader!
(Ullrid wraps Littara and Dushevnaya into her arms in one fell swoop, then waves at Lotta and Bathilde.)
Bathilde! Let's also join—
Nope, it's so corny—don't tug on me!
(The resolute Lotta forcefully drags Bathilde with her, and eventually, the five of them embrace each other in a messy hug. Unfortunately, Ullrid's terminal rings up, disrupting the warm moment.)
Rosalind? What's the matter?
Lotta's disappeared again. Do you have a clue?
...Ah! I-I was in a hurry to come... to support. I-I-I will be back at once, Miss Rosalind. Please don't hunt me down!
(Rosalind's gentle voice emanates from the comm terminal.)
Good. I'll give you one more chance. A final one.
Speaking of, where have you gone? Why have you all disappeared?
Ugh, something came up. We're now over by the cooling tower... By the way, Rosalind. Dushevnaya just said she'd like to stay!
Really? That's fantastic. I was worried she would quietly leave with an unadjusted arm hanging off like that.
That won't happen, Miss Rosalind! If I were ever to leave, I'll make sure to let everyone know!
By the way, Miss Rosalind hasn't made a wish yet. Do you have something you want me to fulfill?
Haven't I said it before? My wish has always been—for my "patients" to STAY PUT.
(Groan)
Including you, Dushevnaya.
Alright, alright. Let's not scare her, Rosalind.
Ultimately, they are the way they are because of your leniency. You're half to blame, Ullrid.
Uh... I'll bring them back! Immediately, right now! No one can escape!
Good. I'll be awaiting your arrival in the maintenance room.
(Ullrid wraps Littara and Dushevnaya into her arms in one fell swoop, then waves at Lotta and Bathilde.)
Well, since we're companions, we'll have to bear Rosalind's wrath together. No calling off on this!
I forgot to mention this earlier. I also got a little glimpse of the Great Healer's other side through this event...
Hmph, look at you. Wouldn't it have been nice to just stay put and let her fix you in the first place?
But... I was worried about Bathilde and Dushevnaya...
Who needs your worry? I am the one worried about you getting turned into scrap metal!
(Littara smiles as she watches upon her companions, all dirtied up and heading for their hideout; she wants to write letters again.)
Littara? Come on, don't fall behind!
Uh—Right!
(A convoy slowly drives into the center of the settlement, coming to a gradual halt amidst cheers and fanfare.)
(A vehicle door opens and a troop of theatrically-dressed people dismount, depositing huge crates on a patch of open ground. The girl at their head gives everyone present a breezy greeting.)
(Jiangyu finds herself pumping her fists as she sees the enthusiastic crowd outside.)
Wow, there's so many people here! Come take a look, Big Sis! The people over there are waving to us!
Yes, dear, it's time to get down now. Miss Aida is waiting for us to help her out.
Hehe, I can't help being worked up! We haven't seen such an excited crowd in a while; that's a popular troupe for you!
(As she watches Daiyan emerge from the hold with two full crates, Jiangyu races over.)
Aw, let me give you a hand, Big Sis! Faye, don't just stand there, help her out too!
Where are we putting these crates?
We'll just put them beside that billboard for now.
Huh? A billboard? Has the troupe set one up already?! Let me see...
(Jiangyu straightens up and looks at the heart of the open space.)
(There, a simple fence of wooden posts and rope outline a large circle where the billboard stands between the fence and the crates.)
(The billboard's message is written in huge, eye-catching letters—'The play "Daybreak's Oath" is now on tour!')
Hoho... Now that looks impressive! I'm actually getting a little excited now...
Big Sis, when we finish up backstage, can we watch it together?
We'll have to ask Zhaohui and the Commander about that.
After all, they're the whole reason Monsoon Squad could go on tour with the troupe.
Oh yeah...
(Jiangyu looks back inside the vehicle—)

(Three people are seated beside the driver's cab. One of them is Zhaohui, the leader of Monsoon Squad, another is the former Griffin Commander {} who now captains the Elmo, and the last one is the manager of the Talia Troupe.
(The three of them have serious expressions on their faces. Jiangyu has no idea what they might be discussing. She puts down the crate she's holding and stares in fascination.)
They look so serious... Big Sis, what do you think the Commander and Zhaohui are discussing?
It's probably about the show.
Still... I can't believe we managed to meet the Commander again and even go on a mission together.
Is this fate? After all, even when we were in that situation back then...
(The dilapidated shack's interior is covered in dust. It's less than 10 meters square and piled high with junk, stuffed full like a storage closet.)
(Daiyan is extremely careful, but as she tries to inch past a small mountain of debris, the guzheng on her back bumps part of it and triggers a miniature avalanche.)
Careful.
(Zhaohui moves with lightning speed and keeps the "avalanche" from spreading. Daiyan smiles at her in gratitude, but Jiangyu dejectedly dumps the drum stand she's holding to the ground.)
Can anyone even live in this crappy place? There isn't anywhere to put our instruments! How are we supposed to practice?!
At least there's space for four Dolls to charge while in standby mode.
Just paying for the damaged instruments alone cost 80% of our funds, so after considering our future travel plans, renting this place was the best option.
(Whimper) But I only knocked a couple of stands over, why did we have to pay so much?!
Ahhhhhh! I knew I shouldn't have been so impulsive back then... Faye, we need to hold ourselves back next time! That argument was way too costly!
W-What are you looking at me for! Okay, so I was sort of at fault, but I apologized for it already back then! You—
Jiangyu.
Okay, okay, dropping it now...
(Jiangyu pouts in annoyance, then goes around Faye and heads for a corner of the room.)
(After seeing Faye fidget in place for a bit, Zhaohui walks up to her.)
Faye, come look around the area with me. Let Daiyan and Jiangyu handle our luggage.
We're in a pauper's district and security here is bad, so it's best to be cautious.
(After leaving the shack, Zhaohui and Faye turn and enter a small alley.)
(The high walls surrounding the pauper's district block out what little sunlight there is, making the cramped alley even darker, while the pair's silence imbues the air with a sense of creepiness.)
(After turning another corner, Zhaohui slows down and breaks the silence.)
Faye, do you know why drums go "tum tum tum"?
Why do they do it?
That's because it's the same sound they make when they fall down. Sometimes, a drum doesn't make noise because it was hit, but because it fell.
...Hah?
...Was that not a good joke?
Not at all... Just say what you have to say, there's no need to try and lighten the mood.
And you don't need to force a smile either, I know you have trouble doing that.
Alright then.
Jiangyu wasn't actually blaming you for anything just now. She just had trouble keeping her emotions in check.

We're a team—in other words, if you're blaming yourself for making a mistake, then Daiyan and I are also a part of that mistake. If we were there, we could have kept more instruments from being damaged.
Ah—!
(A scream from the other end of the alley interrupts Faye's thoughts. Zhaohui and Faye exchange looks and break into a sprint.)
(They race to the source of the sound and see a dark shadow running off. A boy collapses to the ground in a miserable heap, beanie and all.)
(Zhaohui runs over and grabs the beanie while she helps the boy up.)
What happened?
(The boy grabs his beanie and gesticulates furiously in front of him.)
That guy took my bag! Help me, please!
(Before Zhaohui can speak, Faye is already rushing toward the direction where the dark shadow vanished.)
(Like a pouncing falcon, Faye catches up with the fleeing figure. Clearly not expecting pursuit to be so swift, the robber pulls out a knife from somewhere as he runs and swings it wildly at Faye.)
(However, she nimbly avoids its edge and kicks it away, before seizing his arm with a lightning-fast grab, flipping him head over heels with a flick of the wrist, and pinning him to the ground.)
Gwaaaaaaargh! Owowowow!
Tsk.
(Zhaohui ignores the robber's please for mercy and stalks forward, coldly snatching up the dropped sling bag on the ground and returning to the boy from before.)
Here. This is yours.
Ah... Ah! Thank you!
(Still numb from shock, the boy takes the bag in a daze.)
(Then, as though to comfort him, Zhaohui gently pats his shoulder.)
It's alright. Go rest for a bit. We've contacted the police. Someone will be here soon to take care of things.
Th-thank you!
(After clutching the bag and taking a few deep breaths, the boy finally manages to relax.)
(He stands up, dusts himself off, puts his cap back on his head and bows to Zhaohui and Faye.)
Um, thank you very much for your help just now!
(—Unlike his ragged clothes, the boy's voice is clear and pleasant.)
Think nothing of it. It was a piece of cake.
However, why did you run all the way here? Do you live nearby?
N-no, a-actually... I came here for something like cultural immersion.
Ah, I forgot to introduce myself! I'm Aida, part of the Talia Troupe.

We have a production that we're going to present on tour in the Yellow Zone, but I keep thinking that there's more room for improvement, so I came out here to do some, uh, cultural research and figure out what the audience might like.
See, this outfit of mine was patterned after the usual clothing of Yellow Zone residents. Looks pretty realistic, huh?
Hm... It does seem quite similar to the attire of Yellow Zone residents that I've seen before.
I know, right? Everyone in the troupe was saying that this outfit is perfect for the female lead as she travels through the Yellow Zone!
...Er, what? Hang on, the female lead?
Yup! Our play is a story of two girls who become companions as they adventure through various locales throughout the wor—
No, that's not what I mean—are you a girl?
(Aida scratches her beanie and blinks.)
(Then, she takes it off and reveals a head of soft, smooth hair in a pageboy cut before smiling at Zhaohui and Faye.)
I'm a born and bred girl! Looks like my immersive costuming was a great success!
Immersive?
Mhm. These clothes might look raggedy and all, but they're our stage costumes. Although I didn't expect to get robbed even though I looked so pitiful...
Ah yes, also...
(The girl who has "come out" about her true gender suddenly clutches her beanie and gives them a pleading look.)
Um, before the police arrive, could I impose on you to accompany me in my walk around the neighborhood?
I want to keep scouting the area and, uh, I feel safer with you around...
(Faye signals to Zhaohui that "I can watch the robber by myself" and Zhaohui then accompanies Aida into the cramped alleys once more.)

(Along the way, Aida gawks in all direction, occasionally taking out her comms terminal to quickly make notes. Her panic from being robbed just now seems to be slowly fading away as they proceed with her reconnaissance.
(As she watches Aida take notes with practiced ease, Zhaohui is compelled to ask a question.)
Do you usually go out to scout like this by yourself, Miss Aida?

Yup! In the past, I used to go with... er... with everyone in the troupe. It's just that the tour's about to begin and we need to prepare lots of stuff, so I decided to take care of the reconnaissance by myself, since it's relatively minor.
Even so, it wasn't wise to go walking around the pauper's district by yourself.

(Sigh) That's true, I did underestimate how bad security would be in the pauper's district. Things will surely be more dangerous after going to the Yellow Zone. There's no telling if the manager can arrange for reliable escorts...

I apologize if I'm being rude, but surely there must be many PMCs willing to accept escort contracts to the Yellow Zone, yet your group does not seem to have found any suitable candidates. Are you facing other difficulties?
(Aida sighs heavily and lowers her head in frustration. It seems Zhaohui has hit the nail on the head.)
There were... issues. It's a long story, but the short version is that the troupe doesn't trust PMCs.
Also, we haven't even found enough stage assistants yet, to say nothing of our security arrangements... I don't even know what we'll do if we can't find anyone by the end of the month...
(Sigh) After all, we're doing a charity tour in the contaminated zones, so our per-show revenue isn't going to be anything close to what we'd make by staying in the Green Zone...
(Aida sighs again as she keeps walking, but Zhaohui has ground to a halt.)
(Curious, Aida looks back and sees that Zhaohui's lip is curled up ever so slightly in a stiff curve.)
May I ask if your troupe would be interested in hiring a team of Dolls?
I might be able to recommend certain Dolls who possess stage experience and fighting ability.
Ehhh—?
(Inside the cramped shack, the four members of Monsoon Squad huddle around and stare hard at the communications terminal.)
(The girl on the screen has an apologetic look on her face.)

...I'm so sorry! The manager went through Monsoon Squad's documents and she acknowledges that you are skilled, but she's a little worried because your team isn't affiliated with anyone at the moment. There are concerns about how responsibility will be assigned...
Also, the manager contacted a bounty hunter team recently. Supposedly they're really experienced and came recommended by B.R.I.E.F.
...In any case, thank you for bringing Monsoon to their attention.
No problem! I'll keep trying to put in a good word for you with the manager and the bounty hunters.
That said, there's a limit to what I can do, so you'll need to come up with something else before the manager makes the final decision.
Thank you for informing us.
Okay! I'm off for practice, then. I'll let you know if there's any news!
(The transmission ends. The quarter seated around the console exchange looks.)
(Jiangyu grabs her head in frustration and wails.)
Uwaaaaaaaahhhhhh this is bullshit! We had a gig in the bag and it slipped out just like that!
We can't really say it was in the bag. After all, Miss Aida never promised that the troupe would hire us.
I thought being able to take on this contract would help ease our financial situation, but now...
Dammit! It's all the fault of those bounty hunters, they took our job!
Say, Big Sis, why don't we go have a chat with that manager? Monsoon Squad isn't exactly a bunch of lightweights either. All we have to do is put up a good show and the manager might say yes to us!
If we tried to force our way into the theater to put on a show, we'd probably end up being chased away by security before we got to see the manager.
Uuuurgh... Faye! Why are you still butting heads with me at a time like this?!
I'm simply stating the truth.
(Zhaohui ignores Jiangyu and Faye's bickering. Instead, she toys with the dagger she's holding in silence.)
(Then, she suddenly freezes up, as though she's thought of something, and clenches the dagger in her fist.)
Everyone, quiet, please.
Rather than try to directly persuade the manager, I have another idea.
(Faye and Zhaohui are taking cover behind the low walls on either side of the entrance to the theater.)
(The afternoon plaza is bereft of people. Faye carefully pokes her head out and glances at the end of the path several times.)
Will that bounty hunter team really pass by this way?
From what we know of their area of activity and the direction by which they entered the city, they'll have to pass by this way to reach the theater.
If we can't stop them, it'll all be up to Daiyan and Jiangyu outside the theater entrance.
I hope we can stop them. After all, "fighting over a contract outside the theater" would leave a bad impression on the manager.
...But we are going to end up fighting, right?
(Zhaohui ignores Faye's reply and focuses on the view beyond the walls while reviewing the bounty hunter's information again.)
(Our target's name is Kelly Norton, currently employed by the Lawrence Security Firm. Retired from the military to be a bounty hunter and has worked in the Yellow Zone for over five years.)
(There's no picture in the data, so we'll have to observe potential targets and pick out the most likely candidates from among the passers-by.)
(Now, what would a highly-experienced bounty hunter with military experience look like?
(After 25 minutes, a set of figures at the end of the road draw Zhaohui's attention.)
Zhaohui, over there—
(Three people are carefully making their way forward. The one in the lead wears a large coat and looks a little fat, followed by two girls.)
(Zhaohui turns up the magnification on her visual modules and under their elaborate makeup, she can make out the tell-tale lustre of synthetic skin.)
The two in the back are Dolls!
After them.
(Disguised as ordinary pedestrians, Zhaohui and Faye slip out from behind the walls, but right at that moment, the bounty hunter makes a turn and vanishes around the corner!
They've spotted us! Careful!
Tsk! They're really cautious!
(Before Faye can finish, a bullet hits the ground at their feet.)
(The two Doll girls race over, firing at Zhaohui and Faye.)
Fall back!
(Zhaohui drags Faye behind a nearby wall and readies her gun, pointing it at the girls firing at them.)
Now what?
Cut off the head and the body will die. We'll split up; you go for that bounty hunter; I'll take care of this.
(With that, Zhaohui sticks her head out and fires at the girls again.)
(Faye nods and takes advantage of the firefight to slip out by the other path behind the wall.)
(Although Zhaohui thought she would be able to take control of the situation quickly enough, several minutes have passed but the situation remains uncertain—the opposition is surprisingly skilled.)

(From behind the wall where she's hiding, Zhaohui's neural cloud kicks into high gear—she's not facing ordinary civilians Dolls. Rather, they are skilled and experienced Tactical Dolls; it's very likely that they're at least as good as her!)
(There's no point keeping this stalemate going. Perhaps she should end the fight in another way.)
(After making up her mind, Zhaohui stops shooting. Just as she's about to step out from behind the wall, she hears a scream from nearby.)
Uwaaaaahhh—
That voice... is it Faye?
(Heedless to the enemy's attacks, Zhaohui vaults over the low wall and sprints toward the source of the scream.)
(In the narrow alley, she says Faye facing off against the bounty hunter in a large trench coat.)

(She has no idea what's going on, but Faye has the bounty hunter's sleeve in her hand while the bounty hunter's gun is raised. On the ground around them are many articles of clothing, including a hat, a wig... even a small pillow?)
Faye!
(Zhaohui races over to Faye's side and points her gun at the bounty hunter.)
(However, Faye grabs the barrel of Zhaohui's gun and frantically pulls it up and out of the way.)
D-Don't shoot! T-They're a friendly!
A friendly?
(Zhaohui peers at this clearly-disguised bounty hunter. While said disguise has been pierced, they seem to be in good spirits and smiling evenly.)
(There's no way she could forget anyone who could be so calm with a gun pointed at them. Could it be...)
(Zhaohui glances at her friend beside her with doubting eyes. A suspicious red blush is coloring her cheeks.)
...Faye?
C-Commander!
(After stopping both sides from continuing the fight, I briefly explained the circumstances of the unexpected encounter with Zhaohui and Faye.)
...So you came here to investigate Varjager activity in this area?

Yup. The Elmo received a mission recently and we're checking out the traces left by the Varjager gang. According to B.R.I.E.F, they've committed numerous acts of arson, looting, and murder. A broker I know also had a shipment seized by them.

However, the mission hasn't been going too well. The Varjager are too familiar with the terrain and we haven't been able to find their real base. Going after them openly as bounty hunters is only going to alert them even more.
No wonder you wanted to join the escort party.
Yup. Fortunately our partner recommended a protection mission for a theatrical troupe about to take a tour of the contaminated zones, which helps in keeping our identity under wraps.
Also, a troupe from the Green Zone would be a "big catch" in their eyes, which would make it easier to draw them out.
But surely you didn't have to...
(Zhaohui hesitates as she glances at the "little pillow" on the ground.)
Oh, I had to make some preparations before entering this place. After all, I didn't want to attract attention.)
(After putting the various elements of my disguise back on, I put my gun away and chuckle amiably.)
Still, what happened to you guys? Zhaohui and CZ75—hm, do you still go by that name?
What are you guys doing together? More importantly, why were you trying to waylay me?
Um, I, I'm called Faye now. Daiyan helped me come up with it! I, er, Zhaohui, Daiyan, Jiangyu, and I are now a band and Doll squad, AKA the Monsoon Squad. Zhaohui's our leader!
Er, um, actually, we used to wander around. I truly didn't expect that we'd run into you, Commander. I'm, I'm really happy! Truly I am!
(Faye seems so overcome with emotion that she can only stutter out short sentence fragments.)
(What's going on with her? I remember back in Griffin she was a little quick-tempered, but she wasn't like this.)
(Eh, I'll just ask her later when the chance comes up.)
...Allow me to explain the situation to you, Commander.
Due to certain accidents, the four of us found ourselves stranded here and we happened to hear about the Talia Troupe's request.

While we from Monsoon Squad felt that we were the best choice for the job, we hadn't heard from the theater manager in a long while and they were prepared to meet with you. Thus, we had no choice but to carry out our plan—to try and convince the competition to allow us to help complete the assignment.
I see. Well, you were all experienced performers to begin with. There's really no better choice for joining the troupe and part-timing as security staff.
Commander, does, does that mean you approve?!
I have no reason to refuse you so long as you don't interfere with the investigation. Plus, with your help, Groza and Vepley can stand by on the Elmo.
However, it seems your leader isn't finished yet.
(I glance to the side, at Zhaohui—)
(Compared to Faye, who's so shaken up that she's having a hard time making sense, Zhaohui retains a cool, calm demeanor.)
My concern is merely for the safety of the troupe. If the Varjagers knew someone was hiding among the troupe to investigate them—

They won't. This is a secret investigation; it is fundamentally a form of remote observation. For the duration of this mission, I will not attempt to actively make contact with the Varjagers or enter their camps.
Are you satisfied with that answer, Miss Zhaohui?
Considering I'm old friends with Monsoon Squad, surely you won't out me for having ulterior motives when we meet with the troupe manager later, right?
(I smile and extend a hand to Zhaohui in as friendly a way as I can manage.)
(Zhaohui is briefly silent and then she extends her own hand, which is covered in scars, to return the handshake.)
(That's odd, is Zhaohui really such a miser? The repair bills for this level of synthskin damage shouldn't be that high.)
I look forward to working with you, Commander. However...
Hm? What's wrong?
(Zhaohui glances behind me, the hand that's holding mine suddenly freezes.)
(I hear the pitter-patter of footsteps approaching me from behind, followed by a joyful cry.)
Commander—!
(I turn to see a gust of crimson wind racing toward me and leaping into my arms.)
(The massive impact knocks me off balance and I end up falling backward.)
Aahhh...!
Look out!
(The moment I fall back, a hand reaches out and grabs my shoulder in the nick of time.)
(At the same time, the girl who just pounced me barely manages to break her forward momentum and assists Zhaohui in holding me steady.)
Ack! I'm sorry, Commander! I, I didn't mean to do that!
...Urgh... It's okay...

(After finally getting back on my feet, I size up the girl in front of me—her long twintails sway energetically behind her and she has the same brilliant smile on her face as she did in the past. Just seeing her lifts my spirits.)
(I can't resist the urge to reach out and ruffle her fluffy hair.)
It's been several years, but you're as lively as ever, Jiangyu. Looks like we almost "ran into each other" again.
Ahem! I just missed you a lot, that's all!
We just got Zhaohui's message, so Big Sis and I immediately beat feet over here. Along the way I was thinking about what I'd say to you, but the moment I saw you I just plain forgot about it!
Oh yeah, I came here with Big Sis, so where is she—
(Jiangyu looks around and finds Daiyan already standing off to the side.)
(She is as demure and dignified as ever. Daiyan looks at me and Jiangyu, a quiet smile on her face.)
Huh? Big Sis, why are you just standing there? Normally you'd be going on and on about the Commander this and the Commander that so why are you owwwwww hey!
(After lightly bapping Jiangyu on the head, Daiyan's cheeks slowly flush a light red.)
(She walks up to me and nods, her eyes filled with a deep mirth.)
Finally, we meet again, Commander.
Mm.
(As her recollection comes to an end, the corner of Daiyan's mouth turns up in an unconscious smile as she gazes at the people speaking in the distance.)
I truly did not expect to meet with the Commander again in this fashion.
Yeah, we're even registered as affiliated with the Elmo! While it was because the theater manager asked the Commander to be our "guarantor"... It still counts as "reuniting" with them!
Well, this is only a temporary arrangement and we don't know if it will fall under the limitations of the "agreement". If this ends up causing problems for the Commander...
Aw, are you still going on about that agreement, Big Sis? The Commander already said nothing's going to happen in the short term!
Oho... Or perhaps you're thinking of what you're going to do after this contract is over, hmmm?
(Daiyan's answer is interrupted by a voice from behind.)
Daiyan, Jiangyu, are you free now?
You're done talking with the manager at last!
The Commander still has a few more things to discuss. However, Monsoon Squad's pre-show duties have already been confirmed.
In keeping with our contract, we will assist the troupe in setting up and tearing down the props and costume management, as well as taking charge of security duties for the cast and crew.
I've finished organizing the detailed task assignments. I'll sync them to you now.
(After gathering everyone, Zhaohui's expression turns serious.)
Daiyan, you will manage the instrument and the sound equipment. Jiangyu, you're in charge of moving props. Faye, you'll set up and tear down the stage.
Understood.
Acknowledged.
Woohoo!
As for me, I will be our liaison with the troupe and the Commander. I'll also step in to help you if you happen to need it.
Finally, everyone in the squad will be responsible for protection duties for the cast. The Yellow Zone is a complex place, so please stay alert at all times.
(After our discussion with the manager, Zhaohui has already assigned various duties to the members of her squad.)
(As I watch everyone head off to do their own thing, I smile and approach Zhaohui.)
You handled that pretty well.
Looks like this "Commander" can slack off a little with you around.
(Zhaohui turns around upon hearing my voice.)
That was simply my duty as squad leader. Is something the matter, Commander?
This settlement seems like it's quite full of life. Want to go take a walk around it with me?
Alright.
(After leaving the under-construction theater campsite, Zhaohui and I wander at random through the settlement.)

The streets are covered in gravel, the houses are run-down, the residents are dirt-poor... In the Yellow Zone, the only thing that sets this settlement apart from the others is that it's fairly large, which is why the troupe chose to set up camp here.)
(However, the bigger a settlement, the more likely it is to attract Varjagers that will rob it.)

(That's what I'm thinking as I gaze outside the settlement—piles of stones and drifts of sand cover the land as far as the eye can see. I'll definitely need to leave the settlement if I want to find any trace of the Varjagers nearby.)
(Just as I'm about to head outside the settlement to continue my observations, Zhaohui stops walking.)
...Commander.
Hm?
May I know why you invited us to join your operation? This is a secret investigation, after all, and there is a chance the secret might be leaked.
Well, things in the Yellow Zone are complicated and I'm here empty-handed. Having a certain squad leader to help me out puts me at ease.
Given what I know of you, you're perfectly capable of taking out quite a few Varjagers by yourself even without a Doll squad backing you up, Commander.
Mhm, which is why that's only one of the reasons I'm doing this.
The other reason is you, Zhaohui.
To date, we've only met twice and we haven't had any falling-outs. But this time, your attitude was completely different from how it was back in CHE-02.
We bounty hunters have very keen noses, so feel free to chat with me about any thought you might have.
(Zhaohui remains silent, her face impassive.)

(According to Jiangyu, this is because her facial modules were damaged during a mission and as a result she can't change her expressions too well. At times, such a "blank face" might end up being an excellent disguise.)
(I look directly at Zhaohui, waiting for her reply in silence. Just then, an argument suddenly breaks out in a nearby residence.
...It's not like that, please listen to me...
Listen? Listen to how you... if it wasn't for you... Feris wouldn't have...
No, Feris... please listen to me...
(For some reason, tha pleading woman's voice seems kind of familiar.)
(Zhaohui's eyes meet mine. We nod, then both take cover nearby.)
Enough of that, stop pretending to be a good person! From the start... it was all for yourself...
No, I... I really didn't...
Hah... know that this is the real you? It's all your...
Tsk, stop pretending already... Get—Get lost already!
(The argument doesn't last long. Soon, the rough voices fade into the distance, leaving only a quiet sobbing behind.)
(It lasts for a while before it too begins to die down. After that, a familiar figure steps out from behind the wall—it is Aida, lead actress of the Talia Troupe.)
(Aida is wiping her eyes as she walks. Her clothes are stained with dust and sand, probably because of the argument just now, and her hair is a little messed up.)
(Zhaohui frowns and makes to stand up, but I put a hand on her shoulder and shake my head.)
Let's not be hasty. It might be a private matter for Aida.
(Zhaohui doesn't answer, but she stops trying to get up. Only when Aida is long gone do I let go and allow Zhaohui to rise.)
(As I expected, Zhaohui doesn't attempt to go after Aida. Instead, she turns her chilly gaze on me.)
...Why did you stop me just now, Commander?
If this is a personal matter for Aida, just barging in and questioning her about it would put her in an awkward position.
The troupe is about to put on a show. It would be best to figure out the whole situation and then ask Aida about it rather than go in right now and risk creating unintended consequences.
That argument just now was quite intense. If he keeps harassing Aida, it might end up affecting the show.
We don't know exactly what happened just now. Like I said before, barging in rashly might only end up making things worse.
In the contaminated zones, minding your own business isn't always a bad thing.
(Zhaohui frowns.)
I see, so this is just "minding your own business" to you...
(Zhaohui's face doesn't change, but I can hear a hint of disappointment in her voice.)
(Still, this is the most sensible choice for the time being.)
That said, I will not remain silent if the aftereffects of this incident could affect the rest of the performance.
In any case, I will investigate the surrounding area. I can do that by myself, so you can return to the campground first, Commander.
(Zhaohui seems very determined about this. I sigh, then turn to leave.)
(I'll discuss this with her again once she calms down.)
(On my way back to the troupe's campground, I see that the foundations for the stage are taking shape.)

(A group of people are surrounding the empty space around the stage and Aida seems to be among them. I head over and lightly pat Jiangyu's shoulder; the latter is waiting eagerly around the periphery of the area.)
And what are you doing?
Oh hey, you're here too, Commander! Miss Aida's doing a rehearsal with everyone, apparently they just revised the script and they're going through the changes!
(I look at the heart of the group. While it's just a scene rehearsal, Aida seems utterly invested in her performance. There's no way to tell she had been crying just a while ago.)
(Shortly afterwards, Zhaohui enters the campground.)
(Upon seeing Aida's performance, she wrinkles her eyebrows and then steps aside to watch in silence.)
(The rehearsal soon ends and the surrounding crowd applauds with gusto.)
Good! I like this change! It feels more moving than the previous version!
Heh, I think this tour is going to be a big hit!
Alright, I'm happy to see how much faith everyone has in the tour. Still, we need to listen to the audience too!
(Aida walks through the crowd and smiles as she waves to me and Zhaohui.)
Hey guys! You saw the rehearsal just now, right? What do you think?
Hm... It looked very good to me.
As for the technical details... Zhaohui's got quite a bit of stage experience. Maybe she could share her wisdom?
(I smile and look over at Zhaohui. She thinks for a moment, then answers in earnest.)
I think your performance was very professional.

While I came late and only saw part of it, the girl Sarah that you were playing was animated, lively, and very likable. The last part where she made a pledge to her friend was also very moving. It would be most impressive even in the Green Zones.
However, some of the lines don't link up too well, so more rehearsal on that front is needed.
Wow, Zhaohui thought really highly of you! Although the end seemed kind of harsh. In any case, I think you did a great job, Miss Aida!
(After being praised by the two of them, Aida scratches her head in embarrassment.)
Eh, well, it's only to be expected, right? After all, the character was inspired by Aida!
Huh? So there was an inspiration for her?
Um, it's nothing. Oh yes, I need to go over my costume with the director. If there's nothing else, everyone should go take a break!
Miss Aida...?
Hm? Is something the matter, Miss Zhaohui?
(After seeing Zhaohui's hesitation, I interrupt the conversation.)
Zhaohui, could I speak to you for a minute? It's about the campsite's security.
...You're right.
Heh, thanks for all your hard work! I'll leave you to it, then~ Need to go find the director.
(Aida leaves and Jiangyu heads back to the stage to help.)
(Zhaohui's face is as impassive as ever. I sigh internally, then step forward.)
So, what did you find outside the campground.
Thanks to your "interference", I did not find anyone suspicious, Commander.
Then since you didn't find anything, you shouldn't question Aida thoughtlessly.
...Do you mean to say that you feel that such questioning will affect your mission of investigating the Varjagers?

Frankly speaking, this investigation mission takes priority over the theater assignment. Currently, Aida's matter does not concern the troupe, and our contract does not cover interfering with the private lives of the actors. Thus, I do not wish to do unnecessary things.
In the Yellow Zone, supplies are not cheap. I don't know how Monsoon Squad operates, but for a bounty hunter, "minding your own business" is a crucial part of life.
(Zhaohui falls silent for a moment. It seems she was not expecting this full disclosure about my stance from me.)
(She frowns a little, but in the end, she calmly returns my gaze.)
Since you have decided to prioritize your investigation, then I have a request of my own—
I hope that you will not affect the troupe's performance for the sake of the mission.
Naturally. I know my limits.
I'll tell you if I find anything during my investigations.
(After camping in the settlement for two days, the stage is finally built. Tonight, the troupe will be conducting their first internal test run.)
(After the music stops, thunderous applause erupts from the audience seats. On the stage, the actors take their bows one after the other, and the director excitedly waves to the audience.)
I declare that this test run of "Daybreak's Oath" is a great success! Well done, everyone!
(Following the director's announcement, the actors on stage come together in a group hug. As the female lead, Aida is naturally in their middle.)
Aida, you were great!
I didn't think the ending would be so touching after the changes were made... (sniffle)

Thank you, thank you, everyone! It wasn't just my efforts that made this test performance a success. Both the changes to the script and the choreography were all thanks to everyone's hard work! I am truly glad to have your support!
(Aida bows deeply in the center of the group. The director walks over and pats her on the shoulder.)
Oh, you're too humble, Aida. Everyone knows just what you did to make this tour a success.
If Feris' parents could have been here, I'm sure they'd be able to understand your feelings.
...I sent the invitations out long ago, but... I guess they won't be coming... otherwise they wouldn't have...
(Aida quietly sighs and drops the subject. She quickly recovers from her dejection and pulls Jiangyu and Faye up with a smile.)
Oh yes! Director, I've been talking with Monsoon Squad and learned a lot of interesting things from them!
Jiangyu and Faye, for example—they both know martial arts and they look super cool when they're doing it! I was thinking that maybe we could incorporate some martial arts into our next production!
Wow, really?
Yup, I remember you once showed me a super cool flying kick! It would look great in a fight scene! Also...
(Aida begins dragging Jiangyu around the stage to illustrate, but then a dark shadow suddenly falls from the rafters.)
Look out!

(Just as Faye spirits Aida away, a glass bottle full of paint smashes down onto the place where Aida had been. The paint splashes everywhere as the glass breaks, leaving a lurid blossom of color on the ground.)
(Before Aida can react, a second and third bottle fly toward the campsite, along with a shower of rocks, leaving oily splatters all over the stage.)
S-someone's causing trouble!
Daiyan, protect the cast and Commander! Jiangyu, Faye, with me!
(Zhaohui has already leapt out of the campsite before she finishes speaking and rushes toward a nearby low wall.)
(With lightning speed, Zhaohui subdues a suspicious man hiding behind the wall without giving him any time to respond.)
(Elsewhere, Faye and Jiangyu have also nabbed suspicious men of their own.)
(The three of them drag the men to the center of the campsite. Despite being pinned down, they're still struggling and cursing.)
Who the fuck are you?! Let me go!
Yeah, you're just a shitty playgroup, what right do you have to grab me? Get it through your thick skulls! Stop going around doing shows and fuck off now before you fuck up more people's families!
You're shameless and harbor criminals! That lead actress Aida or whatever is a murderer! That makes the rest of her people accomplices too!
Shut up.
(Zhaohui knocks the ranting man out with a karate chop.)

(After seeing how his friend was KOed, the other two men shrink away in terror. However, when he sees how Aida is not trying to stop this and in fact lowers her head in dejection, he starts cursing again.)
(As the verbal abuse grows more and more intense, Zhaohui scowls and takes out her knife before pressing it to the man's neck with a cold look in her eyes.)
H-hey, let's talk this out! No need to get serious!
Alright, then talk. Why are you attacking the troupe.
W-We were hired! Our client only gave us money and told us to make trouble and mess up the show!
And what's all this about a "murderer"?
I, I don't know either, the client just told us to say that! Ah! Yes! They've got a grudge with your leading lady! He said she—
(Before he can finish, Zhaohui karate chops him as well.)

(She glances to Jiangyu and Faye, indicating that they should drag the two unconscious men away. Then, she looks at me, standing aside in the distance. I instantly get Zhaohui's meaning and enter the crowd before giving the director a meaningful look.)
Miss Aida looks like she needs some rest. We'll end our show here tonight. Everyone should turn in early. We'll clean up the rest.
(After seeing the director nod, the rest of the cast and crew obligingly disperse. Soon, the only people left in the once-bustling campsite are the director, Aida, and the Dolls.)
(Zhaohui helps Aida take a seat and then squeezes her hand.)
Aida, can you tell us what happened before this?
(Aida's head is still lowered, remaining gloomy and silent.)
(After seeing the state Aida is in, the director shakes her head and sighs.)
...Maybe I should tell you.
If I'm not wrong, my guess is that the clients who hired those people to attack the theater were the parents of Aida's former friend Feris.
Former friend, you say?
Yes. Feris was a good friend of Aida's and an outstanding young actress.
The truth is, she was supposed to be the female lead for "Daybreak's Oath".
Back then, Aida and Feris joined the auditions for the part and they made it through all of them. Feris was the female lead and Aida was the second female lead.
...Feris and I both loved to act.
I still remember the day we met each other...
(Aida, who has been silent all this time, slowly lifts her head.)
(She looks at the stage, but it seems more like she's gazing into the depths of her past.)
That day, I joined an impromptu drama competition... I was a rookie back then and nobody paid me any attention.
But by the time the competition ended, a girl ran over all of a sudden and praised me for doing a good job. She even pointed out all the little details in my act!
We ended up talking for a long time... She told me her name was Feris and that she wanted to become a pro actor, just like me.
(Aida smiles as she recalls her past with Feris.)
After that, we became good friends.
At that time, all we had were bit parts, but no matter what roles or scripts we were given, we would always rehearse them together so we could critique and further refine our act.

Over time, we slowly became able to play supporting roles. And then... We both made it through the auditions for "Daybreak's Oath" and began practicing in the Yellow Zone together, doing undercover recon together, going on tour together...
Those days were really happy... But...
(Aida stops speaking, as though she's thought of something, and her smile turns bitter.)
Two years ago, when Feris and I were out in the contaminated zones together, we were attacked by the Varjagers... the PMC assigned to protect us were taken out by the Varjagers... and Feris too...
I passed out back then and was mistaken for dead... But a passing bounty hunter saved me...
Everyone in the troupe was heartbroken over Feris. We had lost a great actress and a good friend...

But the troupe couldn't stop performing just because of that. The show must go on, you know? We needed a replacement for the female lead, and after considering that Aida had always performed opposite Feris, I made Aida our lead. Since things turned out quite well, I decided to permanently leave her in that role.
But I didn't expect that my decision would lead to a misunderstanding by Feris' parents... They thought that Aida had gotten Feris killed in order to become the lead actress.
Did you not try to contact Feris' parents?
We tried many times, but Feris' parents thought the troupe were accomplices with Aida and kept refusing to talk to us.
Aida also tried looking for those Varjagers, but they've never been easy to find and the situation was very chaotic back then. After so much time passed, we couldn't find any evidence at all.
And that's how the misunderstanding lasted all the way until now.
Yes... The truth is, Aida's been working hard to try and erase that misunderstanding.
During this tour, Aida convinced me to change the script and its ending as a memorial to Feris.

Frankly speaking, we weren't too happy about the change at first. But Aida went all over to gather inspiration and built up experience as a scriptwriter before consulting me about it many times... And in the end, the altered script began to take shape.
After we nailed the script down, we began preparing for our tour. Right after we finalized the show schedule, Aida sent an invitation to Feris' parents.
And you know how that went.
(Everyone present goes silent as they look at the glass shards and red paint scattered everywhere.)
Aida...
Is there anything we can do to help?
Stay alert and protect future shows.
That's right. Since they've rejected Aida's goodwill, they definitely won't give up easily.
(Aida smiles bitterly and bows to everyone again.)
I'm sorry for causing you trouble.
Ensuring the show takes place successfully is part of our contract. You don't have to blame yourself for this, Miss Aida.
(Zhaohui helps Aida up and Jiangyu comes over to help support her by the shoulders.)
Yup, yup! Nothing's going to happen to the troupe with us around!
I'll be counting on you all in the future, then. It's getting late and I also need to take care of troupe business. Oh yes, about those two attackers—
Leave them to us.
Ah, Miss Zhaohui, could you go easy on them? After all... it was... it was because of me that...
Relax, we know our limits.
(Several minutes later, the two hired attackers receive a stern talking-to from Jiangyu and slink off, vanishing into the night.)
(As I watch them fade away, I can't help but ponder the situation.)
...So they were hired, then...
(Several days later, inside the troupe campsite.)
(Despite the little upset during the test show, the attack we feared never came again and the troupe enjoyed a rare few days of peace.)
(After morning rehearsals for the troupe end, I seek out Zhaohui.)
(As she listens to my intentions for coming here, she puts down the prop she is holding and looks at me in puzzlement.)
...So you intend to investigate the Varjagers outside the camp? Right now?
Yes, right now. You can tell something's wrong too, right?
(I turn to look outside the campsite—)
(While things seem peaceful enough in the campsite, the settlement outside is nowhere as warm and welcoming as it was when we first came. In fact, it feels somewhat deserted.)
...Our audience is gone.
That's right. The troupe advertised this show heavily, so there ought to be more people here.
However, it seems the Varjager activity nearby has forced people who were planning to watch the play to abandon their plans.
Commander, do you think it's connected to the attack from that day?
I can't be sure, but there's been too much Varjager activity recently.
I don't think it's because I revealed myself, and I don't think anyone would actually pay to invite those starving wolves here.
Therefore, I need to head out there by myself to figure out what's going on, and for that I will need the help of Monsoon Squad.
Understood. I can accompany you, Commander.
Oooh, me too, me too! I haven't gone out investigating with you in a long time, Commander!
(Jiangyu has appeared from seemingly nowhere and inserted herself between Zhaohui and me, followed closely by Daiyan and Faye who turn up in front of me.)
Why didn't you just tell us you needed the help, Commander?
Yeah! Zhaohui would have monopolized the scouting mission with the Commander if I hadn't secretly followed behind!
(As I see the looks of anticipation in their eyes, I can't help but chuckle, but eventually I "harden my heart" and shake my head.)
We can't all go now, can we? The manager's going to have a headache if the troupe has issues and she can't get a hold of us.
Zhaohui and Jiangyu will follow me. Daiyan and Faye will stay behind and protect the campsite.
Woohoo!
Understood. Faye and I will mind the campsite, but please be careful, Commander.
(As our jeep drives deeper into the wilderness, there is still no trace of the Varjagers.)
(Jiangyu stares out of the back seat window for a long time, but she can't find anything. Bored, she begins tapping out a rhythm on the back seat of the vehicle.)
Jiangyu, mind your volume.
Okay, okay... Fine, I'll stop now!
(After being reminded by Zhaohui, Jiangyu sticks her tongue out and grumbles under her breath.)
These Varjagers are such a pain! There's no sign of them anywhere, it's just a waste of your time, Commander!
Ahhh, we finally got to see the Commander after so long and we have to spend all this time together on those Varjagers! It makes me so mad!
(After complaining, Jiangyu drapes herself over the back of my seat.)
Still, we got to meet with you again thanks to this assignment...

I've been really happy these past few days. In fact, I can't help but wonder how nice it would be if the troupe could just keep performing. Then Big Sis, Faye and I could just ignore that crappy agreement and stay with you forever. Right, Commander?
(So it's the agreement, then?)
(Actually, Kalin sent me a secret transmission about a month ago, when I was assisting 404, regarding new changes in the agreement...)

(I was planning to maintain the status quo for a while longer to avoid the Elmo becoming a target once again, but after seeing the delight on Jiangyu's face and thinking about the pendant that Daiyan cherished so dearly, I find it hard to keep quiet.)
(Perhaps I can't answer for the world, but at the very least, I can give them an answer.)
Commander?
...Actually, you can do that right now. You don't have to worry about that agreement any more.
Ehhh...?
(Jiangyu's jaw drops and her eyes go wide.)
(I sigh and then smile as gently as I can.)
Just last month, the Non-Military Forces Administration secretly lifted part of the agreement's restrictions for various reasons.

That said, it was done in secret, so I didn't tell everyone because I didn't want to alarm certain people. Also, I'm just a penniless bounty hunter right now, so all I can do is wander the land doing jobs to make ends meet. It's a hard life.
I don't care if you're wandering or not! I'm happy as long as I'm with you, Commander! It won't ever be a hardship for me!
I'm sure Big Sis and Faye feel the same way too! Oh yeah, we'll go back and tell them the good news! I'm sure they'll be really happy if they knew they could follow you again!
Really now?
(I chuckle, then turn to look at Zhaohui. However, I realize that she's staring intently through the windshield, her face grim.)
Commander, Varjagers sighted ahead.
(Thanks to Zhaohui and Jiangyu's combined attack, the ambushing Varjagers are soon driven off.)
(We hunt them down, but don't see any other Varjagers along the way.)
...What's going on?
(In the past, exterminating Varjagers would not be a difficult task.)
(However, they seem to have become more cunning over the past six months. The Elmo has tried to wipe them out several times, but we've never been able to finish the job.)
(A vague feeling that there is something wrong about all this churns in my mind.)
(It's almost as though someone is directing these crude bandits from the shadows. Unfortunately, I have no clues or proof about them at the moment...)
Commander, we're here!
(The vehicle lurches forward, jarring me from my contemplation and I realize that we're back at the campsite.)

(Jiangyu eagerly dismounts and runs up to the nearby Daiyan and Faye. The flurry of wild gesticulation that follows tells me, even without hearing her words, that she's informing them about the agreement.)
(Sure enough, Daiyan and Faye run up to me a moment later.)
Commander, is what Jiangyu said really true? Is the agreement annulled?
(I nod.)
Strictly speaking, the terms have been loosened.
So if you don't mind following me on my wanderings, you can come back to the Elmo with me after this contract is finished.
That's great! I... I've been looking forward to the day when I could go back to the Elmo... to the day when I could return to your side.
(Daiyan strokes the pendant on her wrist.)
I (cough) me too! I'll follow you anywhere, Commander! Doesn't matter where you go, Monsoon Squad was always about travelling after all.
Alright... Since you're willing, I have no reason to refuse you.
However, it seems your leader still hasn't chimed in yet.
(I look toward Zhaohui. She's been keeping her distance ever since she got down from the vehicle. Jiangyu and the others all look expectantly toward her, expecting Zhaohui to respond with a smile.)
(However, Zhaohui simply toys with the knife in her hand, her expression as cool and even as ever.)
So you want me to join the Elmo... I will need to consider it. But I will not stop you.
Hah? What's there to consider? The Commander's super reliable, you know? You don't need to overthink this, Zhaohui!
You know, I've always been waiting for this to happen...
(The air turns chilly. Daiyan steps forward and carefully ventures a question.)
Zhaohui... is there some reason that makes you reluctant to join us?
(Zhaohui doesn't answer. She simply continues toying with the handle of her dagger.)
(Upon seeing Zhaohui's reaction, I sigh inside—I probably won't be able to get the answer out of her today.)
(After patting the others on the shoulder, I chuckle quietly.)
Well, if she needs to think about it, then we don't have to press her for an answer today.
The troupe will be performing for a while. You can always decide once the contract is done.
(The weeklong schedule of shows is slowly winding down. During this time, the attacks we feared did not happen, and the troupe's performance has received glowing reviews.)

(On the night before the final performance, the troupe's campsite is brightly lit and the members of the troupe are gathered with Monsoon Squad in the heart of the campsite, nervously preparing for their last show.)
When daybreak comes, I will go with... go with...
Aida, mind your footing.
Ah, s-sorry about that! Let's do it over!
When daybreak comes, I shall go with the wind, onward to a kingdom on the faraway clouds.
Aida, your delivery just now was too stiff.
...I'm sorry, I...
(After the second reminder, Aida stumbles a little as she gets to her feet.)
(Even the most clueless actor would be able to tell that right now, she is not in the right state of mind for a rehearsal.)
(The director sighs and pats Aida on her shoulder.)
Relax. If you're not feeling well, then go rest up a little. We'll go over the other portions first.
...Thank you.
