(Aida nods to the director in gratitude and then slinks away from the stage.)
(Zhaohui rises from her seat in the audience and silently follows her.)
Miss Aida.
When humans are bothered by something, do they feel better when they talk to holes in trees?
So if there's something bothering you, why not try telling me about it?
If nothing else, my color scheme matches up with a tree hole. I figure I ought to be able to provide 70% of the functionality of one.
(Aida freezes up, then carefully looks Zhaohui up and down before bursting into laughter.)
Miss Zhaohui, is this how you always comfort your friends?
Not always. But right now, it seems to be working.
Thank you, I do feel a little better now.
(Upon seeing that the sadness in Aida's eyes has abated a little, Zhaohui walks over to Aida's side.)
Are you feeling anxious about tomorrow's show?
Yes. I believe Feris' mother and father won't give up that easily. I...
Miss Aida, I don't know what will happen tomorrow, but as an actor, your sole duty is to deliver your performance.
Ensuring that the show is safe falls to us in Monsoon Squad.
Got it. Thank you, Miss Zhaohui!
I'm sorry for subjecting you to that terrible performance just now. No matter what happens tomorrow, I'll perk myself up and properly prepare for it.
(Aida smiles and nods to Zhaohui, then turns to head back to the stage.)
(After watching how there's a spring in her step now, Zhaohui returns to the audience seats.)
(After the rehearsal, in a corner of the camp.)
(Having confirmed that her various tasks and preparations are complete, Zhaohui is about to head back to rest when her shoulder suddenly sinks.)
Hehe, ambush successful! Big Sis, Faye, come quick!
(Having managed to grab Zhaohui's shoulder, Jiangyu excitedly waves the others over. Soon, Daiyan and Faye have arrived, flanking Zhaohui.)
(Faced with their "ambush", Zhaohui raises her hands in exasperation.)
...I don't recall a pre-show celebration on the cards?
No, it's not really a celebration, we just have a few questions for you.
(Faye rubs her head and her expression turns serious.)
That is to say... What do you think of the Commander's offer to join the Elmo?
Yeah, yeah! What do you think of the Commander? You've been with them for so long already! Surely it's about time to decide, right?
The last show is tomorrow... Zhaohui, no matter what you decide, won't you have a good conversation with us before making your final decision?
I'm sorry. I was planning to decide after discussing it with the Commander.
I didn't think that I would cause such a bother for everyone.
Aw, who says you're bothering us? Zhaohui, you're always so smooth most of the time, why are you all hesitant now?
We've known each other for so long, so you can just tell us if you've got anything on your mind!
Mhm. Zhaohui, you can tell us to our faces if you have any doubts or questions about joining the Elmo.
I mean, Monsoon's been through so much together over the past few years, and we've faced it all together, right?
Yeah! In the past, you were always the one to come up with a plan when we ran into trouble. Now you've got trouble, so you should tell us about it. We're a team, after all!
...Thank you. I'll be frank, then.
It is true; I have some reservations about joining the Elmo. However, they are not related to the Elmo or Monsoon, but rather, my background.
(Zhaohui looks down at the scars on her hand.)
(A moment later, she looks up at Daiyan.)
I want my choice to be meaningful, so... I'm sorry, but I can't give an answer right now.
Daiyan steps forward and gently grasps Zhaohui's hand.
It's alright, Zhaohui. We didn't find you tonight to ask you to do anything.
We just wanted to tell you that... You have always been a great leader for all these years.
Yeah! You might have it out for me, but you're actually pretty trustworthy as a squad leader!
Monsoon might not even be here if it wasn't for your ideas!
Yes, I agree. I would not follow orders from just anyone.
So we truly hope that we can continue travelling with you.
...I hope so too.
And I will also seriously consider the matter of our future.
(—Bang! Bangbang!)
(Zhaohui is about to say something, but then a series of gunshots and explosions outside the campsite shatter the silence of the night.)
Run! It's the Varjagers! The Varjagers are here!

(The Varjagers who attacked the settlement are swiftly beaten back, but the troupe campsite was caught in the crossfire and much of the intricate backdrops and stage are destroyed. Anything even remotely valuable in the backstage area has vanished.)
(The campsite is in an uproar. The troupe manager is frantically shuttling between the stage, the admin tent and the costume racks, totalling up the losses while Monsoon Squad and I help her out.)
(Just then, an actor runs over.)
Manager, manager! It's bad! Aida's gone!
Hah? Tell me, be clear about it, what happened?
The cast was doing a headcount just now and we couldn't find Aida!
After that, someone mentioned that they think they saw several Varjagers going after Aida when the campsite was being attacked!
A-And also, someone was guiding the Varjagers—I think it was the people who came to cause trouble for us earlier!
W-wait a minute. Are you saying the troublemakers from earlier were inside men for the Varjagers and that Feris' parents hired the Varjagers to attack the troupe?
No, I don't think so. When you consider how Feris died, there's no way her family would hire the Varjagers.
The underground markets are chaotic and hard to manage. It's more likely that the assignment to cause trouble here was "coincidentally" taken by the Varjagers.
...So the Varjagers needed an "inside man".

That's right. The tour was heavily publicized, so the Varjagers probably had their eye on the troupe for some time now. The request put out by Feris' family gave them the perfect excuse for them to sneak around the campsite and not arouse our suspicion.
Since when were the Varjagers so cautious? I've never known them to act like this throughout the years I've known them.
It does seem like the Varjagers have grown a brain over the past few years. The contracts regarding them have gotten harder and harder to complete.
While they're a bunch of brainlets in actual combat, their ability to strategize does seem to have evolved a little.
Dammit! Then what should we do now, we—
(A sudden ringtone from a comm terminal interrupts the manager's words.)
(The manager frowns and picks up. We instantly hear a girl's scream from the other side of the connection.)
(It lasts only a second and then the girl's voice cuts off, replaced by a short-tempered voice.)
Heard that?
Your lead actress is in my hands. Bring her ransom by tomorrow.
I'm warning you now, don't try any fancy shit with me or the girl dies!
(The call cuts off and the campsite instantly goes silent.)
(But soon, confused voices erupt from all around and panic swallows the entire troupe.)
That was Aida's voice! The Varjagers kidnapped Aida!
Director, manager, w-what should we do?!
Can we really trust the Varjagers? What if...
(Amidst the clamor, the theater manager walks over to me, a look of utter helplessness in her eyes, and tightly squeezes my hand.)
Please... please save Aida!
We'll try to get the ransom together, but we can't let anything happen to Aida again!
Alright, calm down. No matter what—
(Before I can finish, Zhaohui has already walked up to us.)
Commander, allow me to handle the rescue.
I've seen enough kidnappings to last me a lifetime, hmph... These scum only know how to bully the weak and run rampant.
I don't know how people live in the contaminated zones, but stepping in when I see injustice being done is how I live. And now that I've seen it happen, there is no way I can turn a blind eye to it.
I know that, but please wait a moment.
(Zhaohui's eyes narrow as I stop her.)
Don't get me wrong, Zhaohui. Calm down and listen to me.
(I massage the space between my eyes as I take in her guarded attitude and suspicions... Looks like she's really misunderstood me.)
(Then I shake my head and look her in the eye.)
Zhaohui, I feel the same way as you. There is no way I would simply stand aside after seeing something like this; that has nothing to do with being a bounty hunter.
That said, stopping you comes from my experience as a bounty hunter.
—I believe there is a better solution to this matter.
(Inside a darkened corner of a Varjager warehouse, I secretly slip a thin razor blade out from between my layers of clothing.)
(I remember the calm look on Zhaohui's face as she slipped it into my sleeve—)
I've carried this blade with me all this time just for situations like this, when I'm trapped among the enemy.
Since you're willing to take the risk, Commander, I'll give you this blade.
—The blade is sharp, so be careful that you don't cut your fingers when you retrieve it.
(I feel for the blade and take advantage of the fact that there's nobody there to cut the ropes binding me.)

(Soon, the ropes fall apart behind me and I work my shoulders to free myself. As I tuck the little razor back into my thick sleeve, it nicks my fingertip and coolness oozes from the point of contact.)
Ack—it really is sharp.
(I ignore the pain in my finger and fish out the micro-communicator in my collar before calling Zhaohui.)
(There is hardly any delay before the call goes through.)
The plan was successful. I'm inside the Varjagers' warehouse.
So your definition of success is pretending to be defeated and captured so they can throw you into their warehouse while trussed up like a turkey?
Hey, it beats mindlessly charging in.
This place seems lightly guarded and their ropework is sloppy; looks like these Varjagers aren't very experienced. Oh yeah, your knife was really useful too.
As long as you're safe. Have you found Aida yet?
Yup. Aida's in another corner. I think she's fainted.
I'll go wake her up now. Wait for my signal. How are you and Jiangyu?
Ready to move in on your signal, Commander.
Alright.
(I hang up and quietly approach the corner where Aida is lying.)
(Aida's face is pale as she lies on the cold ground. Her hands are tied behind her and her tired body is curled up into a ball.)
(I bend down and start cutting her bonds, then I pat her shoulder before calling her name.)
Aida. Aida! Wake up!
(After a while of this, Aida weakly opens her eyes.)
(Upon seeing me, she grabs hold of my sleeve. Her eyes go wide and fill with tears.)
(Sob) Please help me! It... it's them!!
(Zhaohui, Daiyan, and Jiangyu hide behind a pile of rocks, keeping a watchful eye on the nearby Varjager encampment.)
(Sounds of merriment and the occasional laugh come from it. It seems they are celebrating their recent "victory". Jiangyu pouts in annoyance as she crouches by the rock pile, bored out of her skull.)
Ahhhhh, this is so boring! Why hasn't the Commander given the signal yet...
Be patient.
Eh? Weren't you about to butt heads with the Commander yesterday? Why are you willing to listen to them all of a sudden?
That was then, this is now.
(Zhaohui's eyes do not leave the Varjager campsite even as she delivers her flat reply.)
Oh, I get it now! You've realized how trustworthy the Commander is, haven't you?
(Zhaohui remains silent, but then a command suddenly comes over the comm channel.)
Zhaohui, go.
Acknowledged.
(After ending the transmission to Zhaohui, I instruct Aida to hide in a corner.)
(I ensure Aida is well hidden and take cover behind a nearby heap of junk, my gun ready in case we're attacked from outside.)
(Soon, gunshots fill the air outside the warehouse.)
(The gunfire draws closer. Someone kicks the main door and a familiar form rushes in—)
Commander! Aida!
We're here!
(Zhaohui swiftly rushes over to my and Aida's side, then nods to us.)
Jiangyu and Daiyan are covering us outside. Come with me; there's a side path we can use to leave their encampment.
No, we can't leave now. At least, not like this.
And what is the reason for that?
I took a contract from Aida.
(Zhaohui wrinkles her brow.)
Time is tight. I'll summarize.
Just now, Aida told me that she recognized these Varjagers.
Y-yes, I did, Miss Zhaohui! I've seen them before!
(Aida's eyes suddenly flush red as she tightens her grip on Zhaohui's arm. Her voice is trembling.)
Last night, when I was brought here... I saw their leader, the Varjager's leader!
He, their leader had... He was wearing a necklace. I remember... that necklace was from Feris' family. She cherished it dearly and she'd wear it everywhere!
That's why I'm certain of it! He was the one who led the Varjagers that attacked me and Feris!
Correct. And so, Aida contracted me for a task; she wants me to wipe out these Varjagers to avenge Feris.
I accepted.
And now, Zhaohui, you have a choice.
Are you willing to join me in clearing this nest of Varjagers? Of course, it's going to be more dangerous than just leading Aida away.
(For the first time, there is an almost imperceptible smile on Zhaohui's face.)
It would be my pleasure.
(Zhaohui and I coordinate with each other and corner the Varjager leader.)
What should we do now? There are no police stations in the contaminated zones.
We do it the bounty hunter way—either you hold your peace forever, or you leave no regrets behind. Though when it comes to scum like that, I'd be disgusted with myself if I spared him.
(Bang—)
(A single gunshot fills the air, and the bulky man wearing a necklace slumps against the wall.)
Contract closed.
(I recover the necklace from the man and indicate to Zhaohui that we should leave.)
(Zhaohui seems a little pleased with herself right now.)
Let's go.
(I turn and head out of the encampment.)
It's time we returned this to Aida.
(Two days after the Varjagers were eliminated—)
(The Talia troupe campsite is abuzz with activity. Tonight, "Daybreak's Oath" will be performed in this settlement for the last time.)
(Night has just fallen and the temporary seating is packed with audience members who have come here from nearby settlements.)
(As the show progresses, the sounds of applause or sniffling come from the seats, and when the final scene arrives, all eyes are on the girl in center stage who is illuminated by the spotlights.)
I'm sorry, my very best friend. Please forgive me for bidding you farewell.
For last night, I received word from the goddess of dawn. She told me that when daybreak comes, I shall go with the wind, onward to a kingdom on the faraway clouds.
But my dear, beloved friend, do not be saddened by this parting.
For you know that it has always been my wish to become that faint ray of light that illuminates the dark night...
(As she recites her lines, a twinkle of light blossoms in her hand.)
(She holds up this radiant mote and descends from the stage into the audience seats, until finally she arrives before a man and woman.)
...And so from now on, so long as you see the sky at dawn, remember that ray of daybreak and know that I wish you well.
Let this necklace be the proof of our pact; no matter where you may be, so long as you need it, it shall become as the daybreak and defend you.
(And with that, Aida gently lifts her hand and deposits Feris' necklace into the couple's hands.)
(Then, Aida bows deeply to the two of them.)
I am so, so sorry...
(Zhaohui and I watch the end of the show from an unobtrusive corner of the audience.)
(After seeing Aida finally embrace Feris' parents, even Zhaohui's cool expression seems to have softened a little.)
A good ending, don't you think?

It is good that the misunderstanding could be resolved. And it was also good that you were willing to testify about the evil deeds of the Varjagers. Otherwise Aida's parents would have found the tale hard to believe.
So, does that mean our misunderstanding has also been resolved?
Can you tell me about your reluctance to join us?
(Zhaohui is silent for a while, and then she nods.)
Before joining Monsoon Squad, I was used to travelling alone and dealing with any dangers I encountered by myself.
But after becoming part of Monsoon Squad, Daiyan, Jiangyu, and Faye became my friends. We travelled together with the same wish in our hearts, just like Aida and Feris.

I once thought Monsoon would keep travelling like this forever—while everyone kept talking about finding their Commander, they were still limited by that "agreement", so I believed that the day when they would do so was still far off. Thus, I did not think much about what would happen once the "agreement" ended, or what I would do.
By the time I realized that there really was a chance for them to go to the Elmo, I... hesitated.
If everyone else in the band chose to return to the Elmo, then what about me?
(Zhaohui pauses for a moment. She runs her fingers over her gun, and then looks at me.)
The members of Monsoon often told me about you and your shared past.
So before I make my decision, I would like to know, what made you walk this path of self-exile?
To my knowledge, you were not compelled to become a wandering bounty hunter.
Oh, me?
(I look up at the sky. Too many scenes from the past flash before my eyes.)
(—What exactly was it that made me choose my present course? I think of the flames from that explosion, and that one-sided farewell.)
(In order to give all of that some sort of meaning, I finally chose to sign the "agreement", much as I loathed its terms and the fact that I had done so.)
(As my emotions fly into disarray, I shake my head, and my gaze settles on the nearby stage.)
Perhaps it was for these people... Feris, Aida, and the audience members watching the play, just like you.

Perhaps I could have chosen a better-paying way of life. But if I had, I would always be taking and following orders. By boarding the Elmo, perhaps I could follow my heart and help the people that needed saving.
...But then again, maybe I just did it for myself.
So, I'm sorry; I cannot answer your question, because I still haven't accomplished anything yet.
Is that what you wanted to hear, Zhaohui?
(Zhaohui looks at me in silence, and the night shrouds that "stiff face" of hers.)
(She looks down at the scars on her hand, and there is a vague sense of confusion in her eyes.)
...Once, I simply acted as I was ordered, never questioning the rightness of my actions or the lack thereof.
After that, I learned that I could choose for myself.
And so... you chose Monsoon.
Not just Monsoon.
When I joined Monsoon, I also chose the future I wanted.
So, what kind of future will you choose now?
(Zhaohui looks up.)
(She stares into my eyes, and the confusion from before is now gone.)
Commander. I am not like Daiyan and the others. I have not experienced the days of fighting by your side in Griffin.
That is why I cannot immediately decide to board the Elmo and follow you.
But of course. I would like all Dolls who join the Elmo to do so of their own free will.
However, our contract has allowed me to get the measure of your character. And since my friends in Monsoon Squad trust you completely—
I think I can try to trust you too, Commander.
In the past, I chose to travel with Monsoon Squad. Now, I think I can choose a future of travelling with the Elmo.
Surely a journey with you should be a pretty good one, am I wrong?
(And with that, Zhaohui watches me quietly.)
Hm... Well, in terms of "doing good and stopping evil"... It ought to be pretty good.
(Upon hearing my answer, Zhaohui smiles that barely visible smile again.)
Then from now on, the Tactical Doll Zhaohui shall join the Elmo.
Here's to jolly cooperation, Commander.
(It is late at night and the bustling crowds have receded. The actors have cleared away their costumes and props and are now taking a break, leaving the campsite silent at last.)
(Just as I'm about to return to my tent, I hear a familiar and gentle voice from behind me.)
Commander... do you have a moment?
Daiyan? What are you doing here? Is something the matter?
I came to return you this.
(Daiyan smiles as she approaches me. Then she extends a hand to me, revealing the intricate pendant in her palm.)
(The thunderbolt-shaped symbol on the pendant gleams in the night.)
Ah, that's...
(My thoughts return to a time several years ago.)

(It was before I was officially reunited with Daiyan. A certain request had led to the Elmo travelling near the Green Zone. There, I received Daiyan's "signal"; a blue ribbon brought back by Groza after she returned from a mission in a satellite city.)
(Without news, without a message, we were separated by just a purification zone—these were the limitations imposed by the agreement, and also a sign of Daiyan's care and concern.)
(At Groza's suggestion, I had her pass Daiyan the pendant.)
This was the keepsake that you had Miss Groza give me.
I still remember the words I told her that day—
"Bathed in lightning and rain, waiting silently amidst the storm, the blue-white flash shall one day be seen."
That is the origin of the name Elmo and also the promise you made with me; is it not, Commander?

During my time apart from you, I have always carried this pendant with me... it has gotten me through the countless lonely days when my thoughts were of you and gave me the strength to keep moving forward.
Thanks to its existence, I have always believed that one day, I would be reunited with you, Commander.
You're right...
The rain and the storm have passed. Welcome back to the Elmo, Daiyan.
(I look toward Daiyan, but just as I'm about to retrieve the pendant, she suddenly pulls her hand back.)
(She holds it in her palm, looking tenderly upon it, as though she were caressing it with her gaze.)
C-Commander... The truth is, I have a request to make of you.
Though we are now reunited, I have always etched the meaning of this pendant onto my heart.
If I might, could I continue to hold onto this pendant? I will always cherish the spirit in which it was given.
(Still holding the pendant, Daiyan gazes into my eyes, her face flushing a faint pink.)
Of course.
(Shortly after, in the Elmo.)
(Several Dolls who have travelled from afar are now gathered at the foot of the massive vehicle.)
(The twin-tailed girl tugs on the hand of the blue-clothed girl, hopping around excitedly in front of the Elmo.)
I'm so happy, Big Sis! We've returned to the Elmo again!
Oh yes, I didn't expect we'd be able to come back.
Is this really alright? The agreement...
Relax, the Commander said that our friend in the Non-Military Forces Administration—namely, Miss Kalina, will help us take care of it. We won't have to worry about the paperwork.
So let's enjoy our reunion with the Commander.
Wow, is the Commander aboard? I'm feeling so nervous all of a sudden!
Well, that's unusual. To think the day would come when Monsoon's best drummer is blushing.
Uwaaaah, Zhaohui! You're still making fun of me at a time like this!
I was simply trying to add to the mood and an opportunity presented itself.
But I guess it worked pretty well, no?
(With a "wow", Jiangyu runs to the Elmo and Daiyan follows in exasperation. Faye too strides into the Elmo.)
(At a leisurely pace, Zhaohui walked at the back of the group.)
(What will Monsoon Squad's future be?)
(Zhaohui looks up, at the person on the Elmo who's waiting for them.)
(—Perhaps this person will give her the answer.)
(Dandelion slowly exits the room and stands upright under the night sky.)
(The clouds gradually scatter and the moonlight shines on her. While she is the only one in the garden, a pair of images suddenly appear.)
(She seems to realize something and closes her eyes. Her mouth curves up in a faint smile and she bows, as though welcoming someone.)
You're here?
It's your first time coming to see me in 10 years. Makes me feel a little lonely.
(There is nothing in front of Dandelion, but that familiar form in her eyes is standing before her, clear as day.)
Hehe, we haven't seen each other in so long, but you aren't even discussing anything related to me. How cruel.
It might just be an instant for you, but it's a long time for me, and for that person, it is endless torment.
That's terrible, don't you think? Isn't that just too cruel for that person?
How could I possibly refuse you~ I was just griping, surely you'll permit me to indulge myself a little, won't you~
I knew it~ Selfishness is unavoidable, even for someone like you~
(Dandelion looks at the girl before her who does not deny this, and shakes her head as though in self-mockery.)
Everything has changed, possibly for the better, but possibly for the worse.
Everything that happened 10 years ago feels like a lovely dream compared to now. Sometimes I wonder if I've even woken up yet.
If not for my neural logs telling me that it actually did happen, I'd have forgotten that unforgettable time.
Did you expect all of this too? Or were you just standing aside, watching aloofly as we flailed around like a troupe of clowns?
I understand. Your arrival implies a new trial is upon us.
Still, you chose to stand aside and watch back then. Now you're spouting pretentious lines about how you want that person to walk back into the fire. Don't you think you're going too far?
Or is this one of your little indulgences?
(Dandelion leisurely walks in front of that invisible presence. Her face does not change, but Dandelion, who was born of the same origin as her, already knows the answer in her heart.)
Yes, yes, I KNOW I have to do this. I know them well; for them, trials have never been a difficult thing.
But that person has lost everything; wealth, fame, comrades, their precious future, and all our former friends—namely, those Dolls.

Everyone and everything has been taken from them, and a great price must be paid for them to gain the strength to rise again; yet, more than this strength, it is the question of how to make them WANT to rise up once more that truly puzzles me.
Surely you have a way to steer the future in a direction which is not bound by the terms of "Mephisto", do you not?
But if it's you, you'd surely reply that everything that happened was meant to protect that person.
After all, to you, that person is the "Catcher in the Rye", am I wrong?
(Dandelion freezes up. For a moment, there is an almost imperceptible shade of emotion on her face.)
(However, she immediately resumes her usual smile, and then continues talking like she's trying to convince herself.)
After all, living is the most important thing...
That might be true, but it's also a prison of sorts. 10 years is by no means a short span of time for humans.
Even if it was the right choice, it still ended up hurting that person, and for the second time too~
I wonder, as someone who made such a ruthless choice, do you feel sorry for the person you hurt?

(Dandelion tilts her head ever so slightly, as though she's ready to listen to a confession. She seems to be looking forward to making life hard for her conversational partner, but it doesn't last long, because she then proceeds to state her own request.)
Alright, alright, it's not like it's particularly difficult for me anyway. I shall carefully calculate the odds of you fulfilling your wish~
And then, I shall move in a mysterious way to guide that person's destiny to join with yours. Will that satisfy you, my dear sister?
It's just going to take a bit of time. There are no drawbacks for me besides things being a little annoying.
However, the price that YOU will have to pay is going to be so high that even I am having trouble imagining it, you know?
Alright, alright. Since it's related to that person, I shall have to exert myself and give it a try.
I promised to watch how that person's life ends, after all. But in exchange, you'll have to help me fulfil our wish, okay~
(Dandelion opens her eyes, and her face, still with a smile, gently lifts. She gazes on the radiant moon and begins talking to herself in a self-deprecating tone.)
Goodness, you're just like before, running off and abandoning me the moment you're done talking.
Still... The boring days are finally over. An age of fire and blood is upon us once more, and I wonder what kind of destiny awaits them in such a world?
Yes, it'll be a while yet until that day comes. Until then, I should probably start doing some of the things I promised her~
(Dandelion slowly raises her arms, and then she claps rapidly. Almost immediately, a girl with the black hair like hers appears behind her.)
Lady Dandelion, you called?
Heli, I need network access to the beacon network in the Central Region.
Oh yes, help me say hi to the old bunch and tell them their peaceful lives are over.
Would you like me to sugarcoat the message?
Just give it to them straight. They will understand my meaning with joy in their hearts~
Yes, I will take care of it at once.
(The girl called Heli leaves without a sound, leaving Dandelion alone in the garden.)
...Hehe, when will the day of reunion come?
It's such an exciting thought~
(The desolate plains are host to a cluster of buildings that stand out among their surroundings, but are otherwise rather shabby. They sit within a temporary quarantine wall.)
(Several sets of thick railway tracks extend inward from the distance, intersecting at this small intercontinental railway resupply station.)
(This seemingly unassuming supply station serves as a repository for supplies from outside the contamination zone, and it is also the last and only hope for anyone seeking to leave the Yellow Zone.)

(As the quarantine wall's gate opens, a rust-speckled intercontinental railway train slowly pulls into this supply station amidst strident alarms. Radiation-cleansing wash is sprayed onto the train cars and pours off the side, emitting an acrid odour.)
(As the train slows down, a deafening, metallic shriek echoes within the building, causing the surrounding travellers to reflexively cover their ears.)
(The train comes to a halt and its heavy blast doors open. Gangways extend from the train to the platform and the passengers stream off the vehicle.)
(The passengers all look tired as they drag their luggage off the trains. However, one of them is not like the others as she hops, skips and jumps off down the ramp.)
Ahhhhhh, that ride was so BORING!
So much for an "express train", I was stuck in my seat for 20, count them, TWENTY hours!
My bones feel like they were being shaken to bits!
As an elite Doll, aren't you made of sterner stuff than that?
Even an elite Doll can't handle having to sit still in a chair the size of a washbasin! Isn't that right, Big Sis?
(An elegantly dressed Doll emerges from the cabin car. She gently pats Jiangyu's head, which manages to soothe the somewhat antsy little sister.)
It must have been hard on you, but I don't think that's enough to get the better of the best little sister in the world, am I right?
(Upon hearing Daiyan's words, Jiangyu goes from pouting in annoyance to smiling broadly, and she smugly plants her hands on her waist.)
Of course! I was just venting a little, it's not as though I was actually bothered by it!
Zhaohui, how are you doing?
As a Doll, being able to get a seat at all is pretty good.
Uwah, we shouldn't have asked you.
I know it's been hard on everyone. There are still a few more hours until our transfer train arrives. Shall we rest in the train station?
Big Sis, we spent the Collapse pieces we saved up for half a year on the travel expenses for this journey. Was it really necessary?
It's true that cross-country travel is a little expensive, but there was an important reason for it.
What kind of reason could be worth half a year of income...
Mm, that's a secret for now. But once you find out, I'm sure you'll be surprised.
A surprise, hm... I hope it won't turn out to be a shock instead...
I'm sure Daiyan has a reason for doing what she did. Shouldn't you have absolute faith in her, as her little sister?
That's true, but... We've spent so much money and I don't even know the reason why! Can't you let me complain a little?!
Ugh... Ah, I think our luggage for this trip's been unloaded. Go over and get our travelling cases before someone takes them, okay?
Oh... oh!
My collection is in my luggage! I can't lose them again this time!
(Jiangyu frantically runs toward the luggage carousel. Daiyan sighs quietly and Zhaohui walks up to her.)
Frankly speaking, I don't really understand the purpose of this journey either.
If it's to expand the range of our tour, then there's no point in going so far by train. We won't even make the money for the tickets back with our concert earnings.
Our destination is far away from our current active radius. I'm sure you wouldn't have chosen this region if you didn't have a reason for it.
Indeed, I have very important reasons for doing this.
An important friend contacted me some time back, and while she didn't tell me why I had to be here, I was sure that it was related to our shared past.
An important friend... Does that mean it's related to your past in Griffin?
Yes. For a certain reason, my friend did not want to leave any records that we knew about this ahead of time.
What a strange reason.
Sorry I dragged you into this.
Don't worry about it. Besides, it's not like I have anywhere else to go.
(Zhaohui stretches, seemingly to put Daiyan at ease, and Daiyan responds with a smile.)
(Jiangyu's piercing voice rings out from the distance.)
B-Big Sis! This is bad!
(Daiyan and Zhaohui turn to look toward the sound of the voice and see Jiangyu being chased by several men in security guard uniforms.)
(The guards are trying to handcuff Jiangyu, but her strength and agility are far beyond theirs. Jiangyu calls out loudly to Daiyan as she runs.)
These stupid guards won't listen to me at all!
This smuggler is a tricky one! Get more guys in here to surround her!
You're the smuggler! Your mom is a smuggler!
(As Jiangyu makes a bigger and bigger ruckus, the surrounding travelers gather round to gawk and more security guards swarm over.)
(Daiyan and Zhaohui immediately run over to Jiangyu, blocking her behind them and then Daiyan whispers to Zhaohui.)
Don't hurt the humans, otherwise things will get very troublesome.
(Zhaohui replies with a knowing nod and attempts to take down the oncoming security guards aside with minimum force.)
(After seeing the Dolls' prowess, the guards freeze up, unwilling to recklessly approach them.)
(However, there is the sound of a handgun chambering a round in the distance, and a middle-aged man who looks like a police officer stalks over to Daiyan and the others.)
Railway Police!
Cease struggling or I WILL open fire!
Oh no...
(Daiyan looks around herself. While this is just a minor transfer station, things will get extremely troublesome if they do get detained here.)
(Since they haven't broken the law, their current priority is to figure out why Jiangyu was being chased by those security personnel.)
Officer, we're just ordinary travellers. Why are you trying to arrest my sister?
(The railway police officer looks Daiyan up and down. He shows no sign of lowering his guard.)
Are you a Doll?
Dolls of your grade are a rarity around here.
Where's your owner? Get him out here, I want to speak to him!
Officer, we own ourselves and we have proper credentials. Here is our electronic ID.
(Still suspicious, the officer scans Daiyan and the other's ID. His system indicates that they are indeed self-owned and authorized to travel freely.)
Damn, so you really are self-owned Dolls. That's something you don't see everyday.
(The railway police officer finds it hard to believe his eyes. Then, he looks back to question the security guards who were chasing Jiangyu.)
What's with those Dolls?
Our scans revealed weapons in their luggage! They've got guns, lots of guns!
We are authorized to bear fire control cores and use weapons. Our ID already shows this.
We also declared the other weapons before boarding the train. You can find it in the hazardous goods transport permit section.
(The police officer eyes the security guard behind him, who frantically opens his terminal and goes through it. A while later, he lowers his head and speaks dejectedly.)
It's all in there...
What the hell are you morons playing at?
Don't you even know how to check IDs and forms?!
But our scanners threw up an alarm, and we saw the guns and thought we should detain them...
That's why none of you have managed to get a proper posting so far! You clowns can forget about being promoted for the rest of your lives!
(The railway police officer makes a big show of berating the security men while he pulls them aside, then quietly speaks to them.)
They say that Dolls who can get clearances like this have a complicated past. You shouldn't get involved with them.
Dammit... Even humans don't get this kind of treatment.
They're licensed to carry weapons and fire control cores, so they must be Tactical Dolls from some PMC...
A PMC? Then maybe these Dolls are—
(Kaboom—!)

(Suddenly, there is a massive explosion from outside. A huge plume of black smoke rises from the quarantine wall in the distance. As the shockwave from the explosion washes over them, many people lose their balance and fall to the ground.)
What was that?!
(The sound of screaming comes from the direction of the explosion and a panicked crowd begins running this way.)
It's a Boojum!
A Boojum's hitting the quarantine wall!
A... A Boojum?!
Run for your life!
(Fear instantly spreads through the crowd and the surrounding tourists drop their luggage as they frantically run in the opposite direction.)
Dammit, how many times has it been this month!
Chief!
We've got an ELID incursion!
Get your guns and follow me!
(Something suddenly occurs to the railway police officer, and he turns around to address the Dolls.)
We're undergunned here, can you help us out?!
Since you're Tactical Dolls, dealing with ELIDs should be a piece of cake for you, right?
What should we do?
We should take our luggage and run.
No, we can't, there are too many civilians here. The consequences if the ELIDs broke in here would be unimaginable.
But if that was a Boojum, it's not something we can handle.
(After seeing the Dolls hesitate, the railway police officer immediately chimes in.)
Just think about these unarmed civilians! As Tactical Dolls, shouldn't your priority be protecting humans?
How about this; if you help us out, I can help you apply for a security certificate within the railway network. That way, you'll never be stopped or questioned no matter which station you go to!
Sounds like a good deal to me.
Then we'll...
Wait a minute, Big Sis! I have a condition; can we get better seats on the next trip?
No problem! I'll think of something!
(Upon hearing about the seat upgrade, Jiangyu's eyes practically glow with excitement. Daiyan looks at Zhaohui, who nods back in response.)
(Now that her friends have agreed, Daiyan makes up her mind.)
Understood, Officer. Please allow us to assist you.
The railway officer entrusted this region to us. Make sure you don't let the ELIDs into the station.
Wow, look over there, Big Sis! There's a huge hole in that section of wall over there in the distance!
The ELIDs must have entered through there.
Looks like the work of that Boojum. What should we do if we encounter it?
It's just a Boojum, I'll rip it to bits!
Surely you know what Boojums are, right...
They're strong ELIDs, aren't they?
I knew it...
We won't be engaging the Boojum. If we run into it, we flee immediately.
Understood.
Yes yes, got it, Big Sis.
Focus, the ELIDs are drawing close. Prepare for battle.
(After eliminating the ELIDs within the area, Daiyan contacts the railway police officer over the radio.)
Officer, this area is clear.
There is a breach in the quarantine wall here and there are elevated levels of Collapse radiation at our position. Please warn any nearby humans not to approach it.
Understood. Thank you.
I've already contacted the nearby railway units for support. Please ensure no ELIDs get through on your side until they arrive.
Alright, leave it to us.
Ah... Also, you'd best not pass through the quarantine wall and head outside. You might run into something bad out there.
Is there a problem over there?
We've received reports of unidentified groups being active there, and a lot of people have gone missing recently.
Boojum sightings have been increasing recently, and there are rumors about a cult operating nearby, so you'd best not get involved.
Thank you for the reminder. We'll pay attention to this.
(Jiangyu puts her weapon down and stretches lazily.)
What the heck, these ELIDs are wimps.
After seeing all those humans running scared, I thought we'd encounter some big monster.
We're lucky that we didn't run into that "big monster".
(Boom!)
(There is another explosion which sounds like it came from much closer this time. It gives Jiangyu a fright.)
Uwah, ANOTHER explosion?!
Did more ELIDs sneak in?
There's no way these mook ELIDs could have caused so much damage. That Boojum might be nearby.
If it was a Boojum, we'd have heard its roars.
Hmm... That's true.
We'll head over and take a look. We need to completely clear this area of threats.
(The Dolls warily approach the origin of the explosion just now, but the thick smoke it left in its wake hasn't completely dispersed yet.)
(Fortunately, they don't hear the howling of ELIDs. Apart from the sounds of burning and the wind blowing, everything is silent.)
(After making their way through the smoke, they see the breach in the quarantine wall not far ahead. The surroundings are a mess.)
(Sand and invisible Collapse particles are streaming in through the breach. The Dolls are stunned by the extent of the devastation here.)
(However, what truly shocks them is that there's something that most definitely does not belong in a place like this right in the middle of the breach.)
B-B-B-Big Sis!
There's someone lying on the ground!!
(Daiyan looks over and sees a girl with blue hair on the ground. Her hands are tightly clenched around her weapon and there are three strange spheres circling her.)
(The spheres glow with blue light, and the heat boiling off them makes the surrounding air ripple. It's plain to see that the previous destruction was their work.)
Is that... a Doll?
(Daiyan slowly approaches the Doll on the ground, but Zhaohui immediately steps up to stop her.)
Wait a minute, don't go over.
(Daiyan looks at the fallen Doll. The spheres have changed position and begun glowing in response to her approach. It looks like they might attack at any moment.)
Is that some kind of autonomous defense system?
Huh? Why would a Doll have something like that?
The last time we saw something like that was around 10 years ago, right?
(Just as the Dolls come to a halt, the spheres suddenly flash with light before flying rapidly in the opposite direction from Daiyan and company.)
Those spheres flew off... Does that mean it's safe?
...Your logic pathways sure are simple. What if there's another trap?
I'm not picking up any other threats for the moment.
That Doll looks like she's crashed. Watch our surroundings, I'm going to try and reboot her.
You want to do it here? Can't we just haul her back to the train station and be done with it?
I have some questions for her.
For some reason, I get the feeling that we have something in common...
Is this related to the past you were talking about?
The reason that we couldn't know about ahead of time?
Yes, that's the feeling I'm getting.
I'm sure there's a reason that we've come all the way here.
(While Jiangyu looks a little confused, she nods toward Daiyan anyway.)
(After seeing the two Dolls scan their surroundings, Daiyan begins working on the Doll.)
(She carefully turns the Doll's body over and finds her connection port.)
(She attempts to connect to the other Doll's neural cloud, and its firewall structure seems strangely familiar to her.)
Are you alright, Big Sis?
Since when did you become an electronic warfare specialist?
Connecting to her was easy. The IFF handshake protocol she uses is the same as ours.
The same? How could it be the same?
She's got the same IFF data as you, haven't you figured out why yet?
Er... Ah... Um... Was she in Griffin too?
But then, why don't I remember her at all...
You'll have your answer once she wakes up.
(Daiyan breaks the connection and gets to her feet.)
(The other two Dolls approach her, waiting for the Doll's neural cloud to finish rebooting.)
(As she looks at the Doll before her, Daiyan has a rough idea of what to expect.)
(I'm sitting in front of one of the big drop windows beside the main console, blowing on my cup. As I sip the revolting instant coffee, I think about how to handle the upcoming situation.)
(Paradeus has been sighted. Dolls like Sextans and Darture have attacked us. And then there's the recent transmission... All this makes me sink deep into thought.)
(While I'm trying to sort things out in my head, something in my heart is protesting.)
So the past has caught up with me at last...
(Just then, Mayling opens the door to the ops room, walking toward me as she works her tablet.)
(Upon hearing me mutter to myself, Mayling puts down her tablet in curiosity and speaks to me.)
What were you talking about, Commander?
It's nothing... Just an adult's pointless grumbling.
How's that Doll?
Are you talking about Sextans?
She's already inside the Doll repair bay. I just ran the first round of comprehensive system diagnostics on her. Looks like she's been very badly damaged...
Most of it wasn't from Leader, though. Just what on earth happened to her before this?
I wish someone would tell me that. Let's just bring her in and do some basic repairs on her. We'll have to watch her around the clock, though.
Yeah, Leader Groza said so too.
She's already arranged for rotating shifts to man the security cameras, and we'll have Dolls stationed in the repair bay.
Alright then. I can rest easy knowing Groza's handling things.
Ah... Commander...
What's going on?
Are you really going to bring Helena out with you again?
Ever since we brought Helena back from Paradeus, she hasn't been feeling too well...
We can't let people keep pursuing us. It's not enough just to keep Helena safe; we need to gather more information and launch an adequate counterattack.
I know that, but I'm just worried...
Don't worry, Mayling. Everything will get better.
Really?
For some reason, the look in your eyes seems different than before...
Different?
In the past, you always had a kind smile on your face, but ever since you got involved with Paradeus, your eyes have started looking kind of scary...
(I fake a cough to hide my accidental display of emotion.)
(After seeing the worried look in Mayling's eyes, I make a show of shrugging to try and calm her down.)
Sorry, Mayling... I think I recalled something from the past...
Don't worry, I won't put the others in danger, I won't let this happen again...
(My words don't sound the least bit reassuring, but fortunately Mayling doesn't probe further into it.)
Well, if you say so, Commander...
(I nod to Mayling, and Mayling nods back, though whether or not she actually understands remains in question.)
How are things on Colphne's end?
If Helena's alright, can you have Colphne let me speak to her for a bit?
They ought to be in the medical room. Should I go over and take a look?
Yeah, please pass the message on.
(Mayling nods to me, then turns to leave the ops room.)
(After watching Mayling leave, I take a look at myself through my reflection in the window glass.)
...Am I really that scary?
(It seems the ripples which that transmission set off in my heart were bigger than I expected. My regrets over the past surge to the fore along with my hopes for the future.)
(Before, I had not been willing to recall the past, and neither did I dare dream about change in the future.)
(Right now, however, all the thoughts hidden in my heart are bursting out uncontrollably into my mind. Perhaps I had been trapped in the events from 10 years ago all this time.)
(I look into the glass again, and my face does seem a little twisted... I should drink some coffee to cover it up.)
...Ack! That's hot!
(Annoyed, I put down my mug, and I catch sight of the nearby control terminal. I had heard the news that had tied my heart up in knots there, just half a day ago.)
(I rub my temples, and begin recalling the events from back then.)
No time to backtrace... and no time for repair either. I've only been able to go through basic maintenance on everyone...
Sextans is out there, and the storm here is bad... W-we'll be alright, right, Commander?
—Groza?
Enemy number confirmed to be just one.
Is it Sextans?
...Yes.
(A burst of static comes through the comms, making it difficult to make out what Groza is saying.)
It's just her? No other Paradeus combat units?
No. Enemy confirmed to have left combat area.
She retreated?
She's remaining outside of our firing range and is not leaving.
T-there's a new communications request—caller unknown!
...Put it through. Groza, stay alert.
(Mayling displays the new comms window on the projection screen.)
(I walk up to the projection screen.)
Good... day...
(I find myself looking at Sextans, who is wearing a hood.)

(I cannot be certain if the Collapse storm is affecting the signal reception or if Sextans' vocalization module is damaged, but her words are very choppy, and the simple greetings took her seconds to get out.)
It's a terrible day. This should be the first time I've seen you in the flesh—Sextans, chasing us here, tailing us—what do you want?
Sex... tans... my... na... me...?
You... kn... ow... who... I... am... pl... ease... tell... me...
Still trying these childish tricks on us?
(Sextans makes no reply or any sort of movement. She looks like a static image pasted on the projection screen.)
Groza, sitrep.
No abnormalities. No movement from enemy unit.
I have no time for this. Groza, get rid of her.
Tell... me...
(Sextans takes off her hood...)
(...Revealing her exposed circuitry, protruding eyeballs, and mangled metallic hardware.)
Neu... ral... autho... ri... zation... un... lock... li... mit... tell... me...
Give me the order, Commander!
A new comms request! Encrypted channel... caller is... "Light the dawn, shining edge in hand"?
...Put it through.
Commander!
Lenna? What's wrong?
Ah, are you busy, Commander?
It's nothing, just a battle.
That Doll called Sextans showed up again, although she looks a little weird...
Well, if you need to deal with her, I've got a handy little helper that I can lend you~
A handy little helper?
Is the Commander who conquered far and wide back then having this much trouble with a single Doll?
Looks like the "good stuff" Persica was talking about isn't doing that much good after all~
That voice... Could it be...
That's right, it's Miss Dandelion. She said she had urgent business with you, so I activated the emergency communications system.
Is now not a good time to talk, Commander?
Normally, that would be the case, but it would be a different matter if she could lend us a hand.
(Lenna picks up on my meaning and opens a link window. Dandelion's image instantly projects out of the comm terminal.)
(Dandelion is still the same as she was 10 years ago, still acting all smug even at a critical moment.)
(Still, since she's come knocking on my door, there's got to be something she needs me to do for her. It would be more efficient to let her take care of this emergency until then.)
You really don't stand on ceremony, do you, Commander? You're always having me clean up a big mess for you~
Well, I'm sure it's not a big loss for the great and powerful Dandelion to help us out, right?
Hehe, alright, then. What's the problem now?

(I suddenly realize that it's been a long time since we last spoke like this, but I ended up taking this tone with her anyway. For some reason, I'm not worried at all that she'll be repulsed by my attitude. In fact, even her seemingly mocking tone is putting me at ease.)

(As expected, Dandelion smiles in that familiar yet annoying way. Every time I see that smile, I just know she must be laughing like a hyena deep inside her virtual cognition image, but at the same time I know she'll step in to solve my issues.)
(I drag the video message Groza sent back into the comm window. Dandelion instantly recognizes the person within it.)
Isn't this the third-generation Doll Sextans?
You know her?
I found the information on her easily enough in the NOMFA databases. She's the Girard Group's newest product and their pride and joy.
A third-generation Doll?
So just like RO, then?
Her hardware's a little more advanced, but from a design standpoint, all I can say is that she's nothing more than a crude copy.
In short—way worse than RO.
A copy? Forget it, that's not important...
Although she looks pretty messed up, her fighting power still poses a major threat to us. What should we do?
The best way to deal with a fake is the real thing, of course~
If I'm not wrong, you've acquired Remolding Pattern technology already, right? Have you used it yet?
Mayling?
Ah, I've outfitted Leader Groza and the others with Remolding Patterns, but for some reason, maximum burst output is stuck at 68%...
If I could enter the Elmo's systems, I might be able to solve the problem of the Remolding Patterns' limited output~

And then your squad's combat power will rise like "whoosh" and then you'll one-shot that Sextans before dragging her frame back. I'm sure a third-gen Doll's neural cloud contains lots of info on the Girard Group. If you let me take care of it, I could crack it just like that~
Sounds good to me.
Groza, keep a safe distance from Sextans. Dandelion can boost the maximum output of your Remolding Pattern. Once that's done, take her out and recover her frame.
Dandelion?
Can we trust her?
She's an old friend... In any case, we'll upgrade it ASAP. Once I give the word, launch the attack.
Understood. We'll keep our distance and stand by for further instructions.
(Groza's team begins falling back and I signal to Dandelion to work as fast as she can.)
Miss Mayling, are you the Elmo's adjutant?
Will you allow me to enter the Elmo's systems?
Huh? Ah? Well...
You can enter without asking her, you know.
Good manners are very important for girls, Commander. You're always breaking your subordinates' hearts because you keep forgetting that~
Er...
Ah... You're Miss Dandelion, right?
H-how are you planning to get into the Elmo's systems?
You need to tell me whether I can come in first~
C-Commander...
It's alright. She's probably more familiar with the Elmo than we are, and we need to get the upgrade done ASAP.
Th-then please come in, Miss Dandelion!
As you wish~
(The Elmo shakes violently and the lights sway as well. The monitors on the command console begin to throw off sparks.)
(Mayling nervously sucks a breath in, terrified that she's just made the wrong decision.)
(I pat her on the back, indicating that she shouldn't be worried. However, she looks at me with nervous eyes.)
(Soon, the monitors and lights go back to normal. Dandelion must be back.)
Hmm... All the modules have been cared for very well. Looks like Miss Mayling's more capable than I expected~
You... are you in our systems already?

Oh yes, I booted up a data backup from 10 years ago, and thanks to the massive data center on the Elmo and the nearby signal beacon, I managed to update part of my virtual cognition image's data. Once it completely fuses with me, we'll all be happy campers here together~
(I palm my face. The scenario I least wanted to see has come to pass... I can practically imagine the tragic days ahead of us.)
Wait, a backup from 10 years ago?
Have you been to the Elmo before, Miss Dandelion?

Well, that's a long story. You see, 10 years ago, that Commander of yours who's leisurely sitting over there used little old me as a vehicle support AI and had me slave and labor for them all day long~
Hey!
...Isn't that the same as m—
Ah... What I mean is that you helped keep the Elmo running in the past as well?
So don't worry, I'll take on a big chunk of your workload. However, the priority right now is to get the Remolding Pattern up and running.
Mayling, have you connected the Remolding Pattern's backend systems to the Elmo?
Ahhhh yes!
I need you to open the database and give me the necessary authorizations so I can go through the past data.
Commander, can you give me a minute?
I'll let you handle it.
Looks like it's time for me to talk, then?
Lenna, where's Kalin?
Ah, I was juuust about to get to Miss Kalin~
Dandelion and Miss Kalin already contacted me. Seems there's been a change in the situation, so Helena's destination will need to be altered a little.
So we're not going to Kyiv?

No no, it's just a tiny adjustment. Our prior decisions might have been leaked and Miss Kalin's still looking for the source of the leak. Until then, we'll be transferring Helena to a reliable faction.
Right now, the Girard Group has their eye on the Elmo. Having Helena remain on the Elmo would be too dangerous for both her and the Elmo.
It IS a pretty high-profile vehicle...
So, got any specifics about the plan?
I'll explain later. In any case, there is much work for you to do, Commander~
If just listing all that work takes longer than a minute, it seems I'll need to mentally prepare myself...
Commander, I've finished analyzing the problems with the Remolding Pattern. Do you want to hear about them~
Go ahead.
That... that's amazing... I can't believe she took care of everything in less than a minute!
Any problem that can be covered by the Elmo's processing power is not a problem at all~

I made some deductions based on the data and found that the data on the plants in Groza's and the others' Remolding Patterns was inaccurate, which led to them not being able to absorb Collapse particles at full efficiency.
Fully resolving this issue will require sample calibration data, but that sort of thing can wait until later.

Right now, I've performed some simple simulated calibrations. That should bring the Remolding Pattern's output from 68% up to 85%. Still not at full output, but that should be more than enough to deal with that third-generation Doll.
Has it already been done?
You can use it right away~
Understood.
Groza, check your Remolding Pattern. Can you raise its output to 85%?
Yes, the Remolding Pattern's maximum output has been increased. Commander, should I continue with the attack on Sextans?
Your orders are unchanged. Take her down and recover her frame.
Understood, executing now.
Commander, we've recovered Sextans' frame. Estimated 20 minutes until we get back to the Elmo.
Thank you, you've done well. Take care on the way back.
Understood. We're heading out.
Well, that's Leader Groza for you. She one-shotted that Doll the moment she got an upgrade!
I didn't expect someone who chased new trends as much as you would bring along an old subordinate, Commander~
I'm not a trendchaser.
Really now?
But then why don't I see a single familiar face?
Shouldn't you be the one who best knows the reason for that and best understands what happened back then, Dandelion?
Hoho, of course I understand. Is there anyone who understands you better than me, Commander?
I simply thought your reaction when I phrased it that way would be very amusing~

Naturally, I understand that you're bound by the limitations of the "Mephisto" agreement, because SOME people are so terrified of you that the thought of you NOT being separated from those cute little Dolls of yours keeps them up at night~
And here I thought you had wasted away to the point where you'd gotten used to those days of drifting with the wind~
...You didn't have to say that.
What's this, Commander? Are you mad? Frustrated? Wroth, even?
(I look down and away from her. There is no response.)
(I know that I'm not angry. Rather, the fact that she has hit the nail on the head has left me feeling a little guilty instead.)
(All this while, I'd thought that I'd completed my mission, so I didn't want to experience those despair-inducing things again—things like watching my friends die and sacrificing my subordinates.)
(Still... Despite everything we did, everything we sacrificed, Paradeus is still around.)
(If my mission was a failure, then what even was the point of everything I did back then?)
(As I ponder this, the regrets I've been hiding in the depths of my heart surge to the fore again.)
It's not like I don't understand how you feel.
Maybe a new beginning might not be so bad after all~ Perhaps those subordinates of yours could come back and work for you again~
A new beginning?
What kind of beginning?
Hmm, perhaps we could start with a teeny tiny accident~
...I don't have time for your riddles.
Aw, you wound me. I guess Little Miss 9 will have to explain, then.
Lenna?
It's like this. Kalin had an idea and she wants you to meet up with 404 after this.
You mean, with 45 and the others?
No, Leva—that is to say, 45—is still on a mission with Miss Kalin now.
Klukai's leading 404 now. Ah, Klukai's—
I know, she's 416. She finally became 404's leader like she always wanted.
Haha, yes. Klukai and her team are on a mission and Kalin was hoping you could send a squad over to back them up, in case something dangerous happened.
That way, you'll be making contact with them through a request posted by the NOMFA. Doing that shouldn't cause too many problems.
Got it. Give me the coordinates and the time. I'll prepare for it.
Well, it's not too urgent. Their mission is still in the preparation phase. They'll let you know if they need support.
Also, there's something else which is more important—like I said earlier, Helena needs to get to Kyiv by some other way...
In other words, without using the Elmo, right?
That's right. Kyiv has forces and organizations that are completely under the control of the Non-Military Forces Administration, including hospitals with comprehensive care units.
However, Miss Kalin wants to bring her in via the intercontinental railway. Sending her via the Elmo would attract too much attention.
Considering our past experiences, it's not like the intercontinental railway is that much safer...
Last time, it was because there was a problem with the pickup at your destination. We'll make sure it doesn't happen again.
But you didn't actually encounter any difficulties on your way there via train, right, Commander?
That's true...

While the intercontinental railway and the cities it passes through might not be 100% safe, at least the enemy won't be able to attack them so openly. In comparison, moving through the contamination zones is riskier.
I suppose that's true.
Thing is, while I can still ensure Helena's safety on the Elmo, I'm not confident of bringing her out without an adequate escort.
Aw, you don't have to worry about that. There are tons of Dolls everywhere who are willing to help you out~
Who knows, you might end up "encountering" lots of friends along the way to Kyiv...
Encounters, you say...
I mean, a random encounter technically isn't a violation of the agreement, right~
Of course, if you can get Helena to safety, it's not like there's no way to deal with "Mephisto"~
Am I correct in understanding that this is a condition for the deal?
Deal is such an ugly word~
I have nothing but good intentions for you, Commander~
The more you say that, the more I'm thinking there's some pit trap out there waiting for me to fall into it...
Of course, the right to decide is still in your hands. If you're satisfied with your lifestyle of running away, you are of course free to reject my request~
As long as~ you're~ really~ all~ right~ with~ that~
(I frown, then finish the last of the coffee.)
(For some reason, that memory fills me with displeasure. Although I became used to Dandelion's attitude 10 years ago, I'm particularly irked by how she's acting this time round.)
(I glance at my watch. Just as I think someone ought to be coming over, there is a "ding" from the lift.)
Commander~ Mayling told me you wanted to see Helena, so I brought her here~
Where's Mayling?
A Dinergate called her away. Apparently she needs to fix something?
(More of Dandelion's tricks... Never mind, I won't bother about them for now.)
(I focus my attention on Helena, who's in front of me now. Although she just woke up, she doesn't look well.)
Helena, are you okay?
Commander, just now, scary...
Felt like, something was getting into my head...
Like I was remembering something... But I can't remember what...
(As Helena's eyes fill up with tears, my hand moves on its own to pat her head. My heart is aching for some reason.)
Colphne, is there anything wrong with Helena's body?
Apart from bruises where Krolik hit her, her vital signs have improved considerably.
Still, Helena was acting a little strangely back then... There might be something that the Elmo's equipment can't detect.
Is that so...
(I think for a bit, and then I make up my mind.)
Helena...
(I wipe away Helena's tears and speak to her in the kindest voice I can manage.)
Don't be scared, Helena. I'll take you to a safe place this time.
It'll be a place where you'll never feel scared like that again.
A safe place?
Yup. Safer than the Elmo, even.
Not true! Elmo is the safest!
You don't believe me?
Commander, I believe, but...
Commander... Are you going to take Helena away from the Elmo?
Yup, Kalin provided us with a new pickup method. I'll be bringing her to the nearby intercontinental railway station.
As you know, Kyiv is within the NOMFA's sphere of influence, and it also has a place where Helena can get treatment, so we need to get her there safely ASAP.
Yeah... The Elmo has a medical center, but we're not a hospital.
In that case, sending Helena there would definitely be better for her.
However, if we're going to a city, Helena might end up suffering organ failure like before.
That's definitely an issue...
I'll head back and consult with Lenna on a solution to that.
If you've made up your mind to go, then I'll go with you~
After all, I AM a medical Doll, and if anything happens to Helena along the way, I can deal with it immediately~
Colphne, are you coming too?
Yup yup, I need to accompany Helena. That way you'll feel much more at ease too~
(After hearing Colphne's words, Helena immediately throws up her arms in approval.)
Yay! Colphne is great, I like Colphne!
So don't worry about a thing, we'll head out with you, Commander~
Commander... is this really alright...
Just leave it to me. I'll make sure you'll be fine.
(Helena remains silent for a long while before she finally nods and agrees to my request.)
I'll give Helena some anti-degeneration medicine, then give her another checkup.
Good point. Take care of Helena, then.
(Colphne nods, then leads Helena out of the room with a smile on her face.)
(I exhale and think. Then I pick up my communicator and describe the situation to Groza.)
What do you think, Leader?
My opinion is the same as before. Helena was exposed to the Nytos, so we can't ensure her safety with our present firepower if she continues staying on the vehicle.
Since Miss Kalina has made arrangements to receive Helena, we should send her to her destination and complete the assignment ASAP.
Finish it ASAP, huh...

(I rub my temples. I know what Groza's trying to say without her having to actually put it into words. Maybe forgetting about the past would make things easier for me, but for some reason, I KNOW that I can't do that.)
(I tell Groza what's on my mind. As expected, she expresses her opposition to my idea.)
Commander, we have very few Dolls on hand. Carrying out two missions at once would be too much for us.
We won't be able to support Squad 404 if we have to cover both you and Helena as well.
Meeting up with Squad 404 would be an excellent opportunity for us. They're very good fighters and would greatly improve our combat capabilities.
Then Helena...

My plan is that Colphne, Helena and I will travel along the route Lenna gave us while you stay behind and secure the Elmo. According to Lenna, 404's situation isn't too urgent, so we'll back them up once we finish escorting Helena.
So you won't need me to escort you, Commander?
No, there's no need for that. We still have Sextans on the Elmo, and we don't know what her deal is, so I can't be at ease if you're not on the Elmo.

Also, using firearms will be troublesome once we enter a city, which will make your strengths very hard to employ. Someone like Colphne who's good at interacting with humans is better suited for the task of escorting Helena.
Dandelion is decrypting Sextans' neural cloud, but it'll take some time to finish. We can use this time to hurry over to the train station.
(Groza doesn't reply right away, unlike how she would normally.)
(I suddenly realize that what I said just now might have made her unhappy.)
(However, Groza is not silent for long. She speaks to me in her usual tone.)
Understood, Commander. Let me do the planning.
(Groan)
(The fallen Doll's neural cloud seems to have successfully rebooted.)
(She shakes her head, then struggles to prop herself up. Daiyan gently helps to support her into a sitting position.)
Are you alright?
I... I think I'm fine...
Where am I...
You're just outside an intercontinental railway station. What's your name?
My... My name is Colphne...
(The Doll called Colphne slowly comes to her senses. Then, she seems to realize something and begins casting a searching gaze around herself.)
Commander?! Helena?
Helena?
Commander?!
(There is nobody else around except the Dolls. Colphne looks like she's about to cry.)
(Daiyan looks just as shocked as Jiangyu, but she patiently waits for Colphne to calm down.)
The last thing I remember is the Boojum charging at me...
Did you guys save me...
The Boojum was gone by the time we arrived, and Big Sis helped reboot your neural cloud.
I see... I don't know how to thank you for your help.
We were just doing what we had to. The important thing is that you're okay.
Ah... About that Commander you mentioned... Could you tell me more about them?
The Commander?
Why are you asking about the Commander?
Perhaps the Commander you're talking about is the same one I know. We might be able to help each other out.
Can you tell us more about this person so we can verify them?
I didn't know the Commander had so many old friends...
(Colphne mutters to herself. These people don't seem like a bad lot, and she DOES need help.)
(After some soul-searching, Colphne decides to reveal a bit of information.)
Um... The Commander is the person who commands us... Ack, that was completely accurate and 100% useless...
Ah yes, I should be saying this; the Commander is a bounty hunter who drives a mobile base vehicle around and takes assignments from all over the place, although they hardly make any money—
The MBV!
Is this MBV called the Elmo?
Huh? How did you know that?
(Daiyan and Jiangyu exchange looks.)
Could it be...
It seems like it.
Colphne, we were once Tactical Dolls who served under the Commander of Griffin and Kryuger PMC.
Griffin... Does that mean you used to be subordinates of the Commander?
(Upon hearing Colphne's words, Daiyan is now certain that she's talking about the very same Commander that she knows.)
That's right. Pardon me for not introducing myself.
My name is Daiyan and this is my little sister, known as Jiangyu. We used to be Tactical Dolls from Griffin.
This is Zhaohui. While was not from Griffin, she is very reliable and is a friend of ours.
(Jiangyu and Zhaohui wave to Colphne.)
So please believe us when we say that we wish to help you.
Miss Colphne, can you tell us what happened just now?
(Colphne glances at the Dolls and decides to believe in them. Then, she quickly explains what just happen.)
We were attacked by an unknown force on our way to the train station, and as we were exchanging fire with them, a Boojum suddenly appeared. I think I passed out after the Boojum's attack...
I thought my frame would be shredded. I certainly didn't expect my functions to all be normal...
There were three floating spheres around you just now. They flew away when we approached you.
Floating spheres...
Did Helena save me?
Helena?
You mentioned that name too, in addition to the Commander. Who is that?
Why is there something as fancy as an automated defense system here?
I... can't tell you that.
(Colphne shakes her head. She clearly doesn't trust them.)
Hah? But we saved your life!
(Daiyan looks at Colphne and realizes that further questioning is pointless. More importantly, there are other, more pressing questions she wants to ask.)
Leaving that aside for the moment, do you know where the Commander is now?
The Commander managed to avoid the Boojum's attack just now... I'm sure the Commander would look for Helena if they were alright. Maybe the two of them are together...
Can we track their location?
Y... Yes, we can!
I planted a tracker on Helena...
(Colphne fiddles with her terminal and the sounds it makes indicates that it's running normally.)
Thank goodness... It's working fine.
Hang on; Helena's actually pretty close by?
But this location... It's underground...
(Colphne doesn't wait for the Dolls to answer before she runs off toward Helena's coordinates.)
(The group catches up with Colphne, and after passing through the broken quarantine wall, Colphne goes a good long way before she finally comes to a halt.)
(There is a wrecked shutter leading underground at the location where Colphne stopped.)
(The shutter is built behind a small hill. Half of it is below ground level and it's practically invisible from afar.)

(The shutter's outer camouflage has been blasted to bits. It was once the size of a cinema theater screen, but now it's nothing but ruined fragments that have been blasted inward, as though something huge had torn through it.)
Look at this ripping and tearing... Did that Boojum flee in there?
There's weird slime on the ground. Looks like it went in there.
Those spheres flew this way too. Maybe they went inside?
The Boojum might have brought Helena here, but with her defense system, Helena ought to be fine...
(Colphne wrings her hands, doing her best not to let her thoughts wander toward the worst. Daiyan gently pats her on the shoulder, hoping to calm her down.)
Miss Colphne, things will be alright. Besides, the Commander is here, right?
Yeah...
(Colphne nods. She quietly mouths the words in her heart until she can calm down and function normally.)
(The Dolls approach the destroyed shutter. The interior is extremely spacious and it seems to lead to an underground passage.)
This underground entrance... It has GOT to be some kind of shady facility!
Looks like it's a secret passage built to smuggle people past the quarantine wall.
Why is this secret passage so big?
It's big enough for vehicles to pass through, and considering how close it is to the train station, it must have been built by a really powerful broker.
Can underground brokers really do that...
How do you think they transport the really big pieces of merchandise?
(All this can't be just a coincidence.)

(Daiyan remembers the reminder that the railway police officer just gave them. That, combined with the fact that anything involving the Commander is bound to be complicated, makes her think that they need to be exceptionally careful with their next move.)
Is this Helena's location in the depths of this passage?
From their coordinates, they seem to be far below us. Perhaps there's another facility below.
I know I have no right to ask this of you, but could you please help me to find the Commander and Helena?
(Daiyan looks at the pleading look in Colphne's eyes, and then at her two companions.)
Looks like your instincts are as accurate as ever, Daiyan.
Of course! I'm overjoyed to be able to see the Commander again!
(Daiyan turns back and nods to Colphne, replying in the affirmative.)
If we can help the Commander, then we will certainly be inclined to help you. Please guide us to them.
Th-Thank you!

Colphne gazes into the black depths of the passage and struggles to swallow the fear in her heart. Then she sends the coordinates to Daiyan and company before turning on her flashlight and venturing forth.
(I sit down in front of the control terminal and think about my next move.)
(With Sextans and Nemesis on the Elmo, there's no way Groza can leave it, even if she isn't happy about it.)
(However, there was something strange about Groza's expression, especially when I was discussing the past with her. Still, she's the Doll team leader, so she ought to be able to handle it.)
(We'll need some combat power to account for any sudden developments. The other Dolls are way too flashy, which means the best choice is Colphne.)

(The conclusion I reached is that I can rely on my own flexibility and Kalin's resources to take care of things in the city, but in the contamination zones, Squad 404 needs fire support from the Dolls.)
(I lightly tap the table with my knuckles and decide to split our forces up in the end.)
(I scratch my head, then sigh heavily. The familiar pressure that once plagued me returns. I hate having to choose between a rock and a hard place like this.)
Have you made up your mind?
(Dandelion's voice comes from a strange place. I look around, then find that there is a Dinergate floating in the air right on top of my head.)
Since when did you gain the fetish of sleeving into Dinergates?
(The floating Dinergate that was originally intended as a smart navigator for the Elmo flies a little lower, but I still need to look up to see it.)
(Even in a Dinergate's body, this aura of smug superiority is uniquely Dandelion's.)
And whose fault is it that there aren't any usable frames on the Elmo~
Now I have to lower myself to using this body~
Lower myself, who the heck even says that...

Still, being able to float around like this feels nice. Looks like the stuff I left behind back then has pretty good performance. With just a quick modification, it can interface with beacon signals; now I can contact the Elmo no matter how far away you are~
So you're saying... You're going to head out with us in Dinergate form?
Well, if I stayed on the Elmo by myself, I'm sure you'd be worried about me taking it for a joyride and leaving you homeless~
Oh yeah, I can totally see you doing that...
However...
(I rise from my place in front of the command console and keep my gaze trained on the Dinergate.)
(The Dinergate backs off a little to keep its distance and projects a hologram of Dandelion, as though she's standing in front of me and having a conversation.)
Why are you looking for me now, of all times?
It's already been 10 years, right?
What, did you miss me? Did you think I was too late~
I just learned that Paradeus wasn't completely destroyed, and right after that, you show up. The timing seems a little too much of a coincidence to me.
You're still as sharp as ever, even though you've been wasting away out here in the boonies for 10 years~
(I don't bother keeping up the banter with her. Instead, I wait for her to continue speaking.)
Commander, why did you throw everything away and abandon everyone for 10 years?
You should know the reason why.
Of course~ Because you didn't want to "get your hands dirty"~
But you do know that doing so cost you the ability to change things, right? Is that really okay?

A lot of people think what you did was incredibly stupid. They believe that if you had just continued on your previous path, you'd be in a position of power now, instead of being bullied by Varjagers in the Yellow Zone. Do you think they're right?

At first, I thought you wouldn't put up with this injustice for long. But now, 10 years have passed in the blink of an eye and you've endured shame that normal people would not have been able to bear, with no intention of compromising in the slightest.
Because of your sacrifice, all of the people under you, humans and Dolls, ended up living pretty good lives.
I was definitely not expecting to hear those words from you. Are you trying to persuade me to go back?
Of course not, you'd thoroughly resent me if I did~
Damn straight.
However, it seems that you couldn't achieve your original aim despite going rogue to do it, and the target you were truly aiming for was never exposed.
