The time was not yet ripe over the past 10 years, but now "she" has come to see me, so perhaps it is time for everything to be turned around.
"She", you say...
Yes. Even if you don't believe me, you can believe "her", right?
(I hesitate briefly, but in the end I ask the question in my heart.)
And what does "she" want me to do?
(Dandelion smiles and shakes her head before raising a finger to her lips.)
She is just a silent observer. The important thing is, what do YOU want to do?
Leaving aside that pointless hatred, leaving aside that meaningless humiliation, what do YOU want to do after stagnating for 10 years?
(Dandelion looks in my eyes and I meet her gaze. There seems to be an inescapable power in them, forcing me to remember something that I've been trying to forget.)
Or do you think not doing anything at all would be the best choice?
(It's obviously not the best choice, but right now, do I have the grounds to reply like that?)
(The communicator beeps. I hesitate for a moment, but in the end I pick it up.)
Commander, the battle plan and combat supplies are ready. Do you want to conduct the briefing?
(I glance at Dandelion. She shrugs, then shuts off her Dinergate's holo-projection, as though to say we'll have lots of time to discuss this later.)
(I shake my head, then take a deep breath before giving Groza her orders.)
Alright. Have them come over to the ops room.
(The drone takes off from the Elmo's landing pad, and soon the massive Elmo is nothing more than a tiny speck on the ground.)
(Helena and Colphne are on one side of the drone, while the box-form of Helena's transformed defense systems and I are on the other side.)
(Inside the Dinergate's body, Dandelion sprawls over a nearby crate. She taps its surface curiously, as though she's looking for a way to open it.)
(The drone pierces through the cloud cover and the air begins to clear up. I take off my gas mask and the morning sunlight is slightly dazzling as it illuminates my face.)
(However, it is not an unpleasant feeling. On the contrary, I actually like it. Seeing the morning sun makes me think that everything is full of hope.)
(I turn to look at Colphne. She's helping Helena to adjust her safety belt so she feels more comfortable.)
(Meanwhile, Helena is looking around curiously. All this is new to her.)
(That's just as well. I was worried Helena would be afraid of flying, but it seems my worries were unfounded.)
(Just as I think this, I hear Mayling's voice over my earpiece.)
Commander, we're in cruise mode now. We're about an hour away from our destination, the intercontinental railway transfer station.)
Make sure you fly us well, Mayling. It took me a long time to get this drone back into flying condition.
I... Of course I will, Commander!

The drone will touch down some distance away from the train station. Miss Dandelion said she upgraded the Dinergate's functions, so you can use the beacons' comm systems to contact the Elmo at any time.
Got it. Thanks, Mayling, I'll be counting on you to get us there and land us.
(I end the transmission and turn to look at the Dinergate that's engaged in amusing itself.)
(I suddenly realize that this isn't any kind of upgrade at all.)
I mean, you're basically just making use of your permissions to access the URNC beacon channels, right?
Aw, if it really bothers you that I'm using public property for private purposes, I can always get RKN to send you the bill for long-distance broadband network signal~
Sounds like this Dinergate before me would make a killing if I sold it to the underground brokers. Think it could cover the bill?
Even if you sell me off, you'll never be rid of me~
Ahem, let's talk about something else instead.
Sure, such as?
For instance... How much do you know about Helena?

While the information we collected beforehand already suggested it, I suspect that she's not a fully-immune individual. The only thing we can be certain of is that she's related to Paradeus in some way. Surely there's no way you're entirely ignorant of this, right?
Aw, am I really that all-seeing and all-powerful in your eyes?
Unfortunately, I'm not as idle as you, Commander. I don't have the time to investigate this matter.
While you were slacking off for 10 years, I was working on the development and maintenance of the URNC's fully-automated internal planning and management system.
How's that? Impressive, huh?
So tell me, oh endlessly busy Madam Dandelion who is involved in great endeavors, where DO you find the time to come down here and cosplay a Dinergate?
That's because I have a capable junior who is my pride and joy~
Don't forget, OGAS is very good at differentiating and evolving~
I upgraded daughter forks of my virtual cognition image and had them learn and grow until they became autonomous intelligences who could work on my behalf~
So you created a few clones of yourself in order to slack off, is that it?
Commander, I am in awe of how you can can reduce something so complex and grand to a banal triviality in just a few short words~
Aw, you're making me blush.
Back then, even the URNC's top brass had to queue for a whole week just to meet me~
Goodness, there might not be anyone in all the URNC who could do this instead of me.
Huh... Is that so?
Want to know how I did it?
Um... I'm kind of clueless about technical stuff...
I'll bet Persica would love to talk shop with you, though.
What a shame. Let's discuss something else, then.
In short, while I've lost certain authorizations and permissions, I don't need to remain stuck in the central hub system any more~
And while I don't know that much about Helena, this device over here is most interesting~
Is this an automated defensive sytem?

Yup yup. It's made with extremely high-grade parts and its makeup is also very interesting. The internal barrier design is very unique, to the point where I want to try and crack it to see what's inside~
What happens if you get in?
I'll be able to control the defense system like I do this Dinergate, of course~
(So after cosplaying Dinergates, Dandelion's going to cosplay a box next?)
(While the notion comes to mind, I decide not to speak it out loud lest I get scolded.)
This defense system is very powerful. It would help me out a lot if you could control it.
Huh—
(The Dinergate's eye-like main camera whirs and narrows, as though it's gotten some kind of wicked idea.)
I'll hold off for the moment, then. We can't have you getting into the habit of relying on others and becoming lazy, Commander~
...Thank you.

(Once again, I turn to look at Helena. Colphne's head is down as she's checking her systems. I hit the PTT on my communicator twice to indicate that she should patch into the channel, and Colphne obliges.)
What's wrong, Commander?
Helena's going to be spending a long time out of the contamination zone this time round. Is she alright?
I brought some nutrient supplements along, they ought to help keep her body functioning.
Also, I modified my Remolding Pattern. Now it can dispense Collapse particles for Helena to absorb. That way her body won't degenerate too quickly.
Miss Lenna also promised us that there would be places in the cities along our way where we could treat Helena's condition. She'll coordinate with us as we move.
Good. We need to be prepared.
(Helena begins gesticulating wildly upon seeing Colphne talk to me.)
(Although I can't make out what she's saying over the roar of the engines, it's immediately obvious that she's trying to tell Colphne that she wants in on the conversation.)
(As expected, the moment Colphne puts a headset on Helena's ears, her voice immediately comes onto the channel.)
Commander! Sky, pretty!
Not like, on the ground!
If all the Collapse contamination were cleared away, we'd be able to see things like this on the surface too.
I see...
So when, cleared away?
That is a mystery. Surely the great and mighty URNC will finish that task someday.
(Helena tilts her head from where she's sitting on the other side of the drone. Perhaps the topic was too complicated for her, but she decides to just skip over it entirely.)
Feels like, going out, on holiday!
Do you know what a holiday is?
N-no, I don't...
Colphne taught me!
I knew it...
(A holiday, hm...)
(That's a wonderful word that's completely unconnected to my current situation.)
Colphne, have you ever been on a holiday?
As if Dolls could go on holiday. I read about it in a book.
However, the Commander can take us aaaalllll on holiday in the future~
Holiday, holiday, everyone on holiday!
Haha... If only we had the money for that...
Helena seems to be in high spirits today.
That's because you're here, Commander. Helena has always enjoyed being around you.
It's like you've got a daughter, even though you haven't tied the knot yet~
Quiet, you...
(Dandelion seizes the opportunity to slip into the conversation and begins telling them all about my various dorky scandals from Griffin until they're doubled over in laughter.)
(I quickly change the subject, clearly because I'm worried they'll fall off the drone from laughing too hard. Yes, that's it.)
(Dandelion then talks about one of our previous missions. They are so shocked by the tale of the Dolls' battles and sacrifices that they can't even speak.)
(This time, I don't interrupt her. I silently listen as Dandelion narrates the past, and the faces of all my past friends and comrades come into view.)
(The drone is flying serenely through the sky, and the sky is slowly brightening from the pink of dawn.)
(At great length, Dandelion finally finishes telling her story. Colphne's voice sounds a little choked-up over the comm channel.)
I didn't know you went through all that, Commander...
It was all in the past.
Commander, amazing!
Haha... I'm not that amazing...
There you go again, Commander. You get embarrassed when a girl praises you, even when it's a young one doing it.
That sounds really wrong...
Uwah... do you like them young, Commander?
Oh, not necessarily, I believe the Commander's preferences are very comprehensive, otherwise they wouldn't be so indecisive on that particular topic~
Hey!
(I reach out to try and grab the Dandelion-gate, but she nimbly evades me.)
(She hovers just barely out of reach of my arm's maximum attention, and as I am still secured in my seat, all I can do is glower impotently at her to indicate my displeasure.)
Commander, we're almost there. Please remember to put on your mask. The drone is about to descend.
Got it. Alright everyone, settle down and prepare to descend.
(Mayling's voice draws me back to my task, and after hearing her, the others stop messing around too.)
(I put my mask back on and signal to everyone to get ready to land.)
(Colphne checks her safety belt, then helps Helena check hers, while the Dinergate attaches itself securely to the defense system's box.)
(The drone slowly sinks into the cloud cover. Although I can't see the surface, I have the feeling that we're not far from our destination.)
(Just as I'm prepared for the descent, Colphne's voice reaches my ear and my terminal indicates it's a private transmission.)
Commander... If Helena gets cured during this trip to Kyiv, will she come back with us?
Probably not. Someone will protect her and take her to a safer place.
Is that so... It'll be a little lonely, then...
(For a moment, I'm at a loss for how to respond. After a brief silence, Colphne continues speaking.)
But that's definitely a good thing, right?
In the story Dandelion told just now, you saved a lot of people, so it's the same as well this time. We saved her, right?
(I'm briefly at a loss for words.)
("There were a lot of people I didn't manage to save...")
(That's what I want to say, but even though I open my mouth, I can't bring myself to say those words.)
(I reflexively look at Helena, but she has none of her excitement from before. In fact, she seems to be in a daze.)
(Colphne also notices Helena's unusual behavior and speaks to her in a concerned tone.)
Helena, are you okay?
Are you not feeling well?
...There's... There's a voice...
(Helena does not answer Colphne's question. I can hear her muttering quietly to herself over the channel.)
(Just as I'm about to speak to her, the drone suddenly starts shaking violently and I immediately realize it is caused by the shaking of the box beside me.)
What's going on?
Commander, the defense system is changing form!
(The Dinergate breaks free of its attachment and flies into mid-air to avoid being hit by the box's shaking.)
There's a voice that sounds the same as me... It sounds familiar...
It's like before... But this time, it doesn't hurt...
Did something happen to Helena?
Looks like she can hear something that we can't...
Helena, what's with you?!
(Colphne looks worriedly at Helena, but Helena ignores her, instead gazing into the depths of the clouds.)
Over there...
(The box instantly transforms into the three spheres and I hurry to grab the Dinergate as the shockwave of the transformation tosses it aside.)
(The spheres fly over to Helena, slice her free of her safety belts and carry her into the air.)
(Colphne tries to grab her, but Helena nimbly avoids her.)
(After glancing coldly at Colphne, Helena flies free of the drone, ensconced within the embrace of her spheres, and swiftly disappears into the clouds.)
(The disruption from the spheres makes the drone shake violently and I hold on tight to the handrails to try and keep my balance.)
Commander! What happened?!
The drone suddenly lost flight stability!
Helena... She flew away!
Flew away?!
(The unbalanced drone goes into a flat spin and plummets toward the ground.)
(I glance at the propellor next to me and see that it's constantly shifting its pitch and orientation. Clearly, Mayling is doing her best to keep the drone aloft.)
(All I can do now is let Mayling handle things. I hold onto the handrail for dear life, and the blood surging into my brain makes me feel like I'm going to puke my guts out.)
Commander!
Hold on tight! Don't fall off!
(Through the corner of my narrowed eyes, I see Colphne clinging for dear life to the handrails.)
(The wind is blowing so hard I can barely open my eyes. I channel all my strength into sticking the Dinergate to the drone so I can free up a hand to cling ever tighter to the handrail.)
Pull up. PULL UP!
(Mayling yells over the comm channel. I've never heard her yell that loud before.)
(Perhaps her angry yelling had an effect, because the drone manages to adjust its propellers' pitch and the drone slowly stops its spinning.)
(As we regain lift, the drone climbs hard, forcing me to change position so I don't feel so uncomfortable.)
(At long last, the drone's flight path levels out and my blood begins flowing normally again. I take big gulps of air as I try to recover from my stressed state.)
(Everything happened far too suddenly and we're all confused. However, I know our current priority is getting Helena back.)
W-well done, Mayling...
Commander, are you alright?
I'll take more killing yet.
Colphne, can you track Helena's location?
(Just in case, I had Colphne put a tracker on Helena. Who would have expected that it would come in handy even before we touched down.)
Hang on... I can still track her!
Send Mayling the coordinates. Mayling, take us there!
O-Okay!
Mayling, can you see the coordinates?
Helena's position is constantly changing. I need you to keep refreshing the location data!
Got it, leave it to me!
(The drone immediately changes course and begins flying in another direction.)
(My brain kicks into high gear. Was our information leaked? Are we going to get ambushed again?)
(But this time, it was Helena herself who did it. Or does the problem lie with Helena?)
She can hear something that we can't.
Perhaps Helena has something in common with those Nytos we've seen before.
(The Dinergate that's attached to the drone looks my way. Her tone isn't as teasing as before, which is a sign of Dandelion's reliable side.)
I thought so too... When we first received her, the words Helena_O43 were written inside her box's logs.
Can you help me gather information regarding that?
I'm on it, but I don't have much processing power bandwidth, so it'll take time.
Alright, I'll leave it to you.
(Mayling's skilful piloting and the drone's high-speed flight quickly brings us out of the cloud cover.)
(Looking down, we can see the glow from Helena's spheres in the distance.)
(There are flashes coming from the ground where Helena is firing. I squint and see an intense firefight taking place, against a not-too-large monster.)
Is that... a Boojum?!
Mayling, head for the Boojum. Descend as you go!
Once you reach 100 meters AGL, begin orbiting the Boojum so we can observe the situation!
Will do, Commander!
(The drone rapidly descends, and after going lower, I get a clearer picture of the situation on the ground.)
(The not-too-large Boojum has just flipped over a vehicle belonging to a squad of armed troops, and the forces around it are blasting it with weapons of various calibers.)
(The Boojum is heavily wounded from the attacks, but it does not move from its place, as though it's protecting something.)
(It's located in what seems like a small town, but the town seems to have been abandoned for a long time, and the ravages of war have only made it even more run-down.)
(The point of light representing Helena is flying over to the Boojum. We try to follow it, but some of the armed troopers firing on the Boojum actually turn and shoot at the drone instead.)
(Bullets whiz past my ear, and with no recourse available to me, I have to ask Mayling to pull up.)
What the heck is with these people?!
We'll land first, Mayling. Circle around to where they can't hit us and then set us down!
I... I'm on it! Now searching for a landing site!
(The point of light containing Helena is now extremely close to the Boojum, but we are forced to land further away due to gunfire from the ground.)

(Mayling picks a fairly high clod of dirt as her landing spot. Before she can fully touch down, I've already ripped my safety belt off and jumped down from the drone. Colphne and the Dinergate follow me.)
(The troopers who saw the drone land begin to encircle us, and I am forced to draw my sidearm to engage them.)
Dammit... this was not at all what I was expecting.
Things don't look good, Commander...
Don't worry, compared to the Commander's previous encounters, this wouldn't even rate No. 5 on the "things don't look good" scale.
Plus, we haven't even gotten to the SNAFU, TARFU and FUBAR categories yet~
What a shocker! Is that true?!
That's enough smug out of you. How are the surroundings?
We've got about 20 hostiles approaching. Let's see if your skills have dulled over the past 10 years~
20 of them... Eh, I'll manage.
Can you do anything besides scouting and scannng?
Well, as you can see I am currently just a feeble Dinergate. The only thing that separates me from other Dinergates is the fact that I can fly~
Naturally, I already sent a distress signal to the Dolls who can help us, but then you would have had to wait half a day for them to arrive, no?
Wow, what a great help you are. Half a day means they'll be just in time to find my cooling corpse.
(Even if the drone went back right away to pick up Groza and the others, they'd take at least two hours to arrive. Looks like I can only rely on myself right now.)
(I look at my handgun and regret not bringing something with a longer range, but there's no point thinking about that now.)
(Since the enemy doesn't know about our situation, our only chance is to hammer them hard and throw them back with speed and violence of action.)
Colphne! Get ready for battle!
Dandelion, keep up!
The enemy's been beaten back, Commander. What should we do now?
Follow me. Keep advancing.
(As I look in Helena's direction, I see a distant point of light flashing in all directions. Helena's automatic defense systems are firing wildly at those armed units.)
(The Boojum isn't far from Helena, but it doesn't look like it intends to attack her.)
(Her defense systems are laying down suppressive fire on her attackers. The Boojum takes advantage of this and rampages wildly, knocking over multiple vehicles armed with heavy weapons.)
(While I picked up a rifle from the enemy along the way, it's little more than a drop in the bucket considering the situation we're facing.)
(I have no idea what might happen next and I don't have enough resources on hand.)
(All I can do is stick to cover and approach Helena's location, gathering as much intel as I can to try and formulate a solution.)
(As I see the Dinergate orbiting over my head, I suddenly think of something.)
Dandelion, you just said you could break through the barriers of the defensive system, right?
If you can bring me within 50 meters of them, I can force a connection to those systems.
How confident are you of doing that?
Well, this Dinergate has limited processing power, and considering I'll have to do it all remotely, I guess there's about a 50% chance of success.
That's enough.
Mayling, can you observe Helena's surroundings from the drone?
Sure thing! I can see everything!
Helena's still engaging those armed troops on the ground. She's slowly taking them out!
Find me a path that's free of enemies. We need to get as close to Helena as possible!
O-okay! Right away!
(A route soon appears on my terminal. I pick up another rifle from the ground and toss it to Colphne.)
Use this for now, it's handier than a pistol. Just hose the enemy down with suppressive fire afterwards.
We need to buy Dandelion time.
O-Okay!
Wow, is this what you're like when you fight in person, Commander?!
If you've got any better ideas, now's the time to bring them up.
N-no, I don't!
Then follow me. Dandelion, we'll need scans of the surroundings for enemies. Mark any hostiles that approach us.
Aw, feels just like old times.
(The Dinergate flies ahead of us and clears out a path. With Mayling's directions and Dandelion highlighting enemy positions, we quickly eliminate the scattered troopers that we encounter.)
(After passing through an open area, Colphne and I jump into a pit that's deep enough to provide us with cover.)
(This place isn't far from Helena. The Boojum's deafening roars remind us of how close we are to danger. Worse still, greenish clouds are closing in from the distance.)
Commander, there's an incoming Collapse storm, you need to hurry!
Tsk... Dandelion, we're moving in to hack the defense systems. Can you control them and bring Helena down?
It won't be hard once I gain control privileges over them.
Alright. Bring Helena down on top of that building there afterwards.
(I point to a nearby abandoned building. It is within 50 meters of Helena.)
Colphne, cover me from here. I'll go there to get Helena.
No, Commander! Let me go!
(Just as I'm about to jump out of the pit, Colphne grabs me by the sleeve and pulls me back in.)
The Boojum's too close! It's too dangerous for you, Commander!
And besides... Protecting Helena is my duty!
Commander, you should just stay here and give commands!
You're just one Doll, it's not like commanding you is going to be difficult...
(I check my ammo. I have two magazines left, including the one I picked up on the way here.)
We should focus our firepower. Come on, let's go!
Um... Okay!
Wow, you're brave. I like that~
Just keep up!
(Fortunately, there aren't many armed troops left in this area and we can pass through practically unhindered.)
(Soon, we're inside the building. It's only two stories high and half of it has already collapsed. I kick open the rotten wooden door on the top floor and we arrive on the roof.)
(We aren't too high up, but it's enough for us to see Helena's side of the battlefield.)
Dandelion, I'm counting on you!
Roger roger~
(The Dinergate that has been accompanying us turns to fly toward Helena.)
(The Boojum is right beside her. Perhaps it's afraid of her defense systems, but it's been keeping outside of their light. Helena remains motionless in mid-air, as though she's lost consciousness.)
(The Dinergate rapidly approaches Helena, and as they sense the approach of an interloper, the autonomous defenses flare with light and begin firing deadly beams at the Dinergate.)
(However, Dandelion's hacking is severely disrupting the enemy's systems as she approaches and the Dinergate easily avoids the fired beams.)
(The spheres begun to waver and they stop shooting. The Dinergate boldly flies up to Helena and begins to examine her.)
This girl...
I will save you—
Who's she talking to?
(The orbs shake harder and harder. Their firewalls are unable to resist Dandelion's hacking, and in the space of a few seconds, Dandelion has assumed direct control over the defense system.)
Do you have friends that you can't abandon either?
I can't... I can't leave them behind...
In any case, just come back to us first.
(Dandelion controls the orbs, then brings them and Helena back to the building where we are. Colphne can't help but exclaim in approval.)
I can't believe she took care of it in an instant...
Well, it's Dandelion, after all.
Looks like you owe me again, Commander~
(Helena isn't far from us now. Colphne is at the observation point, preparing to retrieve her.)
(However, Helena is still looking at the Boojum. Then she gives voice to a heart-rending wail, to the point where even I can hear what she's saying.)
NO!
I CAN'T LEAVE THOSE KIDS BEHIND!
(Helena is screaming things that don't sound at all like what she would say. They hit me like an invisible shockwave, even making me feel a little dizzy.)
(In the distance, the Boojum seems to hear Helena's cry and immediately abandons its battle with the armed troops, rushing toward us at incredible speeds.)
What—
Hurry! Faster!

(The Dinergate leads Helena toward us, flying faster than her. Colphne throws her rifle aside and spreads her arms in a defensive posture, ready to physically cushion the impact of Helena's fall with her body.)
(However, the Boojum emits a blood-curdling scream and speeds up again as it charges right for us.)
Oh no... We're not going to make it in time!

(As she sees that the Boojum is about to crash into the building, Colphne throws me out of the building with all her might. In that moment of weightlessness, the Boojum's massive body crashes into the building and swallows up Colphne and Helena's forms.)
(I hit the ground hard, and with the last of my stamina, I see the Boojum winding between the buildings and heading into the distance.)
Commander, are you alright?!
Commander, can you hear me?!
(I hear Mayling frantically hailing me through my earpiece, but I'm out of strength to answer and my thinking grinds to a halt.)
They... they're all gone...
Those guys were really strong...
Everyone, are you alright?
Damage is minimal. It shouldn't be a problem.
Fortunately, they didn't have too many people. It would have been troublesome if they came in the same numbers as the Varjagers.
Colphne said something about fighting them before this, so maybe that's why they only had this many people left?
That's certainly possible...
These people are much better fighters than the Varjagers and they've got very good gear.
(Zhaohui scrutinizes their equipment, trying to find some hint as to their identities.)
They don't have any identifying marks on them beyond the Mangi Security logo on their armor.
Their weapons are all new, they've got a full set of accessories, their armors are equipped with air filters, you can tell right away that they're designed for use in contamination zones.
But they were speaking just now, so... are those dead people in that armor?
(Just to confirm, Daiyan takes the helmet off one of the troopers who was killed.)
(He's been shot in the head. The inside of his helmet is covered in blood and gore. Though it's a grisly sight, there's no doubt that he was alive until recently.)
They're probably standard PMC fighters.
But normal PMCs wouldn't go up against the Commander, right?
Speaking of which, why were they trying to capture Helena?
I'm not sure either... They just shot at us out of nowhere. Perhaps they're working with the previous faction that was trying to kidnap Helena.
Wait, there were people trying to kidnap Helena before this?
Going into the details might take a while... In any case, the Commander got the assignment to escort Helena from a person called Kalina, and people have been trying to kidnap Helena all this while.
Miss Kalina, you say?
(Daiyan and Jiangyu look surprised.)
Is Kalin involved in this too?
If it's an assignment from Miss Kalina and she gave it to the Commander to carry out, then it must be very important.
Miss Colphne, why don't we head to that location ASAP?
Yeah, it's just over here.
(Colphne tracks the signal on her terminal, and as the signal begins moving, she spots a cargo elevator nearby.)
(The elevator isn't very big, with only half-height fences for cover, and the elevator shaft vanishes into the darkness below.)
(The Dolls get onto the elevator, which groans with a thunderous bass roar as it slowly descends with them on it.)
Big Sis, doesn't this remind you of that one mission we went on back in Griffin?
Yeah... If I'm not wrong, we were at a submarine base...
We were fighting on the base perimeter back then, but this time we get to go on an elevator ride!
You seem happy.
I'm just trying to lighten the mood, okay...
(Colphne looks into the depths of the pitch-black tunnel without saying a word. She understands that everyone here is feeling uneasy.)
(However, the blinking icon on her communicator tells her that Helena is somewhere below her, and thus she must keep going.)
(After realizing her attempt at cheering everyone up has failed, Jiangyu doesn't say anything else. The Dolls began watching the surroundings, in case they're ambushed.)
(However, nothing happens.)
(As the elevator descends, a strange smell fills the air.)
(Freakish-looking vegetation made of meat grows rampant on the corridors on either side of the lift. Exposed cabling merges with the plants and snakes everywhere.)
(Perhaps she's just imagining things, but as they continue downward, the surrounding temperature seems to get lower.)
The Collapse particle intensity in this place is rising.
Yeah... I can feel it.
(Colphne's terminal screen is coated in frost. She tries to wipe it off and sees that the height of the target coordinates are slowly matching up with her own position.)
(Suddenly, the lift arrives at the bottom level with a "doink" and the huge gates before her slowly grind open.)
Is this... a warehouse?
Looks like a pretty messed-up warehouse to me.
Ugh...

(Countless square glass tanks that are half the height of a person are piled up messily against the walls of the room. The ones on the left contain some unidentifiable plant, while the ones on the right hold various twisted bodies.)
(The tanks are engraved with what appear to be some kind of spell incantation on them and the walls are covered in indescribable designs, but the Dolls immediately recognize one of them.)
Paradeus...
(That symbol is one that no Griffin Doll could ever forget. Colphne can't help but cover her mouth as she sees what's happening around her, and Zhaohui frowns from her place off to the side.)
Were the missing people that that police officer was talking about all taken here?
A single transfer station wouldn't have that much "capacity". They must have been brought here from various locations.
I... I can't believe there were so many...
Is this Paradeus...
(Colphne finally realizes why the Commander was acting so strange just now, and she tightens her grip on her weapon. Disgust churns in the depths of her neural cloud.)
The Collapse particles are emitted from plants, but... Why were they placed with these corpses?
Perhaps... They're trying to pickle—
(Jiangyu immediately clams up the moment she realizes her faux pas, but the other Dolls understand what she means.)
(All the Dolls are eager to get out of this room that's lined with glass tanks, but it feels like an endless corridor.)
(It takes a long time before they manage to stride to the end of the room.)
Hey, is that light up ahead?
(The only thing at the end of the room is a rot-eaten door. A faint light leaks through from the gap below it.)
(Meanwhile, unsettling whispers can be heard through the door, which spooks the Dolls even more.)
I can hear something... Let's be careful while moving in.
(The Dolls crouch low, then gently push open the door at the end of the room.)
(It leads to an open space. The char of candles blends with the stink of gore and hits them square in the face.)
(The whispering becomes clearer, and as it repeats over and over again, the Dolls can make out what it says.)
(May deformity be exchanged for purity; if you must pass wisdom on to this sinful world, then may my form be the medium—)
(Wisdom is like unto a curse; if this world does not deserve a blessing, then may my form atone for it—)
(For the flesh is but a shell; if blessing is to be shared with all things, may my form be how they are joined—)
(A sonorous liturgy comes from the distance. Several dozen Unitates in long robes recite verses over and over again from where they're standing around a deep, steep pit.)
(Meanwhile, the girl standing in the middle leads their prayer, her voice the loudest and brightest of them all.)
This is the final offering—
(The Dolls duck into the shadows, looking into the pit, where a monster breathes its last inside the pit.)
Is that... a Boojum?
That's the one which attacked us just now!
Helena's signal is down there...
Was Helena swallowed up by the Boojum?!
(A look of shock appears on Colphne's face and she immediately tries to run out of the shadows and toward the pit.)
(Daiyan and Jiangyu frantically grab her and drag her back.)
Let go of me! I need to save her!
Helena's right there! Let me save her!
Please calm down, Miss Colphne!
That's a big monster out there! Are you planning to jump down and commit suicide?
But... But I...!
Don't worry, I'm sure there'll be a way to do it... Let's observe the situation more carefully!
(The girl slams her staff on the ground and the loud noise it makes draws everyone's attention.)
May deformity be exchanged for purity; if you must pass wisdom on to this sinful world, then may my form be the medium—
(Cries of fear come from among the Unitates, but their bodies continue marching up to the pit. Their trembling is visible even through their robes as terror echoes among the congregation.)
Wisdom is like unto a curse; if this world does not deserve a blessing, then may my form atone for it—

(The Unitates pull out daggers in trembling hands and point them toward their own throats. Some people try to struggle against this, but their bodies do not heed their commands, as though they were not in control of their actions.)
For the flesh is but a shell; if blessing is to be shared with all things, may my form be how they are joined—
(The daggers plunge in forcefully, just as the Unitates fall into the pit along with their blood. The dull thud of their bodies hitting the ground rouses the monster at the base of the pit.)
(The twisted monster writhes at the base of the pit. Covered in wounds, it looks like it's barely hanging on to life as it strains to drag itself over to the fallen bodies.)
(Upon touching the Boojum, the corpses meld into its bodies. The three orbs begin circling around the monster, as though they're protecting something.)

(A massive plant coils around the Boojum's tail, binding it to the base of the pit. The Boojum emits a shrill cry from time to time, sounding like a howl of pain and a roar of anger at the same time.)
So this Boojum... wasn't formed naturally?
Paradeus is feeding their followers to Boojums?
That... that's disgusting...
(The group shifts their attention from the Boojum to the girl by the pit. She seems to be smiling happily, like she's at an amusement park.)
Where you have Paradeus, there's bound to be Nytos.
This one ought to be Niter.
Niter?
Yeah, we fought Paradeus before this, and this one looks just like the Niter we met earlier.
Is she a mutant Nyto or something? We ought to be having a really hard time beating a Nyto with our present weaponry.
According to our previous experience, Niter isn't a particularly strong fighter. She's more like... a Doll.
(Colphne lowers her head, then raises her weapon like she's made up her mind before addressing everyone.)
The Boojum hasn't fully recovered yet, this is the best chance for us!
If we kill Niter, nobody can stop us from saving Helena!
(Colphne fires at Niter before anyone can stop her, but the bullet does no harm to Niter. It is as though it had vanished into thin air.)
(Niter whirls around in rage, slamming her staff into the ground. A loud echo fills the air, followed by an angry shout from her.)
The time of blessing has not yet arrived! You shall not profane this sanctuary with your insolence!
Everyone, get ready for battle! Be careful as you face the enemy!

(The ringing in my ears interferes with my perceptions, and I don't know how long has passed until I finally regain some sensation in my body. Fortunately, the aches and pain coursing through my body is a reminder that I am alive.)
(I sense the weight on my body lessening. Somebody is moving the stones on top of me away, one by one.)
(The world in my eyes goes from a neon-esque blur to clarity, and a petite form slowly comes into view.)
He... lena?
(The person before me is Helena. She does not answer, only stands aside, watching me fearfully.)
(I look at her dust-covered hands and realize just who moved those stones aside.)
(I cough and spit up the dust and dirt in my mouth.)
(Then, I take stock of my body. I can't quite seem to exert any strength in my left arm. Looks like it's been dislocated.)
(I prop myself up with my right arm, then look around.)
Commander, are you awake?
(Dandelion's voice enters my ears. Her cheerful tone pulls me back to reality from my daze.)
(Considering that she's talking like this, I'm probably not going to be dying anytime soon.)
(I grit my teeth against the pain and slip my dislocated left arm back into position, then test my legs. Fortunately, there don't seem to be any life-threatening injuries, although they ache.)
(The Dinergate floats around me as it scans my body, and then it hovers in front of me again.)
Looks like you've been taking good care of your body over the past 10 years. The worst injury you got from being flung out of a window was a dislocated arm.
Vital signs are all within normal ranges. It won't interfere with upcoming operations.
(Coughs) I'm just glad to be alive.

(I look around. My surroundings are a mess, and the rickety building that the Boojum hit has completely collapsed. The surrounding area is littered with the corpses of armed personnel who were killed in the firefight just now.)
(I reflexively reach for my gun, but the cool sensation I expect is not there.)
(The Dinergate's eye seems to shine as it sees my hand reaching for my gun.)
Relax, I checked your surroundings while you were out. As you can see, there isn't a single soul around here, so you don't have to worry about being attacked again.
However...
(The Dinergate flies a little higher and looks into the distance. As I follow Dandelion's gaze, I see a big patch of dark greenish clouds not far away from us.)
Dammit... Is the Collapse storm that close already...
Fortunately, I found you quickly enough. Otherwise you'd be enjoying another full immersion in a Collapse storm.
Just as I was wondering how to dig you out of there, this little girl showed up~
(The Dinergate glances at Helena, who's still looking at us with a frightened look on her face.)
(While I have a ton of questions I want to ask her, it would be best to get out of here first.)
(There isn't much time left. I need to decide what to do right away.)
(I carefully recall everything that happened just now.)
(Dandelion took over Helena's defense systems, but just as we were about to grab Helena, the Boojum suddenly changed course and slammed into the building we were in.)
(Colphne threw me out the window and saved my life—)
Dandelion, where's Colphne?!
I saw her being coiled up by the Boojum, along with Helena. She isn't responding to my hails, but I can try to track her location.
Her coordinates indicate that she's some distance away from us, and she hasn't moved in a long time.
Dammit... We need to find her.
I knew you'd say that, Commander~
However, shouldn't we be focusing on how to survive right now?
Can you contact the Elmo?
The Collapse storm is almost here, what do you think?
The last time we had signal, I told Mayling to bring the drone back. Hopefully it'll save some time when comms are restored.
This storm sure picked a great time to come by...
I would suggest we find a place to take cover. Otherwise we'll be sporting a new crystalline look in a few minutes~
Are there any suitable locations nearby?
There are some non-sealed buildings. Probably won't provide much in the way of actual protection, but having something is better than nothing.
Fortunately Helena is a quasi-fully-immune individual and this isn't your first time being exposed to highly contaminated environments, so you should be fine~
Will it really be okay...
(A look of hesitation briefly crosses Helena's face, but in the end she works up her courage and walks up to me and the Dinergate.)
This way...
What's wrong, Helena?
Go this way...
(After pointing in the way she wants me to go, Helena runs off into the distance. After a while, she stops to look back at us, then keeps moving ahead.)
Is Helena headed for safety?
How does she know which places are safe?
You can ask that question when you've reached safety~
(I force myself to my feet. Looking back, the ruins under the thick dark clouds look like a massive graveyard.)
(There's no time for me to spend on contemplation. I begin moving in the direction where Helena went and get out of here.)
Over here.
(Helena stops in front of a high point on the edge of the ruins.)
(There is a disguised entrance visible near a half-buried slope.)
(Initial inspection of the entrance reveals that it's been well-camouflaged by vegetation and rubble, but looking closer inside shows clear signs of man-made architecture.)
Is this the entrance to an underground broker's base...?
(The inside of the tunnel is much larger than expected. It's big enough for two trucks to drive through it side by side.)
(The Collapse storm outside carries wave after wave of dirt with it. There are no more traces worth investigating on the surface now.)
Looks like you know this stuff really well, Commander~
Could you explain?
They're traders who do business in the contamination zones. Naturally, the URNC views them as smugglers.
Well, these smugglers sure are bold, to have hidden such a big entrance here~
Well, they're brave enough to transport anything from small animals to heavy arms; did you really not know that?
Not at all~
Seriously...

(In theory, Dandelion should probably not know about these people and things that are only found within the contamination zones, but for some reason, I have the feeling she's already familiar with these things.)
(Helena doesn't pay attention to our discussion, Instead, she goes deeper into the tunnel and I run up to grab her shoulder.)
(She turns to me, a troubled look in her eyes. I walk past and in front of her, then shine my torch into the tunnel. It is empty.)
(The shutter to the tunnel is half-open. Once again, Helena ignores me and walks in.)
(Although I can't be sure that it's safe in there, I have no choice but to grit my teeth and head inside.)
(The Dinergate flies into the hole, and then the shutter which looks like it was broken suddenly grinds shut.)
(The interior of the hole lights up and the sound of machinery echoes all around. As I feel the ground below me start to tremble, I realize that I'm standing on an elevator platform.)
Dandelion, give me a scan of our surroundings.
(We are currently descending underground on the elevator. The Dinergate flies in the direction where the platform is headed.)
(I look in the same direction, watchful for any sudden dangers which might come up.)
Did you come to save Helena too?
(Out of nowhere, the hitherto silent Helena looks at me and asks a question without being addressed.)
Yes, of course, we came to save you.
Still... What happened just now? Why did you fly away all of a sudden?
I'm sorry...
Ah... I'm not trying to blame you or anything here, I just wanted to know... What happened just now?
Everyone was tricked... Everyone died...
But Helena came, Helena was saved...
Wait, you were saved?
Yes, in the moment of greatest despair, the call was answered...
(Helena stares at me, like she's trying to commit something to memory.)
Colphne... Dandelion...
And Commander...
I'm here.
I'm scared...
What's scaring you?
I'm scared that you'll vanish too...
(She pauses, then speaks again in an almost imperceptible voice.)
I already have nowhere else to go...
(Frankly speaking, there seems to be something wrong with how Helena is speaking so frankly, but my instincts are telling me not to focus on that.)
(I have the feeling that if I do voice my suspicions, this girl will vanish like a popped soap bubble.)
Did anyone vanish down there?
The people who once stood beside me are gone.
The people who helped me in my struggles are gone.
Everyone has suffered because Helena exists.
However...
However?
The people who answered me should not become the new sacrifice...
(Upon saying this, Helena lowers her head and does not speak further.)
(I go over her words in my head, trying to extract meaning from them.)
(Perhaps all this is related to what just happened here. With that in mind, I begin looking around the surroundings.)
(The elevator and walls are covered in the scars of battle, and it's plain to see they're all quite recent.)
(We encountered those unknown armed men and that Boojum from the time the signal went through until we touched down, so something must have happened here recently.)
(Just as I'm thinking, the Dinergate flies back as the elevator reaches the bottom floor.)
Commander, I have good news and bad news. Which would you like to hear first?
Start with the bad news.
The bad news is that the following scenes might end up inducing stomach distress. However, they are also highly informative, so you'll need to look at them anyway.
Er... And what's the good news?
The good news is that Colphne's signal is on the move. Hopefully, that means her frame is still functioning and we won't need to load her neural cloud from a backup.
How far away from us is she?
Coincidentally enough, Colphne's on the same elevation as us. In other words, she might be in the base.
Since Colphne's in there, then we'll have to go in.
That makes me jealous. Would you come to save me like this if I were in danger?
...Obviously, right?
This answer is very important to me, you know, so don't try to bluff your way through this, Commander~
I hope nobody around me will end up in danger. That includes you too, Dandelion.
And if danger is unavoidable, I will do my best to protect everyone.
That's unfair, Commander.
You're the one that needs our protection the most, after all.
Then let's do our best for each other.
(After our conversation ends, the Dinergate flies up to Helena.)
Can you contact your defense systems?
We could just walk right in with those balls on our side~
(Helena shakes her head.)
You're so defensive, how boring~
(The Dinergate flies a circle around Helena, and Helena warily turns around to face Dandelion throughout her flight.)
Did you do all this?
You smell like something out of this world~
Let's go.
(I guide Helena's hand to my sleeve, but I can't resist giving her a reminder.)
We'll be going deep into the tunnels after this. Things in there might get really dangerous, so make sure you hold on tight to me and don't run off.
When I walk, you walk. When I stop, you stop. When I crouch down, look for cover and hide. If I don't come looking for you, don't come out.
Got that?
(Helena tugs on my sleeve and nods.)
Helena... remembers.
(The enemies are all down. I look around carefully in case someone's waiting to ambush me.)
(The Dinergate's eye flashes a few times. Dandelion's voice speaks; not from the Dinergate's speakers, but directly into my earpiece.)
Looks like the final piece of the puzzle has appeared at last.
What will you do now, Commander?
Well, we've come all the way to an old friend's house now. Might as well sit down, make ourselves comfortable, and see if there's anything valuable around the place.
Looks like this old friend of yours has fallen on tough times.
There's a bunch of raw garbage in the corner, some out-of-place military supplies over there, it looks like they've been reduced to hiring contractors to mind the place.
You should be praised for your work, Commander.
We'll talk about that once we've ripped this cult out by the roots.
That's strange, how come there's nobody keeping watch?
I'm starting to connect the dots here.

So a Boojum appeared nearby. The PMCs appointed as security moved out to eliminate it. In the end, not only could they not beat the monster, but they even ran into us and they ended up getting wiped out.
Well, it's an idea, but it's missing out on a lot of details.
Why did a Boojum show up near a Paradeus stronghold, and why was it that the PMCs had to go and fight the Boojum in said stronghold, since it was underground?
It just doesn't make sense. Unless...
Unless?
Unless the Boojum was escaping this stronghold and fleeing to the surface.
Now there's an interesting guess~
In that case, why did Helena seek that Boojum out? Why doe she act like she knows this place so well?
(The Dinergate looks at Helena, but Helena doesn't notice us gazing at her. Instead, she looks nervously further within.)
This girl has many secrets about her. I'm sure  you must have seen a lot of strange things about her as well, right?
There's no such thing as "too strange" when it comes to fully immune individuals.
In addition to the readily visible oddities, Helena seems to have a strange relationship with the Boojum. Have you noticed that, Commander?
Hmm... I wouldn't have thought of things that way if you hadn't mentioned it.
(I suddenly remember the report that Groza gave me from when we'd just received Helena.)
(Part of it included the details of Helena appearing and the Boojum vanishing, and there just so happened to be a Collapse storm at the time too...)
So you're saying that Helena can attract Boojums?
It's just a guess. This place just so happens to be a Paradeus base; we might be able to find some information that corroborates that theory~
Since you've said as much already, does that mean you've already discovered something?
Since you're so curious, then please follow me, Commander.
(The Dinergate floats before my eyes once again, and after extending its limbs before me in mid-air, it wiggles around a bit before flying further in.)
(It looks like it's trying to do a cat stretch to show how smug it is, but unfortunately, it just comes off looking dorky since it's a Dinergate.)
(I chuckle to myself. It's true that her body's instruments are more reliable in an enclosed environment like this one.)
(I lightly tug on Helena, and she obediently moves forward with me.)

(The terrain here isn't exactly complex. We head down along the staircases, and every time we think we're at the bottom we find a similar-looking platform, beyond which is another staircase leading down.)
(There is no useful information on the first three floors. However, once we pass the platform, the Dinergate suddenly comes to a halt.)
Commander, you should rest here for a while. I'll go take a look up ahead.
Are there enemies?
(I lower my voice and prepare for trouble.)
I'm not sure...
Not sure? What did you find?
(Dandelion is silent for a while. This uncharacteristic behavior sobers me up completely.)
It's strange. I can pick up a heat source, but it's very faint.
Could it be a combat unit using some kind of special equipment?
No... Perhaps I should say... it doesn't seem like a living person?
Huh?
(Dandelion seems to sense my confusion. She uses the projector on the Dinergate she's in to display a visualization of her findings, and I subconsciously hold my breath.)
(The image shows faint, human-shaped heat signatures standing together in an orderly manner, inside what look like four large glass specimen tanks.)
The heat sources do not move, like they are neatly-arranged specimens.
Are they severely radiated mutants?
No. The mutation isn't complete. Normal human vital signs are still present.
I have to hand it to Paradeus, they're always exceeding my expectations.
Commander, wait for me to give you the all clear.
(Before I can give the order, the Dinergate flies deeper in. I can sense Dandelion's emotion through the tone of her voice just now.)
(Time passes, second by second, minute by minute, as I wait anxiously. Just as my patience is about to run out, the Dinergate returns.)
How are things?
You should probably see for yourself.
(Dandelion doesn't answer me directly. I follow the Dinergate to a hidden door.)
(If not for Dandelion's thermal sensors, given the darkened conditions, I would never have been able to tell that there was a door here.)
(The gate's electronic lock is unpowered. It opens with a light push, and the dim ground lights roughly illuminate the interior of the room.)
(It isn't a big room and there are four glass tanks neatly arranged in the middle. The tanks appear to be full of some kind of fluid, and their contents are unclear at the moment.)

Dandelion finds a port on the control terminal and skillfully connects the Dinergate's data cable to it. Upon seeing me slowly approach the tanks to see what's inside, she thoughtfully turns on the tank lights.
(What I see next makes me reflexively draw a breath. The contents of the tanks are displayed to all by the ghastly white light.)

(Each tank is roughly a meter or so in height and covered in clumsy prayers. There is some kind of vegetation whose name I can't tell at the bottom of the tanks, while there are humans of different physiques, looks and ages on the upper portions.)

(The humans and plants are suspended in differently-colored liquids. The top and bottom of each tank has four hoses of different colors leading into them, completing a biocirculatory cycle like blood vessels.)
(Although I was mentally prepared for this, seeing something this creepy still makes me want to throw up.)
(Somewhat worried, I look at Helena, who has followed me in. However, she has placed her hand on the glass, as though she's bidding the people inside a wordless farewell.)
I trust this has made you adequately shocked and angered?

(The Dinergate's data cable connects to the control terminal. The screen immediately fills with folders opening up and their details. Just looking at it makes my head spin. I bet Dandelion's making copies of everything.)
I think you've pretty much guessed it by now.
There is lots of information in the system, which means fully decrypting and analyzing it will take quite a while, so it's better if I just dump it all in my database and crunch it at leisure.
Still, it's not like I've come away empty-handed. Take a look at the serial numbers of these files, Commander.
What are these serial numbers?
These folders contain basic personal information. They aren't encrypted, probably because they don't contain any valuable information.
Still, I managed to pick up some traces.
Take a look at their surnames—
(Dossiers for ten-odd people flash past my eyes. They all have the same surname.)
Wait, they're a family?!
Or maybe they're of the same race...
That would probably be more appropriate.
Only the data for this room is shown here. I did some digging and found out that all the people here had the same surname.
(Something suddenly comes to mind; the place where the Boojum first fought was apparently an abandoned town...)
(There were no residents to be found there, and I thought it was because they had already fled.)
Could it be that everyone in the village had been captured for experiments...
Paradeus... What have those motherfuckers done?!
One word was mentioned repeatedly in the data — "new species".
A fusion of flora and fauna... does that seem familiar?
Wait, could that Boojum be...!
To be precise, I think they're trying to fuse human bodies with varying characteristics with Collapse radiation-infused plants through varying ratios of this unknown fluid?
Hm... There's a lot of missing information. My guess is they're conducting experiments in fusing live humans with plants, using different concentrations of bonding fluid to catalyze the reaction.
The constituents of this bonding fluid are unknown...
Oh... So not entirely human, but with various animals mixed in too...
Humans and plants... animals and plants... humans and animals and plants... Looks like the radiated plants are a crucial carrier medium for these experiments...
And there are also a line of special... implanted cells?
Dandelion, make sure you save all of this.
Will do. I won't miss a single byte.
(Helena silently walks away from the tanks and bows to them.)
Commander, can you help them?
What?
(Helena reaches out and points to the glass tanks. There is a pained look in her eyes.)
(Dandelion does not answer. Only the blinky red light on the Dinergate flashes.)
From the logs, it seems the people in those tanks weren't put in there too long ago.
Can we save them?
They're beyond saving. Their bodies are too deeply fused for that.
From the logs, they look like logistics personnel from Statesec.
They're... from Statesec?
Were they captured by Paradeus...
I can shut off the power to these tanks. That might put an end to the experiments here.
(I glance at Helena and nod silently.)
Let them rest.
Thank you...
(Helena bows to me and Dandelion in the same way.)
(At the same time, I hear an unsettling growl from the depths of the base. There is no doubt that it's the Boojum we just encountered.)
(After hearing the noise, Helena glances at us. Then, she runs into the base without looking back.)
Dandelion, follow us once you finish downloading the data!
(After telling Dandelion what to do, I proceed to give chase. I can sense something is about to happen.)
Ngh!
(Daiyan and the others rain fire on Niter and force her back, but Niter ducks behind cover and avoids taking a fatal blow.)
The appointed time has not yet arrived... Forgive this insult, my Lord, and rain judgement down upon these heretics!
(Niter raises her staff high. It emits a deafening, sinister sound, forcing the Dolls to cover their ears to protect their hearing.)
What's that bitch doing?!
Look out! The Boojum's moving!
(The Boojum seems to have been rejuvenated by the sound. It crawls out of the pit and with all its might, it shrugs off the plants entangling it.)
(Eventually, the Boojum emerges from the pit. Devouring the blood and flesh of the sacrifices restores its strength and the wounds it just took begin to knit together.)
(The Boojum's body is bigger than before, but the monster thrashes around continuously, as though it is unable to control itself.)
(Niter thumps the ground again. The sound makes the Boojum roar again and again, each cry more pained than the last.)
Atop the Boojum, below the three revolving orbs, a shadow vaguely shaped like a girl can be barely made out inside its body.)
HELENA!
I knew it, Helena's in there!
(Colphne can't hold herself back any more and throws caution to the wind as she runs up to the Boojum.)
Give her back! Give Helena back!
(Colphne unloads all her firepower into the Boojum, while the Boojum raises its tentacles in preparation to counterattack.)
Miss Colphne!
(Daiyan rushes out of cover as well, picking off the tentacles trying to smash Colphne with accurate gunfire.)
(Jiangyu and Zhaohui follow behind her. Since there's no way for them to retreat, the Dolls have decided to utterly crush the monster here.)
It can't be helped, Big Sis! We'll all have to attack at once!
Now is our chance to defeat this monster while it's still weakened!
We'll cover Miss Colphne together! Be careful, everyone!
Heretics... Heretics, one and all!
(The Boojum slowly falters under the Dolls' attacks. Nauseating slime gushes from its wounds.)
(Although Niter raps her staff on the ground, the monster seems unwilling to continue attacking the Dolls.)
Did we do it?
We need to keep pressing on... Helena, I'll save you once we kill this monster!
(The Dolls spread out, circling around the Boojum to attack Niter, and a look of despair crosses Niter's face.)
(But just then, the sphere on the Boojum's head start to shine with a blinding light. Niter's face fills with savage glee, as though she's heard something.)
The appointed time is upon us... I knew this was but a trial set before me. I know you would never abandon me! Thank you for answering your servant, my Lord!
(The sphere shine and light slices open the Boojum's body. Helena slowly floats into view, and despite the Boojum's wounds spewing slime everywhere, her body is not touched by any of it.)
(The Boojum howls in agony, but Helena pays it no heed. All she does is glare coldly at Niter.)
(Niter is full of delight as she stands in front of the Boojum. She laughs maniacally as she casts her staff aside and falls to her knees before the monster.)
(However, her face turns pale and twists as she roars in anger.)
You are not her...
You are not her!!!
WHERE IS MY LORD?!
I am here.
(Shocked, Niter turns around and sees the other Helena taking aim at her with a handgun.)
My Lord?
This is from them. I'm returning it to you.
(Helena pulls the trigger and a bullet blasts clean through Niter's torso.)
Why...
I devoted myself to you with the utmost faith...
Then rejoice, for today you will be a martyr.
(Helena does not stop shooting for a moment. She pulls the trigger again and again, pumping more bullets into Niter's head.)
(Niter collapses to the ground and her staff falls with her. The Boojum in front of her collapses as well, as though its spine had been suddenly removed.)
(As I catch up, I come to a halt, staring in shock. I realize that Helena is holding my pistol.)
(Although I can sense something strange happened with her, what I do not expect is that there are two Helenas standing in front of me.)
(The Helena in front of me is raising her gun and pointing it at the Helena in the air. The two of them are silent, simply staring at each other.)
(Shortly afterwards, the Helena in the air speaks first.)
D-68, you were not chosen. What a shame.
I never wanted to be chosen! Everything we believed in was a lie!
Is it?
Was the resonance the only thing that came of the ritual?
She was the one who resonated with me!
She saved me, so get the hell out of her body!
To think you would sacrifice so much just to do something so meaningless.
This is the only place with meaning to it! I want to save the people here!
I was so close to success!
Why... Why was it you again...
You traitor, you betrayed all of us...!
(There is a vicious glint in the eyes of the Helena before us. She pulls her trigger in a flash and fires off her entire magazine.)
(However, the spheres glow and the bullets are easily melted. The Helena in mid-air looks down scornfully toward the ground, making her final statement.)
Betrayed you?
YOU are the one who betrayed US.
Scum who abandoned their faith and their mission ought to disappear here.
(The spheres begin to circle the airborne Helena. An energy beam gathers between the orbs and it looks like it's about to fire.)
Dandelion! Take over the defense systems now!
On it!
(I rush out and grab Helena before jumping aside. Thanks to Dandelion's interference, the energy beam is thrown off target and it doesn't hit me.)
(The Dolls from afar see me, and immediately head in my direction.)
Commander?!
I knew it! The Commander was here after all!
Is this the Commander you keep talking about?
What do you think? Our Commander still looks as badass as ever, even after all these years!
(The Dolls run up to me and press themselves against me. Fortunately, the defense systems don't initiate a second round of attacks.)
What are you girls doing here?
It's fate!
It's a long story, Commander, but Miss Colphne over here brought us to look for you.
Is... Is that so?
I'm glad you're okay too, Colphne. Thank you very much for saving me back then.
Hehe, you owe me one now, Commander!
(Colphne happily flashes me a thumbs up, then she looks at the Helena in the air before exclaiming in surprise.)
W-What's going on? TWO Helenas?!
(The airborne Helena looks at us in amusement. She does not seem to intend to attack us with her spheres. Instead, she looks thoughtful.)
Well, someone interesting has shown up. I didn't expect us to meet so soon.
Who are you?
I am a consciousness who is similar to someone you know well. A lot will happen between us soon. However...
(Helena's voice starts to sound strange.)
You'll need to survive until then.

(A ferocious wave of gunfire suddenly sweeps in from afar. It's coming from various passages, laid down by armed troops who look like the ones we fought earlier, but whose helmets have been painted black.)
Enemy reinforcements?
Didn't that PMC just now said there were reinforcements incoming?
They came a little quick, don't you think?
Prioritize protecting the Commander!
Lay down suppressive fire, we'll be withdrawing through the passage!
(I reach out to Helena. She hesitates for a moment before returning the handgun to me. I wave to Colphne and she immediately joins me in my cover.)
Colphne, bring Helena to the rear. Everyone else, form up on me!
Will do!
(Colphne grabs Helena's hand and runs toward the tunnel where I'm pointing. However, before she reaches the entrance, she comes to a halt and comes back with Helena in tow.)
C-Commander, there are enemies coming from the rear too!
Dammit, we're surrounded.
Jiangyu, move behind the Commander and intercept the enemies there!
O-Okay!
(Bullets start flying our way from the tunnel just now, forcing us to leapfrog between cover lest we end up getting caught in a crossfire.)
Things don't look good, Commander. At long last, it's time for you to flex your leadership skills~
Do you SERIOUSLY think this is the time for something like that?!
(The Dolls fire back at the enemy, but their reinforcements vastly outnumber us and soon we are almost completely suppressed by the enemy.)
How many more enemies are there?!
There should be at least 50 according to the scans, right?
Is there another way?
As you can see, right now, I am just a Diner—
Look, I'm being serious here!
In that case, we should be able to solve the problem handily once our reinforcements arrive, right?
Reinforcements?
Where are we getting reinforcements from?
(Just then, I hear a familiar, yet unfamiliar voice in my earpiece. The moment I do, I know that we've been tossed a lifeline.)
Commander, do you read me?
Loud and clear!
We received Miss Dandelion's distress signal and are now approaching your location.
Makiatto's come too.
Wait for us, Commander! Don't die down there!
Oh, thanks for your hard work, Leader!
Is the mission accomplished?
All done. The object has been delivered, and the outstanding sum will be transferred at the agreed time.
Where are Krolik and the others?
Their frames took a bit of a beating because of the Collapse storm in the combat zone, so they're now undergoing maintenance.
Sighhhhh...
Compared to "maintenance", the phrase <color=#f26c1c>"outstanding sum"</color>... sounds so much more pleasant to the ear.
Um, Commander, some of the essential maintenance parts still haven't been replenished since the last repair on the MBV... Shouldn't we take stock of them and place an order with B.R.I.E.F.?
—Mayling.
Ah... Huh?
Do you see what I'm holding in my hand?
Hard... tack?
Yes, hardtack. |We've been living off this thing for a month—an entire month!
Shouldn't we be indulging in a spectacular feast to celebrate the completion of a mission?
Considering our current position... procuring culinary ingredients would be rather challenging, Commander.
Contact Poludnitsa...
Commander.
...Some timely relaxation should... uh... be conducive to completing missions?
I believe there's some dehydrated ingredients left in the storage compartment. |A feast is out of the question, but a dinner for you, Mayling, and Helena should be manageable.
Oh! Is Leader going to cook?!
(The sliding door to the ops room suddenly opens, and Colphne strides in.)
I heard that~
...Colphne, the Commander just wants to give us a treat.
Mhmm~ But wouldn't it be a bit too much work for Leader to prepare everyone's dinner~?
Leader has just completed a mission and d-does deserve some rest... Uh, Commander? W-why don't you leave dinner to me...?
Leave it to you...? Mayling, if you serve the Commander that "tea" again, you'll have to take over as the Commander.
Then...
(Colphne flashes a familiar grin.)
Would you like to hear... my suggestion~?
(The central hub, which was full of clutter just a while ago, has been quickly reorganized.)
(The space in the middle has been emptied out. Two workbenches equipped with simple stoves and kitchenware now occupy opposite ends of the space.)
N-now... Let the second... Hm? Why is it the second?
Oh... Who cares~?
Anyway, let the second Elmo Cooking Contest begin~! |The two contestants are, uh... Leader Groza and... and Krolik?
Huh? Me? Why me?!
I don't think this suggestion reduces my workload in any way.
Humph, I have zero interest in this.
...In the desert of time, reaching the end of nothingness...
—I'm not cut out for such intricate tasks, you say?! Should I peel your frame and carve it for some fancy food presentation, eh? Miss O-So-Intricate-Nemesis?!
...Solid boulders block the flow of water...
Ha! Then I'll show you I don't only talk a good game. |Leader, lend me your kitchen tools! It's just cooking, yeah?! I'll make you eat your words!
...Be careful with them, Krolik.
Fufu~ Looks like boooth contestants are happy to participate~|Now let's announce the prize for winning this contest—Mayling~?
P-prize? |Uh, the p-prize money will be paid out of the Commander's own pocket... The winner will also win—two bottles of very rare rice wine?!
Com! Man! Der?! Didn't you say you'd pay me back for the wine you owed me?!
Did I? Then we'll use these bottles for the prize for now, and I'll buy you two... no, three bottles later. I'm giving you an extra bottle, okay?
An extra bottle?! Th-then it can't be helped. I'll donate the wine as the prize this time.
But this is hardly a suitable prize. After all, other than the Commander and Mayling—
Heheh! ☆ Can you hear meeee?!
(Groza is interrupted by a loud noise from the speaker.)
Vepley will now perform a number—to kick off the cooking contest! |Please sit back and enjoy Vepley's singing~☆
Vepley, don't wreck the MBV, and don't wake Helena.
Helena? Is she asleep already? At this hour?
Hm~ So much stuff has happened lately, it has really taken a toll on her~
Yeah, she's had it rough. We'll wake her later and get her to eat something.
Even without my amp, Vepley will not lose! ☆ You hear that, Krolik?! Don't hack the carrot with so much force! It's all in pieces now!
It's meant to be in pieces!
Uh, guys... Guys, chill...
How... did things turn out this way...?
Colphne's idea has piqued everyone's interest, I suppose?
I simply made a reasonable suggestion based on the Commander's needs~|Cooking, dinner, relaxation—
Put them together, and you get a cooking contest~
B-but... Krolik looks like... she's totally fuming...
I just hope there'll be SOMETHING left of the kitchenware and the food reserves on the MBV after this.
(Colphne saunters from Krolik's workbench over to Groza's.)
(Seeing the stark contrast between the chaos on one side and the orderliness on the other, she shakes her head.)
Sighhh...|It looks pretty obvious how the contest is gonna go~
I think... Krolik could use some help~?
Ah...
I recommend Krolik's best buddy, Nemesis~|That should even things out a bit~
Colphne, don't go pushing the envelop!
But I think this would be a fantastic opportunity~|For rapidly building some teeeeeamwork between the two of you, don't you agree, Leader~?
(Groza has just put on her apron and is in the middle of tying up her long hair. She pulls some of her loose hairs out from under the neck strap of the apron and smooths them down.)
(Hearing Colphne say her name, she turns to face the other workbench.)
Some level of coordination is necessary when working as a team. Why don't you two take this opportunity to build up some rapport?
...Tsk.
...Complex acorns, lost in the mist...
Humph, I'm clumsy, eh? Then you do it. But you'd better not slow me down.
(Mayling sudden raises her hand in the center of the empty space.)
(Her unexpected interjection interrupts the two Dolls' argument.)
I-I think—
L-Leader, it's 150°C! What-what do I p-put next...?
Red onions. They're on the second shelf all the way to the right, Mayling.
(Mayling trips as she makes her way to the vegetable storage area and is only saved from falling on her face by Vepley.)
Whoa— Mayling, calm down! ☆|Vepley is cheering for you!
S-sorry, Vepley! |Um, r-r-red onions... Th-this one?
(Seeing the red onion in Mayling's hand, Groza freezes for a brief second—)
...On second thought, please bring me the green pepper next to the red onions.
Oh, g-green pepper... Is it th-th-this one?
That's right.
(Mayling stumbles from the shelves back to the workbench.)
Now we need to flavor the sauce. Add a spoonful of salt, half a spoonful of black pepper, and a pinch of ground cinnamon, in that order.
Uh, how much is a pinch, Leader...?|And w-w-which one is the ground cinnamon?
The second jar on your left. Relax, Mayling.
Okay, Leader! S-s-s-s-second jar—
Hold on, Mayling! That's the white pepper!
Eeeek! Huhhh?!
(The panicking Mayling wants to pull her hand back, but she loses grip on the spice jar she is holding.)
Wow~ The ingredient that just went into the dish on Leader's side was... white pepper? Was that white pepper? That was almost half the jar? |That's gonna have quiiiiite a kick, Commander~
...I look forward to it.
Ugh... I-I really... shouldn't have tried to help...
Mayling, put this into the bin and wash the saucepan. |We'll start again. There's still time.
...Huh? Leader?
(Mayling turns around and looks at Groza, who just patted her lightly on the shoulder, with teary eyes.)
Don't you want to win back your rice wine? We still stand a chance.
...(Sobs) ...Even though the Commander promised me an extra bottle, the best rice wine is still the rice wine that I can drink right away...
(Mayling wipes away her tears forcefully.)
I'll do my best! Leader!
That's exaaaactly what I love about Leader~|I see there's nooooo need to worry about this side at all~ Now let's all turn our attention to the other side~
Huh...? |What did Nemesis just put into the pot?
|...Dark seeds, filling the cracks of the void, wailing in vain...
Ghost pepper? What's that? Didn't I tell you to let me know before you put in any seasoning?!
—Ghost pepper? Who bought that? Was it meant for me?
...The wandering stars appear, unforeseen...
What do you mean I wouldn't know how to make this?! Go on then! Tell me how you'd go about this, O Great Culinary Master?!
(Groza wedges herself in between the arguing Dolls and addresses Krolik.)
Here, Krolik, takes this.
Uh... Huh?
It's my usual recipe. Just follow the instructions.
Oh, cool. Great. |Let me see... It's so long?!
Huh? Huh? Is that really okay, Leader? You're giving your recipe to your rival just like that?
We're only rivals if we start on the same starting line.
Wow! ☆ That's so cool, Leader!
(I sit behind the table with two dishes in front of me.)
(After a long wait in hunger, both dishes look very enticing.)
(But the winner has been decided—)
(At the workbench to my left, Krolik and Nemesis are each holding a bottle of rice wine as their prize.)
Uh... aaaah...
Krolik, you... should slow down...
Glug-glug-glug-glug...
Pffwa! Burp. This is supposed to be a premium rice wine? It didn't taste anything special.
(Krolik picks up the cooking wine that Nemesis has placed on the workbench and takes a swig from it.)
Aren't they exactly the same?! "Only cooking wine can be used in cooking" my ass... You were lying your ass off, Nemesis!
...Roaring, howling, breaking... The huge waves wrestle with the storm...
Humph, why would a Doll drink so much? You're the one with a neural malfunction. |Mayling, take the rest of the wine. It's not really my thing.
Oh... okay. Thank you, Krolik...
Sorry, Mayling. We didn't succeed.
N-no, Leader! |It was me... (Sobs) I mixed up the spices again... (Sobs) It was all... my fault...
(Mayling clutches tightly at her clothes as she starts panicking again.)
No, it was also... partially my fault.
(Groza gently pries Mayling's vice-like fingers off her crumpled clothes and smooths down the wrinkles in a comforting gesture.)
(Nemesis walks up to Mayling wordlessly and shoves her bottle of rice wine into her hands.)
...Huh? What?!
...Blurred boundaries... Stop, pause, and look up at the ancient woods...
Uh, um... Pardon?
Oh, Nemesis says she has no interest in alcohol.
Oh, so... I can keep this...? (Sniffles)
Oh, uh...!
(Krolik fidgets with her hair ornament sheepishly.)
Ah, you know, sorry for taking a large mouthful out of that. I'll... I'll buy you a new bottle next time I get paid.
Huh? Don't worry, I don't mind—
Actually, what if the Commander also buys you a new bottle?
This picked beans with green pepper is pretty delicious. Come and try this, Mayling.
Uh, what?
Hm... You WILL approve this special expense, won't you, Commander? For buying rice wine, you know~?
...Fine. I knew it'd on me one way or another.
Huh? No, I would buy her a bottle whether you chip in or not.
Krolik, why are you so nice to Mayling?
Huh? Of course I'm nice to Mayling. She's always helping me with maintenance. What's wrong with wanting to repay the favor?
You're right, there's nothing wrong with that. But I think Leader Groza here also deserves some praise~|She gave up the chance of winning for the sake of the team, you know?
Hm? Vepley doesn't get it?
You see... Leader used the wrong ingredient on purpose~
...Hm, it was indeed my mistake.
Groza also makes mistakes?
(A loud hiccup suddenly interrupts the conversation.)
Hic! Oof, that was good! Drinks! Yay! Working overtime! Noooo!
...Mayling, take it slow.
Boohooooooo! I don't wanna work overtime! NO OVERTIME!
(There is no trace of the liveliness during the day left in the room now that it is night. Under the slightly dim lights, Groza cleans up the mess left by the crew on her own.)
(Standing quietly in front of the workbench, she studies the dish she has made earlier.)
(A familiar set of footsteps pulls her out of her daze, and she resumes her cleaning.)
Good evening, Commander. It's pretty late already. Still walking off your dinner?
My dinner got gobbled up by Mayling because she needed something to wash down with the booze. I have nothing to walk off.
(I watch Groza sweep all the food waste expertly into the waste processor.)
I saw the lights were on in here, so I thought I'd take a look.
Just taking a look?
And check in on our precious Leader Groza, of course.
I am operating within normal parameters, don't worry.
(I glance at the stain left by some dark-colored sauce on the waste processor.)
Come to think of it, that dish that Krolik and Nemesis made today was very much your style.
I'll take that as a compliment?
Ha, "A Brilliant Game of Russian Roulette". |You can never tell if the next bite will give you heaven or hell.
Thank you kindly. Still, surely you didn't wager the Russian Roulette dish to be my work during the blind test and deliberately chose the other dish so that I wouldn't win the prize?
