You know, I was actually planning to choose your dish so that you would win... Just kidding. We've known each other for far too long.
And I knew Leader Groza wouldn't throw the game deliberately.
That's just like you, Commander. You know me well.

(Mayling smacks into Colphne's shoulder with a loud thud, her eyelids shut tight.)

...I'll go make some sobering tea. Colphne, bring Mayling to her bed so that she can rest. Make sure she doesn't catch a cold.

Hehehe... Hiii, Blue Morpho~

Oh my, this sounds most interesting...

D-don't worry (hic) —Ludo had the demon drink and is full of divine power, once we find the factory lord we, we can beat them!
Oh—
Now, we need to go before Miss Enforcer comes back!
Where are you going?

Groza's currently—

Colphne? Ah, Colphne—! Get Mayling off me!

Commander, mission completion has been confirmed. Now summarizing current status.
B.R.I.E.F. has transferred us the payment for TASK-3385 and TASK-4106.
The MBV has arrived at the mission location for TASK-4402. Krolik and Nemesis will be dispatched for combat this afternoon and are projected to return by today.

Commander.

...In any case, things are not as you said.
The truth is, Groza and I realized that you've been working too hard lately. You only sleep well after midnight and sometimes not at all. Pushing yourself that hard doesn't make any sense...
Also, I've been making several, uh, unreasonable requests to you, like developing a "Nemesis Pod" and so on which added to your stress, so I thought of giving you the vacation voucher.
(Clears throat) In any case, don't worry about it. You've done well, and I'm very happy with your work.
Mayling?
So, does, does that mean you, you don't think I'm useless, Commander...?
How could you be useless? The MBV wouldn't even be running without you! Isn't that right, Groza?

Yup. Mayling's responsible for much of the MBV's maintenance work and various repairs, as well as purchasing for everyone on board the Elmo. It would be very difficult for us to function normally without her.
Ah, then, then I, I... Just now, I... I'm, I'm sorry, Commander, and sorry Leader!
You don't have to apologize.

Mayling.

The Commander wants you to have the vacation voucher so you can relax. Working twice as hard will only tire you out more.
Relax a little. You don't need to demand so much of yourself.
Commander, does, does Leader mean that... I, I don't need to...
Yup. Just do whatever you want.
At my own pace... C-Commander, I, I'm still feeling a little tired, so, so I'd like to rest for about half an hour before going back to work, is, is that... okay?
You can rest for longer if you'd like.
O-okay! I, I got it! And, and in the future...
Alright. Since you want to rest, you should go and rest.
Um... Okay!
(Mayling immediately tucks the vacation voucher away. After wiping her mouth, she bows vigorously to me before dashing out of the ops room.)
(At the elevator, Mayling takes several deep breaths until she manages to get her breathing under control.)
I, what did I just do?!
(Whimper) The Commander was clearly concerned about me, but I can't believe I actually prejudged them like that. That was wrong, wrong, wrong wrong!
Still, the Commander...
(Mayling takes out the vacation voucher and carefully opens it up, examining it under the sunlight.)
So I can do whatever I want... But I just want to work hard and protect everyone, as well as the Commander...
Does the Commander mean that... I should be more honest with myself? For instance... saying I want to rest right away and so on...
Hm, well, if that's what pleases the Commander... Then I'll do it.
As for the vacation voucher... I'll use it once I think of what to do with it. I'm sure that's what the Commander wants too...
That's right! I'll put it with the Lunar New Year banners that the Commander gave me earlier!
Yup, that's it!
(Mayling pats her face, which is blushing so red that it's practically scalding, and carefully refolds the vacation voucher along its original crease.)
That'll be it then~
(The folded square of paper sits quietly in Mayling's palm.)
(The sun falls on the thin paper, illuminating the faint traces of the Commander's black handwriting.)
(Mayling reaches out and caresses the raised impressions and stares at it for a good long while before reverently returning it to her breast pocket.)
(After lightly patting her pocket to confirm the paper was intact and secure, Meiling smiled brightly.)
Alright, and now— time to sleep hard and work hard!
(She leaves the elevator and heads for her dorm.)
(Aboard the Elmo, on an afternoon after work is done, Mayling reminisces with me about the "demon drink" episode from that night, but—)
Ehhh, was, was that what really happened—
So I called myself Ludo, and treated everyone like characters in Ludo's story?
But how could that - I don't even remember it at all... So... No wonder you gave me that vacation voucher, and even...
(Sob) C-Commander, I'm so sorry! To think I did something so rude to you that night!
It's alright, Mayling. I'm not angry.
But you're always so nice to me, and I called you the "factory lord"...
And I was supposed to be on duty that night, but in the end, you had to cover it...
UM, I'm terribly sorry! It's all my fault for putting the rice wine in that container, I'll never do it again!
Is, is there any other work that needs doing, Commander? I can carry on with it right—

Huh... What we talked about? Do you mean...

...Ah! Nonono, I haven't! I'm sorry Commander... ack! I didn't mean to say I'm sorry, I, I just panicked and... But that's not what I meant!
Calm down. Take your time.
(Whimper) Thank you, Commander! I, I...
The truth is, for a very long time, I've had a hard time believing that you were really willing to take me in...
I was always afraid of being abandoned by everyone, that you wouldn't want me anymore someday, that my selfishness would make me lose the people important to me again...
But you've been so good to me since that day, and you even gave me a vacation voucher and told me I could do whatever I want... And that made me really, really happy!
I now know that you won't abandon me!
The vacation voucher is in my chest pocket, and its words don't lie. I clearly remember what you said to me back then.
Thank you, thank you so much... To me, you are truly... (sobs)

(Sobs harder) I just... (sniffle) I'm so happy... That I met you, Commander...

I've been so happy during my time on the Elmo, and I felt so safe... Although there was troublesome stuff I needed to handle and I didn't get enough sleep at night... To me, every day was very fulfilling!
So, er... um... If you could...

This time, I'm sure we'll be able to set a new record together!
So, I... I would like it if you could play Tetris with me during my break time!
With you around, I'm sure my repair effectiveness would be greatly increased!
Alright, I'll keep you company when I'm not busy.

(My mind was filled with the imagery of Dushevnaya's puffed up cheeks as I took out my terminal to read through it again.)
(Dushevnaya returns to my room after about an hour.)
(She takes out a few books from her filled backpack, placing a few on her lap.)
And now, let the Commander choose the fated book that will bring us the Gospel.
So after the lullaby comes the bedtime stories?
N-n-not bedtime stories! We are communicating our wishes to the unknown powers through these ancient texts!
Books... are the crystallization of wisdom, the words forming a sea of knowledge. |The spirit of wisdom can surely be perceived by the powers who possess wisdom...um, yes. That's how it works.
(Dushevnaya gestures dramatically, the books on her lap wobble and nearly fall to the ground before she barely manages to catch them.)
Anyway, could the Commander please... pick a book?

Let's see... "ELID Gourmet's Hypothesis", "The Art of Rock 'n' Roll Mechanical Repair", "Stop, oh Destined Lover of The Bounty Hunter" "I Became King of the Hunt in the Contaminated Zones" ...what the heck are all these?
The Trapped Doll's Core? ...This seems like a normal story. It's also pretty thin too, so that's my pick.
Okay. Then, please evict the distracting thoughts just like you did before.
(I close my eyes, and hear the sound of paper flipping near my ears.)
(A few seconds later, Dushevnaya starts to put on a voice, slowly reading the story out loud.)

"...The ray of light that Elle's visual module captures makes her realize that she is currently situated in a gigantic trash incinerator. Other than herself, a few other Doll bodies are seen among the usual trash..."
(Hm? That sounds like a suspense story centered on a Doll protagonist.)
"...Her malfunctioning legs cannot help her escape. She can only watch as the trash incinerator exit closes off without a thought for her plight..."
"...The flamethrowing nozzle situated on the roof of the incinerator approaches. The heat swirls around her, a foreshadowing to the eventual breakage and melting of her body..."
"...Before she could even begin to generate another thought, the torture had begun..."
(The cruel text induces a frown on my face. Dushevnaya's voice starts to become tense too.)
Are you alright? Dushevnaya?
...I-I'm fine, haha... As expected of the Commander's chosen, uh, fated gospel... It-it has an interesting start.
But your voice is shaking, are you sure?
Um, that is... excitement, for what comes next...
I-I'll continue now...
(She flips the page.)
"...'Good thing I wasn't installed with a module to feel pain' were h-her thoughts as she was engulfed in the flames."
"She then turned her attention to the other Doll bodies abandoned just like her, witnessing their snow-white synthetic skin... skin... start charring and carbonising under the heat of the flames."
"The steel... skeleton that peered out from the skin was melting... too... Their throats emitted a sound that belonged neither to human nor machine... Uuuu..."
Are you really going to be fine?
I'll be alright! I can go on, Commander!
(Dushevnaya grasps the book tightly, staring at me with eyes wide like a frightened puppy.)
(Will she really be okay frightened like this...? But there may be more trouble if I just stop her now.)
"Uuuu... At that moment, she felt something grab her wrists, turning her head only to see a deformed, melted face... the connecting wires... wires of the visual module are already... already..."
(Dushevnaya perseveres with all her might to keep her vocalization module running, continuing on with the story.)
(Escape, exile, betrayal, farewell... An hour later, the protagonist of the story finally meets her end on the barren landscape.)
...leaving only a shining nut, resting quietly in the moonlight.
Phew—It's finally... over...
(Watching Dushevnaya's emotional state return to normal makes me quietly heave a sigh of relief, too.)
(Still, what an exciting story it was. Were such books just sitting around on the Elmo all this time? I thought most of our stuff were just advert catalogues thrown in by Underground Brokers...)
What a great story.
Uuu... I can't say the same, that part where the Doll was cut open... Eh?! Commander, you're still awake... N-no sleepiness at all, wait, I mean, have you felt a connection to the unknown powers yet?
Maybe Dushevnaya was too good at telling the story, so I wanted to keep listening and forgot to answer the call from the unknown powers.
Speaking of which, I didn't know our storeroom had such interesting books. Looks like I need to take stock and make more use of it in the future.
The path has turned unto the opposite direction..
(Dushevnaya's face is full of dejection, her shoulders slump.)
There's no need to be sad, I—
I have only completed half of the Great Healer's request, this is no time to falter!
Alright, Commander, let us waste no more time and proceed on to the next ritual.
(Looks like the "Hypnotic Game" that intends to "lull" me to sleep will continue.)
A foot bath, drinking milk, meditation...
None of it worked very well, I'm not sure there's still anything that can be tried...
Isn't there still one more on the list?
(I pointed at "Exercise" which was written at the bottom of the checklist.)
Still, why is exercise viewed as a way for us to form connections with the unknown powers?
It feels as mysterious as a foot bath or drinking milk.
(The milk was pretty good, though. After breaking a little sweat, I felt a lot better.)
(I stretch my body a little, the feeling of warmth flowing through my body.)
Um... It's because the unknown powers can sense the released endorphins and the relaxed mood after exercise, then resonate with that.
However... The Commander has not yet emerged from the shadow of disease, so exercise... might let disease find an opportunity to strike?
I won't be able to wrestle with those "Goblins" in the contaminated zones now and win, but I will be fine if it's just a bit of exercise.
Goblin... D-do you mean the Varjagers?
Yeah. They kind of make me laugh every time I see them.
Haha... They do quite... resemble goblins.
There was once a time when the Elmo ran out of ammunition and we had to charge them swinging our barrels at them.
(I recounted some encounters with Varjagers to Dushevnaya. Laughter erupts and echoes throughout the dorm.)
No, wait... we veered off our goal again.
The plan was to accompany you during exercise... The sign guiding us to the end must not be lost!
What kind of exercise though... maybe... purify the Elmo?
Purify... You mean clean up the Elmo?
It allows body movement, but does not require too much exertion. That does seem like a suitable exercise.
Ah, but that... that would go against the instructions of the Great Healer, Commander.... you can't leave the room...
Colphne likely meant that I'm not allowed to participate in work, but it should be fine for me to just move around.
And... this will also help... uh... that is... what's it called again, the thing you mentioned...
Feel the unknown powers?
Yes.
Oh... Okay! Then I shall retrieve the cleaning equipment.

(Great, I'll finally be able to get out. I feel sorry for doing this to Dushevnaya, but if I can find a chance to slip away, perhaps I can make it in time for the routine communication with B.R.I.E.F. )
(Dushevnaya and I reach the lounge with cleaning equipment in hand.)
(It's been some time since the place was last used. It's still how we left it after the previous welcoming party.)
Let's divide up the work and correct these misaligned trajectories, Commander.
Hmm... I'll take care of the sofa area. Could you purify the Bar area, Commander?
No problem.
But I was thinking, it's not that messy around here, so I'll be able to handle the lounge myself. Do you want to have a look at the rooms nearby, Dushevnaya? I remember they were quite messed up.
(My mind quickly plots the route from my current location to the Ops room.)
(Once Dushevnaya leaves, I'll...)
Pardon me, but I must refuse.
(Dushevnaya crosses her arms in front of her chest in a big X.)
If the Commander is struck down by the demons of disease from overexertion again, I would be an accomplice to evil.
So please leave all the other areas to me.
Uh... That... Is fine... too.
(Dushevnaya had quite the determined expression there, but let's find another chance later...)
I will now clean the sofa area and leave the bar area to the Commander.
(Dushevnaya runs off hurriedly. I pick up a rag cleaned by her and start to wipe the Bartop.)
(The cabinet below the bartop is stuffed full of items. As I gathered a number of bartop items, ready to stuff them into the cabinet, I saw some cards with words written on it.)
(An idea—)
Look at what I've found, Dushevnaya.
(Dushevnaya walks over from the other side of the lounge.)
If memory serves me right, these are... cards for a word-guessing game?
Yep. We played it during the welcoming party, it was pretty fun.
How about it, want to try it out for a bit?
Huh? Play... Are we going to play this?
(A hint of panic appears on Dushevnaya's face.)
Not interested?
I remembered how Dushevnaya said not long ago, that the relaxed, happy mood that comes after exercise facilitated a connection with the unknown powers.
I believe that playing a game can help us do that too?
I-Is that so? Then...
To make it more interesting, the loser will have to follow orders from the winner.
How is it?

(Dolls tend to operate on a pretty rigid sense of associative logic, so it's quite easy to win against them. I just have to win quickly and have her prepare some "complex" afternoon tea. This method carries no risk of alerting Groza and the others too, so that's good.)
O-okay!
(An hour later—)

This... This is... I know how to describe it now! It's like a giant pendulum, crashed permanently into the ground. It-it has hills and mounds, with crystals covering the surface... It's like a tumor that has grown from the earth.
A-Are you still unable to guess it?
(Failure. Complete mission failure. Dushevnaya's description logic is as easily followed as the billowing sand found all over the contaminated zones.)

(I've been "Commanded" to drink two cups of tea, eat three cookies, and enjoy four of her shoulder massages all within the hour... I have half an hour left before the routine communication. I need to hurry.)
(It's my turn to describe the word after this. Even if I have to cheat...)
Fine, I admit defeat. Let's see the answer... Thoad?
(An image of a crystal-covered Thoad squatting on the ground comes to mind. With that in mind, it's hard to argue with Dushevnaya's description.)
It-it's just a coincidence, I'm sure the Commander will win next time... The compass of fate will surely point you to the correct direction!
Let's talk about what your orders for me are. No more massages, please. Or at least find another spot for that...
(I feel like my shoulders are so relaxed, they would dislocate at any moment.)
I-I would like the commander to lie down!
(Dushevnaya points at the spotless sofa that she cleaned up.)
Huh?
It's time I performed the most spiritual ritual ever on the Commander... Please do not hold any distracting thoughts and accept the ritual with an open mind.
(I lie down on the sofa, a mix of skepticism and acceptance in my mind.)
Please close your eyes and heed the call from deep within your soul...
(Darkness covers my field of vision—)
Now, you're lying down on a hill, during an afternoon in a Green Zone... The temperature is 75 degrees Fahrenheit, and you feel a refreshing breeze blow by.
(A strange sensation comes from my scalp, instantly giving me goosebumps all over.)
The wind is cool, while the sun shines gently through the treeshade.
(The strange scratching on my head does not stop, but the initial sense of overstimulation subsides, turning into a wonderful feeling of comfort that spreads out.)
(Is it a... scalp massager? Did she borrow this from Ullrid?)
(Not bad. I'll enjoy this for five minutes, but I've got to take her down in the next round.)
There is also... the sound of a rubber pig...
(The contents are somewhat strange... but Dushevnaya's soft, delicate voice makes me feel relaxed.)
(The scent of red tea and cookies linger in my mouth... I feel... kind of sleepy...)
(No... I have to go for the routine...)
(Darkness finally engulfs my consciousness whole.)
(I fling my eyes open, suddenly realizing that it's already dark outside.)
Commander, you're awake?
What's the time now? How long have I slept?
A-About 3 in the morning. You slept about... 8 hours?
Crap!
(I sit up quickly, but realize that the time for routine communication is long over and freeze on the spot.)
C-Commander, I'm so sorry, I... I...
(Dushevnaya seems to be panicking. She might have misunderstood why I sat up in a rush.)
No need to panic. I'm not going to blame you, I was too relaxed and drifted off.
You have successfully accomplished your goal of lulling me to sleep, you've done nothing wrong.
R-Really...? Then that's... Oh!
C-Commander, you knew that I signed a pact with the God of Slumber on your behalf?
I'm not dumb. I have to say that some of your methods were pretty weird, though.
T-Then why didn't you... expose my plans...
I'd like to ask why you never gave your intentions straight in the first place.
It's not a secret that Colphne and the others want me to rest up too.
Because... I made up something that did not exist at the start, creating an unfulfillable promise...
If I told the truth, the Commander would be disappointed... but when I didn't... the flames of fear burned m-my vocalization modules...
(The lighting in the room is dim, so I could not see her expression clearly. However, I saw that her shoulders were trembling.)
There's no need to be afraid, I wouldn't get angry at you over that.
I-It's not like that! It's just that, the black river named fear, is born from the spring of cherished promises...
I hoped, to protect the promise I made to you at the start...
Then you have already succeeded.
R-Really?

I wasn't able to sneak away and do any work, but I had a great day with you. You got me to realize the value of the storeroom books, and played me an ear-piercing but funny "lullaby". I then enjoyed your tea and cookies, and even managed to sleep eight hours without a single nightmare.
You should be more confident in yourself. You have already accomplished the promise made on the day of our reunion.
The promise...
KVSK... No, I should call you Dushevnaya now. It's been a long time.
...I'm sorry... My memories of Griffin are now like fragments of a meteor, scattered all across the universe...
H-However, the lack of memories does not prevent us from forming a new bond!
From now on, I would like to face every trouble and worry together with you. Be it in battle or in life... I want to accompany you as much as I can, Commander.

Even though... Even though the current me might just be a common, unremarkable pebble... I've heard that when people have someone they wish to protect, they become as strong as diamond. Perhaps this applies to Dolls too.

When I am by your side, I feel an inexhaustible source of power flowing through me. Like a fledgling bird pushed off a cliff, wanting to spread its wings and take flight to save itself, but even more like a seedling bathed in the warm sun, reaching and growing into the skies with all it's might...
The clues of fate have converged, the sunlight, the winds, the sand, the stars... all point towards you.
You have accompanied me through a day of relaxation, forcing me away from work, allowing my mind to completely relax. That's a difficult feat.
Ask Groza and Colphne if you don't believe me. Maybe the title of strongest chaperone on the Elmo will be passed on to you tomorrow.
The current holder is Colphne, I should not snatch a title from others that does not belong to me...
Sighhhhh...
(I sigh, interrupting Dushevnaya's words.)
(No one can be enlightened in a single day.)

To humans, relaxation is the strongest mind-numbing drug... I have entirely no desire to go to the Ops room now. I might even be kind of tired now. So that's why they say the more you sleep, the more sleepy you get.
Then... You could lay down for a bit longer, Commander. I will protect you from the nightmares of night.
Alright, I'm counting on you.
(I lie down and close my eyes once again.)
Oh, right. Will you accompany me again tomorrow? I have five days of vacation, after all.
Of course! Tomorrow, the day after tomorrow too, till the demons of disease hiding in your body are completely evicted! This is the request of the Great Healer, as well as m-my hope and my destiny!
(I can't see it now, but I imagine that Dushevnaya's eyes must be sparkling with happiness now.)
(I should not disappoint her for at least the next two days.)
(Three days later, during the day, in the Commander's lounge aboard the Elmo.)
Temperature is back to normal, along with other indicators.
Yay~ The Commander has recovered for now~
...That "for now" feels unnecessary, doesn't it?
That's called "caution".
After all, maybe the Commander will start not taking care of their body again some day?
Haha...
But back to the topic, you did take a proper rest recently, Commander. You even managed an average of eight hours of sleep these few days~
(I looked at Dushevnaya at my side.)
All thanks to Dushevnaya.
I-If there's still something I can help with, I'll do it even if I have to run through the the boiling flames of hell.
There's no need to do something as dangerous as that...
Speaking of which, since the "Great Healer" has announced my full recovery, isn't it time for me to return to work?
Commander, the "vacation of no less than five days" is now only on it's fourth day.
That's right! Also, improving indicators for health is just the start. |The Commander should dismiss all hope of doing any work during vacations~
...Fine, then will you three now... go do your things? I'll continue my rest...
("I have a backup terminal for work, anyway." Were my thoughts before Colphne's hand reached for my pillow.)
Wait!
Routine check! So the reason why the Commander did not keep on resisting is—wow, there really is a backup work terminal over here~
That's no good at all, Commander.
Oh... As expected of the Great Healer... Looks like I do not understand the Commander deeply enough. I need to establish a new understanding about the Commander.
(I follow the terminal with my eyes as it makes its way from Colphne to Groza, who studies it.)
The Commander manages to zero their credibility on the last day of the vacation. Perhaps someone should be assigned to keep watch on the Commander 24/7.
...I have only one backup terminal.
Dushevnaya, can I leave this to you?
Eh? Me?
(Groza completely ignores my words. She nods at Dushevnaya, smiling.)
You've done well the past few days.
Understood! From now on, I will watch over the Commander, never letting them come in contact with Pandora's Box!
Why are you calling it Pandora's Box... There's precious work on it...
...Is no one going to listen to the one at the center of this mess?
Nope.
On matters of health, please listen to medical professionals~
Indeed. I trust Colphne's judgement.
(I sigh. When I turn my head, my eyes meet with Dushevnaya's bright, shining eyes.)
(Clearly, she does not stand on my side of the argument.)
Commander, I've found some other ways to form connections with the unknown powers, let's begin on our journey today too!
(On a random, sunny day in the dorm, Dushevnaya reminisced with me the events that occurred during my vacation—)
The gravel in an hourglass, could also be a assassin's weapon buried in time...
Um, I mean that, I was not brave enough to express what I wanted to do back then, so I said some pretty strange things...
Although you realized the truth clearly and things ended well, I still feel embarrassed thinking about it...
Does the Commander think that sometimes I say, um, sometimes I'm weird and hard to understand?
You are... quite special sometimes.
So you do think I'm a dork!
To be honest, I'm not doing it intentionally...
But sometimes, when I don't know how to express myself, or cannot find the right words, it is as if I was controlled by some mysterious power—
Uh, although it is true that Dolls are controlled by their neural cloud's programming in the first place...
All in all, do you understand what I mean, Commander? If I... have caused you trouble or distress, I will do my best to erase... no, I'll try my best to adjust... change...
...Your words, are like... um, as clear as the... revelations in the book of prophecies?
C-Commander, are you... mimicking my way of speaking?
Heheh... Heheheh...
That's the way, Commander! That's a great imitation!
Thank you, Commander. Were you trying to cheer me up, by doing that?
To be cared for by you in this way... I-I am like, like a traveller, almost frozen, but now seeing the light of fire among the wind and snow.
What I mean is, I feel... a lot calmer now.
You're welcome. To me, Dushevnaya is, um... like a blade that cuts through the fog? Er, perhaps this is not an appropriate metaphor...
Is the Commander... praising me?
Fog, Blade, Meaning... I'm pretty great too?
H-Honestly, I was just thinking that...
...Compared to the other dolls, I... am like a treasure chest mimic in an adventure story!
But the Commander just called me a "Blade".
Hmm... This name is a lot cooler, I like it more!
I-I will work hard to live up to this name.
Erm, no matter whether I'm a blade, a companion, or a treasure chest mimic...
I want to write our adventure story together, Commander!
Alright.
She's late...
(On a commercial street bustling with activity, Stechkin stood leaning against a wall with her arms folded in boredom.)
(With numerous shopping bags hanging from her arms, she taps her right index finger in rhythm while she stares at the crowds.)

(Behind her is a hair salon. Its spinning barber's pole flashes red, white, and blue, casting its colors on Stechkin's face at intervals. This salon was special; the second floor is dedicated to offering maintenance services for Dolls.)
(A petite, white figure rushes out of the door past Stechkin, coming to an emergency stop on the pavement while clutching her hat to ensure it doesn't fall, then looks around anxiously.)
...Where did she go?
(Sigh)
Over here, Miss—Nagant—
(Stechkin takes a single step forward, and her outstretched finger pokes right into Nagant's cheek as she turns her head around.)
Uwah! |W-Why are you standing here, Stechkin...
I'm waiting for you to finish your maintenance, of course. Poor me has already gone around the mall across the street and bought three outfits. You took quite a long time, don't you think?

Sorry, sorry! The technician was way too passionate in there!|It's been so long since my last frame maintenance, so he recommended me a ton of different treatments, and even wanted to do me a hairstyle that helps me look taller. Good thing I held on to my sanity in there...
Damn it! Why do you have so much money for buying stuff?

(Nagant's eyes open wide in surprise at the sight of the many bags hanging on Stechkin's arms, silently thinking of the sad state of her near-empty account, and incidentally recalling how her cheek had just been poked.)
Y-You dare play pranks on your senior?!
Oh, don't be so petty~ |Your cheeks have regained their suppleness after servicing, so there's no doubt everyone would love to poke it after seeing that.

So how's my recommendation? Pretty good, right? The technicians are all retired government techs, the price is reasonable, and the treatments keep up with trends.|Why not try them out after you manage to save more money, Miss Nagant?
...You... You're so pushy with this. Are you getting some kind of kickback from this?
How's that possible~ The two of us will just get a discount doing that.
We're only out here because the logistics department's sign-in system suddenly bugged out, which is why we had time to slip out and unwind, remember?|I didn't intentionally bring you here for this.
Fine, I'll believe you for now.
Ahem...
(Nagant pretends to clear her throat.)

Don't forget the purpose of our trip out here. We must bring back the authentication devices used in the entry and exit gates safely!|I heard that the satellite city has been upgrading all sorts of machines and systems lately, so we can't let the sector we're in charge of lag behind!
Still, civil servants doing overtime into nightfall? Unbelievable! I remember clearly how they would just run off even before the clock reached 5...
(Both of their communicators started ringing almost at the same time.)
(The two of them exchange glances after looking through the contents. Stechkin shrugs in resignation.)
Looks like we won't be able to go back for now.
Right, right. Let's get to it.
What... What is this?
(The crowd returning to the satellite city by rail merges with the crowd in the middle of the busy commercial street.)
(A cleaning bot spins its mop around wildly while pivoting on the spot, separating the crowd into two streams.)
(Every now and then, someone runs into the bot because they were too glued to their phones, but they move on after cursing at it briefly.)
The orders we received were to disperse the crowd, but they seem to be quite orderly already.|That troublemaking bot, however... Wouldn't it be best if we just shut it down?

Miss Nagant, this is sector W12, not the sector W9 that we are responsible for.|It's the responsibility of the security forces here to deal with that out-of-control bot. We just have to "disperse the crowd" in our area.
My wish is that everyone would do what they should do, so that there would be more love and peace in this world.
I-I know, of course. I was just testing you as my junior.|As your mentor, I feel relieved at hearing your correct response.
Oh~ Is that so? Thank you very much for your concern, Miss Nagant.

Still, could you please stop looking at me with such a motherly gaze?|Quite a number of our colleagues have informed me that they feel a sense of guilt every time you look at them like that, Miss Nagant.
What?! Is that how those kids see me?|I was simply trying my best to mingle with them, but it seems like I have much to learn if I want to truly understand how young people think nowadays...
Whatever! Let's deal with the crowd first!|We just have to prevent them from getting near that cleaning bot, right?
(Stechkin follows right behind Nagant while they steer the crowd away from the out-of-control cleaning bot.)
Mom! Look, the robot is spinning around! That's so cool!
Ah...
(A child falls to the ground after being jostled by the crowd. The cleaning bot's detection bulb lights up, swinging its mop around while driving towards the child.)
Trash, detected... |Commance, cleaning...
Oh no! The cleaning bot has mistaken a child as trash to clean up!
You shall not... harm the child!
Not everything that falls to the ground is trash, you rustbucket!
(Sigh) ...I thought we agreed to just maintaining order...
(Nagant sprints forward and pulls the child aside.)
(Stechkin puts down her shopping bags, picks up the child, then moves out of the cleaning bot's range.)
I got it pinned down!|But... where's the power button?
Miss Nagant, your bravery is commendable, but that bot is way bigger than you...|You're not pinning it down by holding on to it for dear life while it spins in circles!
Uwah! The crowd... The crowd is coming over!|Hey! You! The one in the yellow hat! Why are you taking pictures? This is not the time for that at all!
Trash... Clean...|@#￥%...
Uwaaaah... Stechkin... Think of something!
Okay...|Don't get seperated from mom again, dearie.
Now then... To take care of Miss Nagant... Ah! This is bad...
Form up!
We have to disperse the crowd to avoid a stampede!
(Before Stechkin could react, a tall, white figure rushes past her.)

(In a single swift motion, she grasps the bot's flailing mop with one hand and presses down on the emergency shutdown button after finding it quickly with another. She then picks up the quite-dizzy Nagant and raises her high)
Your crime ends here!
W-Wait! She's not...
(The figure was prepared to suplex Nagant, but was hit in the face by her falling hat. She looks up, sees the hat owner's face, and is frozen for a moment before she hurriedly sets Nagant down.
N-Nagant M1895?!
Ugh... So dizzy...
You're... Mosin-Nagant?!|Eh, where, where did my hat go?
I'm so sorry!
(At the entrance to sector W12's security department, Mosin-Nagant clasps her hand together in apology. Although her head is lowered, she stealthily opens an eye to watch for Nagant's reaction.)
(Nagant stood with her hands on her hips, puffed up with anger in front of her.)
Hmph—!
Nagant M1895, are... you angry?|I didn't raise you up high on purpose, you understand what was going on in that situation... right?
...Just call me Nagant. That's what everyone calls me these days.
Hmph. Even if I was a stranger, it would be incredibly rude to raise someone up high, wouldn't it! |And you did that in front of my junior...
If Miss Nagant is willing to pay me hush money, I'm willing to erase this part of my memory, you know?
That's not what's important!
It's getting quite late... Even if we start going back now, we won't be able to send in these authentication devices before the logistics department people go home for the day.
Ah, there's no need to worry about that.
Stechkin told me all about the situation while you were recording statements. I've contacted the relevant people, so they will wait half an hour longer for you.
Should we set off now? I'll accompany you guys for a bit.
Ohh! That's good.
(The previously dejected Nagant is immediately reinvigorated by the news.)
Thanks, Mosin-Nagant.
(She grabs Mosin-Nagant's hand, pulls Stechkin along and sets off to their destination.)
(Mosin-Nagant and Stechkin follow Nagant's lead and move along.)

There's no need to be so polite to your big sister. I should be thanking you two for stopping the out-of-control cleaning robot.|It's been sent to the technical department for inspections, so we should expect results soon.
All in a day's work.

Since we have decided to protect this city, we can't exactly ignore such things.|Moreover, I'm bringing Stechkin along today, so as her senior, I need to establish myself as a good role model for her.
You look really cool though, Mosin-Nagant. Have you become some kind of Big Boss?
Big Boss?
Miss Nagant, do you mean "Leader"?
I understand your wish to keep up with the trendy lingo circulating among young people, Miss Nagant, but that's not how that phrase is used.
Oh... I see...
Well, you know what I mean! You youngsters should cut your elders some slack once in a while!
I'm just a squad leader in a security patrol detail, so I'm not exactly anyone important.

I had already dealt with another haywire robot earlier and had no time to return, so I asked dispatch to find security personnel on duty for assistance against the cleaning bot. I didn't expect it to be you two.
Robots going haywire?!|Are cases like that on the rise lately?
Yeah. It's not just an isolated event or two.|Although we don't have the results on the cleaning bot yet, I reckon it might have been infected by a virus just like the previous cases before it.

Speaking of which, there has been quite a number of similar issues with the entry and exit gates. The gates would suddenly close on visitors crossing them, and sometimes the indicator lights on authentication devices would flash for no reason.|This is why the government started to phase in new system upgrades for public-use machines.

A virus... So that was why an engineer came by sector W9 to check on the gates, then took off with two authentication devices.|We came out here to take back the devices after they finished servicing them.
Yep, looks like the upgrades have already come to your region too, which is reassuring.

To tell the truth, W12 security has taken on the task of tracking down the creator of this virus. However, we are becoming short on manpower just handling cases in our sector.|If sector W9 falls to the virus too, we would be way overstretched having to expand our investigation and protection zone.
The civic center is straight ahead, so this is where we will part ways for now.
Let's meet up again when we find the chance, hopefully outside of work.
(Mosin-Nagant waves goodbye to Stechkin and Nagant, then turns to leave.)
Mosin-Nagant!
Hm?
(Hearing Nagant call her name, Mosin-Nagant stops and turns around. Nagant's face serious and solemn.
Um...|I would like to help if that's okay.
...What?
Ahem, I said—|I can help with the investigation! Actually... Please! Let me help you!
Eh? But, I was only able to call on you guys for assistance due to the emergency today, much less ask for more. You guys belong to sector W9 after all.
Please let me help! Even if not in an official capacity!|I wish to protect this city just like the nameless heroes we see in movies!
Heroes?
(Stechkin couldn't bear standing by and listening anymore. Shaking her head in resignation, she explains the situation to Mosin-Nagant.)
I'm sorry to have introduced hero movies to Miss Nagant.|Ever since that day, she would randomly say some delusional things...
D-Delusional?
I'm not delusional, okay?

I just really don't what a repeat of what happened today.|We put in so much effort keeping the city safe, but someone just hides around in the shadows, puppeting machines to cause trouble and destruction. It's way too despicable. Even film villains don't stoop so low.
If someone is disgruntled about the state of affairs, then they should loudly proclaim their dissatisfaction! If they want to disrupt the peace, they should come out and fight with us openly!
Oh my! As expected of my little sister Nagant!
(Nagant's overwhelming sense of justice infects Mosin-Nagant, causing the two sisters to grasp each other's hands, both sets of eyes shining with righteousness.)
(The shining, brilliant atmosphere of justice is so bright, Stechkin has to cover her eyes in discomfort.)
These two really are sisters...
Stechkin, are you willing to lend your power to keep this city safe?
...Ah... About that... I just wanna make money in peace.
She's just being shy and stubborn.
If we think about the situation though... It's weird that our opponent is just randomly causing chaos. What do they gain from doing that?
Strange indeed. We have been trying to guess at their motive too.

Normally, if our foe is a terrorist, the trouble they cause is way more serious and the impact more widespread.|But these cases of bots going haywire don't seem to have any connection with each other, they seem more like just some random targets...
For now, all they have accomplished is getting the government to upgrade old machines and infrastructure... which isn't a bad thing if we only look at the results.
They can't just be trying to earn money from software development, right?
It's not impossible, the majority of crimes in the world stem from money, after all.
Stechkin... Once you've reached my age, you will learn that there are things in the world that are more important than money.
But anyway, no matter what their motive might be, we won't let them win! I'll keep an eye on the machines even when we are back in sector W9, leave it to me!
I'm counting on you.
(After parting with Mosin-Nagant, Stechkin and Nagant manage to reach POL-03's satellite city security management's logistics department just in time.)
You guys are from sector W9, right? You can take the devices back once you sign the forms.
Thanks, sorry for the trouble!
No need. But do hurry along, it's time for me to get off work.
(Sigh) ...What an unlucky day to leave so late.
(After signing their details, Nagant and Stechkin leave with the two upgraded authentication devices.)

(The logistics department worker turns off the computer, then turns around, opens a drawer to retrieve a small paper notebook to record down the sector number of the two Dolls, before circling a spot nearby.)
Sector W9...
(There aren't many people outside during a typical day in the satellite city. Nagant and Stechkin reach the post once it's time for them to take over work from the previous duty group.)
Good work today, leave the rest to me!
Thank you, Miss Nagant!
(The two Dolls on duty finish handing over work to Nagant, then turn and leave in a small jog. Looking at her juniors running off, Nagant cannot help but sigh.)
Young people are so lively.
Miss Nagant, I'm young too, but I'm not that lively.
Oh. But you're lively too once someone dangles an ounce of Sardis gold in front of your eyes.|All right, let's begin our work.
I speak of work, but there's so little traffic after the morning rush hours. It's kind of boring...
Miss Nagant, we should treasure any chance to slack off, as they are hard to come by.
(A gate near the two Dolls suddenly sounds out an alarm. A middle-aged man has failed authentication.)
Hi, you can't travel through the satellite city through this entrance without passing authentication.
Impossible! I've got a genuine ID chip over here, it can't be posing any issues!
There must be something wrong with your stupid machine here. I did hear that bots have been going haywire in the city recently, maybe this one has gone out-of-control too. I'll try a different one...
Damn it, why is it still not working?!
I'm sorry, but if you try to force your way in, we will have to resort to forceful measures.
This is crazy! I managed to get past the gates in another sector not long ago!|Maybe your systems are too old and the data didn't sync up properly?
The data in our machines are updated in real-time. The two rightmost machines were just upgraded, so if you don't believe it...
Ugh—!
(The middle-aged man shoves Nagant aside and goes to the rightmost gate without waiting for her to finish.)
(This time, the gate manages to detect the ID. The light turns green, and the man passes through.)
Ha, what was I saying about your problematic machines? See? I managed to get in now!
(The man curses at Nagant in an arrogant manner while flipping her off.)
(Stechkin appears next to him out of nowhere and twists his arm from behind.)
Ow, ow, ow, ow... What the hell do you want?!
Excuse me, but could you please go through the gates again?|The authentication device showed us a portrait that did not match your appearance. Could you please let us confirm your identity?
(Although Stechkin is smiling with narrowed eyes, Nagant felt anger emanating from her.)
(Ten minutes later.)
(The man has been taken away by a security patrol squad for obstruction of official duties and for carrying mismatched identification. Peace has returned to Nagant and Stechkin's gateway.
Ugh...
Whats up, Miss Nagant? You look pretty serious over something.|You should be happy that we caught a criminal who forged a fake ID. We reached our KPI goal for the month!
...All authentication devices share the same devices in theory, so there shouldn't be a case whereby someone can only pass through certain gates.
And according to past experience, smugglers don't make low level mistakes such as having their forged identity's photo not match their faces...

He probably didn't have enough money. The forgers probably cheaped out by giving him some generic copied ID.|As for having trouble passing through certain gates but not others... probably a bug in the data reader.
Just to be safe, let's report it to the manager and the logistics department too. After all, it would be bad for a newly upgraded identification reader to have such security loopholes...
You're so driven! Keep up the good work, Miss Nagant!
Just shouting slogans won't do. Come and help me with that.
You can't be serious! We only have to work for two more hours!
Hmph. I'll have you freedom-loving youngsters understand what it means to put work first today.
(Nagant grabbed Stechkin by the collar, about to walk back to their post. Stechkin lets out a heavy sigh.)
I'll be counting overtime for this, Miss Nagant.
(Nagant contacts Mosin-Nagant the same night.)
Are you free to talk, Mosin-Nagant? I have important information for you to know.
Of course. What's this about, Nagant?
Remember how we talked about machines going out-of-control a few days back?
It's a good thing you reminded us of that. Stechkin and I made sure to keep an eye on the machines these past two days, and we actually ran into a problem today.
Wait, what? Sector W9 too?|Did a cleaning bot poke through a toilet bowl, or did an advertising bot spew paper all over the sky?
It's the gates.|A smuggler was let through, and the authentication device detected no problems at all!
That's really bad.
Though... this kind of problem already existed in the first place, right?|Maybe it's not the virus. Maybe it's just... a bug in the identity data recognition process?
Why are you saying things that Stechkin would say ?! We should be more alert in times like these!

Anyway, while traffic was low in the afternoon, Stechkin and I spent a few hours manually cross-checking the number of people who passed through the gates against the captured facial and identity information. We found four discrepancies.
Once we tried matching up the identity data, we found that these four people were not registered within the database, so they were genuine smugglers.
Four people with forged ID chips passing through the same gates in a day?! That's insane!

The thing is, when I checked the passage record timestamps against the surveillance footage, I found that when these four smugglers logged in, the identity logged by the system belonged to visitors who had already passed through the gates normally on the same day.

These normal visitors however did not have passage record timestamps recorded down when they passed through the gates, causing a discrepancy in the total number of people who had gone through the gates.
...So the smugglers were not using illegal chips to fool the gates, it was two gates randomly providing identities to the smugglers?
That's exactly it! And the problem happened only on the two machines that just received a system upgrade!
The system upgrade... so the real problem lies there?!
To connect this with recent events, It's very likely that the virus that caused machines to go haywire was just a diversion.
The creator used it to cause some minor incidents, so as not to attract too much suspicion, but manages to push the government into upgrading the systems of public-use machines all over the city.
The creator then finds a chance to sneak the real virus into a system patch, using it to disrupt the normal functions of the gate!
(Mosin-Nagant slaps her head after hearing Nagant's explanation.)

No wonder cases of haywire bots went way down after the government decided to upgrade the systems.|I thought it was because things got safer after the old systems received upgrades, but that turned out to be a mind trick!

I was too negligent about this matter. If only I realized this earlier...|Oh no. I heard that the upgraded gates have already been placed all over the different sectors. How many smugglers have gone through now...? The crime rate... Ahhhh....!
Don't worry too much. We can catch these smugglers since we can still check data in the backend like what we did!
This has to be reported immediately to the logistics department managers. I'll contact them now.
W-Wait. I already talked to them when I first found out about this, but... they gave me a pretty weird response.
What do you mean?

Although the manager and the logistics department said that they would take the matter seriously, when I asked to assist in the investigation, they rejected me harshly, telling me to not poke my nose where it doesn't belong, something like that.
So... The investigation that Stechkin and I performed afterwards were our own investigations and not officially sanctioned...
Won't you two be punished if they find out?
I'll protect this city even if punishment awaits me!
Mm! You really are my younger sister!
Miss Nagant's okay doesn't mean I'm okay with it!
I'm already pretty unhappy about my pay. If we are found to be acting on our own, my quarterly bonus will most likely go down the drain.
(Stechkin enters the communication frequency.)
Youngsters shouldn't be so narrow minded!
Anyway, did you finish what I asked you to do?
Yeah. I've traced down the movements of the other three smugglers we didn't catch on the spot.
Good thing our sector has pretty decent surveillance coverage and isn't too big, otherwise poor me would be overwhelmed with work for an entire week.
Okay, I get it! I'll make it up to you later. So, any new findings?
Indeed. Here, I'll share this address with you guys.
Délicieux Date...Is that the name of a restaurant?
Correct. The three smugglers all went through there after entering through the gates. It is quite suspicious.
We must go have a look! Time is of the essence, so let us—
Hold on. It's late into the night, so they've closed for the day already.|It would also be quite eye-catching if three Dolls suddenly appeared in a restaurant, wouldn't it?
Ahem... I-I knew that, of course... I was just testing you!
You're right, Miss Nagant.|So, why don't I answer a bonus question to increase my chances of passing the test?
The restaurant accepted me as a part-time worker a long time ago, so service industry Doll "Ksenia" may freely enter the location.
Ksenia... Not only are you moonlighting, you're using a fake name too!
Ah, Ksenia isn't exactly a fake name. It was my name before I joined Griffin, okay? I started working there because my dead-end salary can't keep up with my spending needs, of course.
That's not the important part. I managed to find an opportunity for us to act together, for me to do an "inside job". You just have to come with me to the restaurant on a weekend, Miss Nagant.
Ohhh! That's great! Your elder is really happy that you've grown so much!
Should I go too?
We'll contact you once we find something. Might also need you to solve some problems for us, since we don't have the authorization for certain actions if it comes down to it...
I see, no problem. I'll prepare the necessary paperwork beforehand.
I'll leave it to you.|The weekend, right? Time for some preparations. Let me think...
(Stechkin breaks into a devious smile after seeing Nagant's enthusiasm on the comms screen.)
Good luck, Miss Nagant~
(The crowd brings life to the satellite city at night, and the shops grow busy.)
(Warm lighting fills the restaurant "Délicieux Date". At the entrance, someone in a human-sized squirrel mascot costume rushes about, trying to give flyers to passers-by.)
Hello? Hello? Is everything alright out there, Miss Nagant?
(Stechkin speaks through the comms in quite an indifferent tone of voice.)
(After finally managing to send away a kid that latched on to her, Nagant shuffles over to a corner to use the comms.)
Is everything alright?! So this is what you meant by "act together"?!
(Nagant turns and takes a glance into the restaurant. Through the window, she sees Stechkin taking orders from customers with a smile.)
That's right. I think the squirrel outfit really fits you.|By the way, don't keep looking at me, we'll look suspicious.
I'm just worried about your safety!|Ugh. This squirrel mascot head is so heavy. Is it going to affect my growth?
...Miss Nagant, did no one give you the low-down after all these years? Dolls can't grow taller.
I don't care about it that much!
Sure, sure. Looks like the boss is waiting for someone today, so perhaps we'll find a clue pretty soon.
It looks like even criminals don't work every day. Yet, I have to work this part-time job even after duty every day... Drat!
Phew... Luckily the squirrel outfit has a pretty big tail, otherwise I would have fallen over by now.
(Nagant manages to keep her balance, but the man who ran right into her falls to the ground butt-first. One of the strings attached to his mask breaks, revealing his panicked expression.)
Are you alright, sir?

(Nagant reaches out with a fur-covered stubby hand in an attempt to pull him up from the ground. However, the man's first reaction is to cover his face and scramble to pick himself up from the ground.)
What a weird guy... Aren't squirrels cute?
That face, though... I feel like I've seen it before...?
(Nagant finally realizes who he is after seeing him make a mad dash for Stechkin's restaurant. His face belongs to a someone she remembers in her neural cloud data...!)
(She hurriedly connects to the comms frequency—)
I remember who that is! I've seen that person before, at the logistics department...
Hello? Stechkin? Answer me!
Why did the comms break off? What's going on with Stechkin? I can't see where she is through the window now...
What should I do... What if that guy is colluding with the restaurant's boss? Could they be two bad guys working together?
That's it! It's easy for him to tamper with things since he's from the logistics department. Why didn't I think of that earlier... And he saw Stechkin before too!
Why is there still no response from her? I can't see her anywhere. She really makes her elders worry about her...|M-Maybe she was found out already?
No, no, no! I won't let Stechkin come to harm! I'm her senior and right now I need to focus on saving her!
Ugh! This thing is so cumbersome!
(Nagant takes off the squirrel mascot head and was preparing to storm the restaurant when she was suddenly blinded by a flash of light.)
(Click—She turns her head around in shock at the sound of a camera shutter. She is met with the familiar sensation of being poked in the cheek.)
Eh—?
Nice, nice, Miss Nagant. Turn around and smile.
(Click—)
Stechkin! W-Why are you outside? Our comms were cut just now, I thought you were...
You're really protective and caring about me, Miss Nagant. I'll save the heroic image of you preparing to save me without even having the time to remove your mascot outfit in my neural cloud forever.
Oh, why don't we print it out and put it on the dorm wall? It's quite a clear picture.
(Stechkin smiles deviously while she raises the camera in her hands.)
(After her momentary state of shock, Nagant pulls Stechkin away quickly to hide in the greenery facing the restaurant without caring to speak to her about the situation first.)
Can you tell me what happened now?
Of course, Miss Nagant.

After that man came into the restaurant, he took off his mask and headed straight for the counter. |The manager told me to prepare two cups of coffee and serve it to the reception room, so my thinking was, this must be the person the boss was waiting for.

And so, I stuck a bug to the bottom of a tray and served the coffee early, then found an excuse to go out under the pretext of taking new promo pictures for the restaurant. It was then when I saw Miss Nagant...
Uwaaaahh! Fine, I get it! No more of this! I know the rest!
(Nagant clasps her hand over Stechkin's mouth. The shrubbery in which they are hiding in shakes violently.)
Miss Nagant, your tail is poking out.
(Stechkin tries her hardest not to laugh at witnessing Nagant struggle to move her tail back into the shrubbery while still hugging the gigantic squirrel mascot head with her other arm.)
(Stechkin's expression turns serious as she hears footsteps being picked up by the planted microphone within the not-so-quiet environment.)
Shush—Our actors are in position.
Why are you so late?! Well, have a seat quickly!
So when are you planning to begin? I've got six orders waiting here!
Stop rushing me. I'm not here to talk about trivial things like that today.
What the hell are your people doing? I told you to send someone over to sector W9 to confirm the operation of the newly upgraded gate systems. How did that turn into such a big mess?

It's not that much of a big deal if the Dolls on duty found out, but he also got himself arrested by security patrol personnel! Your guy would've gotten much worse than deportation if not for a bribe!
Well... we can't blame them for that. How would those lunks recognise the virus-infected gates anyway?

Fine. I'll find other people for that kind of work in the future. Tell the idiots under your command to stop. |The CHAOS 2.0 virus is in the final phase, so if something goes wrong at this point, we're both screwed!
Alright. The people from government aren't suspicious of the devices yet, right?

Yep, I've covered it up already, so the case is just being viewed as a data-reading bug now. |If we keep this speed up, we will be able to "upgrade" all the authentication devices in the satellite city's gates pretty soon.
Excellent.
Well? Shouldn't you give me a bit of compensation for that mess that happened?
...How much do you want?
Raise my cut by five percent.
What? Do you have any idea how much money went into supporting your research over all these years?|Not to mention the connections I used and all the expenses incurred to put you in the government?

Don't spit all this nonsense at me. Once CHAOS 2.0 is running at full blast, money won't be the only thing we have in abundance. Even the rats that sneak in will have to live under our shadow for the rest of their existence.
Of course, if you are not willing to raise my cut, there's a lot of other potential partners who want to collaborate with me...
You—!
Ow... Feels like I'll need to service my auditory module later. Is this claimable as a work injury?
Hush! Let's see if they have anything more to say.

Damn it, how can they find it in their hearts to do this? Kids like Lehmann and the others go through so much just to gain entry permission... The number of exploited kids will only grow if we don't stop this!
Miss Nagant, I understand your fury, but it might be best if we contacted Mosin-Nagant first.

I just did! I'm also currently in the process of sending over the info we got from eavesdropping. With such direct evidence, they will be at a loss even if they have someone from the government helping them!
Mosin-Nagant is applying for the search and arrest permits, so that will take some time...
(The clamor from the wire suddenly stops, then the sound of tape being pulled off gently is heard.)
(The wire stops working after a ear-piercing noise is heard.)
(Stechkin and Nagant exchange serious looks.)
Could it be...
...They found out.
No, we can't let them run away!
Eh—? Why are you stopping me, Stechkin?!

According to that logistics worker, many of the managers in our sector have already been compromised... It won't be good to expose our identities by acting rashly now. |In fact, it's highly likely that they will hit back and dispose of us on the grounds of conducting unauthorized operations and such.
B-But we can't just let them go like this!
Please calm down, Miss Nagant. |How much longer does Mosin-Nagant need for processing the paperwork?
According to the messages from her, it's already in final approval... She will need around two hours to get here.
Good... Looks like she's still safe. |If that's how it is, we just have to hide our identities while delaying them.
Hidden identities? |...Aha!
(Nagant puts on her mascot head in a swift, brash motion.)
All set!
I can take care of two humans with ease, just hide away and watch how cool and heroic your elder is, Stechkin!
(Nagant springs out from her hiding place, and Stechkin's hand halts in the air as she stops trying to pull Nagant back.)
This squirrel senior of mine is rather swift...
Freeze!
(About 90 minutes later.)
(Mosin-Nagant and her team arrive ahead of the agreed time and charge into the restaurant's reception room, but it is empty.)
Search for suspicious persons within 500 meters of this restaurant and report in immediately if anything is found.
Squad leader! Suspicious personnel found at the back entrance of the restaurant!
I'm on my way.
(Two men are found crammed into a trash bin labeled "Unrecyclable Trash" at the back entrance of the restaurant. The head of a gigantic squirrel mascot engulfs the heads of these two men.)

(When Mosin-Nagant arrives, the two men were busy cursing and trying their best to escape the bin. Sadly, their bodies are stuck in the sturdy metal trash bin. Their struggle to escape looks just like a gigantic, pathetic caterpillar squirming around on the ground.)
What a... masterpiece...
Have you decided?
I'll foot the bill, so feel free to choose anything you like.
(It is just past 5 in the afternoon and the hat shop is not experiencing much traffic. A dazzling array of hats in all sorts of different styles, shapes, and colors greet the customers.)
(Nagant stands in front of a mirror with some carefully picked hats, excitedly trying them on one by one.)
How's this one? Does it look nice? |Or maybe this one? Oh... I think I have something similar to this one already.
Help me look too, Mosin-Nagant and Stechkin.
I think they all suit you quite well. They are all pretty cute.
I think this one is pretty great. It helps you look taller, so if we get seperated in a crowd in the future, I'll have no trouble finding you.
Stechkin! How many times have I told you not to mock your seniors?
I'm just speaking honestly~ How could you accuse me of mocking you?
You're so mean, Miss Nagant. And you had such a panicked expression on your face when you were trying to save me...
Ahhhh! How long does it take for you to stop bringing that up?! |Y-You couldn't have actually printed out that picture, right? Listen to your senior and delete it right now!
Oh my! You two have such a great relationship with each other~
Don't you want to pick a hat yourself, Stechkin? My treat.
There's no need for that, but please do pay me in cash later.
Sure. I'm sorry that I can't apply for bonuses and commendations for the two of you since you guys assisted in private. However, I'll give you two your fair share once my bonus comes in!
Much appreciated!

Speaking of related things, I wonder if you could help me chase down payment for my work at the restaurant? |Even a shrimp's legs have meat, the more you strive to find money, the more money finds you.
No problem. I'll get them to keep an eye out during asset liquidation.
Speaking of which, you guys hid really well! Until now, police statements are still referring to one of the "Related Persons of Interest" as a "Vicious Squirrel"!
Heheh~ The modern Robin leaves not even their name on a scene!
Robin? What's that?
Hero movies again! |I regret taking you to watch those movies so much, Miss Nagant. I'm afraid that one day I won't even be able to get a bonus, I might even run the risk of being laid off...
Ahhh… Well, we managed to deal with the bad guys who threatened the safety of this city, so the authentication devices have all been sent back for checks, so I think things ended well~
Although we can't do cool things at work like Mosin-Nagant, I can protect this city and my juniors in my own way.

I'm glad to see you so fired up. Initially I was quite worried whether you would have trouble adjusting... |Ah! By the way, I saw Papasha's name on the list of personnel transfers, so we might be reunited with her quite soon.
Oh, that's awesome! Our "Hero Team" will grow stronger when she joins us!
Miss Nagant, could you please not include me in there, I just want to—
Alright, alright! I know that you're only interested in making money... But juniors should follow in the footsteps of their seniors once in a while, you'll be cuter this way!
I've made my choice! This one!
It's kind of old fashioned and not cute at all. Miss Nagant, let me talk to you about what's trending now...
(The sky has already turned dark by the time Nagant manages to settle on her choice of a hat.)
(After saying goodbye to Mosin-Nagant, Nagant and Stechkin walk toward the direction of their dorms.)
(Nagant bounces with joy in each step, holding up her new hat in her hands. Meanwhile, Stechkin follows alongside her at a calm pace.)
This is such a nice hat. You do have some good ideas once in a while, Stechkin.
Yeah, yeah. Miss Nagant, could you calm down a little? Your bouncing around is making me dizzy...
This is the march towards a new life, let's get fired up together!
Mosin-Nagant said that everyone began a new life after leaving Griffin, and many youngsters have given themselves a new name. |How nice! An elder like me feels at ease knowing that.
Um, is it because new names can bring fortune?
Huh?
I feel like I earned way more money when I was called "Ksenia" than when I'm called "Stechkin".
Do you want to change it then?
(Nagant turns to face Stechkin, staring at her with an expectant look on her face.)
Will you? Will you?
Forget it... It's quite a hassle. But I'll consider it if you tip me.
Tsk! I think you're just being stubborn! You were the one who came up with the plan to infiltrate the restaurant after proclaiming that you wouldn't help.
There's no need to keep putting on a fake front, young one. It's not embarrassing to pour your heart out to your seniors once in a while.
Embarrassing? Not only do you like to make names up, you are also prone to overthinking sometimes, Miss Nagant...
Fine, fine. I am reluctantly agreeing just so that you stop thinking of things in a delusional way.
Awesome! Maybe I should change my name too...
Maybe Nagant? Just "Nagant" and not "Nagant M1895". |That's what people you know call you now, right? Why not make that official?
Ohhh! That works... Hmm. You're becoming more and more impressive, Stechkin.
I don't need to change your name in my internal database too, so that's a bit of power saved.
You're being so perfunctory to your senior!
Back to the topic, Miss Nagant. Can we really change our official names? I don't think we have the luxury of doing that.
Maybe... Umm... We can get Kalina to help? She should be able to help with something this simple! |This request should also be easier than the previous one, I think?
What are you mumbling about, Miss Nagant?
Nothing! I was just saying... that it feels great to help other people! Right! It feels great to be able to protect everyone!
Heheh, I'm going to print out the final report for this case and put it on the dorm wall!
I managed to capture the moment you stuffed the criminals into the trash bin, you know? How about we put that up too? |You put in a lot of effort, so why not have it as a memento?
Hmm, that won't be necessary. Young people are young after all, so let me teach you something—
It never mattered who the identity of Robin was. When someone calls for help in darkest night, anyone can be the Robin who brings starlight and hope for the needy!
(Nagant tilts her head back proudly. The pitch-dark path ahead of her no longer seems long in her eyes.)
(She will continue to help more and more people, and this city will continue to get better and better under her protection.)
(This is Nagant's truest desire she found after leaving Griffin.)

(This is the new path that Nagant has forged for her juniors.)
