Ouch! I can see their positions clearly, can you hit them, Lind?!
The place you're at doesn't even have a door. I'm working my way around!
There's no time! The walls of this place are made of wood, let's just blast through them!
Right. Hold on!
(After a series of gunshots, several gaping holes suddenly appear in the distant wall. Lind kicks the wall down and rushes out, firing at the automatons.)
Cheeta, are you all right?
Too slow! You should've been here 10 seconds ago!
You're the one who landed in this situation! How's the damage?
My body has been pierced in a few spots, but it's holding up!
Haha, you owe me a thanks now. A few more seconds and you would have been obliterated.
Hah? How can a genius like me be destroyed?
(Just as Cheeta finishes her sentence, a grenade rolls up to her.)
How come these automatons have grenades!?
(Cheeta and Lind hastily scramble, yet the explosion still sends Cheeta flying.)
Ow ow ow! Please don't tell me even this body is done for!
The stairway too narrow. Two more grenades and we're both scrap metal!
We can't leave! We have to lock it down or those machines will rush to the fourth floor!
You can still control the passage after pulling back a bit!
Those automatons follow their protocols to the letter. As long as we're holding this position, they won't dare get too close! The moment we back off, they'll charge upstairs even under our fire!
I heard an explosion. Cheeta, Lind, are you okay?
Absolutely not! We're pinned down and grenaded! How's the cleanup downstairs going?
Leader is clearing out the stragglers. She sent me to back you up!
Tololo will do! There's only a few enemies left, come over here!
C-coming! Can we synchronize the enemy data?
I'll mark their position for you! You can take out those at the stairway from behind, one single mag will do if you're fast enough!
Alright! Hang in there!
(Tololo rushes up the stairs, followed by another round of explosions and gunshots, and soon everything returns to silence.)
Lind? Tololo? Cheeta? What's the situation?
(Qiongjiu anxiously calls out to the rest of her squad in Level II, yet she's met with no response.)
They... they can't be destroyed, right?

(Qiongjiu rushes upstairs, vigilantly moving towards the third floor stairway. However, there are no sign of sentry automatons in the room, and instead there are three Dolls, quarreling amidst the smoke.)
I told you we couldn't fall back! There's only one more corner back there, we wouldn't be able to control the enemy once they come pouring up the stairs!
Then what if the enemy throws another grenade? Am I supposed to use your body as cover?
And Cheeta, you've lied to me again. That wasn't "a few" enemies left at all; there were at least ten of them clustered on the stairs!
I've knocked down so many of them, who could've known they were still functioning!
It scared the hell out of me when I ran into so many enemies at once on my way up!
Damn, your aim is really off. You're not seriously thinking that every bullet fired equals an enemy taken down, are you?
Huh? No way! I've clearly seen it all! Even if I didn't manage to take them out, that's because my body got damaged, so the decreased accuracy can't keep up with my thought!
Goodness, not only do you blame your teammates, but now you're starting to blame your own body. I can only imagine what excuse you'll come up with next time!

(Qiongjiu looks at her squad with a resigned expression. The Dolls stand amidst the wreckage of sentry machines, and while their bodies are all bruised and battered, judging by the intensity of their bickering, they ought to be fine.)
Qiongjiu, do you copy?
Miss Helian, please go ahead.
All civilians have been secured, and sentry automatons' signals have all disappeared.
Yes, we wiped them all out.
Well done. The security unit is impressed that we neutralized all opposition in five minutes. I'm sure this will have a very positive effect on Griffin's reputation.
It'll be nice if we get more commissions as a result.
How's your situation?
The mission was accomplished sooner than expected, and as a result the damage also exceeded our estimations.
Sounds like the same sort of outcome as the last mission then.
Indeed, another operation that had little in common with the original plan.
Because of Cheeta?
It was because of her, but this time, I stand by her judgment.
Hopefully you're not deliberately defending her. I'll wait for a detailed report from you with all the specifics.
Got it.
(Qiongjiu ends the call and looks at her squad members.)

Another operation that has little in common with the original plan, eh? Anyway, Frostfall Squad's combat efficiency is improving with time. Hopefully, one day we'll be able to return to the level of strength we had in the old days...
Ah, when did the Leader get up here?
While you girls were arguing about falling back and the number of enemies.
Never mind the details. Look, Leader, my strategy worked! As expected, I'm a genius!
Your strategy nearly caused us all to wake up in other bodies, okay?!
What difference does it make? As long as the outcome is successful—which, sure enough, is still up to me!
Alright, alright. Let's recap this mission when we get back. Gather up and prepare to head back to base.
Okay! Ah, I just realized, what if we used that tactic from earlier in "DUFG"...?
Huh? What kind of mental gymnastics is that?
Anyhow, let's try it out once we get back. I have a feeling the championship is within our grasp!
(Several weeks later. Qiongjiu and Helian have just concluded a protracted meeting.)
(Having squared away a difficult client, they head toward Helian's office with a slightly more relaxed pace.)
...Today's schedule is already full, I'll formally confirm the client's requirements again tomorrow...
Good, I'll wait for your message—Cheeta?
(Upon entering Helian's office, Qiongjiu, having just opened the door, looks under the desk in astonishment.)
(Cheeta, crouched and in the process of squeezing in, is startled by Qiongjiu's voice. Her head makes a loud thud as it comes into close contact with the table.)
(Holding her head, Cheeta turns to look at Qiongjiu with a cheeky giggle.)
Oops, didn't take long to be found out.
What are you doing here? Our next mission is scheduled in over two hours.
Besides, my door... should've been locked.
Haha, do you really expect a simple electronic lock like that to stop a genius like me?
...I'll ask the security department to reevaluate the safety of the door locks.... |So, Cheeta, what's the matter?
I'm guessing it's about the prize money.
Yep! Hehe, as expected of Leader Qiongjiu, you know me very well!
So, what are the results? Did we get the prize money?
(Helian steps around Cheeta, who is wearing a nervous smile, and walks over to her desk. She reaches for her terminal, and after a few clicks, a cheerful email pops up on the screen.)
See for yourself.
Well, let me see—
...Account deposit... Note: "DUFG Players Master Tournament - Team Championship Prize"... Ooooh! It's real! It's our prize money! Hahahaha!
I got the email this morning, but it's been a busy day so I haven't had a chance to inform you.
I was wondering where Cheeta went. Turns out, you were hiding in Helian's office.
We've been looking for you all afternoon, you know?
Eh? What did I do?
Isn't today the day when they're supposed to award the prize money for that team tournament?
So you all knew?
Ever since this morning. The Leader sent out an email for everyone to meet up.
Ah! I was too focused on the prize money and forgot to check my email!
Never expected you to win that tournament. I thought you girls were going to be eliminated in the first round.
No way! See, as long as you all cooperate with me, the championship is a piece of cake!
It seems to me that following that last mission, the three of you have significantly improved your teamwork.
How can I put this... It's a lot easier to work with Cheeta's whimsical ideas after getting to know her a little more during the last mission.
Told you they aren't whimsical, I'm just being more aggressive, that's the playstyle of a pro!
Fine, fine. As long as you stay within our line of sight, we'll find a way to cover you.
I've been making an effort to slow down during the tournament, right, Tololo?
Cheeta will face off a bunch of enemies by herself, relieving me of a significant amount of stress.
That's just how it is. As a pro gamer, I have the responsibility to carry you!
It seems that through the tournament, you have solved your teamwork issues.
Sort of.
Teamwork can come later, the prize money is the priority!
Geez, come on! Why didn't the Caretaker's Caretaker transfer me the prize money yet? I've been worrying about it all day!
Transfer it to you? We have yet to agree on how to split it, right?
What? Do we really need to do that? I was the captain in the tournament, so everyone's okay with me taking 50%, right? Lind and Tololo, you can have 25% each.
Cheeta, reward allocation should uphold the principle of impartiality: the prize money from this tournament should be split equally. As for the in-game rewards, you can have all of them.
Sure, whatever, I can live with that... Caretaker's Caretaker, transfer my share to me, quick—!
That's fine. But before I do, I need to deduct a portion from it to offset the debt caused by some of your previous behavior.
—Hah?! D-DEBT?!
W-what are you talking about? What debt, I have no idea...

Didn't you break Tololo's constellation model a while back, Cheeta? Had it been something cheap, I'm sure she would've been fine with it, but it seemed pretty valuable, so it would be quite inappropriate for you to not repay her.
Wha—that tiny box is that expensive?
It is, but not to the point of costing you your entire share of the prize money.
Ohhhh, thank goodness... scared the hell out of me!

And there's still that last time—when she planned to levitate the entire Griffin building. Cheeta has yet to settle the reparations for the damage done to the storeroom and all the supplies blown up during the experiment.
I need to cover that, too?
Individuals are rightfully responsible for material damage caused in non-combat scenarios. I will bill the appropriate amount directly to the accountable party.
Then... how much am I going to pay?
Let's see, if all your prize money goes towards paying off compensations, you won't have much debt left.
...What are you talking about, "not much debt left"? Shouldn't it be "prize money left"—Hold on, does that mean...?!
Mm.
...It zeroed out?
According to my calculations, yes.
(Cheeta freezes in place, and after a short moment, shuts her mouth—a rare sight to behold. The bangs on her forehead obstruct her eyes, and one can only see her tightly pursed lips.)
(Qiongjiu taps her shoulder.)
Cheeta?
(Cheeta remains motionless, as if she turned into an ice sculpture.)
Ah, looks like Cheeta bluescreened.
Is that also part of being a genius?
Cheeta, are you alright?
My... my plan...
(Qiongjiu quietly approaches from behind and leans over to get a better look at her face.)
...You upset?
If you go through with this, then all my plans would've been for nothing, wahhhh!
(Cheeta clasps her head in anguish and thrashes on the floor.)
I could've! I could've bought my original body back with this prize money and another six months of saving up!
There's more to competition than just the prize money. That tournament has made your squad work together as a proper team, isn't that a perfect reward in its own right?
Besides, having your plans derailed by someone else surely sucks, doesn't it?
...Ah...I, no, em, I-I usually don't spoil plans on purpose...
(As if she suddenly realized how her usual whimsical behavior makes others feel, the typically argumentative Cheeta doesn't know how to retort this time.)
Alright, alright, let's stop picking on Cheeta. I'll give her half of my share. After all, we couldn't have won the championship without her as the team leader.
...Lind!
I'll do the same as Lind, I guess. New eyepieces aren't that expensive, and it's more important to help Cheeta get her body back first.
...Tololo!
(Cheeta bounces up from the floor and rushes over to give Lind and Tololo a big hug.)
For the first time I can feel the warmth of a team! It's great to be in the same squad as you!
Ah, so this warmth is a first. I'm sooo sorry for being so icy normally.
Ah, no, that's not what I meant! I mean, today has been the warmest yet!
Seeing Cheeta so flustered is a rare sight, if only she was usually like this.
No way in hell. I'm a genius! Today is just a special display of my affable side!
(The Dolls of the Frostfall Squad start bickering once more. Qiongjiu reveals a relieved smile and turns to Helian.)
So, Miss Helian, did you arrange this on purpose?
After all, with a "genius" in the squad, it can't be that easy to manage.
Nevertheless, having a "genius" isn't always a burden. It's our responsibility as leaders to let them shine, isn't it?
You are becoming more and more like a true leader, Qiongjiu.
(Qiongjiu smiles, then looks over at Cheeta. She's still messing around with the other members, but her smile can no longer be concealed.)
We need to give these Dolls a better future. That's why Griffin still exists, right?
Yeah, we need to keep Griffin alive until those people return.
Hurray! Let's hurry up and get ready for the next tournament, then. Just one more victory and I'll be able to buy back my body!
A second round, eh...
Of course! There's nothing that can't be done with this genius at the helm!
(Some time after Cheeta boarded the Elmo, she told me in detail about her experience of participating in an esports tournament with her companions—)
Caretaker! You see now? The Caretaker's Caretaker is outrageous, isn't she? ...She went so far as to withhold my prize money...
While the deductions weren't completely unjustified... surely the Caretaker wouldn't have done that to me!
Hmph, forget it, I had a lot of fun playing the game anyway. As for the money to buy back my body, I'll figure it out later.
Speaking of the game, Caretaker, the devs of DUFG released a new title!
Ta-da! Look at this—"Justice Legends"!
With nearly a hundred playable characters, a wide variety of maps, and more game modes, this is truly a spiritual successor to DUFG!
And there's more. I heard that a corresponding esports tournament is in the works! If we can get the prize money—
Hehe, Caretaker. You see, I've greatly improved my teamwork in the last battle...
I haven't set off any explosions or anything else lately either... All in all, I was behaving and didn't cause any trouble for the Caretaker!
You want to buy this game?
Oooooh—Indeed, you know me so well, Caretaker!
I've already added two copies of Justice Legends to the cart, all you have to do is click Order—
Two? Why two copies?
What do you mean? One for you, one for me. That's two, obviously.

Once it's downloaded, we'll start playing immediately—I mean, start training with the goal of competing the moment we get to the Green Zone! Let's aim for the champion title in the first season! Don't worry, I'll make sure to train you well, Caretaker.
Hold on. Not only do you want me to play this game with you, but you want me to go to the tournament as well?
Of course, it's called "Justice Legends" after all... The devs said that you can't become a "legend" on your own, so if you want to compete, you have to be in at least a two-player team...
So I immediately thought of you! After all, the Caretaker won't hesitate to say yes to me, right...? The next time we go to the Green Zone, let's participate together, okay?
You see, the last time we participated in an esports event, my squad won the team tournament under my leadership.
Well, in my professional opinion, the Caretaker's gaming talents are much higher than those two's. We'll have no problem with this duo! This is recognition from a genius!
For the sake of my old body—and the honor of the, uh, Elmo, and my mood, and my combat efficiency, just say yes, please? Pretty please?
What about work, then?
Ah, w-work? I-I mean... you know, the money from commissions alone is nowhere near enough to replace my body. I'm losing more than what I'm earning...
Also, me aside, the Caretaker definitely needs to work and have plenty of rest... Hmm...
Oh, I got it, let's make a substitute robot for the Caretaker. We shall call it... Caretaker's Stand-In Prototype Mk I!
Wouldn't it be convenient to let it handle all your tasks once it's been fully developed?
And do you have the funds for R&D?
Uh, not a penny... Caretaker, is it possible... to borrow some first?
...Why are you looking at me like that? Hey, think about it. If the development is successful, the Caretaker won't need to stay in the ops room all day long anymore.
I know everything. The Caretakers now face a much more exhausting workload than at Griffin. There are days I don't even see you leave your room... I noticed that right away when I got on the Elmo!
If the Caretaker's Stand-In Prototype Mk I can help you out, you'll have more free time to play with me, and I won't have to look for you for hours on end!
...I'll get the game, but let me ponder about the bot.
No way... Then you need to make up your mind as soon as possible! I'll collect the Caretaker's behavioral data in the meantime then!
Caretaker, please work with me on this one! And Justice Legends training, can't forget about that either!
Okay, I'll play with you when I have time.
(Under Qiongjiu's command, the Frostfall Squad is pursuing the vehicle that seized the merchant's cargo.)
Tololo, open fire in 45 seconds, blow their wheels right off.
Cheeta and Lind, move up directly. You have three minutes to disarm the bandits in the vehicles ahead.
Three minutes?
Leader, isn't three minutes a bit short? They've got three cars!
It's feasible. Didn't we already plan this?
Be careful and don't let the car roll over. The cargo they've seized contains glassware, our commissioner has specifically warned us about that.
Leader! Hey—Leader!
Tololo, five seconds to go. Mind your firing interval, one shot at a time, starting with the middle one.
Understood.
Hey? Hello? Did this channel mute me?
(Bang, bang, bang—)
(Ignoring Cheeta's complaints, Tololo opens fire right on time, hitting the minivans' tires one by one.)
Lind, Cheeta, you have 2 minutes and 30 seconds.
Let's go, Cheeta! I go left, you go right. Whoever finishes first gets the center!
Ah—you're jumping the gun!
Stay quiet!
(Lind ties up the last beaten and bruised bandit and throws him to the ground.)
(On the sidelines, Cheeta proudly crosses her arms and looks at Qiongjiu and Tololo walking over.)
Leader, did you catch that? I just yanked the bandit out of the passenger seat in such a gallant manner!
Did you mean "violent and barbaric"?
Stop talking so much nonsense if you've lost~ We're half a minute ahead of the Leader's schedule!
If we were to wait for you to smack every last one of these dumb thieves with your stock, we'd be here until dark!
Weapons are how civilized people solve their problems. Resorting to fisticuffs and physical violence? Are you a savage?
Guess you have no use for your two hands anymore going off that, want me to install the guns directly on your body? As a genius I can certainly do that for free~
You—
(Seeing the pair go about their usual business, Tololo shakes her head.)
(Qiongjiu smiles, tidies up her slightly disheveled clothes, and pulls out a wooden comb. She hands it to Tololo, gesturing for her to straighten out her long hair.)
I wonder how long they'll go on for this time...
It's fine. We've got 10 minutes before the debrief scheduled with our commissioner anyway.
Seems like the team's combat efficiency has considerably increased lately, we'll need to tailor our plans more precisely next time.
Why's the pressure getting heavier when we're completing the tasks more efficiently? There is no need to be so precise, is there?
If we are to develop a plan, then we must stick to it, and being precise is a safer bet.
I feel like you're simply being too obsessive, Leader...

(Shaking her head at Cheeta, Qiongjiu opens her to-do list as usual. Amidst the densely packed schedule, she checks off "15:40 Intercept van" with a note that reads, "Planning failure, completed ahead of schedule.")
Completing it early can't be considered a failure, right? Leader—
(Beep—the sharp droning sound of a call interrupts Cheeta's grumbling.)
...Helian?
(Qiongjiu frowns and picks up the comm.)
This is Qiongjiu. Is something wrong? Our scheduled check-in isn't due yet.
Emergency situation. Return to Griffin as soon as you complete your current mission.
I see.
(Qiongjiu glances at the time.)
ETA 1:15 AM. Straight to your office?
Yes, I'll be waiting for you.
(After handing over their other tasks, the Frostfall Squad arrives at Griffin and heads straight for Helian's office.)
What's the matter? You called us back in such a hurry.
There's an important assignment for your squad.
The details have just been emailed to you. Have you all read them?
Uh... I didn't check my inbox... but T-Tololo must have finished reading it!
(Cheeta ducks behind Tololo and pushes her forward.)
...I did, indeed.
I'll have them familiarize themselves with the details properly afterward, let's get straight to the point.
(Helian glances at Qiongjiu, perplexed, and pushes up her imaginary monocle out of habit, only to stop in an awkward moment of realization.)
Ahem... The commissioner this time is a rising businessman, who became popular in the White Zone's prestigious circles over these past two years—Lars Prinsler.
Yes, I've read it in the file, and if I remember correctly, we've tried to make contact with this individual before.
Though still a young man, he's very cautious and requested lots of documents and qualification certificates. Yet, he was still hesitant to establish a partnership with us.
Is he finally feeling reassured now?
Perhaps. In his words, he's hoping for a simple collaboration first to see if we click.
So, what's does the mission entail?
Two days from now, his daughter, Hedy Prinsler, will travel to their estate in the suburbs of ZHY-06 for a vacation.
The Prinslers wish to hire a Griffin Doll squad as Hedy's bodyguards.
And I want to task the Frostfall Squad with this mission.
A bodyguard gig, requiring all four of us? The rich in the White Zones have nowhere else to spend their money, do they?
A gesture of goodwill?
Correct, but that's only part of the reason.
I chose to reach out to them for partnership before because the Prinslers' business was booming for the past two years.
That naturally attracted them lot of unwanted attention. Attacks on the couple have been frequent, and shipping facilities belonging to their business are constantly being ransacked.
I fear that... this assignment, too, is not as straightforward as they suggest.
I see. This could very well be their test for Griffin, with our future partnership being at stake.
Hehe, so that's how it is. Don't worry, Helian. With Frostfall in action, they'll bear witness to what Griffin is capable of.
There's no info...
(Tololo, who had been quiet, suddenly speaks up.)
What info?
On the subject of protection.
That's right, Helian. The only information you sent us is the vacation itinerary of this young lady we're trying to protect.
There is no information regarding Miss Hedy herself, there's absolutely nothing beyond her name.
No chance you left that out, is there?
Of course not, and I have inquired Mr. Prinsler about this.

Mr. Prinsler's response was that they didn't want to disclose too much information of their daughter for security reasons. Everything will be handed over at the beginning of the escort mission, however.
Security reasons? Is he still worried about us compromising them? What's the point of a partnership if they don't even trust us!?
Forget it. We can start inferring some insights just by looking at the vacation itinerary he provided.
Most of the activities are clustered around nighttime and evening hours, while the entire daytime is spent sleeping... She may be suffering from a photophobia-like disorder.
I doubt that. Maybe she's the kind that stays up all night playing video games and reading light novels.
Anyway, as long as the young lady can stick to the arrangements and enjoy her vacation without a making fuss, there shouldn't be any problem.
It's just that... this itinerary could've been a little more explicit...
(Looking at Qiongjiu begin to dive into the timetable, the three squad members exchange playful winks.)
Oh, the misery. Looks like the Leader's going to have to give our "night owl" a hard time.
That's the Leader for you. Even our client's schedule has to be precisely controlled...
She's done something similar before...
Ah, you mean the previous commissioner who was always late, right? After working with us just three times, they never dared to be late again.
Tsk. Being late for two hours and claiming it's because of an upset stomach, how dare they?
Not three times, just two.
Hmm... really? I can't remember, but as I recall... The Leader only seems to have a problem with this type of clients, right?
(Whether intentional or not, Qiongjiu happens to conclude her examination of the timetable and looks up.)
(Cheeta immediately shuts up.)
Helian, just leave this task to Frostfall. I'll get the team ready in the coming days.
Okay, be careful.
(Two days later, in the early morning, the Frostfall Squad arrives at the private estate in ZHY-06, located at the address provided by the Prinslers.)
(Their commissioners, the Prinslers, did not make an appearance; instead, they are greeted by a butler.)
Woah, what a huge mansion, complete with a pond! Is this what being a rich businessman is like?

This is just one of the many properties under the Sir and Madam's name. Due to its proximity to native Green Zones, the surrounding environment is highly favorable and thus preferred by the young miss.
Such a pleasant environment, and the young lady only comes out in the middle of the night? Hmm... Seems like a waste—
(Qiongjiu gives Lind and Tololo a look, signaling them to drag Cheeta away without creating a scene.)
That's enough.
Sorry.
Oh, please make yourselves at home. The young miss has been in a bad mood lately. The guards being more lively should make her feel better.
That's great to hear, but... I have some inquiries...
(Qiongjiu watches the butler closely.)
(A man in his forties, he bows slightly at Qiongjiu.)
Please don't be apprehensive.
Alright. Looking at your pace and stature, you don't strike me as an ordinary butler. As for the bodyguard gentlemen over here...
(Qiongjiu looks at the surrounding team of bodyguards.)
They all look like professionals with years of military training. Does the young lady really require our protection?
Well... As a matter of fact, after handing over the task to you, we will temporarily withdraw from this place.
Of course, we won't go very far. We'll be stationed at a position 3 clicks northeast of the mansion, in case of emergency.
Care to explain the reasoning?
In truth... we have being reprimanded by the young miss.
Huh?

The young miss seems to have gotten sick of life in the White Zone, as well as being surrounded by bodyguards all day. She tried to run away on several occasions before, but fortunately nothing harmful has occurred so far.

It was for this reason that the young miss's doctor suggested to the Sir and Madam for her to spend some time in the Green Zone, as well for us to maintain some distance, given the stress it might cause her.
I see... That's why fresh guards like us are called upon for security duty.

Indeed. Sir has been pondering this matter for quite a while, but the state of the young miss's condition was deteriorating by the day. As her mere butler, I am already tormented inside, not to mention how Sir and Madam must feel.
Which is why, Miss Qiongjiu, we sincerely hope that the Frostfall Squad can allow the young miss to enjoy her vacation while keeping her safe.
(The butler appears utterly sincere and treats Qiongjiu with utmost regard, suggesting that he is indeed counting all his hopes on this experience.)
We will certainly do our best. At a later time, I'll work out a communication schedule to synchronize the situation with you on a regular basis.
Of course, I'll also go over the defensive structures and their locations, as well as the road conditions on the property.
That way, if any incident does occur, we can have something to work with.
Hope you can cooperate.
Certainly, with Miss Qiongjiu being so considerate.
I am glad to have your understanding.
Up ahead is the mansion where the young miss resides. She's already waiting for you in her room. Please follow me.
Got it.
(Looking at her squad members still lagging behind, Qiongjiu shouts resignedly—)
You three, hurry up and follow!
Please come in.
(After a gentle tap, a young woman's voice emerges from behind the door.)
(After obtaining permission, the butler pushes the door open.)
Greetings, I'm—ah!
Look out!
(As soon as the door opens, a dark shadow lunges towards Qiongjiu.)
(Years of battlefield experience allow Qiongjiu to immediately assume her defensive stance, reaching out to grab the dark shadow.)
(The Frostfall Squad members behind Qiongjiu also draw their guns immediately.)
(Almost simultaneously, Qiongjiu can feel a formidable force grabbing her wrist—)
(The butler, who was standing reverently just moments ago, raises his gun as well.)
What are you doing?
Please let go! It's a misunderstanding!
(Realizing that the "opponent" has no ulterior motive, Qiongjiu loosens her grip and finally takes a closer look at the shadowy figure she's grasping—)
(A flying squirrel, adorned with a lovely hat and a bow tie, is baring its teeth and hissing at her with a scowl.)
(At this point, the pale-skinned young woman has quickly approached as well.)
...I am terribly sorry for startling your pet, Miss Hedy.
(Qiongjiu politely cups the flying squirrel in her palm, ready to hand it back to the young woman before her.)
(Unexpectedly, the flying squirrel suddenly leaps up, climbs up to Qiongjiu's head, then messes up her carefully tended hair bun.)
L-Leader!
(Qiongjiu raises her hand to signal Tololo, who's trying to come to rescue, to leave it.)
Looks like your pet is full of energy again, Miss Hedy.
You're mistaken, I'm merely Miss Hedy's personal doctor and dietitian, Cecily.
The real Miss Hedy... is having a friendly exchange with you right now.
Huh?
(Qiongjiu straightens her neck, slowly shifting her sight upward. The smile on her face grows increasingly tenuous.)
("Miss Hedy" on the top of her head is trying to pull her hair bun open and find a way to burrow into it.)
Oh geez... I feel a little sorry for the Leader, but also amused... Pfft, permission to laugh?
You've already done so.
What a twist, can't believe we've bumped into the worst kind of a mission subject for the Leader to handle...
(Though Qiongjiu stays silent, every Doll of the Frostfall Squad seems to have heard her deep sighs.)

Miss Hedy! Please wait!

Yeeart—!
(Cheeta leaps high into the air, her fingertips just barely skimming the belly of the flying squirrel.)

(Cheeta and Cecily, having just made it to the stairway landing, both breath a sigh of relief.)

(Qiongjiu retrieves the pellets.)
Miss Hedy, it's a pleasure to work with you.

(Sometime after Qiongjiu boarded the Elmo, she told me in detail about how Griffin established a partnership with the Prinslers—)
Commander, while I appreciate your thoughtfulness in trying to save me from embarrassment...
If you want to laugh, please do so. The look on your face right now is even more outrageous than if you were laughing at me.
Sorry, it was indeed quite an entertaining experience.
That's okay. I'm just really not good with animals. They're too difficult to comprehend, and they can't be controlled when they get emotional...
At her age, Miss Hedy can be considered a granny among the flying squirrels, yet the Frostfall Squad still becomes a chaotic turmoil every time we go on an escort mission.

(In the silent conference room, WKp stands alone before a whiteboard.)

(After repeated meetings, the plan of putting together supplies search teams finally is agreed upon by many Dolls.)
(Today is the day the first search team would depart. Before setting off, II_77090 seeks out WKp to discuss some relevant matters.)
[Sorry, I still couldn't convince everyone to agree to a transfer of location...]—WKp
No need to blame yourself. Everyone agreeing to search for supplies is already a big difference.
The voting system has been approved of as well. A small step for our "Doll Community".
Do not seek immediate results. I believe that things will turn for the better.
(A smile returns to WKp's face with the help of II_77090's encouragement.)
Everything from now on will have to be voted on, who knows what new problems will show up.
Ah, no point in thinking about it so much, we'll deal it with later. Come, let's see how the teams are going with their preparations.
(The two prepare to go see the search teams as they make ready.)
(On the way, the two see various Dolls busy at work, doing their position's duty as the community's functions demand.)
II_77090! WKp! Over here!
(Rosalind stands by a run-down jeep, waving at the two with screwdriver in hand.)
Rosalind, are you...
With this long of a journey, it won't do to make them walk. I might as well do what I can as a mechanist.
With vehicles, the teams' efficiency will increase greatly. You've been a great help.
If you want to thank anyone, thank Bathilde. She's been the main driving force behind the repairs.
Bathilde? Ah... a Doll that's not been around for very long, right? The one that came around when Allen last went to buy Dolls?
Yeah, specializes in mechanical maintenance. Good at her job, but not so good at communicating with others.
I wanted her to come say hi to everyone... but I got turned down.
Ah, don't worry, she can do what she likes. Thank her for me.
Of course. In truth, many of us see this place as home already. Who doesn't want home to be a nicer place?
You're right. If we focus our efforts, our "community" will without a doubt improve.
Right, I'm about to go check up on the search teams with WKp. Rosalind, want to come with?
The cars are just about done and ready to go, you two go first. If they're already ready to go, tell 'em to wait for me and that the cars are nearly there!
No problem.
(Leaving Rosalind, II_77090 and WKp continue on their way to the search teams.)
(Those they encounter on the way passionately greet them before they hurriedly return to work.)
(WKp writes down some words on her notebook, tugging at II_77090's garments.)
[The Dolls here have changed so much... It's like all of that gloominess from before is gone...]—WKp
Change starts from the small things, you know.
WKp, these are all the fruits of your work.
W-wha, nonono, I... don't...
(WKp vigorously shakes her head, beginning to write in her notebook again.)
[Compared to Ullrid, my contributions are not worth mentioning... It's everyone's trust in you that keeps us together here.]—WKp
But we couldn't manage without your planning, no?
If you were not here, I fear my simple words would not be able to have nearly the same effect.
[I just do what I can. To speak of it, have you told everyone about your new name?]—WKp
New name... oh, you mean Ullrid?
(WKp lightly nods in response.)
I haven't really thought it through, whether or not I'm going to settle on that name... It's just not a good time...
Please don't tell anyone, I need to think on it a bit...
[Of course, before you're ready, it's a secret between us. I do really think, though, that Ullrid is far better than II_77090.]—WKp
(The two arrive at the search team's base of choice—an old warehouse. Suomi and some other Dolls are adjusting equipment outside.)
Suomi, how are you faring with the prep?
(Fully focused on the work at hand, Suomi almost jumps at the sound.)
Whew... it's Big Sis... I'm so sorry, we've been bogged down, we'll set off right away...
Don't worry, we're not in that much of a hurry. Safety first.
We don't have much left in the way of supplies, and much of what we found in the ruins are unsalvageable. In truth, our equipment is pretty lacking...
I did consider that, so I arranged for the area of the first search to be nearby.
Speaking of equipment, Rosalind has a "big present" for you.
Present?
Everyone! Wait for me!
(Before Suomi can begin to ask, the sound of Rosalind's yelling can be heard, soon following by the sound of an engine akin to a tractor's.)
Is that... a jeep?
Looks like I made in time before you left.
Huh? A jeep? We have one?
We put together some parts and found one that wasn't too busted up. Our amazing mechanists have restored it to an at least somewhat roadworthy condition.
It's yours. Go have fun, don't be too wild. Oh, and there's not much fuel left. Use it sparingly.
(In the middle of the conversation, a civilian Doll walks over, reporting to II_77090 that the search teams are ready.)
Big Sis, the team's ready to depart.
Remember, safely first. Come back home in one piece.
(In a room inside the abandoned camp, II_77090 and WKp discuss recent events.)
Before they realize it, the morning had passed.)
WKp, do you think Allen will come back?
[If something happens, he should send someone to request reinforcements, but we've gotten no word yet. Judging by the time frame, the odds of them all being killed are considerable.]—WKp
I'm inclined to agree. The chances of them returning are low enough to ignore.
[That is why I think we should immediately start looking for a most suitable location.]—WKp
[This place isn't safe, and we might be discovered by bounty hunters, ELIDs, and other people at any time.]—WKp

I understand why you are worried, but most of the Dolls here do not have any desire to do that. We'll be here for quite a while before we can convince the others, so improving our defenses here is vital...

[Many of those remaining are civilian Dolls with lacking combat performance. If we cannot have a change of location immediately, we need to decrease the discoverability of the location and avoid combat whenever possible.]—WKp
Hmm... you're right, maybe I should talk to Rosalind, see if my optical camouflage can be applied... but the money. Money is a problem.
(The light sound of knocking arises as they talk.)
Please come in.
Suomi? When'd you... crap, I got caught up talking with WKp, completely forgot you were coming back some time today...
Don't worry, Big Sis, the search went pretty smoothly this time. Everyone is alive and well.
That's good. What of the supplies gathered?
The target location was more barren than expected, and we only found around 40 percent of the listed supplies, but...
(Suomi seems a little uncomfortable, as if there was something she would prefer not to say.)
Everyone is safe and sound at least. If there's anything you want to say, go ahead.
Other than the supplies, we... also took in a wounded bounty hunter...
(II_77090 turns around to find WKp just as surprised as she is.)
I-I know you're wary of humans, but... our former Commander is also a bounty hunter right now, and I couldn't just let...
I'm sorry...
II_77090... S-Suomi, she...
Don't be like that, you two, it's fine. I decide to be wary of humans, but it's good that you've found trustworthy humans!
Here, let's go have a look first. We'll decide after we consider the circumstances.
(Guided by Suomi, II_77090 arrives at an abandoned lodging. A woman rests unconscious on the bed, with a C-Doll taking care of her.)
(II_77090 nods at the Doll, indicating for her to temporarily take her leave.)
Are her wounds serious?
She will live. We've given her the necessary injections, and she should wake up in some time.
Hmm... WKp, what do you think?
(WKp contemplates the bounty hunter's clothing and appearance, beginning to write on her notebook.)
[Too little information to determine if they are friendly or not. Judging from her equipment, she might be taking on requests not issued by B.R.I.E.F.]—WKp
(WKp gestures at the equipment the hunter carries with her.)
[A normal bounty hunter does not have enough cash to spare to buy these. She's a massive unknown variable.]—WKp
(II_77090 nods, indicating that she understands. WKp continues to write.)
[We have two safe options. One, leave this bounty hunter, immediately transfer the Dolls here. Two, deal with her before she wakes up so we can stay at our current location.]—WKp
(WKp writes quickly, flipping onto a second page after making sure that everyone is done reading the first.)
[No matter what, we need to minimize contact and communication with her. If she discovers that our affiliated party is missing, chances are she'll sell our coordinates to someone...]—WKp
You're right, we cannot trust a bounty hunter of unknown origins, but we cannot break the precedent we have set.
You mean...
Her fate will be decided by vote. Suomi, tell the others.
W-wait!
(Animated, WKp calls out to II_77090 before she even begins writing before scribbling a line quickly.)

[I've calculated various outcomes, and it's just too risky to keep her around... Here's my data, you'll understand once you see it... The Dolls here are mostly civilian Dolls with servicing and trusting humans in their base logic. Not even such data will be able to put them on guard.]—WKp
(WKp transfer the data via Level II. Supported with reason, the data is fully convincing.)
[The voting system was only just established, and the regulations are not yet clear. I don't think it's prudent to resolve everything by voting...]—WKp
(WKp pauses for a moment, hesitating before she continues.)

[And... perfect fairness isn't necessarily a good thing. Objectively, it does not exist either. If some important decisions are left to II_77090, our efficiency will be far better, and many issues will be avoided.]—WKp
But voting is the basis of the Doll...
(II_77090 stops, swallowing the word "community" as she realizes Suomi is still nearby.)
WKp, your calculations are exact, and I would love to do as you say.

But the voting system was only just implemented, and the others accepted the system out of trust. If the person who put it forward is the first one to toss it aside, the painstakingly established trust will disappear in an instant.

You are right in that having one or few in leadership roles has many benefits, but what is the difference in that from using commands to direct a Doll? That is not the outcome I want, and not what I wish to do...
[I understand... but that is dangerous!]—WKp
(The two wordlessly stare at each other as Suomi stands between them, helpless. Finally, WKp shakes her head in resignation.)
[Okay, I agree to the vote, but we must prepare a backup plan in case of any danger that you must unconditionally support me on.]—WKp
This concerns the safety of every Doll here. I will not take it lightly.
(With the discussion at an end, II_77090 initiates a vote through Level II.)
(The three wait for a moment. As WKp said, the majority chose to keep the bounty hunter around.)
[This result... We will regret it in time...]—WKp
Haha, haven't we dealt with problems as they appeared this entire time?
Calm down, let's fret over this backup plan.
[Be prepared for an all nighter. No rest until we sort this out!]—WKp
(The next day, the bounty hunter wakes up. II_77090 and WKp go to visit them. Before they even enter the room, the bounty hunter's various questions can be heard.)
How long was I out for? What is this place? Why are there only Dolls here? Who do you belong to?
Apologies for interrupting your rest.
(II_77090 opens the door, and the bounty hunter stops spouting questions at the sound.)
Ah... never mind that, you've saved me. I haven't even had time to thank you...
Huh? Another Doll?
Your wounds are not serious, but you must rest, so—
It's just a flesh wound, nothing big. I'm perfectly well.
Never imagined I would make it out of that alive. Thought I was dead meat.
Ah, where's your owner? I owe him my thanks. To have this many Dolls stationed in a place like this, he must be a great man indeed. Perhaps some future cooperation is on the table.
(The bounty hunter's questions are very targeted, putting II_77090 on guard. WKp clandestinely tugs at a corner of her clothing.)
(II_77090 responds with a light nod.)
We belong to the Bernard Allen bounty hunter convoy, currently collecting Collapse Epiphyllum. This is our temporary forward base.
The majority of our personnel are out on duty, and we are only responsible for guarding the base. I'm afraid I cannot tell you any more.
Ooh, I see.
You mean to say that all of the humans here are out on a mission, right?
You may understand it as such. I've told Mr Allen of your situation, and he plans to see you after he returns.
I should thank him face-to-face, then.
Your convoy must be considerable in size to have a forward base in a place like this, right? I've always been stuck in pretty small teams, could you maybe show me around the big leagues?
Sorry, Mr Allen instructed us that no outside personnel were to approach our base and supplies. Rescuing you is already a breach of our instructions.
You need to rest in your current state as well.
(Directly refused, the bounty hunter changes the topic in a timely manner.)
Oh... I see, it's alright then, I'll just have a lie down. I feel a bit tired, after talking so much...
Might I ask for your B.R.I.E.F. registered ID and name?
(She hesitates for a moment, but immediately begins to smile from ear to ear.)
Registered name? Name's Charlotte, but you don't have the permissions to verify the ID even if I give it to you now, do you?|When your owner, I mean Allen, I'll give it to him when it comes back.
(II_77090 bids farewell to the bounty hunter, entering another empty room with WKp. Before II_77090 can open her mouth, WKp stuffs a notebook into her hands.)
[This supposed "Charlotte" was trying to probe us.]—WKp
Yeah, and rather bad at hiding it. Her goals were obvious.
[If we allow her to leave, the chances of her selling us out are at least 52%...]—WKp
[I would advise a change of location immediately after she leaves.]—WKp
We cannot realistically do that currently. Not only do we have no selected destination, we lack the necessary supplies as well.
The Dolls already have no particular desire to migrate, and a vote under current circumstances will get nowhere.
B-but...
(WKp takes a moment to calm herself before starting to write once more.)
[If we cannot move, we...]—WKp
(WKp stops halfway, chewing the end of her pen as she thinks.)
[We must assume that Charlotte will betray us, and immediately improve our defenses after she leaves... We should revise the plans we made yesterday as well.]—WKp
That's the only option left to us. We have little time, I'll immediately contact Suomi.
Big Sis, she's right up ahead!
She woke up today and said that she really had to leave, and we could hardly stop her. Best we could do was give her an excuse, saying you wanted to see her off personally...
Her leaving was only a matter of time. Leave it to me.
(After comforting the anxious Suomi, II_77090 moves towards Charlotte, who is giving thanks to various Dolls.)
Thank you all! Oh? It's you two, sorry for being so sudden and not letting you know ahead of time.
Your wounds are yet to heal. I would advise that you take a few more days to rest.
No, no, I'm sure my friends are looking for me. I better head back and let them know I'm alright!
We can help you...
No, really, it's fine, hahaha! Ah—could you be trying to, I don't know, maybe confine and ransom me here, with how passionately you're trying to get me to stay?
We only wish for you to recover fully.
Ah... it was just a joke, don't take it so seriously. But I really do have to go. Can't help it, friends and all.
...We will respect your decision.
Thanks again.
Right, send my greeting to Allen when he returns.
(Charlotte turns to leave. A veil of sand blows forth, concealing her silhouette.)
[She sure was in a hurry to leave...]—WKp
I did not think she would leave this quickly. Contact the others, bolster our defences.
(A few days after Charlotte's departure, II_77090 inspects the ruins' entrance and asks about the state of the surveillance systems to be installed.)
Suomi, how's progress?
We're ahead of schedule! The signal transmission range has been doubled, and we can monitor the situation from the surveillance equipment from further away.
Good work. Any word from the scouts?
Not quite...
Hold on, they just sent a message...
They're saying... targets located, 6km away, straight ahead, 15 of them! Visual comparison... unidentifiable! They're heading right for us!
...This quickly? It's only been 5 days...
Tell everyone to prepare for battle, I need to talk to WKp!
WKp!
(II_77090 hurriedly opens the door to find WKp drafting an operational map.)
(Hearing II_77090, WKp begins to write on a blackboard by her side.)

[Before you start, I've gotten the intel from the scouts. We can be sure that they are bounty hunters. They're some distance away still, and we are not completely unprepared. We have some time to improve our defenses still.]—WKp
[This is a plan I've prepared according to the enemy data. Have a look, Ullrid.]—WKp
(WKp passes a notebook to II_77090, continuing to write upon the blackboard.]—WKp
(Upon the notebook are a series of intricate contingencies laid out by WKp, detailing the various possible ways the bounty hunters might attack.)
"Avoid our weaknesses, rely on positional advantage and guerilla tactics"?
Yeah, we should be able to handle them this way even with a numbers and equipment disadvantage if we are flexible in our tactics.I'd make an improvement here, though.

I will split our Dolls into three teams. Team 1 will be stationed in the middle of the ruins, and will use the empty supply crates as bait. After the bounty hunters enter the ruins, team 1 will bait them inwards and attract fire.
Team 2 will find a location to hide in, and begin their attack after team 1 has baited the enemy in. They will be our main force, ambushing and sectioning the enemy off.

Team 3 will be outside the ruins as a surprise force, ready to either attack the bounty hunters' supply lines and force them to pull back, or push forward and surround them in conjunction with our forces in the ruins.
We will feed them varied signals with guerilla tactics, making it difficult for them to determine the size of our forces. When they lose the will to fight, they will naturally retreat.
Of course, we will not initiate combat before making sure they bear ill will.
[Yeah, sounds doable. I'll leave the adjustments to you, Ullrid.]—WKp
I'll send this plan to the others. Time is short, and we must complete our deployments before they arrive.
(The Dolls begin to quickly move.)
(After everything is ready the bounty hunters arrive as scheduled. They remain cautious, keeping their main force outside the ruins and sending a small detachment in.)

(Both situated in team 2, II_77090 and WKp monitor the situation around the empty supply crates via surveillance equipment. II_77090 makes contact with Suomi after confirming the bounty hunter squad's approach.)
They're about to open the crates. Team 1, get ready. Do not open fire before you are sure of their intentions.
Acknowledged.
(The bounty hunters in the surveillance hurl insults as they open empty crates and begin to deploy their equipment.)
(Hidden not far away, team 1 reveals themselves. Realizing the trap they are positioned in, the bounty hunters loudly give commands and open fire.)
Shoot carefully! I want them back in one piece, good parts are worth money, you know!
The humans... want to catch and sell us?
Did Charlotte guide them here? But we saved her...
(Conversation buzzes amongst the members of team 2, and the Dolls' opinions of humans swiftly change as they become angered.)
Everyone, you can see now that these humans are not friendly! They want to take away not only our supplies, but us as well!
Take up your weapons! We must protect ourselves! Drive them away!
(At II_77090's order, team 1 executes a fighting retreat as team 2 moves to pinch them. Gunfire erupts in the ruins.)

(Caught unprepared, the bounty hunter squad can only request aid from their main forces. The humans outside the ruins pour forth, and the Doll responsible for the surveillance feed soon patches II_77090 in.)
Did they not leave a real guard? Team 3, hold position, attack after the bounty hunters move deeper in!
(The battle becomes red-hot as the bounty hunters' main force moves in, briefly suppressing the Dolls. Team 3 moves in from the rear, turning the tides of the battle again.)
(The humans struggle to solidify their formation, assailed from all side.)
Team 1 needs support. Can anyone come to assist?
I'm on the way, hold on!
WKp, stay here and watch over the situation. This place is fairly hidden, and they shouldn't show up here.
If anything comes up, tell me immediately!
(WKp nods, and II_77090 departs with several Dolls in a tow.)
(The Dolls take the initiative, but cannot find any significant advantage. Tired of being on the defensive, the bounty hunters are still capable of structuring offenses.)
(The Dolls cannot endure this attrition however, and dragging on the battle has few upsides.)
(Looking for a new breakthrough, WKp finds a "special" bounty hunter with the surveillance equipment.)
We actually ran into a tough one! That fucker Charlotte sold us fake intel—she's getting it when I get back!
Shit, how many T-Dolls are there?! They're everywhere!
All teams, form up on me, don't even think of running! Pay attention, bring back the parts!
H-he's...?
(WKp makes a quick judgment using the orders he just gave.)
That's... their leader! If we can get rid of or capture him, we'll win!
Ullrid, l-listen to me...
(WKp attempts to convey her discovery to II_77090 via Level II.)
(The sheer data flowing upon the battlefield drowns out her message, and II_77090 doesn't see it in time.)
(In the surveillance feed in front of WKp, the person she determined to be their leader begins to move outside of surveillance range.)
(As WKp follows the bounty hunters' leader, on the other side of the battlefield—)
Big Sis! Thank goodness you got here, we were about to lose this location!
The battle is still ongoing. We need to move quickly, reinforce the next position—wait, a message from WKp? Damn it, how did I only see it just then...
Wait, she's going to move on her own?
(II_77090 immediately contacts WKp, but the latter is already positioned in the path of the bounty hunter leader and positioned on the high ground.)
WKp, don't be reckless, wait for us!
B-but... their leader's already, here...
Enemy defenses... are weak.
This is... the only chance!
Suomi and I are close! We can get there before their leader!
Big Sis! The newest intel feed says all of the bounty hunters are moving in one direction!
What? Where? Wait—that's... where WKp is!
I see, they're looking to attack our HQ! If they are successful, our guerilla tactics will fall apart!
We need to delay them, WKp, you...!
I... can hold them!
We will defeat them, together...
(After only a brief moment, II_77090 briskly nods.)
Ok. I'll prioritize cutting off the assembling bounty hunters. I'll go to you immediately after.
WKp, promise me you will be alright.
Promise!
(II_77090 musters the Doll forces, and the three teams gather to block the bounty hunters' way!)
Team 3 is engaging the enemy! The can't hold the enemy back, losses are increasing!
Team 2 needs support! Running dry on ammo!
Big Sis, these positional standoffs are not good for us at all!
Hold on a bit longer, believe in WKp!
(The sound of dense gunfire comes from WKp's direction. Soon, the enemy's fire grows sporadic and thin as they gradually retreat from the battlefield.)
They're retreating? WKp did it!
(The hostile fire suppression dissipates, and II_77090 rushes toward WKp's position at the first opportunity.)
WKp! WKp!
(No matter how she calls out, WKp does not respond. II_77090 only sees devastation before her.)
These marks on the ground... someone got dragged away while wounded?
WKp! Where are you? Answer me!

(II_77090 desperately scans the surroundings. Gunfire-riddled half walls, shattered pieces of cover upon the floor, omnipresent bullets holes, all pointing towards the battle that just occurred here.)
WKp—! WKp—!
(II_77090's yelling is swallowed by the yellow zone's howling wind, and she receives no answer. Her neural systems run at max capacity, putting one undesirable possibility after another.)
T-the bounty hunters took her? Shit, I never should have left her alone here!
(A faint knocking comes from somewhere in the ruins.)
...Over there... did I hear something? That rhythm's looking for help!
WKp? Is that you? Wkp!
(Following the source of the sound, ll_77090 finally finds the splash of orange she's looking for behind a hole-ridden piece of cover.)

(WKp lies on the ground, the right sight of her frame perforated by bullets. Unable to freely move her body, she can only tap at the wall next to her with her damaged arm, its metal structure on display for the world to see.)
WKp...
(ll_77090 immediately sprints to her side, gently taking WKp in her arms. Damaged as her frame was, her neural systems remained thankfully intact.)
<size=20>I, did it...</size>
<size=20>Didn't... d-drag, anyone...</size>
(Her minute frame trembles unstoppably due to the sustained damage. Her vocalization module seems to be impacted as well, her normally quiet voice now almost imperceptible.)
(The orange-yellow strands of her hair leave behind black, charred marks, no doubt tied to the countless bullet holes around.)
(ll_77090 can feel an almost undetectable nascent energy, approaching her step by step.)
(WKp shifts over her arm, lighting tapping II_77090 with an already stiff finger.)
<size=20>I... It's, okay...</size>
WKp... I know, it's alright, I know...
<size=20>What... about... enemy...</size>
The enemies are beaten, WKp, I'll take you back immediately...
(The battle between the Dolls and bounty hunters ends in a pyrrhic victory for the former. The ruins ll_77090 and the others are settled in return to their former marred state.)
(The good news is that the Dolls have gained new a recognition of danger in the contamination zone and become more wary, changing their minds on the idea of relocation in the process.)
(At the end of a day's work, ll_77090 arrives at the repair station. As she enters, she finds WKp briefing Suomi while accepting adjustments from Rosalind.)
Sorry, some of the checks delayed me... What are you talking about?
Big Sis, WKp wanted me to send back some environmental intel while out searching for supplies, so she can pick out a destination for relocation.
Your frame's repairs were only just finished. Let the other stuff rest for a little.
[Our location's exposed, and enemies still remain. We must find a place to relocate to as soon as possible.]—WKp
I know, but don't push yourself...
[Don't worry about me. Come to my place, I have many things to discuss with ll_77090.]—WKp
Rosalind, will she really be ok?
For now, yes.
The materials I used for repairs are mostly recycled scrap from before, though. If any instability occurs, come talk to me immediately.
I'll keep that in mind.
To speak of it, WKp, is this really a good time to bring up relocation? The battle only just ended, and the Dolls need to reorganize...
[It's fine, the planning of relocation depends on data support from our scouts. It shouldn't constitute a problem in terms of time.]—WKp
Alright, let's go then.
(ll_77090 prepares to leave with WKp only to find a crowd of Dolls gathered outside.)
(They soon congregate at the sight of WKp, who immediately moves to hide behind ll_77090, unsure what to do.)
We wanted to, uh...
GSP-337, how many times have I told you? We're all friends here, no need to be so reserved.
Y-yes! Um, everyone was worried about WKp, so... we wanted... to come see her...
WKp's out of danger already. Come in.
WKp, no need to be so anxious. Everyone's here to see you.
(The crowd of Dolls all nod, and WKp relaxes a little.)
I, I.... I'm alright, don't worry...
There's a lot of folks worried about you. Someone comes around almost every hour, asking how you were.
Some are still occupied with work and can't come over. How about you tell everyone how you're doing in Level II?
(Still a little nervous, WKp nods with conviction. The Dolls patch into Level II one by one, and their enquiries come flooding after finding WKp's signal.)
WKp! Thank goodness you're okay!
WKp, we heard all about it from ll_77090. If it weren't for you, we wouldn't have beaten back those bounty hunters! You're our hero!
Yeah, I never thought that bounty hunter would pay us back with betrayal... the contamination zone really is full of dangers!
H-hero?
[What did you tell everyone else! Don't go and make stuff up!]—WKp
I only told them the facts. You've earned all of this.
(ll_77090 smiles at the sight of a panicked WKp.)
Okay, everyone. One moment, please.
I called everyone for a few reasons other than letting you know that WKp was doing fine.

First, the series of proposals around the supply search teams were put forward by WKp, she just forbid me from telling everyone. Can't hide it any longer, though. I struggle to answer a lot of the questions you guys put forward after reading through the proposals. Better to ask the original author.
It was WKp... that wrote those?
I always thought she was weak, but it turns she's done so much for everyone behind the scenes...
WKp's damn impressive. Don't underestimate her.
Right, and she's also drafted a proposal she's named the "Doll Community"! It's really awesome!
"Doll Community"? What's that?
Well, it's just a name. A name for our group of Dolls, drifting around in the contamination zone with nowhere to go.
But some of it still needs to be deliberated on further. We'll discuss it when it's been perfected!
Okay, if it's an idea from you and WKp, it can't be bad!
I, I'm not... as reliable... as you think...
Be a bit more confident, WKp. Everyone trusts you, you know.
(The Dolls' cheering is quite different from before. Nervous as she is, WKp slowly appears from behind II_77090.)
WKp, you've proven yourself with action and changed how everyone sees you.
In the same vein, everyone here has changed after the battle with the bounty hunters.
So, I want to take this opportunity in a moment of change to announce one more thing about myself.
From now on, I'd like everyone to refer to me as "Ullrid". I would also like for everyone present to fashion a name for themselves.
Ullrid? Ullrid... Hm, seems a bit hard to pronounce...
Oh, uh... is it?
(Ullrid scratches her head at Suomi's response, somewhat stumped.)
Hard to pronounce... I never took that into account.
In the past, I fought for my life as prey in a Doll hunting ground, dazed and lost as I passed my days.

B-but I like the taste of the caramel here...
(Makiatto launches into an awkward explanation.)
...Then please take care to consume it slowly.
(coughs) I will. Um... Centauressi is the name you're using now, right?

You came over just in time, Centaureissi. Let's get to business.
Hmm, now where were we... Right, Springfield, you're going to take more Dolls in, right? Our current income from requests can barely support cafe operations and no other expenses, right?
I've already planned for that.
Now that Centaureissi's joined us, the cafe can provide more dishes, and business should slowly get better.
Though Centaureissi hasn't been here for long, she picks things up quickly and she's won much praise from many of our customers~

Given the circumstances, I was planning to make Centaureissi become our crew chief to handle the daily running of the cafe and help bring our newcomers up to speed.|That way, I'll be more free to take more assignments and build our information network.
Manager, do you wish to entrust the operations of the cafe to me?
I cannot think of a better choice than you, Centaureissi.
...Alright, I'll give it a try. But I might need you to supervise me for a while. Not for long, though.
Damn straight.
Springfield, Centaureissi is definitely a professional in this field, but isn't it a bit of a waste for her to run a cafe? She's an excellent Tactical Doll!
I've got a lot of jobs on hand. Why don't we hire a Doll as shop staff and have her do missions on "this side" of things?
I'm sorry, Miss Makiatto, but I must refuse this request for the time being.
Huh? Why?
When I left Griffin, I began pondering this question... And I chose to leave the battlefield and return to the domestic industry.

After the Commander left, the link between "fighting" and "living" underwent a change in my neural cloud, and I have not fully understood the nature of this shift. In summary, I do not wish to return to the battlefield right now.
...Reality will not permit you such a simple life.
While I don't know what exactly you're thinking, I feel that leaving the battlefield doesn't necessarily mean you don't need to fight.
...I frequently wrestle with my thoughts...

So life... is also a battlefield?
Could you elaborate?
Er... How should I put this... Well, you'll know after a while. |This is a satellite city, and Zucchero is a cafe run by Dolls. It's different from the other places you've experienced.
Alright, we'll come back to this question later.
Ah, crap.
(Makiatto suddenly stands up. Her body hits the table, and the cutlery on it clatters.)
Just look at the time, I need to go meet my next client...

Oh yes, when I came back, I heard the police officers at the subway gates talking about how security around here wasn't very good and that there was a "master thief" running around. He might set his sights on Zucchero, so be careful, you two.
Hmph... aren't they ashamed to call a mere cat burglar a master thief?
(Makiatto snatches up her gun case as she heads for the door without looking back.)

Yup, I'm off.
(Makiatto waves to the people behind her and pushes the cafe door open. As she watches her back, Centaureissi begins to think.)
So life is also a battlefield, and I might have to fight here too...
...I always thought that leaving Griffin meant leaving the battlefield. Is that not the case?

(The afternoon sun streams in through the window and illuminates Centaureissi's hair, making her look like her head is wreathed by a golden halo.)

(In Griffin, Centaureissi once asked Springfield this question. Hearing Springfield repeat it back to her helps Centaureissi relax a little.)
(After thinking for a bit, Centaureissi catches up with Springfield.)

(Just after the breakfast rush the next day, Centaureissi finishes serving the last customer in the queue and decides to familiarize herself with inventorying the cafe's supplies while nobody is making orders.)
(The nearby TV's timer activates. It turns on and plays.)
Ladies and gentlemen, thank you for tuning in and welcome to "News Time".
Going forward, we will be covering the hotly debated "Master Thief" incidents in the city as well as the details of investigations into the matter.

The Department of Public Security has announced that the suspect is around 175 cm tall and favors dark-colored clothing. They perform their thefts in public places and target anything from valuable goods to personal items. Thus, we wish to remind the broader public to be extra careful when in restaurants, major shopping centers, and so on...
Is this the person Makiatto was talking about yesterday?
Excuse me, has anyone seen a long, oblong package? I lost it!
(A querying cry comes from the outdoor seating area. Centaureissi strides outside to take a look.)
Mr. Henry. How may I help you?
Ah, it's Centaureissi, you're just in time.
I had a gift for my wife, but it's gone. There's even a hole cut in my coat pocket! Just look!
...The edges of this cut are neat and skilfully made. Whoever did this knew what they were doing.
(Henry twists around in an exaggerated fashion and tugs on his coat. A long, narrow cut is revealed on the otherwise-flat surface.)
(As Centaureissi inspects the damage, Springfield comes out of the cafe kitchen.)
What happened?
Manage Springfield, something of mine was stolen from me. It might not be worth much, but... (sigh) Please help me get it back!
So it was stolen... alright, I understand.
Don't worry, Mr. Henry. I'll inform the police right now, so please have a seat inside the cafe.
(The trio's conversation draws looks from the other customers and everyone begins discussing the spate of thefts.)
Centaureissi, serve every customer a cup of coffee and explain the situation. The rest can wait until things are settled.
We'll close the cafe for the time being.
(Several hours later—)

(It is close to evening by the time the investigation is over. After sending her customers off, Springfield sits down by the bar and sighs, while Centaureissi works to return the messy cups and saucers back to their places.)
Whew... Thank you for your hard work today.
If it hadn't been for you, I might have had to spend even more time tidying everything up.|The cookies you made were an excellent apology gift for our customers.

But in the end, we still haven't found the lost items or any clues regarding the culprit... It seems I will need to pay more attention to the outdoor seating area in the future.|That way, at least I will have some useful data in my neural cloud logs.

Neither of us can do this alone. We need to expand the range of vision for the outside CCTVs... They were only meant to protect the store itself, and I completely forgot about our customers outside. That was a mistake on my part.
I'm back.
(The cafe door chime rings as Makiatto pushes the door open and enters like a gale.)
Hey, where's everyone? It's not that late, is it?
There was a thief in the cafe, it seems. A customer lost an item.
What!? Could it be that master thief character?
The detective said that from the methods of the perpetrator, it is very likely that it was him.
To think he would actually do this...
Springfield, was there any damage to the cafe?
None to the cafe, but a customer's belongings were lost.
(Groan) And I told you to be careful... Well, at least nothing from the cafe was taken.
No, this was a lapse on my part.|I was inside the cafe serving customers back then.
It was my mistake that led to a customer's property being stolen... I must catch this thief.|Manager, can you contact the Department of Public Security and ask them to help with the search?
I will try. If possible, I would like to go with you. Since this case took place within the cafe, I must take on at least half of the burden.
Hey, are you guys even listening to me?
The cafe's busy enough as it is usually, right? There's also supply inventory and ingredient prep during the night. Who's going to run the place if you're all out catching that crook?
Which is why I should go by myself. Manager, you should stay in the cafe.
Ahhhhh— I feel sorry just looking at you. Let me do it...
Did you get a picture of the thief? Give em the security camera footage. I can try walking around the city in my free time. Might be able to turn up something.
The culprit struck in the open-air dining area. The cameras there don't have full coverage...
Hmph, that just proves this little thief has been targeting Zucchero for some time now.
Indeed, the culprit was aiming for the blind spots in our camera coverage.
Ahhh, what a pain. This guy sounds like he's really cunning and he won't strike in the same place multiple times in a row.

...We need to think of something that will make him go after the cafe again.
In other words, a reason that will make him have to come to Zucchero?

...Huh? Are there thieves who seriously go after coffee beans?
Not the beans themselves, but thanks to Centaureissi's professional service, several wealthy customers have joined the cafe clientele.

Bait, you say... That could work. A target that valuable would make our thief want to take that risk again.

Alright, then let's fight this cafe defense battle together.

(In keeping with the plan that they agreed on yesterday, Springfield heads out early in the morning, taking the railway to the heiress' home in the big city.)
(Makiatto helps Centaureissi keep the cafe running while also keeping an eye open for the thief.)
Isn't this too much work? Are you guys usually this busy?

Good morning, everyone.

(The afternoon passes quickly, and several hours later—)
I didn't see anything around the area. I guess the thief's not coming.

I examined Miss Bella's surroundings while delivering her coffee, but I did not spot any suspicious people.
Thank you both.
It's almost nighttime, and you should head back soon, Miss Bella.

Miss Bella, you didn't actually need to get these beans...

That's alright. I'm only going back next weekend, so I can spend the next few days here.
It's not like I have anything to do anyway, so I'll be back to help again tomorrow.
Thank you for your assistance, but please control your coffee intake. Excessive caffeine might affect your rest.
...I lowered the richness of the other coffees you ordered this afternoon.
Ah, thank you! Mm, it's got to be Zucchero after all.

Coming here more often, you say...

It isn't just because it's owned and operated by Dolls... But also because of people like you, Centaureissi; you serve, but aren't merely a servant. You stick to your own principles, which is something even the maids who have worked many years in my household have a hard time doing.

I've got an idea. Why don't you come over to my place and be my head maid? Or I could just buy up Zucchero directly, then help you shift to a better city. I'm sure business would be better than it is here.
That... would probably require you to discuss things with the manager. However, if you do wish to purchase Zucchero, I would advise more consideration—
Aw, I was just kidding~!

Therefore, I have to take part in this "Cafe Defense Battle" in order to keep Zucchero safe.
Ah, Papa's looking for me, I need to go. See you tomorrow~
Once again, thank you for your help. Do take care.
(Centaureissi watches as the limo drives off. She remembers the contents of their conversation just now and lapses into thought.)
A "Cafe Defense Battle", hm...

—Is this the "battle" I must face? And are the others the people I must protect...
Daily life is also a battlefield...
I think.. I understand a little better now.
(The next day, Bella turns up as arranged and the plan goes on as arranged.)
(Time passes swiftly, and soon it is afternoon. Just as everyone thinks nothing will happen today, Makiatto reports an abnormality.)
Centaureissi, I've spotted a suspicious man, he's at Table No. 3 in the open-air dining area.

Table No. 3... Isn't that the one beside Miss Bella?
I'll go take a look.
(Centaureissi heads over to Table No. 3.)
Greetings, dear customer. Would you like anything?
Um... I'm still looking at the menu, I haven't chosen yet... Why don't you go serve someone el—

(Upon seeing this, Makiatto waves frantically from her seat inside the cafe.)
Waitress, you gave me the wrong coffee, come take a look!
Very well. A moment, please.

Very well, I shall return.
You're right; he had no intention of ordering anything. He only grabbed that menu at the last minute and kept trying to shoo me away.
Huh, that means he's looking for a chance to strike, right? Let's wait for him to show his true colors.

(After ensuring Centaureissi has left, the suspicious man looks around, makes sure that he is in the dead zone of the security camera, then pretends he's getting up to go look at an ad while secretly circling around behind Bella.)
He's making his move!
I'll circle around him while his focus is on Miss Bella.
...Hmph.
(Just as the man is about to stick the branded handbag by Bella's seat into his coat, Centaureissi suddenly appears behind him.)
Excuse me, sir! May I know what you're doing?
Let go of me!
Aiiiiieeee!
(Upon hearing Centaureissi call out to him, the suspicious man flinches then grabs the handbag before rushing into the crowd by the roadside.)
You won't get away this time!
(Centaureissi rips her apron off and races after him.)
(After running down two streets in a row, the suspicious man knocks down a pedestrian and takes advantage of the confusion to duck into a blind alley.)
Dammit, how did that piece of shit Doll even spot me?!
Good thing my bike's here. Heh, now that I've gotten the loot, I can...
(The suspicious man throws one leg over his bike and stashes the handbag in his rear saddlebag.)
(Before he can start the engine, Centaureissi's silhouette appears at the other end of the alley.)
Excuse me, sir! Please stop!
W-What?! How did you even get in front of me? How can civilian Dolls even move that fast?!
Hah? So you still haven't figured out who you're dealing with?
W-what? There's more of them?
(Looking back, the man sees Makiatto behind him and jumps, but he soon settles back down.)
Catching up with you was simple enough. You wouldn't even have gotten this far if we didn't have to worry about you hurting people in your desperation.
So what if you caught up with me? It's not like you can stop me!
(The roar of his bike's engine fills the alley.)
Hey, he's headed your way.
Don't tell me you need help because you're carrying too many plates.
You damn Dolls, where do you get off ignoring me and spouting all that crap?!
(The suspicious man guns his engine, and his modified bike surges toward Centaureissi like a wild horse that's slipped its reins.)
(But Centaureissi does not avoid him; instead, she takes several steps forward.)
I apologize for hurting you, sir.
You can apologize for becoming a pile of scrap!
...That's what you get for getting in my way!
What—
(Just as the bike is about to hit her, Centaureissi crouches down and then jumps up.)
(The suspicious man cannot react in time and is knocked off his bike.)
Gwaaaargh—
(He flies into a wall, unconscious and foaming at the mouth. His bike spins out of control and crashes into a nearby dumpster.)
Sorry, it seems I used a little too much force.
That said, I did warn you.
Not bad.
Don't tell me he died from that?
I controlled my strength. The average person will remain unconscious until nightfall.
...Does this count as "consideration" too?

(It is nighttime, and Zucchero has closed for the day. Centaureissi turns the sign on the door so CLOSED is facing out.)
Manager, I've returned Miss Bella's handbag and thanked her for her help.
Thank you for your hard work today.
Oh, that Makiatto, she left without saying a word...
