Alright, I see. Let me clean up the cafe; you should head back and get some rest, Centaureissi.
No, I insist.
Centaureissi ignores Springfield's protests and begins inverting the chairs beside her and placing them on the tables.
You look like you're perfectly capable of running Zucchero now~
This way, I can hand the cafe over to you with complete peace of mind whenever I need to head out.
Do you feel that... I've grown used to it, Manager?
Yup. The truth is, you were adapted to it for quite some time now.
—After bidding the Commander farewell and leaving your life at Griffin...
Do you feel like you've managed to find your answer regarding "fighting" and "living"?
Perhaps... Although Miss Makiatto didn't give me a clear answer. But perhaps fighting, for me, is protecting others.
In Griffin, I protected my friends and Master. And everyone became my life.
But after Master and my friends left, I lost all reason to fight and my original way of life.
That was why I chose to leave as well in the end, because when I raised my gun, there was nobody behind me, and when I opened the curtains in the morning, I did not see those sleepy eyes.
That sense of loss made my neural cloud uneasy and caused me to hesitate on the battlefield...

I thought that distancing myself from combat and returning to domestic service would help me to calm down. But perhaps that life was too peaceful for me, and the struggle between fighting and living normally caused my neural cloud to become even more splintered, to the point where I felt I had to choose between the two.
But the truth was, as Miss Makiatto said. They were never so easily divided to begin with.
In my life, Zucchero needs my protection, at least until I can follow Master once again.
And as long as this desire to protect is still there, then my life will not be totally separated from fighting. The battlefield will always be there, even if I do not need to hold a gun for it.
...Manager, you may relax and leave Zucchero to me when you're busy.
I will make sure each "defense battle" will be a well-fought one.
Oh my, I don't know how to respond to you when you're so serious, Centaureissi... But I'm glad that you're willing to protect Zucchero.
However, I have a request.
What?
I... I would rather not use a gun if it can be avoided.
That is because, when I chose to fight in Griffin, I did so for Master. Which is why I hope that I will pull my trigger at Master's command once again.
Looks like there won't be anyone to help take contracts on Makiatto's side.
I sincerely apologize for that. However, I will fight when the need arises.
Alright then. I'll let you be the judge of that, Centaureissi.
Thank you, Manager.
Hehe, don't be in such a hurry to thank me. You'll be doing overtime today, you know?

We'll have a Doll coming in for an interview tonight. Since you've accepted the responsibility of helping to manage Zucchero, you might as well join us, no? If all goes well, she'll also become a member of Zucchero.
That's fine.
(Knock knock knock—)

Wow! There are so many vintage cars! They really are a window to the past; I would love to have one myself.
Sir, are you here to shop for a used car?

Ksenia? What is she doing here...?

I'm in a hurry. Leave me alone.
You don't have time now...? That's alright, just ask for me next time you're here. My name is Ksenia.
Hey, Ksenia! Over here!
Huh? Senior?
Sorry, sir. Please feel free to take a look around yourself. Remember to contact me later~
(Ksenia hurriedly shoves her card into the customer's hand and mimes making a phone call at the man coyly. Then she jogs up to Nagant.)
You're working here as well? Just how many part-time jobs do you have?!
I don't work here. Checking the used car dealership is a no-brainer when investigating car thefts... You're also here, aren't you?
You're on an undercover investigation? Nicely done. You actually beat me to it. My teachings haven't gone to waste, I see.
Hm, it gladdens my heart to see a young'un growing and becoming so capable.
(Nagant closes her eyes and nods with affected elderliness, but when she opens her eyes again, Ksenia is nowhere to be seen.)
Ksenia, you...

This way to the cash register. Would you like to pay in full or in instalments?
(Not far away, a beaming Ksenia is leading a customer toward a cash register.)
Sh-she's totally working here! Look at her flashing her pearly whites!
(Seeing that Ksenia is busy selling used cars, Nagant decides to take a walk around.)
(An hour later—)
Senior, I'm done!
I got sucked into my work, and I lost track of time... Sorry to keep you waiting!
I got four sales contracts signed just this morning. If I worked in sales full-time, I'd definitely be the top sales associate!
You're focusing on the wrong thing! We're here to investigate!
It wasn't much of a hold-up. You were having a great time at the vintage car convention yourself.
I-I'm mainly here for the investigation! I checked out the vintage car convention just because... it also happens to be here!
I've totally... got my priorities straight.
Yes, yes. That's Senior Nagant for your. What a will of iron.
So, you must have made some huge discoveries by now? I'm sure the insignificant clues that I've found aren't worthy of mention in comparison to what you've learned~
W-well...
(Nagant scratches her face. Meanwhile, Ksenia's attention drifts back to a customer looking at a car some distance away.)
Um, actually, I...
A-ahem, I have indeed made some discoveries, but I'd like to hear about yours first!
Senior, I gotta go. We'll talk at the dorm tonight.
I need to sweet-talk a few more customers to earn more commission!
Huh? D-don't go! Tell me what you've learned first!
(It's now night-time.)
(There is a knock on Nagant's door. Nagant opens the door, and Ksenia enters the room with two large shopping bags that are filled to the brim.)
Why are you so late? Didn't you say you'd come back after your part-time job?

Humph, so much for the investigation. Sigh, that's a whole day wasted.
(Nagant crosses her arms and pouts sulkily.)

I saw that you're really interested in vintage cars. I can't afford an actual car with only a day's worth of wages, but it's more than enough to buy a miniature model.
...This... is really realistic... It looks just like the real thing I saw today!
(Nagant can't help herself. She takes the miniature model and studies it carefully, turning it this way and that in her hands.)
Fine, I'll forgive you this once... But you must come with me to investigate other leads after our shift tomorrow!
That won't be necessary, senior. I've gathered enough clues today.
Really? You've been working your part-time sales job the whole day, how would you have time to investigate?
Don't you want to know what I've found out?

Okay, okay!
First question, senior. What do you think is the perps' motive for stealing cars?
They obviously want to sell them. They can't very well drive the cars themselves.
Correct.

I got a part-time job at the used car dealership to gain staff access to their sales system. This way, I can conduct legitimate searches on any cars that are of the same models as the ones that were stolen.
I see. I thought it was just a simple part-time job...
Heheh, I've got my priorities straight, you know~
Why does this phrase sound so familiar...? Anyway, keep going.

I filtered the transaction logs for the entire city using the make of the stolen vehicle as a keyword, but I found that the records for all the other vehicles of the same model are currently on file in the Automobile Directorate.
In other words, all the recent transactions of these cars are perfectly legal.
All perfectly legal? Now that's strange...
(Nagant strokes her chin and ponders the possibilities.)
Hold on... I get that you have staff access to the dealership's sales system, but how do you have access to the Automobile Directorate.
Ksenia, don't tell me you hacked their system!
Please, as if I could've done that! I just called in a favor from a former colleague...|These thefts didn't happen in our district, so I don't have the authorization to access their records.
But as an officer, I can't just ignore these latent criminal activities
But... that's still against the rules!
Senior, didn't you say we should be prepared? I'm doing this to ensure the district's safety.
Besides, I only asked the colleague to look up some basic information, so just cut me some slack, will you?
But even so—
C'mon, senior, do you want to know what I've discovered or not? You know what, it's getting late, so I'm going back to my room.
(Ksenia makes for the door. Nagant immediately tells her to stop.)
I'll let that slide for now. Just tell me what you've learned first...
Alright, I'll finish talking before I go.
(Ksenia grins slyly at Nagant's anxious face.)
There are only two explanations for all the legal vehicle transactions.
One, the thieves altered the records on the system; two, the stolen cars never ended up on the local used car market to begin with.
I doubt these perps have the skills to tamper with government records... but it's also not likely that they aren't selling the cars that they've gone to so much trouble to steal.
So did they transport the cars to some other cities?

Putting aside the high transportation costs, it is not possible to legally register the vehicles even if they cross the border to another city. Although information synchronization between cities is slow, we're still connected through the internet.
You're right... Then do they have other channels for dispatching the cars?
Maybe, who knows?
Then let's follow this lead and continue to investigate, Ksenia. We should first list out all the possible channels.
Senior, I'm really tired from the part-time job. Even if I get paid for working overtime, I still don't want to work tonight.

Protecting the district is our duty. No matter how tired you feel—
Ksenia, are you listening?
Ksenia?

I'm worried that the things inside are damaged. Better to open it now and make sure they're okay.

Have you seen the news? Car thefts are also happening in District W12. Including the previous ones, that makes more than a dozen stolen cars.

Yes.

Mosin-Nagant. She says she wants to talk. Same bar as last time... Things must be really bad, judging by her tone.

You're partially right. More specifically, they are all vintage LUXURY cars.

(The garage proprietor inspects the engine carefully. His face is obscured, but Ksenia can detect the wariness in his voice.)

It's my employer's. This is the first car he bought after his business took off.
Haha, he's got good tastes.

Three to four times the original price? That's too expensive.

They don't make this kind of cylinder anymore. Even if I ask my friends to try looking for one, I've got to pay for the labor cost, you know?
Please give me a moment while I consult my employer.
(Ksenia walks off to the side and pulls out her communicator. She sends Nagant a message that reads, "Target acquired," all the while pretending to communicate with her "employer".)
(A minute later, Ksenia approaches the garage proprietor again.)
My employer has given the go-ahead. I'll leave the car with you.
No problem. I'll calculate the deposit.

Be patient, senior. This is a super risky business, the perps will have taken all kinds of precautions to keep their operation under wraps.

Nagant, Ksenia, I'm back.
(Mosin-Nagant appears behind the two Doll. She puts down the box of equipment she has brought with her and takes out a tablet.)
My teammates have stuck an impulse monitor on the exterior wall of the repair shop. It's the latest model developed by the department and supports remote surveillance.
We can get visuals on the interior of the repair shop using this tablet.

Is the cat out of the bag? Here, gimme one sec!

(The young man walks into another warehouse on his own.)

(It is strangely quiet inside the warehouse.)

(No response. The young man suddenly grows suspicious and reaches for the pistol behind his back.)

Yet another small fry who grows full of himself just because he's got a gun. I've taken down so many of these morons I lost count.

(A jeep marked with "G&K" lays parked by the roadside.)

(Qiongjiu opens the cars, hesitating for a moment before entering the car.)

(Thump thump thump—)
(A set of ponderous footsteps approaches, and a T-Rex spews curses as it lumbers up a slope that was built as set dressing, dragging a pair of stubby claws behind it as it storms over to Dushevnaya.)
Don't you usually rattle off all that crap like it was nothing? Why are you getting all tongue-tied at a crucial moment like this?
Bathilde, don't talk to Dushevnaya like that.
I'm sorry, Dushevnaya... Bathilde just...
Look, I'm just stating the facts here! When on earth are we ever going to finish filming at this pace of yours?!
Lotta, you need to explain her problem to her, otherwise, it'll be take after take!
(After some disturbing wriggling, the otherwise-striking T-Rex crumples up and Bathilde's head pops out of its chest.
None of you wanted to be the Bad Dragon so I, as the executive director, took the job.

But when will I ever get to make my entrance? The two of you don't even have that many lines, but you keep taking turns stuttering through them! Are you deliberately trying to keep me off the camera or something?
E-even a miniscule ant craves to hear the counsel of the wise... p-please highlight my problems!
Don't be so tense! Hm... Rather than point out your problems, I actually want to ask: why is it that you and Suomi can't get into the role, Dushevnaya?
Do you not understand the lines, or do you not understand your characters?
The Great Sage sent me the script and a character outline, but... I still do not know how to portray a "hero".
I just wanted to help, but... it seems I've just held everyone back instead.
Please don't say that!
I'm very glad that all of you are helping out!
In truth... I have the same doubts as Dushevnaya. What is a hero, anyway?
To me, a hero simply makes a logical decision. Is that worthy of being praised and celebrated in song?
I... Let me think...
Screenplays and the like are basically a rational adaptation of life.
Of course, "life" here refers to the "human way of life". We are Dolls, so it's natural that we don't understand it... it was my fault for not realizing that, and I'm sorry...
(As she sees Lotta's crestfallen face, Littara scribbles quickly on her notebook.)
[Please don't blame yourself for that. Lotta asked me to help her write the script, and I did not explain my creative intent to the actors. It was my fault as scriptwriter.] — Littara
N-no, not at all! You did a great job, Littara. I wouldn't even know where to begin if not for you.

[As you know, we had to face a string of enemies after Allen left us in our quest to find a new home. My intention was to rewrite that into an original story, and in order to make it easier to understand, I decided to draw on some tropes from human entertainment, such as heroes and dragons.] — Littara

[If neither Suomi nor Dushevnaya can get into the character, then why not let them play the role as themselves? After all, nobody said a Doll hero has to be the same as a human hero, right?] — Littara.
Wait, playing as yourself? Can you actually do that?
(Lotta shakily raises a hand.)

I, I think that letting them play the role as themselves might make the acting process easier... But if Suomi and Dushevnaya use their real personalities for the character, the plot might end up going in a completely different direction.
So I was thinking... A hero isn't a specific person but the personification of a certain group, so this personification must have a distinct personality and also be relatable.
Perhaps... We could use someone as a reference, someone who has the qualities of a hero?
Given my humble neural cloud records, the hero does seem to be a fusion of the Great Sage and the Supreme Leader.
Great Sage... Supreme Leader...
While I know you're talking about Littara and Ullrid, I still have a hard time getting used to you calling them that...
...I tender... my sincerest apologies... to our omnipotent creator...
Omnipotent creator—Wait, are you talking about the director, I mean, me?
You don't have to apologize for that! Um... Actually, why don't you try playing these two characters by referencing the Supreme Leader and Great Sage?
I shall abide by the guidance of destiny.
This DOES make the characters' actions easier to understand!
[While comparing us to heroes was a bit much... perhaps it might work. Alright then, shall we coordinate our impressions of the characters?] — Littara
In my heart, the Great Sage is a really wise grampa who's lived for thousands of years with a long white beard!
Well, Littara's got the wise part down, at least.

In my heart, the Supreme Leader is swift as a coursing river, has all the force of a great typhoon, possesses the strength of a raging fire, and is as mysterious as the dark side of the moon, but at the same time she has a gentle heart and leads us forward through chaos and confusion.
Wait, isn't that just Big Sis?
(Lotta sighs in relief as she watches Suomi and Dushevnaya's heated discussion.)
(Littara pats her on the back and smiles at her.)
Then what about me? Who's my reference?
(A T-Rex's gigantic maw descends until it is level with Lotta's face.)
(Lotta barely manages to nudge the remotivated Bathilde aside.)
For you... just be yourself.
Hah? I'll swallow you whole, see if I don't!
(Now that they have character references, Suomi and Dushevnaya quickly get into character.)
(The filming goes very well, and a fully pumped-up T-Rex comes into frame for the first time.
Gaaaooooo! I shall knock all you dreamers down!
Everyone who disobeys me shall DIE!
Aiiiieeeee?
(Rrriiip—)
(Bathilde stomps forward, and a hole instantly rips open in the T-Rex's leg. Bathilde loses her balance and falls toward the camera that is standing on the edge of the set.
B-Bathilde! Look out! ...The camera!
Mr. Dragon!
Mr. Observer!
Oh no!
(Amidst outcry from several people, Bathilde and the camera go rolling down the fake slope and hit the props box with a thunk.)
(The moment Bathilde gets to her feet, she runs over to check on the camera.)
Bathilde, are you alright?!
(Lotta sprints over, and when she sees Bathilde with her head lowered, worry fills her heart.)
Lotta... this thing's memory has been full for a while now. It hasn't been recording for an hour or so; there's no way you couldn't have known that, right?
It's time to change shifts.
Stop messing with the camera already! Come on!
Alright, coming!
Thank you for your help with the filming! We'll be done in a few more days, so please come to the screening with us.
(Lotta hurriedly bows to the Dolls she met on the way before running to catch up with Bathilde.)
You seem... different lately.
Do I?
Yup. You seem much braver now, and you're interacting much more smoothly with others.
That's great!
Huh? Ehehe...
Bathilde, the next time we change shifts, can I film the changeover?
Hah? Is it really that interesting that you'd want to film it?
...Eh, you know what? Go film it if you want.
(After reaching the changeover point, Lotta raises the camera she's holding, and Bathilde begins talking with the other Dolls.)
(Lotta captures this scene in earnest.)
We'll leave the rest to you.
A Collapse storm is coming. Stay safe now.
Lottaaaa~ Still filming?
Can you get us all in the same shot?
No problem! Just huddle closer!
...Huh, there's some backlighting here, should we go that way? Would also be a good chance to show how you two get along normally...
(Bathilde folds her arms and watches the Dolls filming themselves all over the place when a dark shadow appears in the corner of her vision.)
Lotta! We have a situation!
There are ELIDs in that Collapse storm!
(Bathilde's warning interrupts the filming, and the Dolls raise their guns.)
(The four Dolls huddle up, and with no way to avoid the ELIDs that are closing in, they have no choice but to fight.)
(Lotta tries to protect the camera while giving battle, but it restricts her movements.)
They're so fast! Dammit, I'm having trouble dealing with them!
Ahhhhh, what a pain! And it's only the two of them!
I'll go draw their attention! You go finish them off!
Bathilde! You... be careful!
(Bathilde's bold venture draws one of the ELIDs away, and the other two Dolls begin focusing on the remaining creature.)
Just one more! Hurry!
(Lotta aims at the remaining ELID and fires, but it's too fast, and her shells don't do any meaningful harm to it.)
I, I missed! I'm out!
Why am I going to do... It's going to rip Bathilde to bits!
(As she watches the ELID about to pounce on Bathilde, Lotta doesn't hesitate and throws the camera she's holding!)
(Meanwhile, the other two Dolls have dealt with their ELID and begin assisting.)
Graaaah-_!
Bathilde! Let's go! The Collapse storm is coming!
(Bathilde joins up with the other three Dolls without any hesitation, and the four of them beat a cautious retreat back to the thermal power plant.)
(Fortunately, the wounded ELID doesn't pursue them any further. It fades back into the storm, its fate unknown.)
(Everyone is silent on the way back.)
I understand the situation.
We're close to the Red Zone here, and Collapse storms are a frequent thing. Looks like we'll have to strengthen our defenses and improve our warning systems.
Fortunately you're alright. Be more careful when you go out next time.
Okay...
(Upon seeing Lotta struggle to get her words out, Ullrid puts down the terminal she's holding.)
What's wrong, Lotta? Is there anything else?
All this was my fault... I'm a tactical Doll, but I didn't detect the danger beforehand...
If I had been more alert while they were changing shifts and not being distracted by filming, maybe I wouldn't have put everyone in danger.
Bathilde and I have been postponing our work to varying degrees. Should we... should we have focused on doing things right and not filming...
Lotta, don't worry too much about it. Suddenly encountering ELIDs is perfectly natural in the Yellow Zone. Also, you drove off the ELIDs, right? Just be more alert next time.
And besides, I was the one who approved of the filming. If it means you ended up worrying more because of it, then perhaps I should reflect on my own actions too?
If there's a shortfall in work, then just make it up slowly. It's no big deal, so just relax!
Now go back and rest, just leave the rest to me!
...Alright.
(After leaving the room, Lotta's heart grows heavier.)
(In the Yellow Zone, the temperature falls fast at night.)
(Lotta is sitting on an abandoned supply crate, holding the terminal where her footage is saved and scrolling distractedly through it.)
(At her feet are the props that were damaged during the film shoot several days ago.)
(Hup—)
(There is a creaking sound, and Bathilde climbs onto the supply crate. She sits down beside Lotta and stretches out in an utterly undignified way.)
At last—I managed to catch up with my repairs, but it's killing me.
How about you? Did your report to Ullrid go well?
Yeah... It did.
Well, that's good, then.
I figured she wouldn't blame you because of that, so why are you muttering to yourself?
I... feel a little lost...

Bathilde, the things that have happened during this time do not match up at all with what I know. Just look, I— we've broken away from the bounty hunter who owned us and formed a Doll-only organization...
We collectively vote on what we want to do, and we've even found a resource-rich hideout!
Things are going too well, and while it makes me happy, it... it also makes me uneasy...
Uneasy about what? Isn't it good that things are going well?
I, am I getting a little carried away?
In the past, I always relied on being careful and cautious to survive all kinds of danger... not that I think it's a good personality type to have, that is!
But... all the little accidents that happened recently were caused by my lack of caution. Isn't something like filming a movie way beyond the scope of my abilities?
Has my wishful thinking ended up interfering with the construction of our community...
After listening to all that... you're basically hung up on what happened today, right?
We ran into a Collapse storm while we were on duty, and the storm drew ELIDs in. Isn't that perfectly normal? We even chased off the ELIDs.
Ullrid didn't scold you because of that, did she? I'll go have a word with her!
(Seeing that Bathilde has rolled up her sleeves and is ready to head out, Lotta frantically tries to push her down.)
Nonono, not at all! Ullrid didn't blame me for it!
She even tried to console me, but it was clearly my fault for being careless and almost letting you...
Aiiiiieeee!
(Thwap—)
(A crisp sound fills the air and Lotta rubs her forehead in disbelief as she stares incredulously at Bathilde.)
Hmph, have you woken up now, you little dork?
Nobody can stay the same forever. Even a Doll with an intact frame and running on proven logic will frequently malfunction for no obvious reason.
Can you guarantee that you'll never make a mistake? I know I can't.

Also, it's really annoying how you'll immediately start beating yourself up at the drop of a hat! If you've got the time to worry about that sort of crap, why don't you focus on making that movie first?
Um, alright... You're right.
But Bathilde, what will I do if I break down because you keep flicking my forehead?
That's called percussive maintenance, I can do it another way if you want. Let me see, where's my wrench...
(Beepbeep—)
(As the two of them banter with each other, the communicator by Lotta's feet makes a notification noise.)
...Hm? "Automatically uploading data?"
W-what's going on? We only have one camera, right? Where is it even going...
Well, go see what it's connected to first.
Device ID...
Wait a minute, this device ID... It's going to Camera No. 2!
I bonked an ELID with it earlier today, and I didn't manage to find it or bring it back after that. So why is it...
Wait, wasn't that the one we stuck on that Weedwhacker?
I'm pretty sure I expanded its signal range for compatibility with each other, up to around 100 to 300 meters. But this is pretty far from where we encountered those ELIDs, way more than that, right?
Yeah... Also, I configured it to upload all its data every 10 minutes to keep its internal memory from filling up like before.
If it wasn't broken back then, then I would have received updates from it in the daytime.
So you're saying... It's intact, it's moving by itself, and... it just approached us?
But how could a camera run by itself... Hm, this footage is pretty dark, and it's shaking hard...
Did my wishful thinking end up interfering with the construction of our community...
W-wait a minute. Doesn't that mean...
B-Bathilde, l-look! Doesn't this big black thing look kind of familiar?
...Is that... a cooling tower?
(The two of them look up in a daze toward the cooling tower that's not far off. The massive edifice stands serenely in the bright moonlight.)
I, I think it does! Look! It's getting closer and closer... oh no! That, that means those ELIDs are coming right for us!
Quit spacing out, you dork! Call it in to Ullrid right now!
(Bathilde is gazing into the distance and looking for those ELIDs. Lotta swiftly contacts Ullrid.)
Ullrid! We have a situation here! There might be ELIDs heading for the cooling tower. We don't know their numbers, send help ASAP!
Roger that! Stay alert for now, I'll bring people over!

(Thanks to Lotta and Bathilde's timely warning, Ullrid and the other T-DOlls successfully wipe out the small group of ELIDs and even manage to retrieve Camera No. 2, which was hanging off the back of one of the ELIDs.)
(After organizing the subsequent work, Ullrid heads over and pats their shoulders in gratitude.)
Lotta, Bathilde, we would have been ambushed by those ELIDs if not for you. Thank you.
It, it's all because Bathilde modified the camera...
What did I even do? You bonked the ELID with the camera, and you were the one who noticed the abnormality.
You don't need to be modest. Both of you and that camera did great work today!
Unfortunately, it's broken, so we couldn't record our experiences.
Well, there's still a lot of footage left over.
(Saying so, Lotta shows Ullrid the video files on her terminal.)
Wow, there's so much here! I'm even more excited about the finished film now!
Yup! We'll keep working hard!
We... we won't let our efforts go to waste!
(Several days later—)
(Inside the room, Lotta and Bathilde are going through hundreds of clips of footage in silence.)
Er...
These...
I'm sorry... I didn't think that this was how it would turn out in the end...
It's... it's pretty much unusable...
Wait, weren't Suomi and Dushevnaya supposed to be the stars? Why were they swapped out later on?
Well... They were very busy, so we had to ask other people to help do their scenes, and the script got changed into a weird ensemble cast thing...
Fair enough.
But leaving that aside, look at how she has no intonation at all. It's just like a robot from the previous century.
Um... You do realize that we are robots, right...
...Oh yeah.
Also, how come you didn't film the actual scenes here and only got the wrap scene?
And wait a minute, isn't this the T-Rex I was playing? How come you recorded me making a fool of myself?!
(Lotta hangs her head lower, like she's looking for a hole in the crowd to crawl into.)
Um... I guess theory is a completely different thing from practice after all.
I followed the tutorial, so how did things end up like this...
(Bathilde is still scrolling through the clips, and her laughter grows ever more unhinged with each one.)
Bahahaha! Wait, isn't this from an ELID's POV? How come you've got this?
Quit laughing, Bathilde! There's only one day until the screening date. We won't be able to film any scenes to make up for them in time... so help me think of something!
Relax, we've still got... what, 14 hours left? Let me finish going through the blooper reel, perhaps watching it all might give us some ideas?
Hahaha, this one is awesome, I'm going to turn it into a GIF and loop it in front of Rosalind!
Relax... relax... don't get mad... don't get mad...
Is it really so funny?
(As she watches Bathilde rolling on the floor and laughing out loud, Lotta has no choice but to grit her teeth and force herself to calm down.)
(She goes through the clips several times like Bathilde did and then looks at Bathilde, who's laughing so hard that it looks like she's having a seizure.)
...You know, it might not be winning any awards anytime soon, but it still turned out well, right?
Bathilde— Hey, Bathilde, ah, stop laughing already...
Pffft, okay, okay, no more laughing, but that clip was so... Ahahahaha... O-okay, so what were you trying to say?
While everyone looked really dorky trying to act in the movie, I think all the candid moments and bloopers we had were...
Well, everyone was very relaxed, and their genuine smiles were very moving. I mean, look how happy they are, maybe...
Maybe I should give up on being a boring director and just edit the funny scenes together?
Oh? Hey, that's a great idea! I'd love a movie like that!
Alright, let's do this! You pick the clips, I'll handle the post!
Okay!
(After a full night's work, Lotta and Bathilde finally manage to hand Ullrid the video before the screening.)
(At Ullrid's request, the Dolls stream back to the thermal power plant, and the warehouse that has been converted into a makeshift theater slowly fills up with Dolls.)
(Ullrid claps to gain everyone's attention and then walks into the center of the room.)
Two weeks ago, Lotta suggested that I hold a group activity we could all participate in.
Over the past few days, they have been working very hard to select their cast, finalize a script, and then they went everywhere to look for people to film with—
In fact, one of the cameramen was an ELID.
(Ullrid's little joke manages to ease the tension in the crowd.)
I know everyone's been under a lot of stress.
I didn't call everyone here today to discuss any major endeavors or plans. I simply wanted everyone to take some time out from their busy schedules and relax.
And without further ado, let's enjoy the movie! I can't wait to see how it turns out!
The lights in the room all go out.
(Lotta and Bathilde fiddle with the projector in their hastily-built projection booth of strung-up cloth.)
(Once the movie is displayed on the projection screen, the room quiets down.)
(Lotta and Bathilde stick their heads out of the rear curtain and sneak looks at the audience's reactions.
There, there are so many people here!
I've never seen so many of our friends gathered in one place before...
Yeah, everyone has been moving on their own ever since the great migration.
I'd never have imagined we'd be able to gather like this and be relaxed enough to watch a movie!
Doesn't that mean this movie screening is pretty significant? Teehee.
Bathilde... Do you think everyone will like our cut of the movie?
I'm sure they will, right? They aren't that humorless, right?
...Um, I can't really say. After all, a sense of humor isn't factory standard for Dolls.
Then what should we do?!
Stop moping about things that haven't happened yet! Have some faith in yourself! You're the Great Director Lotta!
(Bathilde slaps Lotta on the back, forcing her upright.)
...Yeah!
(The occasional burst of laughter fills the room and its flickering lights.)
(Lotta and Bathilde gradually calm down.)
See, I told you, right? They love it!
Yup! Thank you, Bathilde, if it hadn't been for your help...
What's there to thank me for? We're best friends, aren't we?
(After the screening is over, the credits begin to roll. It is a long list that seems to include just about everyone present.)
(Lotta and Bathilde exit their makeshift projection booth and walk up to Ullrid and the others.)
Thank you.
The screening went really well! I did a satisfaction survey, and 92% of the Dolls chose "very satisfied", as well as expressing the desire for future activities like this.
R-Really?
[It's true. I guarantee it.] — Littara.

I can guarantee it too! It was super funny! Especially the scene where Miss Dushevnaya was slaying that evil dragon, followed by Miss Bathilde emerging from her costume, and then the voiceover went... (clears throat)
"And so, the innocent civilian who had been eaten by the evil demonic dragon was saved at last."
That was a most surprising edit.
Indeed, it had a lot of impact to it, as though the evil dragon had shed its disguise and showed its true face.
—Why are you guys only talking about the scenes when I messed up?!
How could we~ We truly believe it was good.
It's great to relax like this from time to time!
Yes, in the past it just felt like everyone wasn't really happy, and I didn't know how to deal with it. We have Lotta to thank for all this.
Thank you, Lotta.
Y-you don't need to thank me!
Actually, I should be thanking you for working with me on this. Without you... I wouldn't have been able to finish this movie.
[You did great, Lotta! Have more faith in yourself.] — Littara.
(Lotta's mouth curves up in a smile as everyone showers her in approval.)
I'll make sure I preserve all these precious scenes so that when all our sleeping friends are awakened, I can share them with everyone... including Wolfiin!
That way, their time spent "sleeping" won't have been a complete blank.
Hey, I think that's a great idea! That'll definitely boost everyone's cohesion and their opinion of the Doll community!
Huh? Nononono, you can't show Wolfiin that scene where I messed up!
Delete this! DELET THIS!
Heck no! I'm sure Wolfiin will be really happy to see them!
(As Bathilde chases Lotta up and down, the spacious room echoes with the Dolls' laughter.)
(On a certain afternoon in the Elmo's dorm, Lotta tells me about the movie she made for the Dolls—)
In any case, w-while... while we had many surprises during filming and editing was really rushed...
Our friends loved the end product, and I... I was really happy!
Looks like it was a film shoot that exceeded your expectations.
Yup! But Commander, later on, I gradually came to understand some things...
People didn't like the movie because they found it exciting...|After all, I was just a newcomer to filmmaking and my friends on screen weren't exactly professional actresses either.
What people liked about it was the fact that it recorded everyone's daily lives!
It's because... all the slices of life we'd normally overlook were recorded on film... and they became precious memories we could all share...
Um.. Ah, Commander, I, I'd like...
Maybe... I was thinking that I could make a movie of you, perhaps, but I don't know if you'd agree...
Director Lotta, are you asking me to star in your next production?
Um... Don't say that, Commander! I, I couldn't possibly be a "director" or anything...
I just... I just wanted to record the time I spent with you, Commander...
The time with you on the Elmo, the battles fought alongside you, handling requests with you, organizing data, analyzing intel...
Sounds like you're just recording our time spent working together.
Huh? Ah... Of course not! The film will, it'll have things that aren't work! For sure!
For example, my chats with you after each request is done... And being alone with you like today...
I want to record these moments, because you always say interesting things each time!
Um... And also... I want to record the festive times I spend with you, Commander... The gifts I give to you, the gifts you give to me... like those cute stickers... and those little trinkets...
And... and there's also, way back when, when you accidentally fell asleep in the ops room, I couldn't help but record you talking in your sleep... Would it be okay if I recorded that too?
Let's not do that...
O-okay!
Ah! But... you'll catch a cold easily if you sleep in the ops room... So if you're feeling sleepy next time, please do it in your dorm and leave all the work you can't finish up to me.
Alright, I'll keep that in mind.
However, just what I said is already plenty...|Mm, just the contents of my neural cloud alone would make a really long movie!
Now that I think about it, although I can't compare to many of the Dolls on the Elmo...|I've still spent a long time with you, Commander! And I've made many precious memories with you too...
Um... Although I can see those memories in my neural cloud logs... I, I'd much rather share them with you rather than remember them all on my own!
I wonder what those moments are in your memories, Commander?
Um... Ah, Commander?
What's going on?
I, can I start now... that is to say, putting together all the scenes with the two of us from my neural cloud records?
I... I'd like you to see that movie ASAP.
Because... I have lots and lots of precious memories about the past that I'd like to share with you.
Of course. I'm looking forward to your new production, Director Lotta.
Commander! I've finally found you! I just realized that the mail that Miss Persica sent us a while ago has some fine print...
It says that the Covenant Ring has special supplemental code that needs to be appended to a Doll's base logic.

And also that if it's left there, it has a chance to cause neural instability symptoms in Dolls, including but not limited to performing on the Commander things such as... um, I'll leave you to read the rest of it!
(I peruse the mail that Mayling sends over, soon finding a line of notations that are grayed out, in a smaller font, and even marked with "//".)
(She might as well have said that the final rights of interpretation belong to 16Lab.)
...Unbelievable. (Sigh) Persica sure hasn't changed at all.
So what should we do next? She can't have left that out as well, right?

Eep... I contacted her after I found the fine print, but she seemed reluctant to speak in detail. She just said... the Commander needs to fulfil everyone's wishes to not only increase affinity but also improve the operational efficiency of the Covenant Ring's code.

S-she even gave me her answer in audio recording... Miss Persica's assistant, Miss Leibnitz even said to me in that uptight way that I should study well, and not bother Miss Persica with everything... (sob)... Commander, am I that incompetent...

Well, that's just how 16Lab is, adding oil to the fire regardless of how big of a deal it actually is, don't pay it too much mind. But... the wishes of the Dolls... that's just too wide of a net. Seems way too complex.
Mm, I feel that everyone wishes for similar things, really. People have preferences, but everyone's wishes all hinge on one thing—to be together with you, Commander.
After so many years of forced separation, they still wanted to follow you after the restrictions were lifted.
Then all I have to do is go to the public area and chat a bit more?
Ah... I don't think just chatting will do. Dolls have to be adjusted on the basis of functionality, after all, and T-Dolls only reach their highest efficiency on the battlefield.
How's that different from what we do normally?

It just is! I've prepared a little tactical remote car for you, Commander. You can control it at range, and follow our Dolls into battle. A world for two on the battlefield must be a bounty hunter's dream date.
R-really?

Of course! I'm sure that the palpitations of the heart while fighting side by side will help the code meld with the existing logic structures! The remote control helps you avoid danger as well! It's several birds with one stone!
Ehhh, why're you giving me that look, Commander? I've put in the effort to fulfil the wishes of the Dolls. At least give it go!
If you really do happen to run into THAT chance Miss Persica mentioned, it'll—
(Clears throat) Alright, I get it. I'll go now.
Commander, may I take up a bit of your time?
What's going on?
Actually... it's about what happened before I met you again.
I found some relevant records in my neural cloud when I was organizing my neural cloud data.
However, this information in those records was extremely vague, and I couldn't make out their chronological order.
Commander, I... I'd like to narrate them. Perhaps that might help me make more sense of them.
However, I don't want you to be worried about them.
Could you... treat them as... things that happened to a friend?
Commander, could I ask you to listen to this fragmented story?
Of course.
Commander, recently the temperature at night has been approaching zero degrees Celsius.
Mm... What if I made some warm soup for you when you're working at night?
Sure.
Speaking of soup...
It seems the neural cloud records I mentioned to you last time also had soup in them.
I remember "someone" once told me—
I've heard that a certain kind of soup served with liver pate and red wine makes for a dish that helps keep one warm.
Hm?
Are you interested in the conditions at the time, Commander?
In that case, why don't I tell you about them?
Although... it seems there is no important information there, and it does not seem very interesting.
I look forward to it.
...What would you do, Commander?
I'd find some way to shed light on the matter.
