Vepley, what's wrong? Is it too dark? Do you want to see Mayling later?
(I remembered Vepley's tendency to destabilize in darkness. This Doll, who is afraid of the dark, came to the aid of me who isn't afraid at all.)
I...I'm... I'm fine!
Vepley is-is just saying that she-she wants to stay by the Commander's side!
Not as an idol's responsibility and identity, not because she is thinking about others... Vepley really just wants to be with you!
(Her sudden loud proclamation somewhat surprises me. She is not her usual self.)
(She just wants to be with me... Why?)
(Before I can ask, the surroundings light up. The power has returned.)
(I squint, being blinded by the sudden oncoming light. The first thing I saw when my vision came into focus was Vepley's blushing face.)
Is your face alright?
(Vepley finally realizes that the lights are on. She hastily covers her face and staggers wildly off in the direction of the ops room door.)
Ahh! C-Commander you didn't see anything at all!
Wait, you—
D-don't ask Vepley about that kind of thing! Uuu... S-since the power is back on, Vepley will... need to hurry back to practice! See you later Commander!
(She has hurried off in a panic, leaving me standing in place with my mind full of questions and the image of her blushing face.)
(So, what was it all about in the end?)
Ah, Vepley! Finally found you, I—
C-Commander? Ah—Um, did you come for Vepley? But Vepley needs to—um—needs to rehearse for her performance☆ See you!
...Huh?
(Vepley's behavior seems to be quite unusual lately. She keeps avoiding me.)

(I've been having trouble even saying hello to her ever since the power outage. Whenever I try to talk to her about something, she stammers to find a reason to leave in a hurry, as if she is adverse to my presence.)
(Later on—)
("Ding!" A new message. I open to see...)
[Commander! How is Vepley's outfit today?]
[If the Commander likes it, Vepley will wear it on stage later☆]

(I sigh. This is also an unusual behavior of hers. She is unwilling to meet face to face, yet she talks to me about all sorts of things through messages, asking me for feedback on various aspects of her performances.)
(I still have no idea why she is acting like this, so I went to find her when she was practicing alone.)
Vepley, let's talk.
Eh? Eh?! Um, Vepley—
Ugh... Okay.
(Seeing my attitude, Vepley gives up on protesting.)
What's up with you lately? Are you in a difficult spot? Or did a part of you start malfunctioning on the day of the power outage?
No, I, I...
I'm just—My heart has been racing whenever I see the Commander recently...
When I think about you watching my performance, seated in the audience, with only-only Vepley in your eyes—
Vepley feels so nervous... so nervous that she has difficulty practicing her dances...
So it was because I cause you a lot of stress? It's okay if I don't come—
You can't not come! No, it's not stress! It's—
(She suddenly stops again, looking at me with a pair of eyes glistening with tears. When she notices my gaze, she lowers her head back down.)
Anyway... It's not the Commander's fault.
Although Vepley knows that she can't keep thinking about the Commander, but, but if she leaves the Commander, Vepley's heart feels so empty!
It's too painful for Vepley to completely avoid talking to the Commander. No way! No way!
So that's what you were thinking...
Yes, that's right. But Vepley, wants to show everyone the best possible performance, so it's not right to keep getting distracted like this!
This is why Vepley is like this now, avoiding the Commander, yet constantly messaging Commander through the comms...
Anyway! The Commander does not need to worry! Vepley—Vepley will handle this!
I don't think you look like you are able to "handle this" right now.
(I walk up to her and pat her head gently.)
I know that you care much about your performance as an idol, which is why you don't want anything to affect you on stage.
I'm one of the people who you wish to bring happiness to, but at the same time, I'm something that distracts you.
Yes... But, Vepley does not hate the Commander at all.
I understand. However, perhaps you need not take on such a burden?
If Vepley's performances are here to "bring happiness to everyone", then it's enough so long as your intentions are known and it doesn't matter who is sitting in the audience.
But the Commander... feels different to Vepley. Vepley can't explain, but it just feels different.
I have felt your intentions, but as this specially different audience member, what's most important to me is simply seeing Vepley's performance and feeling the emotions that you wish to convey.
(Vepley stays silent for a while before raising her head.)
Really? The Commander... will like it no matter what? Even if, Vepley gets nervous and falls down as a result?
Hmm? Falling down is a special performance from Vepley, too. Aren't you always saying something about... how the main objective is to bring emotions of joy to others?

(I recall Vepley's usual quotes from our day to day lives. To my surprise, her usual improvised performances that induce speechlessness in me and idol-like speeches, have long been transformed into the most sincere and honest messages that I keep within me.)
(Perhaps I... have unknowingly, actually become Vepley's fan?)
You don't have to be so nervous and keep thinking about what my preferences and opinions are. Fans will enjoy an idol's performance so long as she is taking it seriously.
The Commander... is Vepley's fan?
(I resolutely nod my head. Vepley's eyes start lighting up with joy and surprise.)
If that's how the Commander puts it, Vepley is now super☆confident!
Vepley will do her best to prepare!
Great! I am looking forward to your performance.
Mmmhmm! Then Vepley will no longer avoid the Commander!
Vepley will listen to what the Commander says!
So, can the Commander... forgive Vepley?
I've never blamed you.
Oh, yay! You're the best, Commander☆
Vepley has actually been preparing a one-on-one Spe-cial☆ Performance☆ for the Commander! Because you are Vepley's most important person! Vepley wants to give you the most special treatment possible☆
But the Commander will have to keep this a secret from everyone, okay☆ Because Vepley wishes to make this performance into a secret memory between the Commander and Vepley!
A special performance? What do you have planned?
You'll know once you're there! Tonight, on the deck. You'll definitely come, right, Commander?
(I let out a soft chuckle as I see Vepley prancing around in front of me.)
Well, I'm looking forward to it.
Commander's mood index is so high today! Looks like Vepley's "Campaign for Commander's Happiness" is finally starting to work☆
Eh? Commander doesn't know what that is? But Vepley has been working hard to prepare for her performances every day to make the Commander happy!
Looks like from now on, Vepley will need to work even harder to make you happy! Heheh, this is a Spe-cial☆ treatment for the Commander only☆
Did you find any changes around your ops room seat lately?
Um, you mean this Mr. Pizza backrest?

Yeah! It's great at protecting the Commander during long periods of sitting down! Also, it's not just a decoration, you see. Pressing this will play a encouraging song recorded by Vepley just for the Commander☆
Ohh... These are quite comprehensive features. Why give me this all of a sudden though?
B-Because—Mr. Pizza—Um, Mr. Pizza likes the Commander too...?
...Really?

...Uuu... Okay. It's actually because Vepley usually keeps causing trouble for the Commander, so she wants to make it up to you a little. This Mr. Pizza can accompany you in place of Vepley when she's not around to keep the Commander happy!
However, Mr. Pizza is just the backup plan! Vepley still wishes to be by your side the best she can anytime whenever you need anything!
Just like how Vepley will feel even happier and motivated when the Commander comes to her performances, Vepley hopes that her presence is special to the Commander too...
That's to say, um, Mr. Pizza is a representation of Vepley's i-intentions! When you see Mr. Pizza, you'll think of Vepley, right? This way, the Commander will really be Vepley's personal audience...
Um, all in all, the Commander will take care of Mr. Pizza too, right?

(With my empty mug in hand, I head over to the public area. While there's usually someone to help do this, coming outside by myself and taking a short break at the same time is also a form of recreation.)
Hm?
(It's rare that the public area is this quiet in the afternoon. The only sound in the hall is the rumbling of the Elmo as it drives on.)
(I'm about to head over to the coffee machine, but to my surprise, I notice a familiar figure in the corner.)
(Upon seeing her, I put my mug on the table and head over to say hi.)
Suomi.
(The person sitting there is none other than Suomi, who returned to the Elmo not long ago.)
(The strange thing is that she doesn't respond to my greeting at all. Instead, she sits there, motionless.)
Suomi?

(I found it slightly strange, so I slowly approach towards her, only to notice that Suomi is wearing her earphones, her head bobbing up and down every now and then. It is then that I realize Suomi did not hear her own voice.)
(After I see Suomi like this, I can't help but think of the past, when we were still in Griffin.)

(Suomi had a unique preference in music and would often play it out loud in Springfield's cafe. Although she would turn it off without complaint when it was pointed out, her attitude would do a 180-degree turn when she met THAT person.)
I TOLD you, don't play your shitty death metal in public!!!
What do you mean shitty death metal, you pikkuryssä?!
You want to say that again, blyat?!
That's enough, both of you!!! You're going to tear the cafe apart!!!
...Pfffft.
(The memories of the past force a chuckle for me, and it startles Suomi, who's right beside me.)
(Panicked, she removes her earphones and turns in her chair. Upon realizing I'm standing behind her, an uneasy look crosses her face.)
C-Commander!
Relax, I'm just here for coffee.
(I smile, then pull up a chair and sit down beside Suomi. At the same time, I place the piping hot cup of coffee on the table.)
I see... Thank you for all your hard work.
And you too.
Speaking of which, have you been listening to music over your earphones?
If I'm not wrong, you used to just play it out loud in the past.
Huh?! Why do you still remember things from so long ago...
(The moment she says that, a strange look crosses Suomi's face and she lowers her head, like she has done something wrong.)
(I, on the other hand, do not think there's anything wrong with it. Instead, I take note of Suomi's expression and speak kindly to her.)
What's going on?
...I'm sorry, Commander.
I treated Griffin as something from a long time ago.
...I see...
It's okay, don't let it get to you. I don't mind.
And besides, ten years is a little too long to wait unless you're an elf from a fantasy novel.
...Yeah, about your question just now... I learned a lot from the Doll Community, including how to take responsibility for and take care of others.
Everyone works hard to survive, each and every day, so I can't disturb their rest. And besides, being too loud might attract unknown dangers.
(I can’t help but look at Suomi—never would I have imagined someone like her would actually care about how others perceived her heavy metal music.)
(Suomi notices my gaze and squeezes the earphones in her hand before laughing in embarrassment.)

In the past, there was a time when I was exploring with Big Sis Ullrid. We found a small settlement that had been destroyed by the Varjagers and pretty much everything of use had been carried away... However, we found some CDs and the like which had been left behind.

That day, when we were resting back at our camp, someone played those CDs to try and help us rest. In the end, the noise attracted the Varjagers who had doubled back along their path... and that was after we had gone to such lengths to avoid them!
(I listen attentively to Suomi's story and can't help but think that she must have had a hard life.)
(However, I can also sense that Suomi enjoyed her experiences.)
Looks like you don't exactly hate this kind of life.
...Hehe.
(Suomi smiles shyly.)
Well yes, it's really tough, but being able to build a little place that can hold me and all my friends makes me very happy.
At the very least... It's better than worrying about which of my friends is going to go down each day.
(Suomi's voice grows very solemn at this point, and her mood cools down as well.)
...After all, things aren't like before, when we lived in "heaven" under your protection.
(I scratch my face, a little ill at ease.)
Calling it "heaven" seems a little exaggerated.
Nope, it's not exaggerated at all.
(Suomi raises her head, a serious expression on her face.)
It's only when those days were gone that we realized how precious they were.
So even if we have to go up against some crazy opponents every now and then, that's okay.
Only we Dolls who've experienced it before will know...
(Suomi pauses, then turns back and looks me straight in the eyes.)
They know just how lucky we were to be able to live with you watching over them, Commander.
In the past, with you and Griffin taking care of us, we knew practically nothing about the outside world.
Which is why now, more than ever, I want to be able to help you out.
Suomi...
(My heart aches and I feel a twinge of guilt.)
I'm sor—
Don't!
Commander, don't apologize! I'm not blaming you or complaining about anything!
(Suomi frantically clamps her hand over my mouth. Then she realizes that it's probably very rude to do that, and pulls her hand back.)
I know that! I, I know—
I know I'm not as amazing as Miss Lee or Miss Kar, to say nothing of the AR Team or Team DEFY.
But even so, I know just how great you are, Commander.
(I look at her in surprise— After all, calling me "great" is probably an exaggeration. But before I can speak, Suomi continues, with an earnest look on her face.)
We would never have had good memories in the first place without you.
Even in Griffin, the base where you were treated Dolls differently than the bases where you weren't.
So, it, it's not just me, but I think all the Dolls under you all feel the same way about you.
(I pick up my coffee and take a warm sip.)
Thank you.
I should be the one thanking you.
Not only did you give me a beautiful dream, you even appeared before me again.
As long as I have you, I have the feeling that I won't have to worry about anything.
Alright, that's enough. Any more and you'll make me blush.
(I laugh helplessly.)
Well, if there's nothing else, I'll be heading back. I have unfinished work.
Okay!
(I stand up and grab my cup before turning to leave the dorms.)
Commander!
Hm?
Whether it's in Griffin, or the Elmo...
They're both important to me as long as you're by my side.
...You're right.
Me too, Suomi.
(I nod and then turn to leave the dorm.)
(Meanwhile, Suomi stays behind, holding her face in her hands and bending down, as though her head were radiating heat.)
...Uwaaaaahhhhh... I got carried away by the mood in the air and... I ended up speaking my mind...
(The Elmo proceeds evenly along its assigned course. I pick up my cup and take a sip of bitter coffee.)

(There's nothing which needs to be manually operated at the moment. Mayling is bustling back and forth, seemingly preparing for later work. Meanwhile, Groza is organizing the details of our recent missions.)
Commaaaaander! Commaaaaander! Are you there?
Hm? What's the matter, Colphne?
Suomi's outside, you know—
She looks like she's agonizing over whether or not to come in and talk to you~
Hm? Suomi? Looking for me?
Mhm, and she has a suuuuuuper serious look on her face, mm...
Looks like she's not planning to ask you out on a date~
Don't joke around... Just bring her inside.

(Colphne replies in the affirmative, then heads out of the ops room. Shortly afterward, she returns with a vexed-looking Suomi, then leaves with a cheeky smile on her face, leaving Suomi to flounder around helplessly on the spot.)
Is something the matter, Suomi?
It, it's like this, Commander. I'd like to apply for shore leave at the next settlement.
It's for a mission to collect supplies.
Collect supplies?
(I freeze up for a moment, then turn to look at Groza. Groza also seems lost and gently shakes her head.)
I don't think there's a need for that, right?
Mayling, did we have any supply shortfalls recently?
Hm? Nope. In fact, we've been really well-off recently, which is a rarity. The stuff we got earlier will last us a good long while!
Huh? Eh? Rich? I... I just, I just thought— I should prepare ahead of time!
Hm, if I only start thinking of a solution when we run low of resources... then wouldn't it mean that I'd be too late if an emergency happened? ...You think so too, right, Commander?
Yup. What you say has a point.
But we don't have any suitable supply points nearby, right?
I've already checked.|There's one on our planned route.
There's a settlement that's going to host a fair soon. We can go there.
(I check the map, and find that there really is a small town along our path.)
Looks like you did your research.
But of course!
So, what did you want to buy?
Er...
(Suomi's face turns red, like I've seen through her immediately, and she wrings her hands shyly.)
(Beside me, Groza smiles. The look on her face says "leave this place to me", so I take Suomi by the hand and lead her out of the ops room.)
Can you tell me now?
Is there somewhere you want to go?
Hehe... I just can't keep anything from you, Commander.
(Suomi shyly scratches her head.)
Actually... I want to buy CDs.
CDs?
(I'm kind of surprised.)
Yeah! Actually, it's like this...

In the past, when I was still in the Doll Community, everyone had a hard time building up assets and possessions because resources were scarce... I was the same way too, so I didn't have much funds to use on my hobbies...
Ah, but I'm not complaining about it, though! After all, just keeping the minimum number of Dolls running normally to keep us going was challenging enough.
Mm.
And then... that is to say, after I arrived on the Elmo...
Thanks to your help, I managed to save up a bit of money... How should I put this, now that I'm in a safe, warm environment, I found myself wanting more...
(Suomi's face turns visibly redder.)
During the welcome party earlier, everyone gave me a new CD player, right?
It's not often that I receive gifts from everyone, and I don't want to have to keep going back and forth between CDs.
Oh... I get it.
(I nod.)
Understood. Let's stop outside the settlement for a bit, then.
I'm approving your request.
Wow! Thank you, Commander!
Although, I have a request; or more accurately, a condition.
Ehhh?!
W-What kind of condition is it?
(I grin, then smile warmly at her.)
I'm going with you.
(The Elmo stops near the town, as planned. Mayling takes advantage of this to bring the Dolls with her to begin a vehicle inspection.)
(Meanwhile, I and Suomi take a jeep to a nearby town.)
Commander! Commander! Over here, over here!
Ah, coming.
(Just as we come to a halt, Suomi jumps out of the vehicle. She seems really happy about this rare excursion and the chance to buy a new CD.)
(I shrug and smile, then follow behind her. Seeing her hop, skip and jump lifts my spirits.)

(This is a settlement that was built on the ruins of a city. It's not far from the purification works area and the radiation intensity isn't every high. From time to time, we can even see the bodyguards hired to ensure this region's security.)

(After speaking with the local authorities, Suomi and I officially enter the settlement's commercial district-- while the stalls built on top of the ruins look run-down and impoverished, I can't help thinking that they're pretty decadent, considering that we're in the Yellow Zone.)
Wow... aren't there TOO many stores here?
(Suomi, who has stayed in the Yellow Zone for a long time, fully understands these difficulties and sighs from the bottom of her heart.)
This town sure is in a good location. Radiation intensity is low, it was built on a city's ruins, so there are even some basic facilities which they could use.
A lot of bounty hunters or people who have to travel to and from the Yellow Zones for work often stop over here to top up their supplies, and some underground brokers even restock their goods here.
That's why it's lively in a way that doesn't suit the Yellow Zones.
I see...
But it's a shame... No matter how much traffic it gets... The Yellow Zone is still the Yellow Zone...
If only everyone could live in the Green Zone... In a place with a stable environment... That would be nice.
A lot of choices are out of our control. Also, even if the times now are peaceful, not all places are equally peaceful...
(I pat Suomi's drooped head and sigh before scanning the simple "shopfronts" around us.)
Doesn't seem like there are any CD stalls around here, though?
(But in today's world, art and beauty are luxuries for these people who are eking out a living on the border of the Yellow and Green Zones.)
(That is also the reason why most of the wares here are related to survival.)
It's alright.
Music is an indispensable creation for mankind throughout history.
I believe someone will notice eventually.
Then let's take a walk. We've still got a long time today.
(We hit it off right away and walk down the street, side by side.)
(Although Suomi's spirits seemed a little damped by the topic which came up just now, it doesn't seem to affect her enthusiasm as we walk, and she even grabs my hand.)
(We stop and start, and it seems as though we've visited every single store in our path. No matter what we see, she praises it like it's a rare treasure.)
Commander! Commander! Those are biscuits!
...Did you roast this yourself? To think you'd do it in a place like this... pretty decadent, I have to say.
Should we get gifts for everyone on the Elmo?
Sounds like a good idea to me. Let's take our time and pick well.
We passed a handicrafts store just now, we can go there and take a look!
Let's check it out on our way back, otherwise we'll be stuck hauling bags around while we shop.
Will do!
(We chat and laugh as we continue strolling down the street. Just then, I spot an antique store around the corner.)
Suomi, shall we go there and take a look? Antique stores like that sometimes sell old CDs.
Ah... you're right! We might be able to pick up a bargain too!
(I grab Suomi's hand and we enter the antique store.)
(Behind the counter, a young man in a vest is sitting in front of the table. He has a controller in hand and is playing a game on the console before him.)
(I walk up to the counter and lightly clear my throat before calling out to him.)
Hi.
If there's anything you like, bring it over and I'll tell you the price.
(The staffer doesn't even look at me. His eyes are fixed on the screen as he speaks in a detached tone of voice.)
Excuse me, but do you sell old CDs here?
There's a basket on the side of the second rack from the front.
Thank you.
(The staffer's cold and rude nature doesn't bother me as I take Suomi in search of the CD basket.)

(Said basket is neither too big nor too small and has several dozen old CDs inside it. They are visibly aged, and most of their cardboard boxes are crumpled while some of them have been completely torn up. There's no way to tell what they are without putting them into a player.)
(There are also some CDs casually tossed in here which don't even have a proper jewel case, just some cheap, thin plastic sleeves.)
(Suomi wants to read the data herself, but I stop her-- I have my doubts about the safety of these discs; it would be bad if they contained a virus.)
Want to go out and walk for a while longer and see if there are any other shops around?
N-No, there's no need for that! All this was because of my selfishness in the first place, how could I keep troubling you on my account, Commander?
(Suomi takes out the CD player that everyone gave her. She's been carrying it everywhere ever since that day.)
Let's listen to it with this!
Alright.
(I nod and then take several intact-looking CDs out of their sleeves before handing them to Suomi.)
(Suomi takes them from me and eyes them carefully. Her eyes gleam like those of a certain lupine-themed Doll.
This, this is... Parklife by Blur!
This is a legend! I can't believe we actually found this here! Commander, am I dreaming?
Of course not. While I don't understand too well, I'm just glad you like it.
I'll help listen to the rest.
(I laugh and take the CD player from her, then begin checking the unidentifiable CDs.)

(Should I say the result was everything I expected? Most of them are completely unreadable. Some of them can be listened to, but the quality is atrocious, and for all I know it might be because the CD player is too old, the CDs themselves might have a problem, but whatever the case is, the noise in them is downright lethal.)
Hm? This one...
(...It's certainly special. However, it seems gentler than the ones Suomi usually listens to.)
(I glance over at Suomi, who's excitedly examining the CD that caught her eye, and decide to check for myself.)

(And so, I put the headphones on and continue listening to the record. While I'm not too familiar with this style of music, for some reason it seems to grab onto my ears and it's hard to put it aside.)
(After a glance at the read results from the CD player, I find that there are 12 songs on this CD. If they're all of this standard, then I'd go for it even if Suomi didn't like them.)
Suomi, come listen to this.
Hm? Alright.
(Suomi, clueless on what is going on, simply takes the earphones from me.)
(Then, she listens quietly. As the song begins, her eyes gleam with surprise and delight, the brightest they have been all day.)
This... this is Nevermind!
Ah? Is it famous?
It's not just famous... It pretty much started a whole new era of music! And that's being conservative!
(She carefully turns off the CD player, then gingerly takes it out, like she's afraid of getting the slightest scratch on it.)
And it's got all 12 songs on it... Not even on the Internet can you find all of them.
(I smile as I see the delighted expression on Suomi's face.)
So, all of these?
Okay!
(Suomi picks up five CDs, hesitates briefly, then puts two of them back before running over to the checkout counter.)
(I shake my head and smile helplessly before picking up the two CDs and following her there.)
Hello! I want these!
And these.
Huh?! C-Commander...
Ring us up, please.
Ah... Alright. These will cost this much.
Got it.
(I pay no attention to Suomi's opinion the matter and pay immediately, then take the 5 CDs and stuff them into my sling bag.)
...Thank you, Commander! I, I'll pay you back for this!
It's alright.
(I smile.)
It doesn't matter what I bought. The important thing is that you're here with me.
(Suomi looks up at me. She seems dazed for a moment, then she quickly recalls those were the words she told me before.)
(I watch as a red blush creeps up her face. It look as though steam is going to whistle out through the top of her head and ears.)
C-- Commander! Please don't tease me like that!
Hahaha.
(I laugh and pat her head, then smile.)
Just think of it as a reward for the effort you've put in all this time.
Not just in the Elmo, but also in the Doll Community and all the things you've had to put up with for others' sake.
Okay...
Let's go, we still have quite a bit of time.
...Yup! Let's go! Where shall we go next, Commander?

(After that, I take Suomi with me and we keep touring the town, sampling their specialty dishes, visting an old clock tower, and then finally we return to that handicrafts store Suomi mentioned, where we buy gifts for Groza, Mayling and everyone on the Elmo before we start on the road back home.)
Hmhm~♪ Hmhm~♪
(Suomi skips lightly while holding her bags of things. Her elation is plain to see.)
(I can tell that she's humming the song I heard earlier.)

(Although she says nothing along the way, I'm smiling as I listen to her hum. It is only when we reach the Elmo that Suomi finally calms herself down, hands her purchases to Mayling and takes the five CDs we bought from me.)
Go back and have a good rest.
You must be tired after walking all day.
Um... ah, Commander!
Hm?
Thank you... Thank you very much.
Today has been the happiest day for me in the past 10 years.
(I smile and pat Suomi's head again.)
That's good.
(It is night time and most of the lights on the Elmo have been turned off. I rub my eyes and yawn as I exit the ops room, having finished the day's work.)
(Just as I'm about to head back to my bedroom, I notice something in the corner of the darkened corridor.)
Huh... Suomi?!
(Zzz... mmm... Ahh... huh?!)
C-Commander! Have you finished your work?
Yeah, I was just about to go sleep... Why were you sleeping at the door to the ops room?
I wanted to ask you about a private matter... But you looked busy, so I felt bad about disturbing you.
So I had to wait outside.
A private matter?
Hehe... Ah... That's... Mm...
...H-Here.
(Suomi hands over something that she's been hugging tightly.)
It's a thank-you gift for last time.
What's this...?
(I take the present from her. It is a flat box that has been carefully wrapped and beribboned. I can't tell what's inside it.)
Please open it up and take a look.
Mm.
(With Suomi's permission, I open the present in front of her and take out its contents.)
...Is this a CD?
it doesn't look like one of the five we bought last time. Did you buy a new one?
No... You see, I recorded this one myself.
(At this point, Suomi's face turns red again.)
...There are 11 songs in total. I picked ones which you might like, Commander.
...Huh?
I... ever since I came back last time, something's been bothering me.
You've been so good to me, Commander, so how should I pay you back...
Don't worry...
I'm sure if I asked you, you'd say "don't worry about it", am I right?
Ah, yeah.
So I went to go discuss things with Papasha.
While we ended up arguing at first, she did her best to help me think.
And then...
...And then?
And then, we thought of this idea.
It wasn't too expensive, which might make you think that Suomi was being cold and aloof.
And it was also filled with my good intentions so you could understand how I thought.
(I laugh and pat Suomi's head.)
I like it. Thank you, Suomi.
Mhm...!
...Ah, do you want to listen to it now?
Alright, I'd be happy to.
(Upon hearing me say that, a look of surprise crosses Suomi's face and she grabs my hand before pulling me over to the dorms.)
(A CD player sits on one of the tables there. It has clearly been waiting for long time.)
This is... Suomi? Is there some special occasion?
Um, no? It's just... I was just reminiscing about the past.
Reminiscing about the past?
You'll find out once you play the CD.
(Thoroughly confused and with no idea what Suomi is getting at, I have no choice but to load up the CD, then press the play button.)
(Then, a familiar melody plays from the speakers, along with a pleasing and equally familiar voice.)
(Suomi's voice flows into a song. The lyrics are simple and crisp, and they remind me of something.)
(Today is not the first time I have heard Suomi sing.)
(Suomi's voice is pleasant, on par with that of a professional singer.)
(Though it's been over a decade, I still remember that lovely night.)
(I remembered everything they prepared for me.)
(Even though so long has passed, her voice is still as moving as ever.)
(I take a seat. My eyes start to ache a little, and I find myself sniffling.)
(Suomi notices this and hands me a napkin.)
Ah, thank you...
(My voice turns a little nasally and I use a tissue to wipe my eyes.)
(As Suomi sees that I'm close to tears, the corners of her eyes redden as well. She rubs her eyes and begins speaking a little stiffly.)
...Commander.
I just want to say it again, but I really, really am very happy... that I could meet you again.
We'll make up all the time together twice over, in the days to come.
...You don't owe me anything.
I'm the one who owes you here...
Miss Persica equipped us Dolls with the ability to cry.
I'm sure I existed just for this moment... Commander...
(A tear falls from Suomi's eye, but she has a rare smile on her face.)
I'll never leave you again, Commander!
Yeah... me too.
(Today isn't a special occasion, but as I look at Suomi, I gently stroke her face and help wipe her tears away.)
(...What ARE a Doll's tears made of, anyway?)
...It sounds nice.
If you like it, your Suomi will stay with you from now on and sing for you.
Hmm... if...
If the day comes when I can get you all by my side, then let's sing it together again.
I'm looking forward to that, Commander.
...Yeah, me too.

(And so we sit there, listening to the melodious tune coming from the player while we sip tea and gaze at the pure moonlight outside the Elmo, time seems to stop as we silently enjoy this perfect moment.)
For us Dolls, coming to this world is something we all truly look forward to.
We might not be humans, but there are still many wonderful things to experience, even in this messed-up world.
And meeting you was the most wonderful thing I've experienced so far.
...I hope you'll carry on travelling with me from now on.
Speaking of which, why do you sing so well, Suomi?
Could it be that you were an idol or a band member like Vepley and the others?
Hm? D-Don't tease me, Commander. I joined Griffin right after I was rolled out at IOP.
Huh... So does that mean...
You're a natural? You're simply talented at singing?
Perhaps. I do love music, and it's stuff like rock and roll and heavy metal, which most people have a hard time appreciating.
Hehe... could it be that I actually have great taste in music?
(Suomi seems a little smug and I suddenly get the urge to tease her.)
That's nice, maybe you should become a singer?
Heck no!
I only want to sing for the Commander.
Eh?
While I might not be able to share the songs I like with you, I can still sing just for you, you know?
...I see...
Yup! I'll learn the songs you like so I can sing them for you!
So, what do you want to hear? Just tell me! You don't need to hold back, okay?
Alright, then... That CD just now...
Was that Nevermind? Wow, you're truly a cultured individual, Commander!
Hmmm... I wonder if I can grasp the essence of it... I guess I've just got to sing it and see.
Maybe I should listen to the original song. If there's a chance... I'd like to host a music listening party on the Elmo and recommend it to everyone...
Haha.
Yeah, never mind. That's a big too far in the future.
Commander, I learned a new song before I came here. Would you like to hear it?
Sure.
(Suomi sits beside me and leans on my shoulder before quietly humming a familiar melody.)
(I pick up a cup of tea, close my eyes, and silently listen to her song.)
(...How nice.)
(Morning, Yellow Zone, Elmo ops room.)
(All the reports and files meant to be worked on today are now perfectly sorted on my table, each one clearly labelled with exceptionally perfect annotations and concise project summary.)
(The only thing missing being—)
...I don't remember having finished these.
Good morning, Commander. A new day has dawned... excellent. Looks like you've woken up extremely swiftly today, I'm glad to see you in good spirits.
Klukai, I suspect we've got a suspicious passenger aboard the Elmo.
I've already inspected Elmo's operational status; there are no anomalies, of course, including the crew.
However, if that's the reason for your unusual alertness today, I don't mind going through the Elmo again.
Rest assured, Commander. With me present, no one will ever be allowed to harm you.
(Seeing how seriously Klukai reacts to the"suspicious passenger", I feel like I've made a poorly thought-out joke.)
Rather than harm... it feels like they're being philanthropic. All of my reports and files were compiled overnight.
...Commander, have you double-checked those documents?
They were wonderfully done, so perfect in fact that I feel like I should just pay them well enough for them to remain here.
You ought to feel pleased now, as they have already decided to remain.
Already?
...Really, how many more hints do I need to give you?
Given those sloppy reports and disorganized files of yours, only I could help you organize them all in one night.
Technically, it only took me 4 hours. Which is roughly twice as fast than if you did it on your own.
Umm, thanks, Klukai. With your help, I can go straight to the dispatch room now.
To arrange dispatches? I've drawn up a plan for today's dispatch assignments, it's been sent to your terminal.
(I wearily pull out my terminal to check.)
Did you do this data analysis overnight too?
A trivial task that didn't take very long. Anyway, I've taken care of all work which needed doing. Commander, you can just relax for the rest of the day now.
The appreciation can come later, what I'd like to remind you of is—
You have a lot of free time today, so if you happen to have something you wanted to do but can never find the time for, or...
Things you wanted to say but never found the opportunity to do so, today would be the proper time for closure.
Thanks, that was very helpful.
(After briefly thanking Klukai, I immediately start on checking the dispatch plan.)
Commander.
(But Klukai doesn't appear to have any intention of leaving just yet.)
You seem to have more to say?
(Klukai looks a little displeased... was my tone too informal?)
I just tried to remind you, Commander. Don't you have something you want to say?
Today's not a busy day, you have ample time to think it through.
(Klukai intensifies her tone, her expression also grows more serious, fixing her eyes on me without looking away.)
(Looks like she won't settle for anything less than an answer today... But, what's with her?)
Putting on a thoughtful demeanor right away, huh?
Commander, I've already assisted in completing all your work today. Please use the time saved to reflect on it and don't leave anything out.
(What am I supposed to ponder without a hint?)
(But if Klukai started helping me today... I think I've figured it out...)
I see.
Sorry, Klukai, for taking so long before talking to you.
Hmph...
(Hearing that, Klukai's expression finally softens. She hums gently in satisfaction, signaling for me to continue.)
It's about the fieldwork, isn't it?
Fieldwork?

Both Groza and Mayling are out on fieldworks lately and Groza especially informed me before leaving that you would take over her responsibilities during her absence. However, I assume you aren't well-versed in the Elmo's matters, right? Shall I give you a short briefing?
N-no?
(A tinge of hesitation clouds Klukai's expression, as if she's withholding her feelings. The ops room thus falls into a brief, awkward silence.)
(At last, the enigmatic ripples return to tranquility.)
...No, that's right.
But rest assured, Commander. I am an elite Doll, the leader of Squad 404 and will soon be in charge of all the matters of the Elmo... which includes the Commander's schedule, the entire schedule.
(Hearing Klukai's acknowledgement, I also experience a sense of relief.)
Well, looks like I can entrust you with the Elmo for the time being.
Only now do you realize that? Besides, that preface was redundant.
Anyway, I've enabled all access for you. Whether it's my work or the schedule, you can check in anytime and follow up.
I saw that.
However, Commander, you're still the one in charge of the Elmo. I'll be confirming all schedules and tasks with you.
In addition... I'd like to remind the Commander that giving someone this much access is a bit reckless. Please be more conscientious about it, unless...
...You entrusted them to me, this is the most sensible decision you could take.
Then, I'm counting on you.
Rest assured, Commander. You will not be disappointed.
Whether it's your work or daily life, I'll get everything organized, just you watch.
(Morning, Yellow zone, outside the Elmo.)
I've been waiting for a while, Commander.

(As I exit the Elmo, I see Klukai waiting for me on her heavy motorcycle. She tucks her terminal back in her pocket and I can't help but ponder how many times she has double-checked it while waiting.)
Sorry for being late, I was under the impression that today was a day off. Is there more work to do?
Commander... Have you properly checked today's schedule?
I promised to assist you in organizing all your work and daily life. You haven't forgotten about that, have you?
Since it's a rest day, I honestly didn't pay attention...
(I pull up my calendar and start checking the day's schedule.)
(It's packed... so packed in fact that I'm under the illusion that I've become a resident of a safe zone.)
As expected, took you long enough... Let me just explain.
Since the Elmo just so happens to be stationed near a Green Zone, I've planned you a vacation in the satellite city. A decent change of scenery once in a while, don't you think?
As this is a time for relaxation, you don't need to be so on edge, Klukai.
Let's enjoy the time together, shall we?
...You're right.
(I scroll through the vacation itinerary Klukai created.)
(First, ride Klukai's motorcycle to the Green Zone, arriving just in time for a proper lunch at a pre-booked restaurant.)
I've heard of this restaurant. Must've been hard to get a reservation, right?
Luckily, booking a table there is a breeze for 404 if we desire.
After the meal is... a cafe? We have Springfield's coffee onboard the Elmo, is it really necessary?
It is.
...I mean, the cats in this cafe can help you relax.
And lastly, head to this powersports show to research the latest models of heavy motorcycles...
We can check out many of the latest models. Is the Commander interested?
...Isn't it a little late to ask me if I'm interested?
(Though, compared to her constant facade of a mature leader in everything, I find Klukai's overdue candid sharing of her interests much more comforting.)
...Then suppose it's to keep me company.
Time is ticking, Commander. It's time for us to move out.
No need to contemplate anything. Just follow me and relax.
Remember this day well... our first date since our reunion.
I will make the Commander experience the most unforgettable vacation ever.
(Klukai hands me the helmet she prepared, hops on the motorcycle, and gestures for me to sit in the back seat.)
(Without much hesitation, I follow Klukai onto the bike.)
Commander, hold me tight or you'll fall off.
(I slide my hand around Klukai's waist.)
...A little tighter.
(Klukai leans down, starts off. With the roar of the engine, the heavy motorcycle shoots out like a bullet.)
I never realized you acquired such a hobby.
Surprised? There was a time when 404 was left with just me and Mechty. It was easier to get around this way and I became used to it.
Besides... racing freely on the road like this, all the responsibilities and worries seem to be left behind for awhile. What do you think, Commander?
It's pretty nice.
(While I try to take in the landscape of the Yellow Zone, today's visibility is so low that I can't even see the road ahead.)
(At the same time, a powerful sandstorm, often recognized as the herald of a Collapse storm, relentlessly rushes by, its roar echoing behind my ears. I can't help feeling a sense of unease.)
...But I'm afraid our joyride will have to come to an end.
You don't like this, Commander?
I do, but the impending Collapse storm doesn't.
(I point to the darkening sky with gathering clouds in the distance. No doubt, a storm is brewing.)
...Of all times, it had to be now.
Relax, we're not out of luck. There's a ruin nearby we can use for temporary shelter.
I've sent you the coordinates. Let's go there.
Okay... hold on to me, it's going to be rough.
(Afternoon, Yellow Zone, coordinates SP734QE-H89YU1, unknown factory ruin.)
(Boof!)
(Another rock is mercilessly kicked into the wind—Klukai has almost"cleaned up" the ruin's entrance.)
Klukai, come take a break and sit down for a bit instead of just standing there and moping. Collapse storms are a common occurrence in contaminated zones, you'll get used to it.
(While clearly still upset, Klukai nonetheless walks back and takes a seat beside me.)

...The weather forecasts have become as reliable as the words of a certain commander. Instead of putting my faith in this kind of stuff, I might as well go ahead and flip a coin to decide our next step.
You're being a little dramatic, aren't you?
Thanks to this damn weather, all our plans for the day have fallen through.
On the bright side, I will remember this day fondly, just like you hoped.
Remembered as the worst dating experience ever?
Isn't that the worst possible outcome? ...In this case, I might as well erase this memory as quickly as possible.
It's not like that...
(At this point, I'm afraid there's nothing I can say to soothe the frustration of this elite Doll.)
Commander.
(After a brief silence, Klukai is the first to speak.)
Won't you... say something, Commander?
I'm used to the weather here. Collapse storms impact everyone who moves through the contaminated zones equally.
...I mean, we've got a lot of free time right now, don't you have anything that you'd like to tell me?
(Tell her something? Klukai seems to be asking this question a lot lately, under different contexts too...)
(Is she hoping that I can exhibit better decision-making skills? Indeed, most of our time together were spent on handling missions, it's only natural she's concerned with that.)
(But it's a rest day today... Even with the plans disrupted by the Collapse storm, I still want everyone to be a bit more relaxed.)
Hmm, this storm is probably going to last a couple more hours. We're not making it to satellite city at this rate. How about we figure out what we should do after the storm is over instead?
(For whatever reason, Klukai reveals an expression alien to her usual self. It's obvious to all that she's deeply unhappy.)
Mm.
(But in the end, she didn't say anything.)
(Evening, Yellow Zone, Elmo public area bar.)
I couldn't find you anywhere. Turns out you're holed up here drinking.
It's the new wine Mayling brought back.
Hmph... The Commander is still quite the popular one, not unlike back at Griffin.
Ugh, so, why're you looking for me? I believe all my tasks today should be done....
(Klukai's stern expression makes me want to pull out my terminal and check if I've missed a certain arrangement.)
Looks like I need to remind you that... since Mayling and Groza are back from the fieldwork, I won't be in charge of assisting you from tomorrow onwards.
...In other words, the reason I'm standing here isn't work.
Seems you can now take a breather.

(I glance at the liquor cabinet behind, select a couple flavors of juices from what's left, pour them into a shaker along with tonic water, add some salt and ice, then shake it even and finally pour it into a glass set it in front of Klukai.)
A non-alcoholic drink specially made for you, might be a little skimpy, but it's the best we can get here.
...Thank you, Commander.
I should be the one thanking you. It's been tough on you these days.
(I raise my glass and gently clink Klukai's. However, she only stares at me ponderously without raising her glass. This led me to set my glass down awkwardly as well.)
Is that all?
Commander, don't you have anything else to say?
(I should?)
(Klukai isn't the type who remains silent when they have something to say. What else could prompt her to enquire persistently...)
(I ponder for a moment, then comes up with an answer.)
Commander?
I see.
Klukai, you're suggesting that the Elmo and Squad 404 are now part of a cooperative partnership, not superiors and subordinates.
...And then?
So, supporting the Elmo and aiding me in my work these days were not part of your duties.
...I'm such a fool for expecting anything from you.
(Maybe due to my inability to come up with a clear resolution, Klukai's eyes immediately dull. She lets out a soft sigh, then playfully mocks herself, as if having an internal monologue.)
No need for you to worry about that, I'll make sure to compensate you accordingly.
Not only that, but since you've over-delivered on your duties, this payment will be nothing less than a fortune.
(Rather than the delighted face I was looking forward to seeing from Klukai, I'm faced with one that's seldom seen; one encompassing repressed frustration and bitterness.)
YOU REALLY DON'T HAVE A CLUE!
(Right now, even her voice is a few decibels above her usual.)
(She gulps down the drink, then slams the glass onto the tabletop.)
Klukai?
(Before I can even ask, she yanks me closer by the collar of my shirt.)
Since you keep playing dumb, Commander, don't blame me for being discourteous.
(Perhaps fueled by rage, Klukai's face suspiciously turns red.)
(Although the beverage was undoubtedly non-alcoholic, a tinge of sweet and sour, the telltale odor of alcohol, still lingers in the air.)
When have you ever been courteous...
Uhm, I mean, the kind of shrewdness that can be perceived at a glance is the most dangerous... Right, Klukai?
(While doing my best to verbally appease Klukai, I attempted to find a way for her to let go of her grip without angering her further.)
Even at this point, are you still avoiding me, Commander?
Do you think... I'd allow that to happen?!
(Her grip has become tighter! Almost twisting my collar 180 degrees!)
Are you really not going to explain yourself, Commander?
After all these years, you couldn't possibly have never received any of my messages, could you? I've tried to reach out to you so many times, why won't you answer me in any capacity?
(So, it was about that...)
Klukai, listen to me. I can explain... L-let go of me first.
I... No!
You didn't even bother to answer me once, not a single message! Why should I listen to you?!
(She pulls me a little closer again!)
(The distance between Klukai and myself shortens again, until a distance where even breathing felt intrusive.)
...Commander, why don't you say something?
Are you still playing dumb, even now? I'm right in front of you, asking you all these questions and you still won't answer a single word?
...What about "all I need is you"? Was that merely a ruse to fool me like a child all along?!
(Klukai is clearly in a terrible mood. With the way things are going, the reply needs to be weighed carefully so as not to anger her further.)
(While I was thinking of a response, Klukai keeps voicing her grievances continuously.)
It has been so hard to finally find you, I thought you finally needed me again.
But how did it turn out...?! On the E-Elmo ...with ALL these Dolls already?! It's so lively!
S-so you've just been recruiting new Dolls one after another, but never thought to bother with me?!
Not only that, but you also treated me like a complete outsider, going on and on about partnership and compensation and whatnot. When on earth did 404 ever charge you for anything?!
(Klukai's utterances grow more and more agitated, almost as if she's drunk.)
Had I known that you didn't intend to leave alone at all and still needed Doll's assistance.
I would've... I would've shown up ages ago to get you.
And what happened? Here I am, worried that the agreement and 404 would affect you negatively, like a total dork!
That agreement can't do shit to me!
And even now, you won't even give me an explanation—
(Klukai's voice halts abruptly and her pupils cease to focus gradually.)
...K-Klukai?
Hic—!
(Even louder, now accompanied by a strong odor of alcohol.)
(I quickly glance at the tabletop—the glass of non-alcoholic beverage that was supposedly consumed sits there full, making a mockery out of a certain someone's current embarrassing state.)
(And my glass filled with vodka...)
(Damn it, she downed it all!)
*Alert. Detecting Level II intrusion of multiple Dolls.*
(The warning rings up untimely, breaking the stalemate between me and Klukai.)
(Yet Klukai remains surprisingly calm.)
Intrusion?! Multiple Dolls at that?
*Identifying intruder... Confirmed... Tactical Doll, Klukai*
Klukai, are you accessing everyone's Level II?
Hehe... Today... I'll show the Commander... w-who's the Elmo's true...
*Please expedite response, several Dolls are facing forced shut down.*
Klukai, what are you doing in Level Il? Cut it out!
(However, focused on Level II, Klukai ignores my pleas.)
It's over! It's the end of the world—
(I vaguely overhear the mournful cries of Mechty in the distance.)
(—Five days ago)
Klukai, today's combat report have yet—
(Realizing I was calling out to her, Klukai immediately averts her eyes.)
...The report is in the ops room.
Is it? Well, we can go together...
I'll leave now.
(—Three days ago)
Klukai, there's combat training later today, do you...
...404's got our own group training, so I won't be here.
Huh? But Mechty's coming?
...I... I train by myself.
(Klukai interrupts my invitation with a stiff excuse and turns away just like that.)
For the second time... Is she avoiding me?
(—Yesterday)
(Ever since Klukai declined my invitation, I haven't seen her for the past two days.)
She's totally hiding from me...
Since I can't find her, maybe I should send her a message?
(I open my comm terminal and type a message to Klukai.)
(Morning, Yellow Zone, Elmo ops room)
*New message received*
(I open the comms interface, it's Klukai's reply.)
On our day off at 10 in the morning, I'll meet you at Elmo's exit ramp.
("Where are you?"—my message sent to her still hangs visibly above her reply, with date displayed as from a day earlier.)
(Anyway, it's a nice thing that she replied. After all, she's been avoiding me for a while now. I'm guessing it has something to do with that glass of vodka.)
Hold on, today...
Today's the rest day?!
(I glance at the clock, only ten minutes left before the promised meeting time.)
(Morning, Yellow zone, outside the Elmo.)
I didn't expect the Commander to actually see the message.
After all, it's quite difficult to see you nowadays and I still cherish that.
If possible, please let me know further in advance next time, okay?
...Hmph, it's difficult to see me?
Nothing changed for me compared to usual. It's you who didn't look hard enough.
Fine, I'm sure you didn't deliberately avoid me. And definitely not while drunk...
Commander!
(Klukai interrupts.)
...I have no idea where you're going with this, but I would advise against it, or else—
Or else?
Or else, I will... not be too happy about it. Which wouldn't spell good news for you.
Indeed, when you made a whole scene in Level II last time, you created the biggest breach of the Elmo in years.
That was an accident!
But, rather than mocking me with those words, let's get on the bike... Commander.
(Klukai seems unwilling to continue the conversation about the drunken episode and tosses me the same helmet I wore last time.)
Am I riding in the back seat today as well?
I won't be able to steer very well if you sit in the front.
...But I don't mind trying it if you insist.
Then forget it.
(Klukai gets on the motorcycle, closely followed by myself.)
Not bad. Looks like you've taken it upon yourself to hold on to me.
(Klukai appears somewhat content with the situation and just like that, she drives me around on the plains of the Yellow Zone for a while.)
(After an unknown period, Klukai finally pulls over to the side of the road.)
Get off.
Looks like today's date won't be in the Green Zone.
That date was indeed a shame...
However, I didn't say it's a date this time.
That aside, since you were the one who messaged me first, you must have something to say this time, Commander.
Seems like whether or not if it's going to be a date depends on what I have to say.
If that's how you interpret it, fine.
That's awkward, Klukai. I don't want give you the impression that I'm only saying this because I want to spend time in the Green Zone.
(A hint of anticipation appears on Klukai's face.)
No, as long as the Commander refrains from avoiding the obvious this time...
Don't worry. Actually, I wasn't trying to avoid it. I just couldn't figure out how to say it.
Klukai, I'm well past being a Griffin commander. Yet even as a bounty hunter, the circumstances I find myself in aren't much better.
I've always known that.
It's not just a question of the complex web of powers at play surrounding us, but I myself am subject to... many constraints and bindings, as you are aware.

So, even though the agreement does not ostensibly affect 404, I've always thought that for you, who are in perils of your own, establishing contact with the Elmo before the agreement is relaxed... or before the constraints on the Elmo are gone, would bring about even greater risks to you.
I know you're not afraid of any of that, but...
Are you worried I'll get in trouble if I come too close to you?
So to speak.
Commander, I've always respected your decisions. And I've always convinced myself with the thought that if you're not ready yet, then I won't bother you...
Ever since I became the leader of 404, I've often had no choice but to make compromises and changes. Of course, it's all for the sake of making 404 stronger and protect our companions.
I understand that... in this world, being strong and powerful is what gives you the right to make decisions.
But...
(Klukai ponders for a moment and looks at me solemnly.)
"Being safe" too, is something you can only feel assured of once it's firmly in your own hands.
I'm sure you understand that more than I do.
Since you get it, that makes everything easier.
But it's no longer just that, Commander.
I will always stand by Squad 404, but I'll never give up on you either and much less accept the fact that you've been trying to estrange yourself from me for reasons like this...
This is the path chosen by the new leader of Squad 404 and the elite Doll Klukai.
Squad 404—those who don't exist—have fought tooth and nail in the past just to survive and we are more than capable of doing it again.
Besides, you're going to help me, right?
(Wind ruffles Klukai's long hair. Behind her is the usual, dull brown sky of the Yellow Zone, with dark clouds capable of overwhelming everything.)
(Dust rises with the cold wind, as it has before countless other Collapse storms, rendering everything in the distance growing blurry.)
(But Klukai stands there, her silhouette unmistakably clear to me.)
...Looks like Klukai is still the same old Klukai and I was the one that got too sentimental.
(Seemingly satisfied with this answer, Klukai's face finally breaks into a smile.)
So, what's next on the schedule?
Is that even a question? Of course we're going to make up for the date we weren't able to go on last time. You're not going to shut me down now, are you, Commander?
Of course not.
Well, that concludes the chit-chat. We'll have to savor the rest of our time. Get on the bike.
(Riding Klukai's motorcycle now has become a breeze.)
(With the roar of the engine, Klukai once again takes me on a ride.)
(However...)
Ugh, sure enough, that weather change was indeed a prelude to a Collapse storm.
...Again?!
(Behind us, signs of the Collapse storm resurface.)

By the looks of things, we've got about five minutes before the storm reaches our current position. Should we find a place to take shelter? The nearest ruin we can hide in is only two kilometers away.
It's just a storm after all...
(Before I can finish, Klukai throttles up and, with no intention of changing direction, steers the motorcycle right along the heading of the Collapse storm.)
...Just to be clear, it's not that I don't trust you with the performance of your motorcycle, but... are you really trying to outrun a Collapse storm?
You've caught on pretty quickly this time.
No worries, I'm here to keep you safe. I promise... with all I've got.
No matter what kind of obstacles lie ahead, I will overcome them to prove to you...
I won't allow myself to separated from you again, Commander.
It seems you've finally realized who's the best choice for you. Come, Commander, take my hand and tell me that you need me by your side, eternally.
I will forever engrave this moment in my neural cloud to honor this once-in-a-lifetime victory...
Commander, have you noticed any changes in the ops room?
There's a mechanical black cat... it's hard not to notice. Unfortunately it doesn't move and it's just going to sit there and be looked at.
I've installed surveillance and explosives on it. If it detects any intent from the Commander to leave silently on their own again, the device will automatically activate the explosive.
I'm happy you brought me a gift, but I'd still consider this a serious threat...
Commander, I originally thought that after we reunited and came to understand each other, the restlessness and obsession in my heart might lessen a bit.
But in reality, it seems to be growing day by day in a bittersweet way...
Honestly, even though I understand your feelings and everything you've done, still...
