It might not work, but it's definitely worth a try.
(Qiongjiu mutters to herself as she drifts off into thought.)
(A moment later, her gemstone-like eyes seem to twinkle; it seems she has thought of something and is excited.)
...Did I give you some inspiration?
Yes. Thank you, Commander. I've figured out what I want.
As I thought, you do know me better than I know myself.
(Qiongjiu parts my shoulder in approval. Then, she seems to immediately realize that this is not a very dignified gesture and quickly resumes her prim demeanor.)
Ahem. Er, in any case, thank you for your gudiance, Commander. It was very helpful.
Now then, I must leave and take advantage of my vacation to figure out a repair plan for the item.
Wait a minute, then what about your shopping list?
It will be a backup plan, so please help me purchase the items! Thank you!
(After bidding me farewell again, Qiongjiu leaves with quick and light steps, as though she's been freed of some burden.)
(I look at the package that one of our partner brokers gave us, and it takes me while to remember that Qiongjiu asked me to buy these materials.)
(Since I'm free, I decide to go deliver them to her while I haven't forgotten.)
Qiongjiu? Are you there?
(The sign on Qiongjiu's door reads, "On break, welcome". I can vaguely hear the sounds of an opera from inside it.)
(I open the door, and a wave of unfiltered percussion music hits me. Qiongjiu seems immersed in her work and does not notice my intrusion.)
Hm... this feel... Should I polish it a little more?
Ah, Qiongjiu, your materials—
...Commander?
(Qiongjiu seems a little startled, but she quickly recovers and comes to meet me.)
Hm? Did I just see something on your desk fly into your toolbox? Is that okay?
Did you? You must have been imagining things. Commander, have you been feeling tired lately?
(Qiongjiu smiles calmly.)
I can't really say that...
(While I have my doubts, I can't even begin to find any flaws in Qiongjiu's attitude. All I can sense is my instincts telling me that something is off. Perhaps I really was imagining things.)
Oh yes, you've never properly seen my dorm room, have you? Would you like to view my collection with me?
Oh yeah, sure.
Over here, please, Commander.
I personally carved the "jade soldiers" at the head of my bed. The one with the best colors represents you, Commander, while Miss Helian and the rest of Frostfall are here too.
Hahaha, this Helian looks really lifelike. Did you carve her with those tools over there?
Yes. Those tools look like the kinds used to make precise mechanical prototypes, so it shouldn't come as a surprise to you, Commander.
Come, time for the tour of Qiongjiu's room, the next stop is my closet—
This is for tops, this is for half-dresses, this is for full dresses, and this is my accessory closet...

(The dresser isn't very big, but everything is neatly packed into its place, and the contrasting colors are not discordant. It's plain to see that whoever packed these was good at planning and tidiness. Come to think of it, Qiongjiu's work with jade is also very neat and clean.)
You're very good at packing, Qiongjiu. It must have been hard to tidy all of this up, no?

Hard? It's was alright. In the past, even when I found a piece of clothing, all I could do was resist the urge to buy it and think carefully before making a decision. After all, moving is difficult when you have too many possessions...
The fact that I can collect things that I like now without having to worry about such things makes me very happy.
And that's all thanks to you, Commander.
Ah, yes, I think I saw those famous "signal beacons" of yours just now!
Ah... I knew I should have put those in an opaque black box.

When Griffin picked itself up again, some people thought Dolls with horns or animal-ear accessories weren't too reliable. While they weren't purely decorative items, I decided to transfer their functions and then lock them up.
Helian felt that it was unnecessary, but it ended up being quite convenient for me instead.
(Indeed, Qiongjiu used to feel embarrassed about those ears. I guess she used that as an excuse to make her application?)

(After that, Qiongjiu eagerly drags me around her collection. Eventually, the only thing she hasn't introduced yet is the workspace she occupied at the very beginning, but Qiongjiu suddenly comes to a halt.)
Commander, your schedule indicates that you should be heading back to the ops room now.
While I would have liked to spend more time with you, the schedule must be obeyed. I will gladly continue showing you around the next time you visit.
(Just then, the loudspeakers begin broadcasting a warning about a bumpy road ahead. The room shakes, and several sheets of paper fly out from under the table and land at my feet.)
Pardon me, Commander.
(Qiongjiu bends down to pick up the paper, but I move before she does and help pick up some of them. Turns out they were blueprints for jade stonework.)
Are these... design documents for jade accessories?
(There is an almost imperceptible stiffness to Qiongjiu's smile. Clearly, the problem is with these blueprints.)

(I quickly page through Qiongjiu's blueprints, which show many signs of revision. Perhaps it's because everything else in those rooms is neat and organized, but this blueprint stands out quite a bit.)
I saw this when I came in just now, right? I knew I wasn't imagining things.
I guess even the great planner Qiongjiu has times when she wants to make big last-minute changes too?
(Qiongjiu's face goes pink, and she seems a little embarrassed. Then the blush fades from her cheeks, and she chuckles in resignation.)
You got me there.
I wanted to keep it a secret because it wasn't yet time to share it.
Is it related to me?
Since you've already seen it, I don't need to bother hiding it any further.
Commander, do you remember the broken jade bangle I showed you earlier? This is based on the idea of "preserving the bangle's break" which you mentioned before...

Back then, I did a lot of thinking after I returned to my room and decided to discard the original repair plan. Perhaps I wouldn't need to hide the break; instead, I would let it naturally face change, which would only deepen its history.
No wonder you didn't want to show it to me. After all, it's a piece of evidence that proves your "guilt".
Guilt?
(Qiongjiu seems a little surprised by my joke, but before I can explain, she smiles.)
It seems you've greatly misunderstood how I work, Commander.

Commander, I am not by any means an inflexible person. Making many detailed plans is all so I can better adapt to changing circumstances on the ground, if "changing plans" is a good thing, then what reason do I have not to do it?
...That's not what you said on your last mission.
It's true, I don't like deviating from the plan when I'm working.

Those plans are the most ideal solution I could find after collecting information from multiple fields. Their accuracy has been verified multiple times. Frequently deviating from them implies taking risks, which is bad for both the client and my comrades.
And besides...
What?
(There is a brief flicker of hesitation on Qiongjiu's face, and her blush from before returns.)
Under normal circumstances, I tend to avoid frequently changing my plans.

But... I wanted to do better because of your suggestion. Therefore, breaking with tradition and changing my plan in order to make it as good was worthwhile. Since it concerns your suggestion, then completely abandoning the previous design is not an inconceivable method.
Looks like you're very determined to make it work. How did you change it? May I see?
Right now? I apologize, Commander. Just as a project in progress cannot be casually shown off, a half-finished piece of jade work cannot be given a sloppy entrance.
However, you will be the first person to view it once it is complete.
As for today... Your schedule is calling.
H-hey, wait, quit pushing, I haven't given you your materials...
(Qiongjiu resolutely shoves me out of her dorm and closes the door.)
Commander, are you busy?
Qiongjiu? I'm on break now, please come in.
You've been cooped up in your room for a while now. How are things? Is the jade carving going well?
Yes, I just put the finishing touches on it.
I managed to realize my design thanks to you, Commander. I came to thank you.
You succeeded? Then may I see the result? I'm kind of curious.
Of course. In fact, the "result" is a token of my thanks to you.
The "rebirth" of the bangle went as well as it did, thanks to your suggestion...

(Qiongjiu takes out a gift box from behind her and offers it to me. It is wrapped in lovely brocade whose colors shift in the light as I turn it around. Considering even the packaging was handmade, it is a clear sign of how much thought she has put into this.)
May I open it now?
Of course. Earlier, I promised that you would be the first one to see it. If jade had a will of its own, I'm sure it would be honored if you were the first person it "saw".
(It is plain to see that the item within has great significance for Qiongjiu, and so I slowly and respectfully open the box.)
(Qiongjiu studies me, her lips pursed. There is a rare expression of nervousness on her face.)
So even someone as calm as you can get like this...
...Hm? Pardon me, did you say something? I was a little distracted just now.
No, nothing.

The box contains a crescent-shaped piece of jade, a delicate and intricately carved piece. I have never seen the designs on it before. They resemble branches whose leaves and fruits intertwine into a harmonious whole. It looks very auspicious to me.
It's lovely. What is this?
It's a pen rest. You should leave it on your desk. You can admire it or rest your pen on it, as the name suggests.
Well, it certainly looks unique. The resting surface isn't a perfectly smooth section. Rather, it looks like an uneven mountain range.
Wait a minute, the texture of this jade looks kind of familiar...
I finally realize something as I toy with the jade pen rest.
Did you modify this from that broken jade bangle?
It seems you've realized it at last.
I altered it from the larger half of the broken bangle. The "ridges" took a lot of effort so that I could both preserve the surface of the break and avoid it causing injury by being too sharp.
What about the other half of the bangle?
It's here. I turned it into a small hairpin, and I'm wearing it now.

(Qiongjiu turns and smooths out her cascade of raven hair. After some searching, I finally find the little ornament hidden in the depths of her locks. She quickly turns back around, seemingly a little embarrassed by it.)

Though the inconstancy of the world cannot be defied and both halves are now parted, they were once part of the same whole. When the time moment comes, the memories of when they were one will reawaken their hopes of joining with each other again. Surely that will bring them together? At least, that was what I thought.
It is precisely because that break is unique that they will join together flawlessly should they come together again. Like so...
(Qiongjiu has removed the hairpin at some point. Its sides have the same ridge pattern as the pen rest. She presses them together, and the halves meet flawlessly.)
Well done, Qiongjiu. Also, you designed the engravings yourself too, right? What kind of pattern is this?
Hmm, the design is related to my name. Want to take a guess, Commander?
She gave...
(Qiongjiu secretes the hairpin back into her hair and looks expectantly at me.)
Hmm, if it's related to your name, then... a quince?
Yes. I consulted the leaves of Chinese quince branches and leaves to make these floral designs.

She gave a quince to me, I paid her back in jade. My name Qiongjiu means "jade", which means it is easily associated with quinces, don't you think? So I hope this "quince" can keep you company, just like how I hope to be able to be as close to you as possible.
So you want to stay in the ops room then, Miss Jade?
Can I? ...No, even if you allowed it, I wouldn't allow myself to be ruled by my selfish desires.
When I was No. 9, I could do as I wished, like a smiling, proud wanderer. But now, as Qiongjiu, I must bear new responsibilities. I wish to protect you and everyone in Griffin, Commander.
In order to gain the resources to protect everyone, I can't possibly plaster myself to your side all the time now, can I? I need to go out and complete missions and push myself further.
Mm. Many things would not be able to progress if I kept you, and just as many people would come to "settle things" with me.
Commander, you don't have to make that face.

I don't find these new responsibilities tiresome or annoying. I do enjoy being useful and spreading the reputation of Qiongjiu and Frostfall Squad in the new Griffin. As for your attention and companionship, I am content to let this little "quince" enjoy them on my behalf.
I am in awe of your sense of responsibility.
Alright, I will cherish it like I do you. "Repayment it can't be, but as a sign of love it won't fade."
In that case, both this "quince" and this Qiongjiu will be counting on you from now on.
(Qiongjiu bows deeply to me before straightening up again.)
(The evening mist filters in through the window, haloing her face in faint pink light, making her sparkle like a translucent gem.)
I rarely change my plans, but you're always able to sway my heart.
Still, I am very confident about this upcoming plan. This time, I'm certain even you will not be able to change my mind.
Because the only ironclad principle in the plan for Qiongjiu and the Commander going forward is "it won't fade".
Qiongjiu, I suddenly remembered that I never handed you the materials to repair the jade that I bought for you the last time.
Commander, you're here just in time. I just so happen to have a jade item that needs care.
Oh dear. Has another precious treasure met with a terrible fate?

The circumstances aren't the same as before. This time, it is minor damage from accumulated wear. As for the circumstances... goodness, it's as embarrassing as cutting my neural cloud and laying it bare before you, Commander.

My hairpin comes from the same source as your pen rest, so I wear it all the time. I've been out on missions recently, and whenever my thoughts for you grow too much to bear, I take it off and rub it. Sometimes, I imagine I can scent you through it.
Over time, it began wearing the ornament down, and if I leave it be, the ridges may not match those of the pen rest.
Ah... so Dolls can experience separation anxiety too?
Separation anxiety? That's not like me at all. It's not so bad, is it?

Still, parting is, as the saying goes, sweet sorrow. It starts when you leave the other person, but when it ends is unclear. Even when you're standing before me right now, my longing for you does not diminish in the least. Is it because I'm still not satisfied with how close we are now?

I want to be closer to you, Commander. I want to occupy more of your time and your attention. Am I being too greedy? I don't hate it, though. Rather, I want to encourage such feelings to grow with each passing day.
Commander, may I allow myself to indulge in such feelings? Or perhaps I should accept some kind of constraint to my emotional modules so I only think of you like this when I'm drawing up plans?
Can I really do this, as I am now? The success rate of planning my thoughts like this... Well, it does seem a little distressing.
<size=32>Bow-wow!</size>
Hm? What is that...
Papasha?
(I knock on the door to Papasha's dorm room, but there is no response. I gently push the door open and enter.)
Ah! It's the Commander...
I'm sorry that I didn't notice you... Is there anything you would like me to help you with?
Nope, I'm just coming in to have a look.
Where did this Super Dinergate come from?
(A Super Dinergate crouches near Papasha's feet, looking at me innocently with its head raised.)
(Did that make the sound I heard just now?)
Heheh, Comrade Ksenia gifted it to me after I helped her out.
I wanted to have it help everyone, but after asking around, it seems that people don't really need a Dinergate that only has the capability of transporting things around...
So I was thinking, maybe we can make it into a pet with a bit of modification so that it can bring joy to the others when they aren't away at work.
Mechanical pets seemed to be quite trendy at the satellite city I worked at before.
That's a good idea. However, wouldn't a Super Dinergate lack affection as a pet since it wasn't designed to mimic animals?
And that's what I'm working on here, Commander! I'm trying my best to learn about animal behaviors so that I can modify it to be livelier, just like a real pet dog!
Ah, speaking of which, it's good that you're here, Commander! Could you help me think up a few scenarios in which the Super Dinergate can help us emotionally?
Sure, let me think...
Here's one. Maybe it can help when people are tired after coming back from a battle?
So the scenario where "It sees its master coming back from outside"... Let me think...

According to info, a real pet sees the return of its master as them returning from a hunt. So, they would often wait at the door to await their master's safe return. Once the master is back, they would circle around them to confirm their safety and welcome them back passionately...
So the Super Dinergate should wait at the door before people return, then circle around everyone while wagging its tail once they are back?
Oh. It does feel good when something is waiting for me to come back.
It would be even better if it was equipped with the ability to express emotions through sound.
As expected, you always manage to think of the details I would miss out on, Commander.
The Commander hopes to have someone waiting at the door for them, be sure to note when they go out and when to welcome them back at the door.
Express emotions through sound...
All right, I have that down. I'll make sure to implement your idea!
The way you wrote that down makes it look really weird...
Eh? Really? But I was just noting down the things that would help satisfy the Commander.
Anyway, one scenario is not enough to work with. Could you think up another one, Commander?
Hmm. Since we want the Super Dinergate to accompany us when we are not out at work...
Then, how about a scenario when I'm not busy and kind of bored aboard the Elmo?
Eh? Does that happen at all? My database has no record of any instance like that...
I... It's alright, I'll think of something!
No need to be so nervous, there's no standard answer in the first place.
When you're bored, everything becomes fun when you're with someone.
Ah, so the Commander needs companionship?

Let me check some info... When a pet accompanies its master, it often likes to express its affection through skinship. Sometimes, it also invites its master to play, and sometimes it does nothing but sit on its master or by their side.
How about we have the Super Dinergate try to play with us when we're bored? Playing ball, frisbee, and running around seem to be some way in which pets play with their masters.
Indeed, playing with the Super Dinergate would be a way to pass some time and a good way to get some exercise in as well.
Very well, heheh.
Ah—I should write this down too. When the Commander is bored, provide skinship or play with the Commander. Oh! Papasha can do that too!
Looks like I have much to learn... The two scenarios that Commander mentioned are probably the most common ones, so I'll continue to study up in this direction.
Thank you for helping me, Commander!
Don't mention it.
I do have a question though. If this Super Dinergate is a gift, why are you sharing it with everyone instead of keeping it to yourself?
About that, um, it's quite embarassing...
I keep saying that I'll protect everyone, but I'm an old model, so I can't help much in battle... But even so, there's another way for me to protect everyone, right?
So I thought, I'll help others with empathy and assist them in fulfilling their wishes as we go through daily life. Making everyone happy is also a way for me to protect them, right?
With that said, what are your wishes, Commander? You are the most important person to me... I'll definitely be able to fulfill your wishes!
Uhh... I can't think of anything if you suddenly ask me like that.
But it's great to hear that. I'll tell you in the future once I think of something.
I'll be waiting for you to tell me then, Commander.
(Things have been busy lately, so I've been trapped in the ops room more often.)

(However—A familiar figure keeps appearing within my peripheral vision. Sometimes it comes in but exits the ops room right away, and sometimes it fiddles with a console in the room, with its eyes observing me.)
(After her 3■th time entering the ops room, I lifted my head and called out to her.)
Papasha, is there something you need?
Ah! I... I wanted to ask, have you thought of it yet?
What?
Sorry, I've been busy lately... Have I forgotten something?
Sometime ago, I asked about your wishes...
Did you manage to think about it? Do you have a wish that you'd like me to help fulfill now?
Ah, about that... For now I—
It's fine if you have lots of wishes! I'll make all of them come true, no matter how big or small, no matter how many of them you have!
Commander, if you're getting overwhelmed by work, would you like me to help you out? For example, any files you need help with or machines that need repairing?

Let me think... We do need to do business with Poludnitsa, but I'm afraid you can't win against her...|As for files, probably best if I dealt with them myself... Machines... I don't think Mayling mentioned any that need repairs...
I'm sorry, Papasha. There's nothing here for you to help with at the moment.|If you're free, why not have a break in your room? Leisure time is precious, you know.
Is that so... I didn't manage to help the Commander today either...
Is it because I'm an old model lacking ability, so the Commander does not feel comfortable letting me help?
(Without waiting for my explanation, the downtrodden Papasha slaps both hands on her cheeks before puffing out her chest.)
No, no. What am I saying?! The Commander doesn't think this way!

Even a Doll like me is capable of doing something useful. Although I could not help with the things mentioned just now, I still want to help take the pressure off your shoulders... Please tell me what to do! I can do anything from serving you tea and water to running errands and transporting items around!
(Since she has put it like that already, it would be heartless of me to continue rejecting her help.)
(But what can I get her to help me? Think, think...)
Oh, right. It's been... some time since the ops room was last tidied up. Could you help clean up this place a little, Papasha?
Clean the ops room? Papasha has received the instruction! Your wish shall be fulfilled!
However, the cleaning might interfere with your work, Commander. Could you leave for a little while? I'll call you back once I've finished cleaning up.
Sure. It just so happens that I need to take stock at the storeroom and sort out an order to be sent to Poludnitsa.
(A smile has appeared on Papasha's face ever since I said the words "clean up this place".)
(I leave the ops room without worry.)
(Three hours later, the sky has already turned completely dark. I receive a message from Papasha.)
(Commander, I have finished cleaning the ops room, please feel free to come over for inspection at any time!)
Okay, I'll head right over.
(I return to the ops room quickly. Unusually bright moonlight shines on my body the moment I push the door aside.)
(My gaze moves over to the glass windows surrounding the ops room. I notice that the unchanging scenery of the Yellow Zones now looked slightly different than before.)
Have you finished your work for today, Commander?
(Papasha comes over from the other side of the room, a long-handled mop still held in her hand.)
Sadly no... You cleaned the windows, Papasha?
Yes! Allow me to report on the situation—
The clean-up took about 2 hours and 45 minutes. I used cleaners with active ingredients on all the objects in the ops room, with a focus on cleaning the windows and the area around the Commander.

I think that although we mainly rely on radar as the way to determine our surroundings, it would still be good if more light shone in and we had a clearer view of the scenery. Since the Commander keeps on working here for long periods at a time, this would help make things more comfortable, right?
I also found information stating that when humans look into the distance, their eyes are relieved of strain and they feel more relaxed.

As for the area around the Commander, other than cleaning it up, I also adjusted the angle and height of the seating, allowing it to fit more ergonomically to your seating posture. I also made a new cushion for the back. I wonder if this will help reduce fatigue buildup.
Please inform me if there is more that you need me to do!
No... You've done perfectly already.
The windows of the Elmo... We clean it rarely because we are hit by Collapse storms all the time, so this is the first time I see moonlight shine through so well.
If the Commander likes it, I'll clean it regularly in the future!
That would be a big burden on you...
It's alright. Honestly, so long as this brings you happiness, I'm willing to clean it again right away, even if the windows are covered in sand the very next second.

By the way, there are quite a number of places that the cleaning bot overlooked. I think that this is because there are gaps within its dust detection logic and analysis of areas it needs to clean. The Commander's working environment should be kept clean.
Hence I went ahead and optimized the bot's logic, so it shouldn't overlook places that it needs to clean again.
In addition, I found that some of the equipment in the ops room has been used for a long time, and damage has accumulated in them. It would be bad if they affected the Commander's work.
I've compiled a report based on what we need to refurbish and sent it to you and Comrade Mayling, but I'll remind Comrade Mayling to take care of it if you are not free to deal with it!
That's all. Did I manage to help you out today, Commander? Would you like to inspect my work?
No need... I'm starting to feel guilty already.
I tasked you to tidy up the place a little, but you went above and beyond my expectations.
Thank you, Papasha.
Heheh, I did say that I'll make your wishes come true. I'll take them seriously, no matter how big or small, no matter how many wishes you have.
(Ever since Papasha cleaned up the ops room, I've been able to work more efficiently because of the better working environment.)
(But with work came fatigue, with soreness getting worse by the day.)
Can't finish this yet... Nevermind, I'll take a break first.
Ow-ow-ow...
(I get up to move my neck and shoulders. My stiff muscles felt overstimulated, protesting with pain.)
(A figure appears behind me.)
Are you okay, Commander?
If you keep on accumulating muscle fatigue by working long hours without physical activity, you're likely to get hurt. Please take care of yourself, Commander.
Would you like a massage to help you relax?
You can perform a massage?
How did you know I needed... Did you—
I–I admit it! I've been peeking at you again... But I made sure I didn't delay any work, I'm just coming over in my free time...

For the past few days, I've been noticing that you keep sitting in one posture for a long time, making you uncomfortable.|So I thought, maybe I could help the Commander relieve some fatigue? This was why I went to learn up some massage techniques.
Ah, don't worry! I did not delay work in order to learn them!
Please allow me to give you a massage if you're okay with it!
Since you've said all that, please do.
(I sit down again. Papasha puts her hands on my shoulders.)
(Her serious expression makes her look as if she was going into battle, but her massage is gentle.)
How does it feel, Commander? Do you feel somewhat more relaxed?

Are there other places you need me to massage other than your neck and shoulders? Your back? Your waist? I learned that if you sit down for a long time, the blood circulation in your lower limbs will be affected. Have your legs been swelling up?
Not yet.
But perhaps you can put more strength into the massage. It will help make it more effective.
Is that so? I've looked up lots of material lately, but this is my first time doing it, so I'm worried that I can't control my strength well and hurt you... I'll try using more strength then!
(Hissing in pain)
Oh!
I'm so sorry! Did I hurt you, Commander?
Might just be some really stiff muscles. I can... handle it.
It's fine, you can continue.

Sorry Commander, I was careless. I only knew some rough knowledge on the subject and had no practice before I asked if I could help you relieve some fatigue. I made you feel even worse... If I continued now, I'm afraid I'm not helping you at all.
Could you please wait a while while I go off to practice my techniques before we continue?
There's no need... this feels pretty good already. Don't be so hard on yourself, Papasha.
I... I'm just worried that my actions will be a burden on you.

Actually, before I came aboard the Elmo, something similar... happened.|Because I wanted to wait for you to return to Griffin, I took too long to write my application, causing me to miss the submission deadline. I could only accept my assignment to a security patrol in Romny...
Ah, I'm not saying that I was unhappy with being reassigned! Just that, because I was so eager to do well in my work, in the end I... I... (Sigh)
(Papasha's hands droop. Her always-positive yet serious face becomes dejected.)
Things ended badly?
Yeah. It ended badly.

Although the manager assigned us an unreasonable amount of work, I thought that things would be fine as long as I did my part. So, I took work seriously but neglected knowing how much my companions would take... causing one of them to perish in work.
Although I tried to save her right away, her body was damaged too badly, so she was disposed of and recycled by the manager.
Originally, I thought that she would return to our team quickly because "City construction needs us, all our work goes towards making Romny a better place"...
I kept believing in this, hoping to contribute my ability to the growth of that city.
It's not wrong to be passionate about your job. What happened to your Doll teammate afterwards?

She was disposed of.|Because her body was too heavily damaged, the repair fee was too high, meaning the cost-to-benefit ratio was low. However, they could recover some of their losses by selling her parts.
As for me and the other remaining team members, we were soon sent out to eliminate smugglers, and once again we... took heavy losses.

Really, our capabilities, weapons, and equipment were not at a level where we could deal with those smugglers at all...|But at that time, I thought that this was just what security patrol members needed to do—try their best to overcome adversity.
Don't force yourself to think about such past memories if you feel uncomfortable.
I'm not feeling uncomfortable, just confused.

Even though we succeeded in each and every mission and did our best to protect Romny, that satellite city did not escape the fate of being merged. Our efforts brought us only the fate of being recycled and disposed of.
That was when I started to question myself. Did my efforts, in reality, make myself a burden to others? Could it be that the more I want to do something well, the more likely I am to fumble it?
There's no such thing happening. I mean, my shoulders feel way better now.
(I move my shoulders around to show Papasha.)
See? My shoulders are more relaxed now, and my stiff neck has gotten some relief.
Papasha managed to relieve my fatigue effectively on her first try. Your efforts have reached me.
R–really? Is this enough?
But I haven't... I–I just...
Don't doubt yourself. There are many factors affecting the success and failure of anything, but if anything fails, it's never because you hoped too much for success.
(I pat Papasha on the head. Only then does she start to look up and give me a smile.)
You are already doing very well, Papasha. If you do want to hear advice, I hope that you can use your care for others on yourself once in a while, Papasha. That would make things better.
Commander, you mean, I should... think more about taking care of myself?
I... can't think of anything at the moment... but since it's a request from the Commander, I'll do my best to think about it!
Papasha? How are you doing? Are you alright?
Ah, Commander! I—Ow!
No need to get up. Have a good rest if you are hurt.
(I walk into her dorm, and Papasha quickly gets down from bed, trying to give me a welcome. However, she almost could not keep her balance, causing her to fall back on to bed.)
(A few hours ago, Papasha was hurt in combat protecting her team, causing her return to the Elmo.)
Sorry, Commander, I made you worry...
This won't delay my work! Comrade Mayling has repaired my body, so there shouldn't be any big problems.
If you retreated in time and let your teammates hold off the enemies instead of pushing yourself past your limit, I wouldn't need to worry about you now.
Papasha, can you remember to protect yourself before you protect others?
...So this is what the Commander thinks on the matter?

Commander, I thought about your words "think more about taking care of myself" for a long time after the last time we talked about it.|It is true that I am used to putting everyone else first, but this is not just because of my beliefs but also because I want to make myself look more useful. This way, even though I am not a high-performance model, I can still remain by your side...
So, in truth, what I want to do, what my wish is... is to be with you, to protect you, and make you happy.

To bring you glory through victory in battle, to protect you in life by reducing your burden.|This is what I think. So in the battle not long ago, I was just trying my best to secure a chance of victory for the Commander... After all, this is also a way for me to fulfill my own wishes.
Maybe it's because I'm stupid, so I can only think of doing it this way... I'm sorry to have disappointed you...
(Sigh) I never meant to blame you.

It's great that you took my words seriously, but... satisfying me can't be considered as fulfilling your wishes.|A wish must come from a place of thinking about yourself for yourself. I would like to know, do you have anything that you wish to do just for yourself?
Eh? But this is really my...
(Papasha swallows the second half of her sentence, looking perplexed but still thinking hard while keeping silent.)
My wish...
(Papasha mumbles. I drag a chair over and sit down on it in front of her.)
Just like how you kept asking me. Likewise, do you have something you would like me to do for you, Papasha?
It does not have to be complex. Just a wish that comes from your heart.
I...I... If that's how you put it, I... do have something...
Commander, I know that my body was repaired, but could you... I mean, could you check my body one more time to see if it is functioning properly?
(Papasha lowers her head, seemingly embarrassed thinking that she is making trouble for me.)
...Is that all?
Yeah! If I want to protect myself, it is important to confirm the status of my body first, right? I'll feel quite reassured if you're the one inspecting it, Commander.
Back then in Romny, we had a lack of resources, so we could only perform maintenance ourselves during the short breaks between work. There was no comprehensive maintenance performed at all...

That was when I would keep reminiscing on my days in Griffin, especially back when you were still around. You would always check on us in a timely manner. "If only the Commander was still around... when will I ever see you again?" I couldn't help but think like this every day.
I'm happy that those days are no more. And now I have reunited with the Commander. So, could you please check on how well my body was repaired?
Ah... It's okay if you're too busy to do it. I–I can...
I finally managed to make you think up a "wish" of your own. If I reject you now, won't I be letting you down?
Anyway, this won't take too much time. Send over a copy of Mayling's maintenance checklist, I'll make sure to check each line carefully.
Heheh, I'll leave it to you, Commander!
Still, it really is difficult to come up with a wish. So this is why the Commander had to think for so long to even come up with getting me to tidy up the ops room.

If I continue to focus on thinking for myself, I might have more and more wishes like this, and at that point, the Commander... Ah, no, no, no! The Commander is busy, so I shouldn't take too much of your time! I—
(Papasha is suddenly quiet. The anxiousness in her eyes fades away in silence, turning into shy anticipation.)
(She picks up the terminal next to her bed, containing Mayling's maintenance report on her. It detailed the parts repaired and recovery status.)
Just this time, I'll be a bother for you, Commander.
Commander, the one who shares the same beliefs as I, the one who can make me swear to protect them till the end... That is you, Commander, I'm so happy to know that.
From now on, please allow me to continue being by your side to keep bringing you glory.|This... is my wish, Commander. Could you help me make it come true?
Commander, I... I would like to request a memory expansion...
Sure. Were you affected in combat?
Not at all! It's just that... I–I keep thinking about you no matter what I'm doing...
When I'm at rest... I think about whether the Commander needs some relaxation too.|When I'm at work... I think about whether the Commander needs my help.
The thoughts about you are filling up my neural cloud, causing some parts to run too fast, and causing my body to feel hot as well.
I understand that I'm an old Doll with average capabilities... It's all thanks to the Commander that I can keep on shining.

But the more I go on, the more I feel like I am not good enough to repay the Commander. What should I do? Would the Commander think I'm weird for having these thoughts? Will I never be useful again if there comes a day where my model becomes completely obselete?
Impossible, you really think too much.
Indeed. I know that you're not that kind of person, but... I still worry about it.
I wish to keep you company for longer, not only in life but also in battle.|I want to be a useful gun in your hands, for you to give me orders without a single thought of worry in your mind.

In any case, my will to protect you is unmovable!|Even if my model is old, even if... even if my body degrades and can no longer fight in battle like our comrades, so long as my neural cloud still exists, even as a single fragment... I... I'll still...
I will still give my all to you, to dedicate myself to you without reservation.|It is my unshakable honor to keep following your orders.
(Rare, good weather today. I lazily stretch my back while walking through the corridor, where the sound from the training room attracted my attention—)
Hmm... begin...!
(I walk into the training room out of curiosity, and see a green-black shadow tussling with a training bot.)
(No, this cannot be called "tussling". This looks more like a one-sided "stranglehold".)

(After dodging an attack from a mechanical arm, the green-black shadow zips around to the back of the training not, breaking its attack with a flying kick. It then swiftly closes in before taking down the bot, ending the fight neatly.)
...Finished.
Amazing.
(I can't help but clap for her.)
(Hearing my clapping, Zhaohui lets go of the disabled bot and stands up.)
What have you come here for, Commander?
I have some free time, so I'm walking around the Elmo and happened to come across your exciting performance.
You're too kind with the praise, Commander. It's just my daily training. In fact, I'm kind of worried if I beat it up too hard.
If the training bot is that weak, the Elmo's repair bill would stretch all around the Green Zones.
(Zhaohui walks towards me as if something came to mind)
Speaking of which... I have a suggestion since you are free at the moment.
Commander—how about a spar with me?
Eh?
I've wanted to have a sparring match with you ever since I saw your moves, Commander.
After all, things get interesting when you fight an expert.
(Zhaohui looks towards me, her calm expression hiding subtle anticipation.)
Sure... It's a rare opportunity, so I'll take this chance to exercise a little.
Ha!
(A green-black bracer carries a punch directed at me. I sidestep to dodge it and retaliate with an equally ferocious punch.)
(Zhaohui does not dodge out of the way. She blocks my attack with one hand while attacking my shoulder with another.)
(Detecting the amount of force in her palm, I return the attack and break away from Zhaohui, keeping at a distance carefully.)
(Realizing that I saw through her actions, Zhaohui lets out a small chuckle.)
Good moves, Commander.
Hah... You're not bad too.
If so... On your guard, Commander!

(Zhaohui charges once again, confronting me with a flurry of rapid punches and kicks. Not wanting to contend with her attack for long, I observe Zhaohui's movements carefully, waiting for a moment of weakness.)
(Finally, during a counterattack, I use the chance to swing a fist at her—)
(Thud!)

(Zhaohui raises her arm to block my fist, but with the "thud" came a faintly visible crack that emanates throughout her bracer. The pitch-black shell breaks open in two, falling to the ground with a "crack".)
Um... Sorry, it seems like I've used too much strength...
(Zhaohui bends over to collect the split bracer, shaking her head.)
No need to worry, Commander. I've been using this bracer for a long time, it's time I changed it.
Rather, I should be thanking you for helping me find flaws like this in a spar. It would be pretty bad if it broke in actual battle.
(After setting the bracer aside, Zhaohui re-wraps her arm with bindings.)
(It was at this moment that I noticed it. When the bracer fell, her bindings came loose as well, allowing me to see the grisly scars on her arm through gaps in her bindings.)
(—That scar seemed to exist before she came aboard the Elmo. Did she not get it fixed yet?)
...Zhaohui, there's something I'd like to ask you about.
What's the situation with the injuries on your arm? Why was it never fixed up?
(Zhaohui stops wrapping her bindings. She does not say a word but pinches and fiddles with the bindings while deep in thought.)
(...Does she not want to answer yet?)
(After a moment of deliberation, I try to give her a relaxed smile.)
It's fine, I was just asking.
It's easy enough to get repairs done anytime on the Elmo anyway. If it's too hard to fix, changing to a new body will also help solve the issue with your expression module.
(Zhaohui turns towards me with one corner of her mouth slightly upturned.)

...I apologise. I understand that you come from a place of good intentions, and I do wish to be as frank as possible with you, Commander. It's just that... I still can't face this matter in a calm manner.
Mm. That's alright. I understand.
Thank you, Commander. It was good to spar with you today.
Um... since we are on the subject, I found something out during our match just now—
Oh?
You're always able to catch any mistakes I make, Commander.
Not only in the past but also in the present day. You were also able to find the secret I've hidden so well, Commander.
So, from now on, can I invite you over for a spar in the future again, Commander?
Of course.
(In an ornate yet elegant banquet hall, a number of people mingle with each other with wine glasses in hand.)
(Zhaohui is disguised with a bit of foundation, holding a glass of champagne in her hand while standing quietly in a corner about five meters away from me.)
(I turn on my mini communicator and speak in a hushed voice.)
Sorry... to have made you carry out this mission, you do stand out too much.
I'm most suited for this mission due to my understanding of artworks, Commander. Even in the past, I...
In the past?
(Zhaohui raises her glass gently.)
Target spotted, Commander.
(Following Zhaohui's gesture with my eyes, I spot our mission target, "Allie Brandon", an art dealer.)

(According to rumors, this dealer replaces genuine works with forgeries during art transactions. Due to the secrecy surrounding the transactions, the deceived buyers find it inconvenient to publicly confront the matter, meaning they can only suffer in silence.)
(Zhaohui and I are on a mission to secretly find out the authenticity of the art being dealed here on the request of a client.)
(After a moment, the dealer finishes speaking with the circle of people surrounding her. I nod at Zhaohui.)
(Zhaohui walks up to the lady.)
Miss Brandon, might you be interested in ancient works made of colored glaze?
(A few minutes later, the young lady talking to Zhaohui breaks into a smile.)
(Zhaohui lifts her glass toward her with one hand while making a fist with the other at her back.)
(That is the exact agreed-on gesture for us to signify successful acquisition of information.)
(Zhaohui quickly thanks the lady, but as she tried to leave, another lavishly dressed lady stepped in rapidly to embrace the art dealer in a passionate hug.)
Hey, Allie—
Carmilla? Why are you here?
Heheh, I came here on recommendation from a friend. What, am I not welcome? Afraid that I'll steal business from under your nose?
(The lady named "Carmila" made a glance at Zhaohui, an elegant yet polite smile appearing on her face.)
Hmm... guess that this is a new customer of yours?
Please excuse me for that display. My name is Deryn Carmilla, an old friend of Brandon. Have I interrupted a discussion?
...Of course not. I happen to have finished my discussion with Miss Brandon, so please feel free to talk to her.
(For some reason, Zhaohui's voice from my earphones came across as rather stiff-sounding. Or was I just hearing things?)
(...Nevermind. I'll ask her about it later.)
(Zhaohui performs a subtle bow at the two before turning to leave. Suddenly, a commotion spreads throughout the hall, and a snow-white figure rushes past my legs—)
Woof! Woof woof!
Watch out, Miss!
Aahhh...!
(A waiter loses balance after a collision with the puppy. The champagne flies out of the waiter's tray and onto Zhaohui—)

(Zhaohui evades, but the champagne still manages to splash onto half of her body, wetting her sleeves. The champagne runs down her arm, exposing the scars and circuitry once meticulously covered by foundation.)
This is bad...!
I'm so sorry, Miss!
It's alright.
(The waiter frantically bows without stopping. Just as Zhaohui lightly shakes her head and turns to leave, the lavishly dressed lady grabs her hand.)
Hmm... What's this?
...Apologies, Miss, this is unrelated to you.
Oh, really? Unrelated to me? I don't think so.
(The lavishly dressed lady carefully looks Zhaohui over.)
I did think you looked familiar... weren't you a Doll bodyguard previously in my employ? What were you called... CS... LS06?
What, did I hit the mark?
It's unbelievable... that you're still running around in one piece.

You were making some pretty grand statements, something like "I'll never do that for you again". In order to leave, you stirred up quite a fuss and even messed up your hand and face in the process. And here I thought you really hated this field of business...
But now, you're going back to your roots, I see. Even though you changed your profession, I guess a rat will always be a rat.
Enough! I'm not—
(Allie Brandon interrupts Zhaohui's retort.)
(She grabs Carmilla by the arm, then signals a few men in black suits over with a wave of her hand.)
Carmilla, I must admit that I am somewhat curious about your dealings with this little rat, but I do prefer for you alone to tell me stories of the past.
Okay, I'll listen—Ah!
Let go!
(Zhaohui ruthlessly flings Carmilla away, but the bodyguards are already closing in like a swarm.)
Don't just stand around, get her!
(Zhaohui has no choice but to fight.)
(Surrounded by numerous opponents and obstructed by furniture all around, Zhaohui remains undefeated but cannot find an opening to break through the blockade.)
(...We must not dally here much longer.)
(I observe my surroundings, moving in towards the crowd while trying not to draw attention.)
(There's only one bodyguard behind Allie Brandon. Perhaps I can use that to create an opening.)
Zhaohui, remain calm. Attention to 2 o'clock in 30 seconds!
(30 seconds later.)
(After kicking away the hunting knife used by a bodyguard in a stabbing attempt and throwing another bodyguard over my shoulder, I press the muzzle against Allie Brandon's waist.)
My apologies, Miss. Please listen to my orders for now.
...Hmph.
(The bodyguards stop after seeing their employer being held hostage. Zhaohui sees a temporary opening right in front of her.)
Go!
(Zhaohui breaks through the crowd the moment I shout.)
(I push away Allie Brandone, link up with Zhaohui, and push back the bodyguards before sprinting to the main entrance with her.)
(We finally manage to shake off our pursuers on the car and return to our staging area.)
(Right after I enter for a rest, Zhaohui grabs my hand.)
Commander, your hand...!
(I finally notice an injury—a streak of red running down the back of my right hand.)
(Wait... When did I get hurt? Can't remember. Maybe it was the bodyguard's hunting knife, or it happened when we broke through the blockade.)
(I was still in thought when Zhaohui came over with bandages and medicine, hurriedly bandaging my injuries.)
(The white bandages wrap around my hand bit by bit, but red still seeps through, staining the gauze.)
Commander...
(Zhaohui holds my hand in hers, her head deeply lowered.)
...It's all my fault. You were hurt because I was surrounded.
This is nothing... Just a scratch, which I didn't even notice.
As for you, Zhaohui, the bodyguards really didn't hold back. How is your frame doing, and are you alright?
I'm fine, thanks to your help in finding me an opening, Commander.
(Zhaohui lifts her head and looks at me, her eyes full of apologetic guilt and worry.)
(I gently pat her on the shoulders the best I can.)
In any case, lets get a proper repair done once we return to the Elmo.
Um... Zhaohui, was the dealer you met today... someone you know?
Sorry, I...
(Zhaohui lowers her head, covering the scars on her hand.)
(She finally raises her head after a long period of silence.)
Commander, you were hurt because of me today, and I am really sorry to have let it happen. However, I'm still unable to make a decision now.
Commander... Could you please give me a few days?
This is about the past... I'll explain it all to you once I'm ready.
(Zhaohui looks at me, her apologetic eyes bright and firm.)
(I nod.)
Alright.
(It's a rare opportunity to finish work early. I lean against the back of the commander's chair on the Elmo and close my eyes for a bit of rest.)
(Undisturbed in the quietness of night, I quickly fall asleep.)
...? Why... does my hand... feel itchy...
(I lift my hand. No abormality sensed. However, the itch starts again once I put down my hand.)
(Slowly opening my eyes, I see a green-black shadow standing by my side, gently caressing the wounds on the back of my hand wrapped in bandages.)
...Hmm? Zhao...hui?
(The green-black shadow pulls back her hand immediately.)
Ahem, Commander. I–I'm here to check on the status of your injury.
I'm relieved that your wound is recovering well. If there's nothing else, I'll—
Really? What are those then?
(I rub my eyes and pick up a number of items that have appeared on my table at some point.)

Scar healing ointment, rehabilitation training equipment... Hmm? This spring-loaded hidden blade is rather sharp... There's a recent model bracer and a small force field generator too? Are these all for me?
Yes. These are gifts that I have prepared for the Commander.
I would like to apologize for allowing you to be injured during that mission from before.
You came here to see me with so many gifts. You're not just here to apologize, I'm guessing?
(Zhaohui falls into silence for a moment.)
(Then, seemingly prepared, she stands up straight and looks at me with a serious expression.)
...Indeed. I came here because I am ready—
I hope to tell you everything about my past, Commander.
(Zhaohui looks down and unravels the bindings around her wrist. She removes the bracer, places it on the table, then removes the armor and dagger worn on her arm.)
(Finally, her entire arm—and the long, grisly scar running through it—was laid bare before my eyes.)
(Uneven edges, exposed wiring, synthetic skin that has been burned and slightly curled up...)
(Zhaohui presses her arm while she speaks.)
Commander, do you remember the lady we saw at the banquet? The lady named "Deryn Carmilla" was once my employer.
She runs a company in the art trade, and I was her custom-order bodyguard Doll, becoming her personal bodyguard right after I rolled out of the factory.

She loves art, music, and ancient artworks wholeheartedly. Every time guests arrived, she would play sophisticated music on a record player and discuss the stories behind various artworks with her guests.
So this is why you are so knowledgeable on music and art.
She is arrogant and proud, but did not shirk from sharing. I must thank her for the gifts of knowledge.
She seems to be a pretty decent employer. But looks like the two of you had a quarrel? What happened?
Were there... problems in her business?
Yes. Her... her company was engaging in illegal trade all along.
Like the dealer we investigated, she would create forgeries, falsely inflate prices, extort people, force people to buy or sell... things like that.
People would often go to her residence to confront her, so she custom-ordered a bodyguard Doll...
The thing is, I didn't know about all this at the time, nor did I know evil from good... I chased them away under her orders.
Later on, I met some guests and normal people outside of the company due to an accident...
Hearing their complaints, I finally understood what I was doing... I... I was protecting a bad person.
(Zhaohui squeezes her arm. She lowers her head. I gently put my hand on her shoulder.)
This was all in the past, Zhaohui. You have gone your separate ways with her now, haven't you?
...Yeah. Once I found out what the company was doing, I told my employer that I would no longer be her bodyguard.
She thought I was joking at first, but when she found out I was serious about it, she got really angry... She wanted to reset my neural cloud, but I had already escaped from the company.
And of course, she sent people to pursue me—
(Zhaohui smiles subtly. Her gaze seemed distant as she gently caressed her damaged skin.)
That was how I received these scars.
I was badly damaged, and my frame was almost completely ruined. I was finally abandoned at a waste recycling facility.

I was saved by an underground broker who happened to pass by, who also did some preliminary repairs on my frame. However, it was too expensive to fix my expression module, and there were no replacement parts for my arm at the time, so these scars remained.
After that, I worked for that undergound broker and earned some money, but decided to keep these scars—
I hope for these scars to be a permanent warning for me to never do wrong again.
As for my expression module... perhaps I shouldn't be able to smile and laugh so brightly as a former compatriot of evil.
...So those were the reasons why you don't want to get certain parts fixed.
Correct. I then proceeded to travel through the lands, helping people who were in trouble. I know that the past cannot be changed... but I hoped to atone this way.
Some time after, I met Daiyan, Jiangyu, and Faye, and some time after that... I came aboard the Elmo.

I thought that the past would remain in the past, and I could face the challenges of today with confidence. But that day I saw my former employer, and I realized that I was still haunted by the past... and it even managed to hurt the Commander.
(Zhaohui gently grasps her wrist. The lighting illuminated her scars and the perplexion on her face.)
Commander, do you think... I was wrong?
...Do you hope for these scars to remain?
(Zhaohui slowly makes a fist.)

I don't know. I kept these scars as a way to remind myself of the past. After all, so long as a Doll's frame is not repaired, the scars will remain forever, unlike a human's scars, which fade and recover over time. The same applies to memories in the neural cloud.
But now... these scars have brought new wounds.
Since you are perplexed because of this, why not have a feel of a human's wounds?
(I take Zhaohui's hand, placing the scar-covered hand on my arm.)
Commander? Your wounds have not healed up yet. Won't there be pain if I touch you now?
What about you? Do you still feel the pain?
Of course not. These are scars from the past, so they no longer feel painful.
Is that so? But if you truly feel it no longer, why did you ask me?
(Zhaohui is silent. I slowly pointed towards my chest.)
For both humans and Dolls, the real scars lie not only on our bodies but also within our hearts.
It's easy enough to fix up scars on our body, but wounds of the heart are a lot harder to mend.
You see, Zhaohui—
(I carefully take her hands and gently touch the marks of damage.)
You have noticed only the scars here, and keep it on your frame so that it becomes a drive for you to move forward.
However, you have also unknowingly kept scars in places that you could not see, like in your neural cloud. They remain a source of pain for you to this day.
Pain is a sign of damage.
Some level of pain alerts us to danger, but too much pain becomes a burden.
Zhaohui, throughout these years, you've been running around everywhere to "atone" for your past.
I think... you've done enough. You are being burdened by too much pain.
(I clasp my hands together, covering and holding her heavily scarred hands in mine, hoping for her to feel the warmth emanating from my palms.)
(I look up at her, speaking with gravity.)
Zhaohui, it's time to repair these scars away.
Let the wounds in your heart be healed alongside it. Only then will you truly start to move on.
Commander... I...
(Zhaohui's hands tremble slightly—no, it is more accurate to say that her whole body is trembling.)

(She looks at me, her mouth curving up for a moment but stopping immediately. She seemed to be very emotional, but also seemed to carry a mix of emotions that I cannot identify: confusion, pain, anguish, relief...?)
(Erm... Did I say too much at once? After all, this was troubling her for many years... she needs time to accept this.)
(I let go of her hand right away.)
Zhaohui, please don't be agitated. It was just a suggestion from me. You can decide whether you want to repair it after spending more time to think it through properly.
No, that's not what I meant...
(Zhaohui shakes her head.)
If expressions and language cannot make you understand...
(She hugs me tightly without attempting to continue her explanation.)
(The scar-covered arm rested on my shoulders, the nighttime temperature causing the exposed synthetic skin to feel cold to me. However, I could feel the trust and relief expressed in this hug.)
(...I think she will be fine from now on.)
(Under the dark of night, accompanied by her soft sobbing, I gently return her embrace.)
(Last night, Zhaohui suddenly sent me a message inviting me over to her dorm because she has "something to discuss".)
(At the stipulated time in the afternoon, I arrive at Zhaohui's dorm and find her already waiting next to the door.)
Good afternoon, Commander. Please enter.
Why all the mysteriousness over this?
(Zhaohui does not answer. She simply invites me to sit down in her dorm room. She takes my hand, carefully examining the spot where I was injured before.)
(After confirming the lack of scars on my skin, Zhaohui lets go of my hand.)
...Good thing it healed up well. Otherwise, I will need to custom-order a pair of bracers in the design I am using.
This is still on your mind? A lot of time has passed, so the wound had already healed up long ago. Even so, I have to say that it's normal to get injuries now and then through battle.
It's best to avoid injuries, no matter the source. Even more so that it happened due to my neglect.
...This is also the reason why I invited you over, Commander.
(Zhaohui turned on the projector in the dorm.)
(The image of a brand-new-looking Doll frame appears on the wall, labeled all over by tiny strings of text.)
Are these... plans for repairing your frame? Have you finally decided to fix away those scars?
Yes, I've decided to do so. I managed to think it through thanks to the talk with you last time, Commander.

I once kept these scars as a reminder to never do wrong again. However, since the Commander knows all about it already, it matters not whether these scars remain, for I have you to remind me from now on.
And as you said, too much pain is a burden.
That time, the Commander was hurt because of these scars of mine. If I still wish to remain by your side, I should repair these scars as soon as possible to eliminate these hidden risks.
I don't want these scars to bring hurt to people who are important to me again... Only by repairing my frame can I better help the Commander.
(Zhaohui looks at me with a serious expression upon concluding her speech.)
(Those two eyes are shining brightly. It gives me confidence that this time, she really did think it through properly.)
I see.
Erm... It just so happens that there's some money left over from our previous mission, so—
No, Commander, I'll pay up for the repairs myself.
(Zhaohui grabs my hand.)
(She looks at me, a hint of determination shining through her subtle smile.)
When I was in the depths of self-blame, it was the Commander who grabbed my hand, preventing me from sliding down further.
So, I should at least rely on my own strength for this upcoming change.
Besides, I do have a personal reason for doing this...
(Zhaohui's stiff smile seems to be mixed with some kind of subtle, awkward shyness and embarrassment.)
I know that you are long capable of determining what my expressions mean now, Commander.
But I still hope that there comes a day where you are able to understand all my expressions at a glance, without the need to ever "read" it again.
...I hope to be able to show you a smile.
That's wonderful. Since this is your choice, I'll be waiting for that day to come.
Thank you for your trust, Commander.
I, too, will be waiting for that day to arrive. So, before that, I would like to commemorate this occasion.
(Zhaohui stands up, walks up to the wall and operates the controller for the projector.)
(The projector switches to another image under her operation. In the projection, a golden ray of light shines, lighting up the dorm room—)
(This is a scenic picture of the satellite city at dawn. The sun is rising, with daylight soon to arrive.)
What's this...?
This is an image that has always been kept in my neural cloud.
On that day... where I decided to leave my past behind, I saw this beautiful sunrise just outside the satellite city.
That was how I chose my new name—"Zhaohui."".
(Zhaohui looks at the rising sun and smiles subtly once again.)
(She retrieves a camera and adjusts it, then walks into the "morning sunshine" that illuminated everything. She expectantly looked at me in silence.)
Could you take a picture with me, Commander?
I wish to stand by your side and record my "smile" as of today.
When the day comes... where I change into my new frame, I would like the Commander to take a picture with me once again to record down my real smile. Is that alright?
...Of course.
(I walk towards Zhaohui.)
(Bathing in the golden sunshine, Zhaohui leans against my shoulders and makes that still stiff smile at the camera.)
(Looking at the screen showing the picture I just took with her, I can't help but start to look forward to that day too.)
(The day... where I will be able to see Zhaohui's real smile will surely come soon.)
Commander, in my days of traveling alone, I would have never imagined that there would be someone else willing to walk on the same path that I have chosen.
From now on, please walk with me, Commander.|I wish to welcome every sunrise of the future with you, and spend every dawn together.
Commander, I have something for you, so come to my dorm later.
Hmm? What do you have in store?
You want me to reveal the answer now? It might diminish the surprise when you are officially receiving your present.
I think it will be fine if it's just a little hint.
Since it's a request from the Commander, I'll let you know a little bit about it then. Hmm... It’s find if you know everything, actually.
I have prepared a vinyl record for you.
Hmm? Looking at your expression, this simply looks like any other vinyl record, with nothing special to it.|You won't be moved to tears when you actually receive this then. Well, just kidding.

During the last mission, I happened to pass by a record store.|As I browsed through the records, I remembered how I have worked with you on missions, sparred with you, showed you my weapon collection, and even played a song for you before. However, we have never listened to a piece of music being played together.
Is this why you selected one for me?
Not only that.

...This song is special. This serenade was said to be a gift from a musician to his lover.|I would normally appreciate exciting pieces more, but that night, when I listened to this song, I thought of you.

An image even came to my mind at that moment. You and I, standing side by side atop a lush, green hill, welcoming the dawn breeze and a gold-drenched sunrise together. It was a dawn that belonged only to us.
So, I purchased it without hesitation and brought it back to the Elmo. I am very eager for the Commander to listen to this song and excited to see your expression upon hearing it.
Of course, as a surprise, I have added some content to the vinyl record...
As for whether it's a special performance or a secret message—I'll wait for you to find out yourself.
